Title: Maryland Paint Stewardship
Synopsis: Requiring producers of architectural paint or a representative organization to submit a plan for the establishment of a Paint Stewardship Program to the Department of the Environment by July 1, 2025, and in accordance with certain requirements; requiring the Department to review and approve certain plans, including a certain assessment; prohibiting the sale of certain architectural paint beginning January 1, 2026 unless an approved Paint Stewardship Program has been implemented by certain producers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Paint Stewardship Program in Maryland requiring producers of architectural paint to submit plans for managing postconsumer paint, including assessments to fund collection and recycling efforts. It sets deadlines for plan submission, approval, and implementation, and creates a trust fund to support the program and other recycling initiatives.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Producers, retailers, and consumers of architectural paint in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a producer responsibility model with assessments, independent audits, and statewide collection infrastructure, integrating environmental and recycling efforts with a focus on extended producer responsibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce environmental hazards and improve recycling infrastructure, indirectly benefiting children by promoting environmental health.

Title: Property Taxes - Authority of Counties to Establish a Subclass and Set a Special Rate for Vacant and Abandoned Property
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county to establish, by law, a subclass of real property consisting of vacant lots or improved property cited as vacant and unfit for habitation or other authorized use on a certain violation notice and to set a special property tax rate for certain vacant and abandoned property; requiring the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county that enacts a special tax rate to submit a certain report by December 1 each year; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City and counties to establish a special property tax rate for vacant and abandoned properties, and requires annual reporting on these rates and their impact.
responsible_party: Baltimore City and county governments, Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Property owners, local governments, communities affected by vacant and abandoned properties
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted property tax approach for vacant and abandoned properties, encouraging adaptive reuse and community revitalization.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by promoting neighborhood revitalization and reducing blight.

Title: Institutions of Higher Education - Admissions Standards - Prohibition on Consideration of Legacy Preference or Donor Preference
Synopsis: Prohibiting institutions of higher education that receive State funds from considering a legacy preference or donor preference as an eligible criterion for admissions standards at the institution; and allowing an institution of higher education to ask applicants for information regarding familial relationships to alums of the institution for data collection purposes.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits institutions of higher education in Maryland that receive state funds from considering legacy or donor preferences as criteria for admissions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Higher Education
stakeholders: Applicants to Maryland higher education institutions, especially those affected by legacy and donor preferences
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy change to eliminate legacy and donor preferences in college admissions, promoting more equitable access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to increase access to higher education for underrepresented and disadvantaged groups, which could reduce child poverty.

Title: Criminal Law - Indecent Exposure Within the Presence of a Minor
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing the common law crime of indecent exposure; prohibiting a person from, with prurient intent, committing the common law crime of indecent exposure when the person knows or reasonably should know that a minor is present and the minor is at least 2 years old and is more than 4 years younger than the person; and establishing a penalty of 5 years of imprisonment or a fine of up to $10,000 or both on conviction for a crime of indecent exposure in the presence of a minor.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to prohibit indecent exposure when committed with prurient intent in the presence of a minor who is at least 2 years old and more than 4 years younger than the offender, with increased penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Minors, general public, law enforcement
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies and enhances existing legal definitions and penalties related to indecent exposure in the presence of minors, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but aims to protect minors from exposure to indecent acts.

Title: Housing Innovation Pilot Program and Housing Innovation Fund - Establishment (Housing Innovation Pilot Program Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing the Housing Innovation Fund to provide loans for local housing authorities and county governments to develop mixed-income, cross-subsidized housing; establishing the Housing Innovation Pilot Program in the Department of Housing and Community Development to assist public housing authorities and county governments in increasing housing production and to reward counties pursuing solutions to the problem of housing scarcity; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Fund in certain fiscal years; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Housing Innovation Pilot Program and the Housing Innovation Fund in Maryland to support mixed-income, cross-subsidized housing projects. It provides funding, sets eligibility criteria, and outlines the administration and priorities for the program, aiming to increase housing production and affordability.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Local housing authorities, county governments, and low- to moderate-income households in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs innovative approaches by prioritizing projects that do not rely on traditional tax credits or tax-exempt volume cap, and emphasizes public ownership and prevailing wage commitments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing affordable housing options for low-income families.

Title: Residential Property - Affordable Housing Land Trusts - Authority to Establish Condominium Regimes
Synopsis: Authorizing a condominium regime to be established on certain land owned by an affordable housing land trust.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the establishment of condominium regimes on properties owned by affordable housing land trusts, facilitating the development of affordable housing.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Affordable housing land trusts, residents of affordable housing, developers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new legal framework allowing affordable housing land trusts to establish condominium regimes, which is a novel approach to expanding affordable housing options.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to increase affordable housing options, which can help reduce child poverty by providing stable housing.

Title: Tax Sales - Homeowner Protection Program - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring each collector of property taxes to include with each property tax bill a separate insert that describes the Homeowner Protection Program and encourages taxpayers to make a voluntary donation to the Program through a website maintained by the State Department of Assessments and Taxation.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Homeowner Protection Program in Maryland, requiring property tax bills to include information about the program and encouraging voluntary donations to fund assistance for low-income, elderly, and disabled homeowners facing tax sale foreclosure. It also creates a dedicated fund supported by donations, state budget allocations, and other sources.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Low-income, elderly, and disabled homeowners at risk of tax sale foreclosure in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by integrating donation options directly into property tax bills and establishing a dedicated fund to support at-risk homeowners.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by preventing home loss among vulnerable families.

Title: Charter Counties - Comprehensive Plans - Affirmatively Furthering Fair Housing
Synopsis: Altering requirements for the housing element of a charter county's comprehensive plan to include requirements related to affirmatively furthering fair housing; requiring the housing element of a comprehensive plan that is enacted or amended on or after January 1, 2025, to include an assessment of fair housing to ensure that the county is affirmatively furthering fair housing; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires charter counties in Maryland to include an assessment of fair housing in their comprehensive plans starting January 1, 2025, and mandates that they affirmatively further fair housing through their housing and urban development programs. It also incorporates existing fair housing assessments into the planning process for counties that have already completed such assessments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning and Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents of charter counties, especially those in low-income and workforce housing, and communities impacted by fair housing policies.
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes integrating fair housing assessments into comprehensive planning and mandates proactive efforts to affirmatively further fair housing, which is a progressive approach to housing policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by promoting equitable housing opportunities and reducing barriers for low-income families.

Title: Natural Resources - Northern Snakehead - Common Name
Synopsis: Establishing the common name of the northern snakehead as the "Chesapeake Channa".
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new common name for the northern snakehead fish as 'Chesapeake Channa' and sets regulations for licensing and fishing methods for this species in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Fishers, environmental agencies, and the general public interested in aquatic life and fishing regulations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new common name for a fish species and updates regulatory practices, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Agriculture - Pollinator Habitat Plan - Requirements for State Highway Administration
Synopsis: Requiring the State Highway Administration's pollinator habitat plan to include policies and procedures regarding the use of pollinator habitat areas along State highways; requiring the Administration to track and evaluate federal programs that provide funding for pollinator habitats, native plants, and invasive species control and to apply for any funding that the Administration determines appropriate and beneficial to pollinator habitats; requiring the Administration to update the plan by October 1 each year; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Highway Administration to include policies for pollinator habitats along highways, avoid certain pesticides, and track federal funding for pollinator programs. It also mandates updating these plans annually.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Pollinators, local communities, farmers, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill promotes environmentally friendly highway management practices and incorporates federal funding tracking, which is a progressive approach to ecological conservation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but promotes ecological health and community awareness.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange - Qualified Health Plans - Dental Coverage
Synopsis: Repealing a certain provision of law providing that a qualified health plan is not required under certain circumstances to provide essential benefits that duplicate the minimum benefits of qualified dental plans; and repealing the authority of the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to require children enrolling in a qualified health plan to have essential pediatric dental benefits required by the federal Secretary of Health and Human Services.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain provisions related to the requirements for qualified health plans to include dental benefits, and clarifies the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange's authority regarding dental coverage and certification of health plans, effective from January 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Individuals enrolling in health plans, especially children requiring pediatric dental benefits
innovative_summary: The bill updates and clarifies the certification and offering process for health, dental, and vision plans within the Maryland Exchange, including standards for stand-alone dental plans and the use of federal guidelines.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve access to dental benefits, which can contribute to better health outcomes and reduce child poverty impacts.

Title: Small, Minority, and Women-Owned Businesses Account - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the type of financial assistance that may be provided by eligible fund managers who receive grants from the Small, Minority, and Women-Owned Businesses Account in the Department of Commerce to allow grants of up to $10,000 in conjunction with a loan.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules for the Small, Minority, and Women–Owned Businesses Account managed by the Maryland Department of Commerce, including changes to the types of financial assistance (loans and grants) that can be provided to small, minority, and women-owned businesses, and specifies program details and funding allocations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Small, minority, and women-owned businesses in Maryland, especially in areas affected by disasters or emergencies, and clean energy industry businesses.
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured approach to providing financial assistance through grants and loans managed by designated fund managers, with specific provisions for disaster and emergency areas, and includes reporting and auditing requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting small and minority-owned businesses, which can lead to economic growth and job creation in underserved communities.

Title: Health Insurance – Conformity With Federal Law
Synopsis: Conforming provisions of State health insurance law with existing federal requirements, including updating effective dates for federal regulations, clarifying federal consumer protection regulations resulting from changes to the federal No Surprises Act, altering the material errors that trigger special enrollment periods, and authorizing the Maryland Health Benefits Exchange to adopt an expanded open enrollment period under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland's health insurance laws to conform with federal regulations, including changes to the No Surprises Act, emergency service definitions, and open enrollment periods, and authorizes the Maryland Health Benefits Exchange to expand open enrollment under certain circumstances.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Health Benefits Exchange
stakeholders: Health insurance consumers in Maryland, including individuals and small employers
innovative_summary: The bill employs updated federal regulations and expands open enrollment periods, aligning state policies with federal law and improving access to health insurance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to health insurance for children and families.

Title: Property Tax - Submission of Building Permits to Supervisor of Assessments - Estimated Construction Cost
Synopsis: Requiring local permit offices to include a construction cost estimate when submitting a copy of a building permit to the supervisor of assessments of the county where the building is located.
bill_summary: The bill requires local permit offices to include an estimated construction cost when submitting a copy of a building permit to the county supervisor of assessments.
responsible_party: Local permit offices and county supervisors of assessments
stakeholders: Property owners, local government, county assessors
innovative_summary: This bill introduces a new requirement for the submission process of building permits, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Insurance - Protections After Loss or Damage to Property
Synopsis: Prohibiting a public adjuster, or anyone acting on behalf of a public adjuster, from soliciting or attempting to solicit a client between the hours of 8:00 p.m. and 8:00 a.m.; altering the statements that are required to be included in a public adjuster contract; altering a certain rescission period for public adjuster contracts; and requiring a public adjuster to provide notice to the Commissioner, in a form and manner the Commissioner determines, within 1 business day after the public adjuster has entered into a contract.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations for public adjusters, including restrictions on solicitation periods after a loss, contract disclosure requirements, and notice obligations to the Maryland Insurance Commissioner. It also addresses fraudulent practices by contractors offering home repair services.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Insurance policyholders, public adjusters, contractors, and insurers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing regulations and introduces specific restrictions and reporting requirements, with limited use of new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on insurance regulation and contractor practices.

Title: Baltimore City - Motor Vehicle Off-Street Parking Requirements Near Mass Transit Stations
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City from adopting or enforcing a local law that requires the creation of new motor vehicle off-street parking for a development that includes residential use and that is located within a 0.25-mile radius of a present or planned MARC, Baltimore MTA Light Rail, Red Line, or Metro station.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits Baltimore City from requiring new off-street parking for residential developments within 0.25 miles of certain transit stations, including MARC, Light Rail, Red Line, or Metro stations.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Government
stakeholders: Residents and developers near transit stations in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regulatory restriction on parking requirements near transit stations, promoting transit-oriented development and reducing parking mandates.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on urban development regulations.

Title: Residential Service Agencies - Reimbursement - Personal Assistance Services (Homecare Worker Rights Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Department of Health to reimburse a residential service agency for personal assistance services only if the personal assistance services are provided by an individual classified as an employee.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Health to reimburse residential service agencies for personal assistance services only if those services are provided by individuals classified as employees, starting from January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residential service agencies, personal assistance service providers, individuals receiving personal assistance services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new reimbursement policy that requires personal assistance services to be provided by employees for agencies to receive reimbursement, emphasizing employment classification.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve the quality and stability of personal assistance services, which could positively impact individuals in need, including children in affected families.

Title: Public Health - Public Health Services and Protections - Revisions
Synopsis: Repealing the exceptions that allow the sale, distribution, or purchase of tobacco products, tobacco paraphernalia, and electronic smoking devices to or for certain individuals who are active duty members of the military; authorizing the Maryland Department of Health to reallocate from one county to another county certain projected unspent grant funding relating to cancer to address certain funding needs; altering the duties of the State Council on Child Abuse and Neglect; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's laws to raise the legal age for purchasing tobacco and electronic smoking devices to 21, restricts sales to active military members under 21, improves enforcement strategies, and reallocates unspent tobacco-related funds between counties. It also revises reporting requirements and responsibilities related to child abuse and neglect data collection and treatment funding.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Youth under 21, active military members, tobacco retailers, child abuse and neglect prevention agencies, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining legal age restrictions, enforcement strategies, and data collection improvements, with some use of technology for enforcement and reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may contribute indirectly through improved child protection and health policies.

Title: Motor Vehicle Registration - Exceptions for Golf Carts - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing counties and municipalities to designate certain highways in their respective jurisdictions on which a person may operate a golf cart; authorizing a person with a valid driver's license to operate a golf cart only on a highway with a maximum posted speed limit of not more than 30 miles per hour or 35 miles per hour in Golden Beach Patuxent Knolls, St. Mary's County, between dawn and dusk, and if the golf cart is equipped with certain lighting devices; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to designate specific highways where golf carts can be operated legally, repeals previous authorizations for golf carts on certain local highways, and clarifies rules for golf cart operation including lighting and licensing requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local county and municipal governments
stakeholders: Golf cart operators, local governments, residents in designated areas
innovative_summary: The bill employs a localized approach to golf cart regulation, allowing counties and municipalities to designate specific highways for golf cart use, which is a flexible and community-specific approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns local transportation regulations.

Title: Natural Resources - Sale, Barter, or Exchange of Mounted Specimens From Decedent's Estate
Synopsis: Authorizing the sale, barter, or exchange of a legally acquired mounted specimen of a game bird, excluding a migratory game bird, or game mammal, from a decedent's estate and the specimen is part of the personal property being liquidated or distributed.
bill_summary: The bill allows for the sale, barter, or exchange of mounted specimens of game birds or mammals from a decedent's estate under certain conditions, specifically when the original owner is deceased and the specimen is part of the estate being liquidated or distributed.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Estate owners, collectors, and the general public interested in game specimens
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific exception to existing restrictions, allowing the sale or exchange of mounted specimens from deceased owners' estates, which is a nuanced legal change rather than a new technological approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns legal and estate matters related to game specimens.

Title: Public Health - Maryland Pediatric Cancer Fund and Commission
Synopsis: Altering the use of the Maryland Pediatric Cancer Fund to require that the Fund be used only for pediatric cancer research instead of only for pediatric cancer research, prevention, and treatment and to allow funds from the Fund to be used for administrative expenses; and establishing the Pediatric Cancer Research Commission to oversee the award of competitive grants from the Fund and to develop criteria and a process for reviewing grant applications.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Pediatric Cancer Fund to restrict its use solely for pediatric cancer research, allows funds to cover administrative expenses, and establishes the Pediatric Cancer Research Commission to oversee grant awards from the Fund.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Pediatric cancer patients, researchers, hospitals, and organizations involved in pediatric cancer research in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated commission to oversee pediatric cancer research grants and allocates funds specifically for research and administrative costs, employing a structured oversight and grant review process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by advancing pediatric cancer research, which can improve health outcomes for affected children.

Title: State Employees - Parental Bereavement Leave
Synopsis: Providing that certain State employees are entitled to use up to 10 days of parental bereavement leave with pay within 60 days after the death of the employee's child; providing that certain State employees are entitled to use up to 60 days of parental bereavement leave within 60 days after the employee experiences a stillbirth or the death of the employee's infant; and prohibiting certain State entities from requiring State employees entitled to parental bereavement leave under the Act to use any other paid leave available to the employee.
bill_summary: The bill provides parental bereavement leave with pay for certain State employees in Maryland, allowing up to 10 days for the death of a child or stillbirth, and up to 60 days for the death of an infant or stillbirth, with specific notification requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Department of Human Resources or equivalent agency responsible for employee benefits
stakeholders: State employees in Maryland, including those in the executive, judicial, legislative branches, and higher education institutions
innovative_summary: The program introduces a dedicated parental bereavement leave policy with specific provisions and notification requirements, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily supporting employees during personal loss.

Title: Property Tax - Transfer to Heir or Legatee - Payment Plans
Synopsis: Exempting a grant of land transferring residential real property from the estate of a decedent to an heir or a legatee of the decedent from certain requirements for the payment of taxes on real property if the heir or legatee of the decedent enters into a payment plan to pay all the taxes due and owed on the property; exempting a grant of land that is subject to a payment plan for property taxes from certain requirements for the payment of taxes if the grantee agrees to assume the grantor's obligations under the payment plan; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes programs and procedures to allow property owners, especially heirs or legatees of decedents, to pay property taxes through installment plans, and authorizes local governments to create their own installment payment programs for overdue taxes on residential properties.
responsible_party: Maryland State Tax Sale Ombudsman and local county or municipal governments
stakeholders: Homeowners, heirs, and legatees of decedents, property owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by creating a statewide and local infrastructure for installment payment plans for property taxes, including partnerships with vendors and dedicated ombudsmen to assist homeowners.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by helping homeowners maintain their properties and avoid tax-related foreclosures, thereby stabilizing families and communities.

Title: Maryland Commission on Veterans and Military Families
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Commission on Veterans and Military Families to study developing and implementing a statewide strategic plan to make Maryland the best state for veterans and military families, including legislative and budgetary recommendations; requiring the Commission to consult with the Office of Military and Federal Affairs and the Maryland Military Installation Council as part of the study process; and requiring the Commission to report its findings to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Commission on Veterans and Military Families to develop a strategic plan to improve the quality of life for veterans and military families in Maryland, including making legislative and budgetary recommendations.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Veterans, military families, advocacy organizations, military spouses, health care providers, workforce development agencies
innovative_summary: The program employs a strategic planning approach with a focus on developing measurable key performance indicators and cross-state comparisons to improve veteran and military family services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly through improved support for military families, but it is not specifically targeted at child poverty.

Title: Rehabilitation Services - Disability - Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "disability" relating to the provision of rehabilitation services in the State to align with the federal Rehabilitation Act of 1973; and defining "disability" as any physical or mental impairment that constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment or independent living.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of 'disability' in Maryland's education law to align with federal standards, specifying that disability now includes physical or mental impairments that substantially impede employment or independent living.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities, rehabilitation service providers, educational institutions
innovative_summary: The bill updates the legal definition of disability to match federal standards, which is a legal and policy change rather than an innovative program or service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on disability definition may indirectly impact children with disabilities, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: State Employee Rights and Protections - Personnel Actions and Harassment - Investigation of Complaints
Synopsis: Increasing, from 30 days to 60 days, the time period during which an investigation must be conducted and a written decision must be issued regarding a complaint filed by an applicant or employee alleging discrimination or harassment by an employer; and authorizing certain applicants and employees to provide written authorization to increase by an additional 30 days the time period during which an investigation of a complaint and a written decision must be completed.
bill_summary: The bill extends the investigation period for complaints of discrimination or harassment filed by state employees or applicants from 30 days to 60 days, with an option to extend by an additional 30 days if the complainant provides written authorization.
responsible_party: State Personnel and Pensions Department
stakeholders: State employees and applicants filing complaints of discrimination or harassment
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible extension mechanism for investigation timelines through written authorization, allowing for more thorough investigations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns employment complaint procedures.

Title: Property Tax - Credit for Dwelling House of Disabled Veterans - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering eligibility for a certain property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax on the dwelling house of certain disabled veterans to include individuals who have been declared by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs to have a nonpermanent service-connected disability of 100% that results from blindness or any other disabling cause; authorizing a county or municipal corporation, notwithstanding certain provisions of the Act, to enact a law limiting eligibility for the tax credit; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to expand eligibility for a property tax credit for disabled veterans by including those with a nonpermanent, service-connected disability rating of 100%, and allows local governments to limit eligibility further.
responsible_party: Maryland local governments (counties and municipal corporations)
stakeholders: Disabled veterans and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes eligibility criteria and local government authority for a property tax credit, without establishing a new program or service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly benefits disabled veterans and their families through property tax relief.

Title: Property Tax Credits - Public School Employees, Health and Safety Improvements, and Property Used for Local Housing Programs
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant, by law, a certain property tax credit for certain residential real property owned by a public school employee under certain circumstances; authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant, by law, a certain property tax credit for certain buildings if the owner made certain health or safety improvements on or after July 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local governments in Maryland to grant property tax credits for public school employees' primary residences, health and safety improvements to apartment or condominium buildings made after July 1, 2024, and properties used for local housing programs for homeless individuals or families, starting from the 2024 tax year.
responsible_party: Local governments in Maryland (Baltimore City and counties)
stakeholders: Public school employees, residents of apartment and condominium buildings, homeless individuals and families, property owners, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted approach to incentivize property improvements and support housing for vulnerable populations through property tax credits, which is a common but effective policy tool.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting housing stability and safety for families, especially those experiencing homelessness.

Title: Insurance - Penalties - Unauthorized Insurers, Insurance Producers, and Public Adjusters
Synopsis: Altering the maximum civil penalty to which an unauthorized insurer or person that violates certain provisions of State insurance law is subject for each violation; and altering the maximum civil penalty that the Maryland Insurance Commissioner may impose, in addition to suspending or revoking the license, on the holder of an insurance producer license or a public adjuster licensee for each violation of State insurance law.
bill_summary: This bill increases the maximum civil penalties for violations of insurance laws by unauthorized insurers and individuals, and modifies enforcement provisions including license suspension, revocation, and penalties for insurance producers and public adjusters in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Insurance producers, public adjusters, insurance companies, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates penalties and enforcement rules; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Continuing Care Retirement Communities - Transparency, Grievances, and Unit Reoccupancy
Synopsis: Requiring a provider to post the provider's most recent disclosure statement on the provider's website; increasing from yearly to quarterly the number of times a provider is required to hold a meeting open to all the provider's subscribers; requiring at the last quarterly meeting of the year an officer of the provider to give an aggregated, deidentified summary of internal grievances; requiring a provider to submit a written report to a subscriber or a beneficiary if the subscriber's unit has not been reoccupied within 9 months; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations for continuing care retirement communities in Maryland, including transparency requirements, grievance procedures, governing body composition, and rules for refunding entrance fees.
responsible_party: Department of Aging
stakeholders: Residents of continuing care retirement communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces enhanced transparency, governance, and grievance procedures, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on regulatory improvements is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Higher Education - Teacher Development and Retention Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "institution of initial eligibility" to include community colleges as eligible institutions as part of the criteria for applicants for the Teacher Development and Retention Program; altering the evaluation requirements for the Program; requiring the Higher Education Commission to conduct an evaluation of the effectiveness of the Program and report the results to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 1, 2030; and altering the termination date from June 30, 2029 to June 30, 2030.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Maryland Teacher Development and Retention Program to include community colleges as eligible institutions, extends the program's duration until 2030, and authorizes the use of the Teacher Development and Retention Fund for administrative expenses. It provides stipends for students in early years of their education to encourage careers in teaching, especially in high-need areas, and includes an evaluation of the program's effectiveness.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Prospective teachers, students at community colleges and higher education institutions, high-need schools, and students in those schools
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to incentivize early-stage students and those in internships to pursue teaching careers in high-need areas, with a focus on experiential learning and service commitments, which is a relatively innovative approach to teacher recruitment and retention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing the number of qualified teachers in high-need schools, which can improve educational outcomes for disadvantaged children.

Title: Health Occupations - Pharmacists - Administration of Vaccines
Synopsis: Authorizing a pharmacist to order and administer certain vaccinations to individuals in certain age groups if certain requirements are met; altering the vaccinations that a pharmacist can administer to individuals at least 3 years old; and altering the circumstances under which a pharmacist may administer certain vaccinations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes pharmacists in Maryland to order and administer certain vaccines, including influenza, COVID-19, and others in response to public health emergencies, to individuals of specific age groups under specified conditions. It sets training, certification, and reporting requirements for pharmacists and updates regulations related to vaccination practices.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Children, adolescents, and adults receiving vaccinations in Maryland, pharmacists, healthcare providers, and public health agencies
innovative_summary: The bill expands the role of pharmacists in vaccination efforts by allowing them to order and administer a broader range of vaccines to more age groups, with specific training and reporting requirements, thereby increasing access to immunizations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to vaccinations, which can improve health outcomes and reduce healthcare costs.

Title: Maryland Environmental Service – Governance and Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of the Board of Directors of the Maryland Environmental Service to delegate certain responsibilities to an employee of the Service; altering the obligations of the Service after receiving a request for services and after entering into a contract;  requiring that an audit be made of the financial books, records, and accounts of the Service by November 15 each year; and requiring the Service to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on its activities by November 15 each year.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the governance, responsibilities, and reporting requirements of the Maryland Environmental Service, including adjusting quorum thresholds, delegation of responsibilities, and audit/report deadlines.
responsible_party: Maryland Environmental Service
stakeholders: Government agencies and entities contracting with the Maryland Environmental Service
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates governance and reporting rules; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Hospitals and Urgent Care Centers - Sepsis Protocol (Lochlin's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring, on or before January 1, 2025, each hospital and urgent care center in the State to implement an evidence-based protocol for the early recognition and treatment of a patient with sepsis, severe sepsis, or septic shock that is based on generally acceptable standards of care; requiring a specialty psychiatric hospital to establish a certain process; and requiring hospitals and urgent care centers to require periodic training in the implementation of the protocol for certain staff.
bill_summary: The bill requires all hospitals and urgent care centers in Maryland to implement an evidence-based sepsis recognition and treatment protocol by January 1, 2025. It mandates staff training, adherence to CDC guidelines, and collection of quality measures to improve sepsis care.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Hospitals, urgent care centers, patients with sepsis, healthcare staff
innovative_summary: The bill employs a standardized, evidence-based protocol for early sepsis detection and treatment, emphasizing staff training and quality measurement, which is a structured approach to improving sepsis outcomes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on healthcare protocols for sepsis.

Title: Public and Nonpublic Schools - Bronchodilators - Use, Availability, Training, and Policies
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education, in consultation with certain groups, to develop training for certain school personnel to identify symptoms of anaphylaxis, asthma, and respiratory distress in students; requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with county boards, and authorizing nonpublic schools to establish a policy to obtain, administer, and train certain school personnel to administer emergency bronchodilators to a student who is determined to be, or is perceived to be, experiencing asthma-related symptoms; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes public and nonpublic schools in Maryland to establish policies allowing trained school personnel to administer auto-injectable epinephrine and bronchodilators, such as inhalers, to students experiencing severe allergic reactions, asthma, or respiratory distress. It includes provisions for training, storage, notification, and liability protections.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Students with allergies, asthma, or respiratory issues; school personnel; parents and guardians
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach combining training, emergency protocols, and storage policies to improve emergency response for students with health issues, utilizing existing medical and educational infrastructure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve health emergency responses in schools, which can contribute to better educational stability and well-being for children, indirectly impacting child poverty.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Immediate Vesting
Synopsis: Providing that an individual serving as the State Superintendent of Schools shall immediately vest in the State Retirement and Pension System.
bill_summary: The bill provides that the State Superintendent of Schools shall immediately vest in the State Retirement and Pension System upon taking office.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: State Superintendent of Schools and the State Retirement System
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an immediate vesting policy for the State Superintendent of Schools, which is a change in retirement policy but not a new technology or approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Insurance - Hearing Representation
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Insurance Commissioner to allow corporations, partnerships, limited liability companies, and sole proprietorships that are small employers to be represented by certain authorized individuals rather than an attorney in certain hearings held by the Commissioner.
bill_summary: The bill allows small business entities to be represented by authorized individuals other than attorneys during certain insurance hearings conducted by the Maryland Insurance Commissioner.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Small business entities, insurance companies, and the Maryland Insurance Administration
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by permitting small business entities to be represented by designated authorized individuals instead of attorneys, streamlining the hearing process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting small business representation in insurance hearings.

Title: Resources and Education for All Prisons (REAP) Act
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to assist incarcerated individuals in accessing federal Pell Grants for higher education; requiring the Department to set goals for the number of incarcerated individuals in postsecondary education programs, establish tracking systems for their progress in postsecondary education programs, and forward certain data to the Maryland Higher Education Commission; requiring the Commission to assist the Department in establishing the tracking systems; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to assist incarcerated individuals in accessing federal Pell Grants and to establish tracking systems for their participation in postsecondary education programs. It also involves coordination with higher education institutions and sets goals and regulations for these initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals seeking higher education, correctional facilities, higher education institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a coordinated approach to increase access to federal education grants for incarcerated individuals and implements tracking systems to monitor their educational progress, employing new data collection and inter-agency collaboration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing educational opportunities for incarcerated individuals, which can lead to better economic outcomes.

Title: Landlord and Tenant - Termination of Residential Lease - Limitation of Liability for Rent
Synopsis: Limiting a tenant's liability for rent to not more than 2 months' rent after the date on which the tenant vacates a leased premises if a physician or psychologist completes a form specifying that the tenant has a mental disorder, the management of which is substantially limited by the leased premises.
bill_summary: The bill limits a tenant’s liability for rent after vacating a leased property if a licensed physician, therapist, or psychologist certifies that the tenant has a certain disability or mental disorder that affects their ability to live in the premises or requires higher care. The liability is capped at two months' rent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or relevant local housing authorities
stakeholders: Tenants with disabilities or mental disorders, landlords, healthcare professionals
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new legal protection for tenants with disabilities or mental health conditions by limiting their rent liability after vacating a property, based on medical certification.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily provides legal protections for tenants with disabilities.

Title: Correctional Services - Inmate Employment - Agricultural Work
Synopsis: Repealing the authority of the Division of Correction to arrange for inmates not needed or being used by the State Highway Administration to perform emergency road work to be employed in agricultural work during any part of the year at a camp in Queen Anne's County or any other county with a similar camp.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the authority of the Maryland Division of Correction to employ inmates in agricultural work in certain camps, effectively ending this practice.
responsible_party: Division of Correction, Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Inmates in correctional facilities, agricultural employers, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill does not introduce new technologies or approaches; it primarily removes an existing program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly involves correctional employment policies.

Title: Health - Newborn Screening Program - Implementation of Testing
Synopsis: Repealing a certain requirement related to the inclusion of a core condition in the system for newborn screening; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to implement testing for a core condition listed in the Recommended Uniform Screening Panel within a certain time period after the core condition is added to the Panel; authorizing the Department to screen for any condition recommended by the Advisory Council and approved by the Secretary; requiring the Department to implement testing for Krabbe leukodystrophy at a certain time; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Department of Health to implement newborn screening for Krabbe leukodystrophy within a specified time after federal recommendations are issued, and revises procedures for including conditions in the screening panel, including reporting delays and approval processes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Newborn infants and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured, federally aligned approach to expanding newborn screening, including reporting delays and approval processes, but does not introduce new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves early health interventions for newborns.

Title: Baby Food - Toxic Heavy Metals - Testing and Labeling (Rudy's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring, beginning January 1, 2025, manufacturers of baby food to test a representative sample of each production aggregate of the manufacturer's final baby food product for certain toxic heavy metals; requiring, beginning January 1, 2026, manufacturers of baby food to make certain information related to the testing and a link to certain guidance available on the manufacturer's website; requiring a consumer to report to the Maryland Department of Health if the consumer believes that baby food is being sold with toxic heavy metals; etc.
bill_summary: The bill, known as Rudy's Law, requires baby food manufacturers in Maryland to test their products for toxic heavy metals before sale, publish testing results online, include information on labels and packaging, and provide QR codes linking to safety information. Consumers can report concerns about contaminated baby food to the Maryland Department of Health.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Baby food manufacturers, parents, and children under 2 in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs modern testing standards, online transparency, and QR codes to inform consumers and ensure safety, representing a comprehensive and technologically integrated approach to food safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on food safety and transparency.

Title: Criminal Law – Sexual Solicitation of a Minor Through Child Pornography – Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting an individual from knowingly and with a certain intent soliciting a minor or law enforcement officer posing as a minor to engage in certain prohibited sexual acts with the minor by a certain means.
bill_summary: The bill enhances laws against soliciting minors for sexual acts through electronic means and against producing or distributing obscene or sexual content involving minors, including those depicted in sadomasochistic acts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Minors, law enforcement, and the general public concerned with child protection and online safety
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates and strengthens existing laws on child exploitation and online solicitation, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but aims to protect minors from exploitation and abuse.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Motorcycles - Passenger Restrictions
Synopsis: Requiring a rear passenger on a motorcycle to be able to firmly position the passenger's feet on the footrests of the motorcycle, subject to an exception for permanent physical disability.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland traffic laws to require motorcycle passengers to be able to firmly place their feet on the footrests, with an exception for those with permanent disabilities. It also clarifies seating and safety rules for motorcycle operators and passengers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Motorcycle operators and passengers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific safety requirement for motorcycle passengers related to foot placement, which is a targeted safety measure but not an innovative technological or systemic approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Dental Services - Coverage and Rate Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to study the feasibility of including removable full and partial dentures and setting adequate reimbursement rates for providers on a per-patient basis for house calls and extended care facility calls among the coverage offered by the Maryland Healthy Smiles Dental Program; and requiring the Department to report its findings from the study to the Senate Finance Committee and the House Health and Government Operations Committee by December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to study the feasibility of expanding dental coverage under the Maryland Healthy Smiles Dental Program to include full and partial dentures and provider reimbursements for house calls and extended care, and to set appropriate reimbursement rates. The department must report findings by December 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Low-income populations in Maryland who need dental care
innovative_summary: The bill employs a study approach to potentially expand dental coverage and adjust reimbursement rates, which is a strategic and data-driven approach to improving dental health services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to dental care for low-income children, which could reduce child poverty related to health disparities.

Title: Drunk Driving Offenses - Expungement and the Ignition Interlock System Program
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to file a petition for expungement of certain records relating to a probation before judgment for driving while impaired or driving while under the influence; requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to require persons convicted of or granted probation before judgment for certain criminal offenses related to driving while impaired by alcohol, a drug, drug combination, or a combination of drugs and alcohol to participate in the Ignition Interlock System Program for certain periods of time; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes expungement of certain records related to probation before judgment for alcohol or drug-related driving offenses and mandates participation in the Ignition Interlock System Program for certain drunk driving offenders, with specific reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Individuals convicted of or granted probation for drunk driving offenses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a mandatory ignition interlock system program for certain offenders and requires detailed data collection and reporting, employing technology to monitor compliance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal records and driving safety.

Title: Baltimore County Board of Education - Nonstudent Member Compensation and Student Member Scholarships - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the annual compensation of certain nonstudent members of the Baltimore County Board of Education from $7,500 to $16,500; providing that the chair of the county board is entitled to receive $17,500 annually as compensation; and increasing the amount that a student member of the board is granted for a certain scholarship from $7,500 to $10,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual compensation for nonstudent members of the Baltimore County Board of Education, sets a specific compensation for the chair of the board, and raises the scholarship amount for student members upon completing a full term.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of Education
stakeholders: Members of the Baltimore County Board of Education and student members
innovative_summary: The bill primarily adjusts compensation and scholarship amounts, which are standard policy updates, not employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal, as it mainly involves compensation and scholarship adjustments for board members.

Title: Natural Resources - Submerged Aquatic Vegetation - Alteration or Removal Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing certain persons to alter certain submerged aquatic vegetation in a certain manner and in accordance with certain requirements; authorizing a public utility company or telecommunications carrier to alter certain submerged aquatic vegetation in a certain manner and in accordance with certain requirements; and altering certain requirements related to the alteration or removal of certain submerged aquatic vegetation.
bill_summary: The bill modifies regulations concerning the alteration or removal of submerged aquatic vegetation in Maryland's tidal waters, including expanding the circumstances under which certain entities can trim or remove vegetation without prior approval and clarifying permitting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Maritime property owners, utility companies, telecommunications carriers, environmental agencies, and the general public using tidal waters
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing regulations and expands permissible activities without new technological approaches or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental and waterway management.

Title: Persons Doing Public Business – Disclosure Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring a person to file a registration statement with the State Board of Elections within a certain time period after the award of a contract that causes the person to be doing public business; requiring persons doing public business to update information on beneficial ownership included in the registration statement in accordance with regulations adopted by the State Board; altering the time at which a person doing public business is required to file a certain initial statement with the State Board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires persons doing public business with the Maryland government to file registration statements and disclose beneficial ownership information within specific timeframes. It also mandates governmental entities to verify and certify these filings, and imposes penalties for non-compliance. The bill aims to increase transparency and prevent corruption in government contracts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and the Maryland Department of General Services
stakeholders: Businesses doing public business with the Maryland government, government agencies, and the public interested in transparency and anti-corruption measures.
innovative_summary: The program employs modern disclosure requirements and ongoing updates of beneficial ownership information, leveraging regulations and reporting to enhance transparency in government contracting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on transparency and accountability could indirectly support efforts to reduce child poverty by promoting fairer government contracting practices.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Horse Riding - Helmet Requirement for Minors
Synopsis: Prohibiting an adult from allowing certain minors to ride a horse, donkey, mule, or pony on a highway, a public horse-riding path, or the grounds of a facility for which the primary purpose is recreational, educational, therapeutic, or competitive equestrian activities unless the minor is wearing a properly secured helmet that meets or exceeds the standards of the American Society of Testing and Materials for protective headgear used in equestrian riding.
bill_summary: The bill requires that minors riding horses on certain properties must wear helmets that meet safety standards, and prohibits adults from allowing minors to ride without helmets.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant local authorities
stakeholders: Minors who ride horses, horse riding instructors, parents, and guardians in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enforces safety regulations for minors riding horses, emphasizing helmet use, which is a standard safety practice but not a new technological approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on safety regulations for horse riding.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Victims' Rights - Notification of Release From Confinement (Jaycee Webster Victims' Rights Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a certain commitment unit to include in a notification given to a victim, victim's representative, or witness regarding the release from confinement of a sentenced defendant or child respondent the telephone number of the Maryland Crime Victims Resource Center.
bill_summary: The bill requires a commitment unit to include the telephone number of the Maryland Crime Victims Resource Center when notifying victims, witnesses, or their representatives about the release from confinement of a defendant or child respondent.
responsible_party: Maryland Crime Victims Resource Center and commitment units within the criminal justice system
stakeholders: Victims, witnesses, and their representatives involved in criminal cases in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific notification requirement to improve communication with victims and witnesses, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Department of Natural Resources - Maryland Geological Survey Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Geological Survey Fund to finance certain direct and indirect costs, including long-term budgeting and planning for survey projects, procurements, and equipment purchases; establishing the Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund in the Department of Natural Resources; and requiring interest earnings of the Fund to be credited to the Fund.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Geological Survey Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund within the Department of Natural Resources to finance geological survey activities, including operations, equipment, and projects. It also specifies that interest earnings of the fund are credited to it and provides details on fund management and investment.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Geologists, researchers, and public agencies involved in geological surveys and resource management in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated, nonlapsing fund for geological surveys, with interest earnings credited to the fund, ensuring sustainable financing for geological research and resource management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is not directly targeted at child poverty but supports geological research which can indirectly benefit public welfare.

Title: Public Health - Giving Infants a Future Without Transmission (GIFT) Act
Synopsis: Altering certain HIV and syphilis reporting and testing requirements for hospitals and health care providers for pregnant women and newborns; providing that certain documents related to certain HIV and syphilis reports are not discoverable and are not admissible in evidence in any criminal or administrative action; and altering certain penalties related to the disclosure of personal identifying health information acquired for the purpose of HIV and AIDS reporting under certain provisions of law.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's laws on HIV and syphilis testing and reporting, including requirements for hospitals and healthcare providers to report cases, include pregnancy status, and maintain confidentiality. It also clarifies testing procedures, consent, and penalties for disclosure violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Pregnant women, newborns, healthcare providers, hospitals, and public health agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs modern confidentiality protections and integrates testing procedures with legal and public health frameworks, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves health outcomes for infants and pregnant women, which can indirectly benefit children.

Title: Economic Development - Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation - Loans
Synopsis: Altering a certain loan program to authorize the Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation to provide loans of up to $10,000 for each seasonal full-time job; expanding eligibility for the Maryland Watermen's Microloan Program within the Corporation to include, starting July 1, 2025, individuals who are residents of the State and hold a commercial fishing license to catch finfish, crabs, clams, or oysters issued by the Potomac River Fisheries Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands and modifies the Maryland Watermen's Microloan Program to include residents with certain fishing licenses, and establishes a loan program for commercial fishermen and seafood businesses, with specific eligibility, reporting, and funding provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Maryland Agricultural and Resource–Based Industry Development Corporation
stakeholders: Commercial fishermen, seafood processing businesses, residents with fishing licenses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted microloans and expands eligibility to support the fishing industry, integrating environmental goals with economic support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting local fishing communities and economic stability.

Title: Division of Parole and Probation - Criteria for Earned Compliance Credit - Exception for Supervision Fees
Synopsis: Altering a certain condition regarding the payment of certain restitution, fines, and fees that a certain supervised individual must satisfy to accrue certain earned compliance credit while under the supervision of the Division of Parole and Probation in the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the criteria for earning compliance credits for individuals under supervision by the Division of Parole and Probation, specifically excluding the requirement to be current on court-ordered payments for restitution, fines, and fees, except for supervision fees. It also clarifies the assessment and collection of supervision fees.
responsible_party: Division of Parole and Probation, Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals under supervision by the Division of Parole and Probation in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes existing rules regarding compliance credits and supervision fees; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly adjusts supervision credit criteria and fee collection policies.

Title: Courts – Military Records – Recordation and Inspection
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law relating to the recordation and inspection of certain military records kept by the clerk of a circuit court to authorize the clerk to keep an electronic record instead of a book to record and index the discharge papers of a person who has served in the uniformed services of the United States; and requiring the clerk to deny inspection of the electronic record except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the rules for recording and inspecting military discharge records kept by Maryland circuit courts. It clarifies who can access these records and under what conditions, including redacting social security numbers and limiting access to certain individuals after a specified period.
responsible_party: Maryland circuit court clerks
stakeholders: Military service members, veterans, their families, legal professionals, and researchers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific privacy protections such as mandatory redaction of social security numbers and sets conditions for access to military discharge records, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Public Health - Nonoccupational Postexposure Prophylaxis (nPEP) Standing Order Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Nonoccupational Postexposure Prophylaxis (nPEP) Standing Order Program to authorize pharmacists to dispense nPEP under certain circumstances; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to adopt regulations necessary for the administration of the Program and that address the needs of certain populations, including victims of sexual assault and pediatric patients; and authorizing the Department to administer the Program, collect certain fees, and establish guidelines for training related to the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Nonoccupational Postexposure Prophylaxis (nPEP) Standing Order Program in Maryland, allowing pharmacists and certain healthcare providers to dispense nPEP medications under specific guidelines to reduce HIV transmission after potential exposure.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals at risk of HIV exposure, healthcare providers, pharmacists, public health organizations
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by authorizing pharmacists to dispense HIV prophylaxis medications under standing orders, expanding access and streamlining treatment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on HIV prevention and healthcare access.

Title: Housing Development Permit Applications - Local Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring local jurisdictions with at least 150,000 residents to report certain information for each building or development permit application that includes a residential housing component as part of the development to the Department of Housing and Community Development and the Department of Planning on or before July 1 each year; and requiring a local jurisdiction to make a copy of the report publicly available on its website.
bill_summary: The bill requires large local jurisdictions in Maryland to annually report detailed information about building and development permit applications that include residential components. These reports must be made publicly available on the jurisdiction's website.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development and Department of Planning
stakeholders: Local governments, residents, developers, and potential homebuyers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces transparency requirements for local jurisdictions by mandating public reporting of permit application data, but it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches beyond data reporting and public access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily improving transparency in housing development processes.

Title: Employment Standards, Prevailing Wage, and Living Wage - Employer Adverse Actions and Enforcement
Synopsis: Prohibiting employers from taking or threatening to take adverse action against an employee because the employee takes certain actions regarding rights and responsibilities, complaints, investigations, proceedings, or hearings; authorizing the Commissioner of Labor and Industry, within 90 days after receipt of a written complaint, to investigate a violation and attempt to resolve the issue informally through mediation; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits employers from taking adverse actions against employees for exercising their rights under certain employment laws, such as making complaints or participating in investigations. It establishes procedures for investigations, enforcement, and penalties for violations, including civil penalties and potential lawsuits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Industry
stakeholders: Employees and employers in Maryland, particularly those involved in employment rights and enforcement actions
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive enforcement and investigation framework, including proactive investigations, mediation, and penalties, to strengthen employee protections and ensure compliance with employment laws.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by protecting workers' rights and ensuring fair treatment, which can lead to improved economic stability for families.

Title: Civil Actions - Civil Immunity - Educator Intervention
Synopsis: Providing that a member of the administrative, educational, or support staff of any public, private, or parochial school, acting in an official capacity, is not civilly liable for personal injury or property damage resulting from intervention in a student altercation or other student disturbance if the staff member intervened in a reasonably prudent manner and the actions taken do not constitute grossly negligent, willful, wanton, or intentionally tortious conduct.
bill_summary: The bill grants civil immunity to school staff members who intervene in student altercations or disturbances, protecting them from liability for personal injury or property damage if their actions are reasonable and not grossly negligent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education or local school systems
stakeholders: School staff, students, and school communities
