child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns procurement processes and legal costs.

Title: Family Law - Marriage Ceremony - Designation of Deputy Clerk
Synopsis: Transferring, from the county administrative judge of the circuit court for the county to the clerk of the circuit court for the county, the authority to designate a deputy clerk to perform a marriage ceremony.
bill_summary: The bill transfers the authority to designate a deputy clerk to perform marriage ceremonies from the county administrative judge to the clerk of the circuit court for each county in Maryland.
responsible_party: Clerk of the circuit court for each county in Maryland
stakeholders: Individuals seeking marriage ceremonies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates the administrative process for marriage ceremonies by changing the responsible authority for designating deputy clerks, streamlining the process within existing judicial and clerical structures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Economic Development - Workgroup on Independent Innovation in Prince George's County - Establishment PG 402-24
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Independent Innovation in Prince George's County to promote innovation and technology in the county; and requiring the Workgroup by January 15, 2026, to report on recommendations regarding strategies to support investments in industry opportunities and potential areas of innovation to the Prince George's County Delegation and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Workgroup on Independent Innovation in Prince George's County to promote innovation and technology, creates the Prince George's County Venture Capital Fund to invest in startups, and sets up related programs and organizational structures to support entrepreneurship and industry development.
responsible_party: Prince George's County and Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Entrepreneurs, startups, local businesses, educational institutions, and residents of Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to fostering innovation through dedicated workgroups, a venture capital fund, and targeted programs to develop innovation hubs and support entrepreneurs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by fostering economic development and job creation in Prince George's County.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Nonprofit Organizations PG 304-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue a Class C (fraternal/sororal/service organization) alcoholic beverages license for use by an independent and nonprofit fraternal or sororal organization that meets certain requirements; authorizing the Board to revoke or suspend a license if a license holder is found guilty of certain violations; and providing for an annual license fee of $910.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners to issue a new Class C alcoholic beverages license specifically for independent, nonprofit fraternal, sororal, or service organizations that meet certain membership and operational criteria.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Nonprofit fraternal, sororal, and service organizations in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized alcohol license for nonprofit fraternal and sororal organizations, allowing them to sell alcohol for on-premises consumption, which is a tailored approach to licensing for specific community groups.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily pertains to licensing for nonprofit organizations.

Title: Cooperative Housing Corporations - Dispute Settlement
Synopsis: Altering procedures for the dispute settlement mechanism under the Maryland Cooperative Housing Corporation Act; applying the dispute settlement mechanism established by the Act to apply to any complaint or demand formally arising on or after October 1, 2023, with a certain exception; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends the dispute settlement procedures for cooperative housing corporations in Maryland, including notification and hearing processes for violations, and clarifies legal rights and enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Members of cooperative housing corporations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates and clarifies dispute resolution procedures, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on dispute resolution in cooperative housing may indirectly impact child poverty by improving housing stability.

Title: Regulated Firearms - Maryland Judiciary - Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Repealing and altering a reporting requirement to require the Maryland Judiciary, instead of the State Commission on Criminal Sentencing Policy, to report on the number of charges, convictions, and sentences for certain regulated firearm violations; and requiring by October 1, 2024 and each October 1 thereafter, that the Maryland Judiciary submit its report to the Governor and the General Assembly and include information disaggregated by jurisdiction, race, and gender.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a previous reporting requirement and establishes a new requirement for the Maryland Judiciary to report annually on charges, convictions, and sentences related to specific firearm violations, starting October 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and Department of State Police
stakeholders: Individuals involved in firearm violations, law enforcement agencies, policymakers, and the public interested in firearm law enforcement data
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new annual reporting requirement with detailed disaggregation by jurisdiction, race, and gender, enhancing transparency and data collection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily involves data reporting on firearm violations.

Title: Environment - Commission on Climate Change Membership - Addition
Synopsis: Adding the Secretary of Emergency Management, or the Secretary's designee, and the Chair of the Public Service Commission, or the Chair's designee, as members of the Commission on Climate Change.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership of the Maryland Commission on Climate Change by adding the Secretary of Emergency Management and the Chair of the Public Service Commission as members.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission on Climate Change
stakeholders: Government agencies involved in climate change and emergency management, policymakers, and the general public interested in climate policy
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates the membership of an existing commission, with no new programs or initiatives introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it focuses on the composition of a climate change advisory commission.

Title: Maryland Uniform Transfers to Minors Act - Transfers as Custodian for the Benefit of a Minor - Authorization of Court
Synopsis: Increasing, from in excess of $10,000 to in excess of $25,000, the threshold amount for certain transfers by a personal representative, trustee, or conservator as a custodian for the benefit of a minor to require authorization by a court.
bill_summary: The bill increases the monetary threshold for transfers made by personal representatives, trustees, or conservators as custodians for minors, requiring court approval for transfers exceeding $25,000.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and estate/trust departments
stakeholders: Minors, estate executors, trustees, conservators, and legal representatives in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal thresholds and procedures for estate transfers, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on estate transfer procedures.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Interested Person - Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "interested person" for purposes of provisions of law governing the estates of decedents, guardians of persons and property, trusts, and powers of attorney.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of "interested person" in Maryland law concerning estates, trusts, and powers of attorney, clarifying who qualifies as an interested person and when they cease to be one.
responsible_party: Maryland State Legislature and courts for implementation
stakeholders: Individuals involved in estates, trusts, and probate proceedings in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates legal definitions to improve clarity and efficiency in estate and trust proceedings, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily clarifies legal definitions related to estates and trusts.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Appointment of Personal Representative - Objections
Synopsis: Authorizing only an interested person or unpaid claimant, rather than any person, to file an objection to the appointment of a personal representative of an estate of a decedent.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to specify that only interested persons or unpaid claimants, rather than any person, can file objections to the appointment of a personal representative of an estate.
responsible_party: Maryland Register of Wills or relevant estate court authority
stakeholders: Individuals involved in estate administration and beneficiaries of estates in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill primarily clarifies and restricts who can file objections in estate proceedings, rather than introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly changes legal procedures for estate management.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Board of Community College Trustees - Membership Alterations and Appointment Requirements
Synopsis: Increasing by two members the membership of the Board of Community College Trustees for Anne Arundel County; and requiring the Governor to consider the geographic and ethnic representation of Anne Arundel County when making appointments to the Board.
bill_summary: This bill increases the number of members on the Anne Arundel County Board of Community College Trustees from 8 to 10, specifies appointment procedures, and emphasizes geographic and ethnic representation.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland and Anne Arundel County Board of Community College Trustees
stakeholders: Residents of Anne Arundel County, students at Anne Arundel Community College, and the local community
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes diverse geographic and ethnic representation in the appointment process, promoting inclusive governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly impact students and families through improved community college governance.

Title: Hospitals - Financial Assistance Policies - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the required contents of a hospital's financial assistance policy by removing the requirement that the provision of reduced-cost medically necessary care and payment plans be in accordance with the mission and service area of the hospital; authorizing hospitals to consider only household monetary assets in excess of $100,000 when determining eligibility for free and reduced-cost care under the hospital's financial assistance policy; and requiring that certain retirement assets be excluded from consideration.
bill_summary: The bill revises hospital financial assistance policies in Maryland, specifically removing the requirement that reduced-cost care be aligned with the hospital's mission and service area, and allowing hospitals to consider only household assets above $100,000 when determining eligibility for free or reduced-cost care, with certain assets excluded.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Hospital patients in Maryland, especially those seeking financial assistance for healthcare
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a change in how hospitals assess household assets for financial assistance, focusing on asset thresholds and exclusions, which is a modification of existing eligibility criteria rather than a new technological approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly changes asset consideration rules for hospital financial assistance programs.

Title: Out-of-State Motor Vehicles - Improper Registration - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration, in consultation with Baltimore City and other interested jurisdictions, to prepare a report on motor vehicles owned by Maryland residents that are improperly titled or registered in another state; requiring the Administration to submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City to tow, remove, or impound vehicles owned by new residents who fail to register their vehicles with the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration within 60 days. It also requires the Motor Vehicle Administration to prepare a report on motor vehicles owned by Maryland residents that are improperly registered in other states, including analysis, enforcement, and policy recommendations.
responsible_party: Motor Vehicle Administration of Maryland
stakeholders: New residents of Maryland, Maryland residents with vehicles registered in other states, Maryland State government, Baltimore City authorities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a data collection and reporting approach to address the issue of improperly registered vehicles, and grants Baltimore City enforcement authority, representing a coordinated government effort employing data analysis and inter-agency collaboration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses vehicle registration enforcement and data analysis.

Title: Election Law - Election Disinformation and Improper Influence Related to Voting
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections to maintain a portal on the State Board's website that the public may use to report election misinformation and election disinformation; requiring the State Board to conduct a periodic review of material submitted by the public through the portal and, to the extent necessary, issue corrective information or refer submissions to the State Prosecutor; and defining "influence" for purposes of certain provisions of law prohibiting improper influence related to voting.
bill_summary: The bill requires large social media platforms to make efforts to prevent, detect, and remove election disinformation and disinformation accounts or posts in Maryland. It mandates reporting of election disinformation to the Maryland State Board of Elections, which will review and publish the information and may refer serious cases to prosecutors. The bill also establishes penalties for non-compliance and creates a public portal for reporting election misinformation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, social media users, election officials, the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by requiring social media platforms to actively monitor, report, and address election disinformation, and by creating a public reporting portal and a review process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting fair elections and trustworthy information, which can influence policies affecting children.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - B-D-7 Licenses - Hours of Sale
Synopsis: Altering a geographic boundary in the 45th alcoholic beverages district of Baltimore City within which a holder of a B-D-7 alcoholic beverages license must operate in accordance with certain hours.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the geographic boundaries and hours of sale for certain alcohol licenses in Baltimore City, specifically the B–D–7 license, and sets new operating hours for license holders in specific areas.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Department or relevant local authority
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents, and businesses in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates geographic boundaries and operating hours for alcohol licenses, which is a regulatory change rather than an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Maryland Achieving a Better Life Experience (ABLE) Program - Materials for Individualized Education Program, Individualized Family Service Plan, and 504 Plan Meetings
Synopsis: Requiring a local school system to provide to parents at certain individualized education program, individualized family service plan, and 504 plan meetings for children with disabilities certain written informational materials regarding the Maryland ABLE Program; requiring the State Treasurer to develop informational materials about the Maryland ABLE Program that may be distributed electronically or by hand; and requiring the State Treasurer to provide informational materials to the State Board of Education and county boards.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland local school systems to provide parents with informational materials about the Maryland ABLE Program during IEP, IFSP, and 504 plan meetings for children with disabilities. It also tasks the State Treasurer with developing and distributing these materials to support awareness of the ABLE Program.
responsible_party: State Treasurer and Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Parents of children with disabilities, children with disabilities, families eligible for the ABLE Program
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by integrating informational distribution about the ABLE Program into existing special education and 504 plan meetings, leveraging these meetings as a platform for financial education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing awareness and access to the ABLE Program, which can help families save for disability-related expenses.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Bike Lanes and Shoulders - Yielding Right-of-Way (Sarah Debbink Langenkamp Memorial Act)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing a violation of a certain provision of law governing the right-of-way of a bicycle, a motor scooter, or an electronic personal assistive mobility device lawfully in a designated bike lane or shoulder that contributes to the serious physical injury or death of a person riding a bicycle, EPAMD, or motor scooter; and providing that a person convicted of a violation of the Act is subject to imprisonment of up to 2 months or a fine not to exceed $2,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill enhances laws regarding yielding right-of-way to bicycles, e-scooters, and motor scooters, and prohibits actions that contribute to crashes resulting in serious injury or death of riders in bike lanes or shoulders.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Bicycle, e-scooter, and motor scooter riders; drivers; general public
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing traffic laws to improve safety for vulnerable road users and introduces stricter penalties for violations causing serious injury or death.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Criminal Procedure – Facial Recognition Technology – Requirements, Procedures, and Prohibitions
Synopsis: Establishing requirements, procedures, and prohibitions relating to the use of facial recognition technology by a law enforcement agency;  requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to  administer a training program regarding the use of facial recognition technology by June 30, 2026; requiring the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to report to the General Assembly by October 1 each year the information reported by law enforcement agencies using facial recognition technology; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations, requirements, and prohibitions for the use of facial recognition technology by law enforcement agencies in Maryland, including restrictions on its use in criminal investigations, mandates for transparency, oversight, and annual reporting, and preemption of local laws.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, individuals subject to facial recognition analysis, civil rights organizations, general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive regulatory framework for facial recognition technology, including oversight, transparency, and restrictions, which is a relatively innovative approach to managing emerging surveillance technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on regulation and oversight of facial recognition technology.

Title: State Procurement - Prompt Payment of Suppliers
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions requiring prompt payments for State procurement contracts apply to payments owed by a contractor to a supplier.
bill_summary: The bill mandates prompt payment procedures for suppliers who have provided labor or materials under Maryland state procurement contracts. It establishes timelines and dispute resolution processes to ensure suppliers are paid promptly and outlines penalties for delayed payments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of General Services or designated procurement unit
stakeholders: Suppliers providing labor or materials for state contracts, contractors, subcontractors, and state agencies
innovative_summary: The program introduces a structured dispute resolution process and penalties for delayed payments, employing a formalized approach to enforce prompt payments in government procurement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve cash flow for suppliers, which could indirectly benefit workers and communities, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Environment - Dredged Material - Containment, Redeposit, and Oversight
Synopsis: Requiring the Cox Creek Oversight Committee to provide input to the Maryland Port Administration regarding management of dredged material at the Cox Creek Dredge Material Containment Facility; authorizing the Department of the Environment to approve contained areas at a large redevelopment site for the redeposit of certain dredged material; establishing the Hart-Miller-Pleasure Island Citizens Oversight Committee to monitor the area water quality, and the future development and use of the Hart-Miller-Pleasure Island chain; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the membership and responsibilities of the Cox Creek and Hart–Miller–Pleasure Island Citizens Oversight Committees, establishes rules for the redeposit of dredged material, and sets conditions for approvals related to dredging and containment facilities in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Local communities near dredging sites, environmental groups, Maryland Port Administration, Baltimore County, and residents affected by dredging activities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces community benefits agreements and oversight committees to involve local communities in dredging and containment activities, and sets specific conditions for dredged material redeposit, which is a relatively innovative approach to environmental management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on environmental oversight and community benefits may indirectly benefit children by improving local environmental conditions and community well-being.

Title: Fish and Wildlife - Endangered and Threatened Species - Definitions, Petitions, and Regulations
Synopsis: Requiring certain petitions to review the listing or unlisting of endangered or threatened species to contain certain information regarding the distribution, life needs, habitat requirements, and status of the species; requiring the Secretary of Natural Resources to review and, if warranted, update certain regulations listing endangered or threatened species on or before July 1, 2026, and every 5 years thereafter; and altering the definitions of "fish" and "wildlife" for certain purposes.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations and definitions related to endangered and threatened species of fish, wildlife, and plants in Maryland. It requires the Secretary of Natural Resources to review and update species listings periodically and upon petitions, and clarifies procedures for listing and delisting species.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Wildlife, fish, and plant populations in Maryland, conservation organizations, and the general public interested in biodiversity and environmental protection.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured, science-based approach to species conservation, including periodic reviews and public petitions, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative methods beyond standard conservation practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing primarily on environmental conservation and species protection.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - 2-1-1 Maryland - Oversight
Synopsis: Defining the term "Health and Human Services Referral System" for the purposes of certain provisions of law governing the System to mean a certain coordinated system for health and human service resources that is accessible to State residents, rather than a certain telephone service; repealing the requirement that the Maryland Department of Health evaluate the performance of certain call centers and make certain recommendations regarding the quality of service provided by call centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill redefines the 'Health and Human Services Referral System' as a coordinated system accessible to all Maryland residents through 2-1-1 and other technology, clarifies the role of 2-1-1 Maryland, and establishes oversight and program development responsibilities for the Maryland Department of Health and 2-1-1 Maryland. It also expands the board of directors to include representatives from call centers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and 2-1-1 Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents seeking health and human services information
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes a coordinated, technology-based approach to health and human services information, including the development of an opt-in mental health services call program, which is a modern approach to service delivery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve access to health and human services, which can help reduce child poverty by connecting families to resources.

Title: Prince George's County - Workgroup on Health and Wellness PG 409-24
Synopsis: Establishing a Workgroup on Health and Wellness in Prince George's County to review and evaluate health and wellness practices, programs, services, and resources in Prince George's County and make recommendations regarding best practices in health and wellness community programming in the county; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Prince George's County Executive, the Chair of the Prince George's County Council, the Governor, and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup on Health and Wellness in Prince George's County to review health practices, programs, and access, and to make recommendations for improving health and wellness initiatives in the county.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Health Department
stakeholders: Residents of Prince George's County, local health and wellness businesses, community organizations, and county agencies
innovative_summary: The program aims to evaluate and recommend integrative health practices and the development of health and wellness hubs, incorporating community-based and potentially new integrative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve health access and wellness, which can contribute to reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: Caroline County - Alcoholic Beverages - Barbershop and Beauty Salon License
Synopsis: Establishing a barbershop and beauty salon beer and wine license in Caroline County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Caroline County to issue the license to a holder of a certain barbershop or beauty salon permit; establishing a licensing fee of $100; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new license in Caroline County allowing barbershops and beauty salons to serve beer and wine to customers during services, with specific limits and conditions.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Caroline County
stakeholders: Barbershops, beauty salons, their customers, and the local community in Caroline County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new type of alcohol license for non-traditional venues like barbershops and salons, integrating alcohol service into personal care businesses.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily changes licensing rules for alcohol service in specific businesses.

Title: Caroline County – Alcoholic Beverages – Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting License
Synopsis: Altering the 1-day beer and wine tasting (BWT) license in Caroline County to be a 1-day beer, wine, and liquor tasting (BWLT) license; altering certain qualifications for the license; and altering the amounts of alcoholic beverages an individual may consume at a tasting.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the existing one-day beer and wine tasting license in Caroline County to include liquor, changing the license to a one-day beer, wine, and liquor tasting license. It updates the qualifications, consumption limits, and other regulations related to the license.
responsible_party: Caroline County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage consumers and license holders in Caroline County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a combined tasting license for beer, wine, and liquor, streamlining licensing and consumption regulations for tasting events.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns licensing and alcohol consumption regulations.

Title: Prince George's County - Stop Sign Monitoring Systems - Authorization PG 301-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the use of stop sign monitoring systems in school zones in Prince George's County, if authorized by local law; providing that the owner or driver of a motor vehicle recorded failing to obey a stop sign is subject to a citation and a certain civil penalty under certain circumstances; establishing certain defenses to a charge of an alleged violation recorded by a stop sign monitoring system; requiring the Prince George's County Department of Public Works and Transportation to make a certain report by December 1, 2025; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of stop sign monitoring systems in school zones in Prince George's County, Maryland, allowing for civil penalties and citations to be issued for violations, and establishes procedures for enforcement, reporting, and program duration.
responsible_party: Prince George’s County Department of Public Works and Transportation
stakeholders: Drivers, vehicle owners, pedestrians, and residents in Prince George's County, especially near school zones
innovative_summary: The program employs automated stop sign monitoring systems to enforce traffic laws, utilizing recorded images and civil penalties, which is a modern approach to traffic law enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve safety around schools, indirectly benefiting children.

Title: Community Colleges - Contraception - Access Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring on or before certain dates each community college to develop and implement a plan to provide students with access to over-the-counter contraception; requiring each community college to submit a certain report to the Maryland Higher Education Commission by September 1 each year; requiring the Commission to submit a certain report to the General Assembly on or before October 1 each year; and authorizing the Maryland Department of Health, on request, to provide certain assistance to a community college.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland community colleges to develop and implement plans to provide students with access to over-the-counter contraception by August 1, 2025. It also mandates annual reporting on implementation progress and allows the Department of Health to assist colleges upon request.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Community college students in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured approach to providing over-the-counter contraception access at community colleges, including consultation, reporting, and potential use of vending machines, which is a relatively innovative approach to health access in educational settings.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By improving access to contraception, the program has the potential to reduce unintended pregnancies and support economic stability for young people, thereby potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Election Law - Recounts - Procedures
Synopsis: Requiring a petitioner for a recount to select the method for conducting the recount; limiting the methods from which the selection must be made; and requiring a local board of elections to preserve and store certain voter-verifiable paper records and conduct a recount in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new procedures for recounts in elections, including requiring petitioners to select a specific method for recounting votes, and mandates the preservation and proper handling of voter-verifiable paper records and duplicate ballots.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, candidates, election officials in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured approach to recounts, including the use of voter-verifiable paper records and duplicate ballots, which enhances transparency and accuracy in election recounts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Montgomery County and Prince George's County - Rent Court Workforce Solutions Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Rent Court Workforce Solutions Pilot Program in Montgomery County and Prince George's County to provide residential tenants who are facing eviction for a failure to pay rent with information on workforce development and employment opportunities; and requiring by January 1, 2026 and each January 1 thereafter, a designated organization to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the number of individuals that were connected to workforce development programs or employment opportunities through the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Rent Court Workforce Solutions Pilot Program in Montgomery County and Prince George's County to connect tenants involved in failure to pay rent cases with workforce development resources and employment opportunities, including apprenticeships.
responsible_party: Designated organizations under the local workforce development boards in Montgomery and Prince George's counties
stakeholders: Tenants involved in failure to pay rent cases in Montgomery and Prince George's counties
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach by integrating workforce development resources directly within the rent court process, which is a novel approach to addressing housing and employment issues simultaneously.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by helping tenants secure employment and stabilize housing.

Title: Port of Baltimore - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the Port of Baltimore to be the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Port of Baltimore to the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore, in honor of Helen Delich Bentley's contributions to the port and maritime industry. It also updates related legal references and establishes a recognition of her legacy.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant port authority
stakeholders: Maritime industry, port workers, residents near the port, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on renaming and legal recognition; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Study on the Feasibility of Relocating the Prince George's County Public School System Headquarters PG 501-24
Synopsis: Requiring the Prince George's County Board of Education to hire an independent consultant to study and make recommendations on the feasibility of relocating the Prince George's County public school system headquarters and to report its recommendations by June 1, 2026; and requiring the County board to cover the cost of the study.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Prince George's County Board of Education to hire an independent consultant to study the feasibility of relocating the school system headquarters within the county. The study will include site analysis, financial and environmental assessments, stakeholder engagement, and community input, with a report due by June 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of Education
stakeholders: Prince George's County public school students, staff, residents, and local community organizations
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, multi-faceted study approach involving site analysis, financial and environmental assessments, stakeholder interviews, and community engagement, which is a thorough and collaborative approach to planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by improving school infrastructure and community resources, but its direct impact is moderate.

Title: State Board of Dietetic Practice - Dietitian-Nutritionists - Application Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring that an individual shall have received at a minimum a degree from a college or university accredited by an educational accrediting association as required by the Commission on Dietetic Registration to be licensed as a dietician-nutritionist.
bill_summary: The bill updates the licensure application requirements for dietitian-nutritionists in Maryland, including educational qualifications and certification standards, and allows for waivers of examination requirements for qualified applicants from other states or with certain certifications.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Dietetic Practice
stakeholders: Aspiring and current dietitian-nutritionists, healthcare providers, and the public seeking nutritional services
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing licensure requirements and introduces flexibility for qualified applicants from other regions or with specific certifications, rather than establishing a new program or service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns professional licensing requirements for dietitian-nutritionists.

Title: Wildlife - Traveling Animal Acts - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from allowing for the participation of a bear, a cougar, an elephant, a jaguar, a leopard, a lion, a nonhuman primate, a tiger, or a hybrid of any of these animals in a traveling animal act; and providing a civil penalty of $2,000 per violation.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the participation of certain covered animals, such as bears, big cats, nonhuman primates, and hybrids, in traveling animal acts, and establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Animals involved in traveling acts, animal rights advocates, traveling entertainment performers, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal ban on the participation of specific wildlife in traveling performances, aligning with modern animal welfare standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Emergency Medical Services Board - Licenses and Certificates - Application Requirements
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Emergency Medical Services (EMS) Board from requiring an applicant to provide proof that the applicant is lawfully present in the United States or have a Social Security number or Individual Taxpayer Identification Number as a condition for licensure or certification; and requiring the EMS Board to require applicants for a license or certificate to disclose certain information or provide alternative documentation and record the information in the applicant's file for a certain purpose.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland EMS Board from requiring proof of lawful presence in the U.S. or a Social Security number for licensure or certification, but requires applicants to disclose their Social Security or Taxpayer Identification Number for record-keeping and child support enforcement purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Emergency Medical Services Board
stakeholders: Applicants for emergency medical services licenses and certificates in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy change to remove proof of lawful presence and Social Security number requirements for EMS licensure, focusing on privacy and administrative efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting administrative procedures for EMS licensing.

Title: State Board of Examiners in Optometry - Criminal History Records Checks
Synopsis: Requiring an applicant for a license to practice optometry and certain applicants for the renewal of a license to submit to a criminal history records check obtained from the Criminal Justice Information Central Repository of the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services; and providing that information obtained from the Central Repository is confidential, may not be redisseminated, and is to be used only for licensing purposes.
bill_summary: The bill requires applicants for initial licensure and renewal of optometry licenses in Maryland to submit to criminal history records checks, including fingerprinting, as part of the licensing process.
responsible_party: State Board of Examiners in Optometry
stakeholders: Applicants for optometry licenses and license renewals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs criminal background checks, including fingerprinting, as a new requirement for licensing, integrating technology for security and compliance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing procedures.

Title: Criminal and Civil Trespass - Professional Land Surveyors - Exception
Synopsis: Establishing exceptions to certain criminal prohibitions against trespass on property and the civil tort of trespass for professional land surveyors, and agents and employees of professional land surveyors, who enter the property of another to practice land surveying.
bill_summary: The bill establishes legal exceptions for professional land surveyors, and their agents and employees, from criminal and civil trespass liabilities when they enter private property to practice land surveying.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board for Professional Land Surveyors
stakeholders: Professional land surveyors and property owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill provides legal protections for land surveyors, clarifying their rights to enter private property without liability, which is a legal clarification rather than a new technological or innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Cosmetology Licensure Compact
Synopsis: Entering into the Cosmetology Licensure Compact; establishing criteria for participating states; authorizing an individual practicing cosmetology to practice in a party state under certain circumstances; establishing the Cosmetology Licensure Compact Commission and its duties and powers; and providing for the amendment of and withdrawal from the Compact.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland participation in the Cosmetology Licensure Compact, a multistate agreement to facilitate interstate practice, improve public safety, and reduce licensure burdens for licensed cosmetologists.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Licensed cosmetologists, public seeking cosmetology services, military members and spouses
innovative_summary: The program employs a multistate licensure compact, a new approach leveraging interstate cooperation and shared data systems to streamline licensing and enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on professional mobility and regulation.

Title: Wage Payment and Collection - Pay Stubs and Pay Statements - Required Information
Synopsis: Requiring that a notice containing certain information provided to an employee at the time of hiring be written; requiring that the statement regarding earnings required to be provided to employees by employers be written on the physical pay stub or online pay statement and include certain information; requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to create and make available to an employer at no charge a pay stub template that may be used by an employer to comply with the Act; and establishing a certain administrative penalty.
bill_summary: The bill requires employers in Maryland to provide written notices of pay details at hiring and detailed pay statements with specific information on pay stubs or online statements. It also establishes a process for the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to create a free pay stub template and enforces penalties for non-compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Industry
stakeholders: Employees and employers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes pay stub information and provides a free template, improving transparency and compliance, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on pay transparency could indirectly benefit low-income workers, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program - Alterations (Maryland Meals for Achievement Flexibility Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Clarifying that secondary schools participating in the Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program may serve breakfast in any broadly accessible part of the school; and authorizing elementary schools participating in the Program, subject to certain approval and allowances, to serve breakfast in any broadly accessible part of the school, including from "Grab and Go" carts.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies and expands the Maryland Meals for Achievement In–Classroom Breakfast Program, allowing secondary schools to serve breakfast in any broadly accessible part of the school and, with approval, elementary schools to do the same, including from 'Grab and Go' carts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students in Maryland public and eligible nonpublic schools, school staff, and families
innovative_summary: The program introduces flexibility in where breakfast can be served in schools, including the use of 'Grab and Go' carts, to increase participation and accessibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to free breakfast for students, especially those from low-income families.

Title: Public Information Act – Surveillance Images – Illegal Dumping in Baltimore City
Synopsis: Altering a requirement that a custodian deny inspection of certain surveillance images of illegal dumping in Baltimore City to allow inspection by an employee or agent of the Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development; and authorizing the Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development to publicly disseminate a surveillance image as part of an investigation.
bill_summary: The bill modifies rules regarding access to surveillance images of illegal dumping in Baltimore City, allowing certain city employees to inspect and publicly disseminate these images under specific circumstances.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents and authorities involved in illegal dumping investigations in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by allowing public dissemination of surveillance images as part of investigations, enhancing transparency and enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on surveillance and enforcement procedures.

Title: Commission on African American History and Culture - Museum Name Change
Synopsis: Altering the name of the museum operated by the Commission on African American History and Culture in certain provisions of law from the "Banneker-Douglass Museum" to the "Banneker-Douglass-Tubman Museum".
bill_summary: The bill changes the name of the museum operated by the Commission on African American History and Culture in Maryland, and provides funding and operational guidelines for the museum and the commission.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission on African American History and Culture
stakeholders: African American community, Maryland residents, cultural and educational institutions
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates the museum's name and funding structure; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific programs targeting it.

Title: Human Relations - Commission on Civil Rights - Appeal of Final Orders
Synopsis: Providing that a certain final order of the Commission on Civil Rights on a complaint alleging a discriminatory act is appealable in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act.
bill_summary: The bill allows final orders of the Maryland Commission on Civil Rights regarding complaints of discrimination to be appealed in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act, and clarifies the process for reconsideration and appeal of such orders.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission on Civil Rights
stakeholders: Individuals filing complaints of discrimination in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates existing legal procedures to align with the Administrative Procedure Act, providing clearer pathways for appeals and reconsiderations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Sales and Use Tax on Energy and Fuel - Use of Revenue PG 407-24
Synopsis: Altering a certain provision of law relating to the use of certain revenue from the sales and use tax on energy and fuel in Prince George's County by allowing the revenue to be used to meet certain education funding requirements for the county; and repealing a requirement that the county appropriate a certain amount of local money to the school operating budget each fiscal year.
bill_summary: The bill allows revenue from the sales and use tax on energy and fuel in Prince George's County to be used to meet education funding requirements, and repeals a previous requirement that the county allocate a specific amount of local money to the school operating budget each year.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government and local education authorities
stakeholders: Students, schools, and residents of Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by reallocating existing sales tax revenue to meet education funding needs, rather than establishing a new program or technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve funding for education, which can help reduce child poverty by supporting better educational resources and opportunities.

Title: Public Utilities – Thermal Energy Network Systems – Authorization and Establishment (Working for Accessible Renewable Maryland Thermal Heat (WARMTH) Act)
Synopsis: Requiring gas companies serving at least 75,000 customers in their distribution territories and authorizing gas companies serving fewer than 75,000 customers to develop a plan for a pilot thermal energy network system or systems on or before October 1, 2024; requiring certain gas companies to submit a certain proposal or proposals to the Public Service Commission for approval on or before July 1, 2025; authorizing certain entities or a community organization to submit neighborhoods for consideration as part of a pilot system; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a program for developing and implementing pilot thermal energy network systems by gas companies in Maryland, focusing on replacing gas infrastructure with renewable thermal energy systems, with funding, community engagement, and evaluation provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration and Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Low and moderate income residents, local communities, gas and utility companies, contractors, and environmental groups
innovative_summary: The program employs innovative approaches by integrating renewable thermal energy systems, community benefit agreements, and federal funding coordination to transition away from gas infrastructure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to affordable, clean energy and creating local jobs in underserved communities.

Title: Prince George's County - Taxes on Telecommunications Services - Use of Revenue PG 406-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the Prince George's County Council to impose an excise tax on certain telecommunications service in Prince George's County in addition to, or instead of, a sales and use tax; altering a certain provision of law relating to the use of certain revenue from a certain tax on telecommunications services by allowing the revenue to be used to meet certain education funding requirements for the county; requiring the county to submit an annual report detailing the expenditure of revenues generated by a tax imposed by the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to impose a local excise tax on telecommunications services, which can be used primarily to fund public education, including specific programs like support for low-performing students and bilingual education.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Council and County government
stakeholders: Residents of Prince George's County, students, and educational institutions
innovative_summary: The bill employs a dedicated telecommunications excise tax to fund specific educational programs and infrastructure, integrating revenue collection with targeted educational investments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by funding educational programs that support disadvantaged students.

Title: Public Safety - Wellness Checks - Requirements (Gabriel's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring a law enforcement agency that receives a certain request for a wellness check of an individual to conduct a wellness check or submit a request for the relevant law enforcement agency to conduct a wellness check without unreasonable delay; and requiring a fire, rescue, or emergency medical services entity to conduct the wellness check simultaneously with the law enforcement agency if the request concerns a life-threatening condition.
bill_summary: The bill requires law enforcement, fire, rescue, and emergency medical services to conduct or request wellness checks for individuals based on credible safety concerns, with specific procedures for life-threatening situations and jurisdictional requests, effective October 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland law enforcement agencies, fire, rescue, and emergency medical services
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland who may need wellness checks, including vulnerable populations and those with safety concerns
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated approach across multiple emergency services to respond rapidly to safety concerns, emphasizing immediate action and jurisdictional cooperation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly benefit children by ensuring safety and well-being, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Mental Health Law - County Mental Health Advisory Committees - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of a county's mental health advisory committee by including an individual with experience with mental health care for veterans or individuals serving in the military on the list of groups from which individuals may be appointed to the committee by the governing body of the county.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to include individuals with experience in mental health care for veterans or military personnel as members of county mental health advisory committees.
responsible_party: County governments and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Veterans, military personnel, mental health professionals, and residents of Maryland counties
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new category of advisory committee member with specific experience in military and veteran mental health, enhancing the diversity and expertise of advisory committees.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit children through improved mental health services for families and veterans.

Title: Maryland Technology Development Corporation - Equitech Growth Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Specifying that the Equitech Growth Fund in the Maryland Technology Development Corporation may be used only to make certain awards and to pay the costs of administering the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Equitech Growth Fund within the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to support economic competitiveness and inclusive growth through workforce development and infrastructure projects, with annual funding of $5 million from 2025 to 2033.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Emerging and advanced industries, workforce, higher education institutions, private and public entities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a strategic approach to leverage private, federal, and other funding sources to support economic growth, workforce development, and infrastructure, with a focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly through economic growth and workforce development, but does not target child poverty directly.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Reports on Standing Orders and Opioid Overdose Reversal Drugs
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on current opioid overdose reversal drugs and, for any current opioid overdose reversal drug approved by the federal Food and Drug Administration, whether the Department has added the drug to a standing order and, if not, the reasons why the drug has not been added; and requiring the report to be submitted by December 1, 2024, December 1, 2025, and December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to report on opioid overdose reversal drugs and standing orders, including whether new drugs have been added to standing orders, on or before December 1 of 2024, 2025, and 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals at risk of opioid overdose and healthcare providers involved in prescribing or dispensing overdose reversal drugs
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy to regularly review and report on the availability and approval of opioid overdose reversal drugs, promoting transparency and potentially expanding access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on drug policy and healthcare reporting.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Administration - Clarification and Technical Correction
Synopsis: Clarifying that the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System may pay certain incentive compensation to the Chief Investment Officer for the State Retirement and Pension System if the Chief Investment Officer retires from the Investment Division of the State Retirement Agency in a certain manner; and correcting a certain incorrect reference of an age restriction applying to certain members of the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System who participate in the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP).
bill_summary: The bill clarifies rules regarding incentive payments to the Chief Investment Officer of the Maryland State Retirement System upon retirement, corrects an age restriction reference for members in the DROP program, and allows certain law enforcement members to extend their DROP participation until a specified date.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members of the State Police Retirement System and Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, and the Maryland State Retirement System
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates rules and clarifies existing policies; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily deals with retirement and pension policies for law enforcement and retirement system administration.

Title: Public Schools - Active Shooter Safety Drills or Trainings - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Center for School Safety to collaborate with an institution of higher education or a designated federal or national research entity to study the effectiveness and impact of active shooter safety drills or trainings by researching and analyzing data collected by local school systems; requiring the Center to identify best practices for active shooter safety drills or trainings on or before October 1, 2024; requiring local school systems to provide parents with the annual schedule of active shooter safety drills; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Center for School Safety to collaborate with research entities to study the effectiveness and psychological impact of active shooter drills in schools, identify best practices, and update these practices periodically. It also requires the Department of Education to incorporate these practices into school safety drills, develop model content on firearm storage laws for parents, and ensure proper communication and support for students and staff during such drills.
responsible_party: Maryland Center for School Safety and Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, parents, school personnel, and local school systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a data-driven, research-based approach to improve active shooter safety drills, including collaboration with higher education and research entities, and development of model content for firearm safety, which is a relatively innovative approach to school safety protocols.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving school safety and mental health support, which can contribute to a safer environment for children.

Title: Grant Applications and Reporting - Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council by removing the Director of the Governor's Grants Office or the Director's designee and adding the Comptroller or the Comptroller's designee; requiring the Council to study and make recommendations to the Department of Budget and Management regarding the creation of a State Grants Ombudsperson by July 1, 2025; altering certain reporting requirements; and extending the termination date of the Council to June 30, 2029.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council to study and recommend improvements to the state's grant application processes, including creating a State Grants Ombudsperson, and extends the duration of the council and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: State grant-making agencies, grant applicants, nonprofit organizations, and government entities involved in grant processes in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the creation of a State Grants Ombudsperson and aims to develop a centralized, uniform grants management system, employing new approaches to streamline and improve government grant processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to grants and resources for nonprofits and community programs that serve children and families.

Title: State and Local Parks - Play Area Accessibility - Recreation Communication Boards Pilot Program
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources and local governing bodies to construct communication boards in certain newly constructed public play areas; defining "communication board" as a device that displays photos, symbols, or illustrations to enable individuals with limited language skills to communicate; establishing the Maryland Recreation Communication Boards Pilot Program, subject to funding, to improve play area accessibility by covering the cost of purchasing and installing communication boards at State and local parks; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Recreation Communication Boards Pilot Program to improve accessibility in public play areas by installing communication boards that display photos, symbols, or illustrations to assist individuals with limited language skills. It authorizes funding for constructing and installing these boards in new and existing play areas, with specific funding limits and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Children and individuals with communication disabilities using public play areas in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs communication boards with photos, symbols, and Braille to enhance accessibility, representing an innovative approach to inclusive play area design.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve access and inclusion for children with communication disabilities, which can contribute to reducing barriers faced by children in poverty.

Title: Montgomery County - Housing Opportunities Commission - Alterations MC 3-24
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement that the Housing Opportunities Commission of Montgomery County hold public hearings on assisted family housing proposals; and repealing the requirement that the Montgomery Commission publish a summary of the Montgomery Commission's annual financial report in certain newspapers.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain requirements for the Housing Opportunities Commission of Montgomery County, including holding public hearings on assisted family housing proposals and publishing a summary of its annual financial report in newspapers. It also updates reporting procedures to be available on the website.
responsible_party: Housing Opportunities Commission of Montgomery County
stakeholders: Residents of Montgomery County, housing advocates, local government officials
innovative_summary: The bill modernizes reporting requirements by shifting from newspaper publication to online publication, reducing administrative burdens and increasing transparency through digital access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes reporting and hearing requirements for a local housing agency.

Title: Places of Public Accommodation - Motion Picture Houses - Captioning
Synopsis: Requiring all motion picture houses to offer closed movie captioning for each screening of a motion picture, with a certain exception; and requiring, if a motion picture is produced and available to motion picture houses with open movie captioning, a place of public accommodation that controls, operates, owns, or leases a motion picture house with eight or more screens in the State to provide open movie captioning for at least two screenings for each motion picture it screens each week.
bill_summary: The bill requires motion picture houses in Maryland to offer closed captioning for each screening and to provide open captioning for at least some screenings each week, especially for movies with captioning available.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant state agency overseeing public accommodations and accessibility
stakeholders: People with hearing disabilities and the general public attending movie theaters in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs existing captioning technology and mandates its use in public movie theaters, ensuring accessibility but not employing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on accessibility for individuals with hearing disabilities.

Title: Community Schools - Rental Assistance for Community School Families Program and Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Rental Assistance for Community School Families Program to provide rental assistance to eligible student households; requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development, in consultation with the State Department of Education, to administer the Program; establishing the Rental Assistance for Community School Families Fund; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $10,000,000 in the annual budget bill for the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Rental Assistance for Community School Families Program and Fund to provide rental and utility assistance to eligible student households in community schools, aiming to support families facing housing instability.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development in coordination with the Department of Education and the Governor’s Office for Children
stakeholders: Families of students attending community schools, particularly those facing housing instability or homelessness
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to address housing instability among students by providing direct rental and utility assistance through a dedicated fund, integrating housing support with educational services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by alleviating housing instability among low-income families.

Title: Department of Veterans Affairs - Renaming and Deputy Secretary of Military Family Policy and Programs
Synopsis: Renaming the Department of Veterans Affairs to be the Department of Veterans and Military Families; renaming the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to be the Secretary of Veterans and Military Families; requiring the Secretary to appoint a Deputy Secretary of Military Family Policy and Programs; and providing that the Department of Veterans and Military Families is the successor of the Department of Veterans Affairs.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs to the Department of Veterans and Military Families, establishes a Deputy Secretary of Military Family Policy and Programs, and makes related administrative and legal updates.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans and military families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates the organizational structure and naming conventions of the department, with the addition of a new Deputy Secretary position focused on military families, which is a standard administrative change.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on organizational restructuring for veterans and military families.

Title: Courts and Judicial Proceedings and Criminal Procedure - Technical Corrections - References to Intellectual Disability
Synopsis: Replacing references to mental retardation with references to an intellectual disability in certain provisions of law.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to replace references to 'mental retardation' with 'intellectual disability' in various legal statutes related to courts, juvenile proceedings, and criminal procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland courts
stakeholders: Individuals with intellectual disabilities, legal professionals, and the criminal justice system
innovative_summary: The bill primarily makes technical corrections to terminology in existing law, with no new programs or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Persons Providing Lobbyist Compensation – Statement of Political Contributions – Exemption for Nonprofits
Synopsis: Exempting nonprofit organizations qualified under § 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code from the requirement for a person providing lobbyist compensation to file a statement of political contributions with the State Board of Elections.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain nonprofit organizations from the requirement to file statements of political contributions when providing lobbyist compensation, specifically those qualified under § 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations, lobbyists, and political contributors in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies reporting requirements for nonprofits, reducing administrative burden and increasing transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes reporting rules for nonprofits.

Title: Child Support - Incarcerated Obligors
Synopsis: Authorizing a court, if an obligor becomes incarcerated, to determine that a material change of circumstances warranting a modification of child support has occurred, provided that the party's ability to pay child support is sufficiently reduced due to the incarceration.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's child support laws to account for incarcerated obligors, including suspending arrearages during incarceration and allowing courts to consider incarceration as a material change of circumstance for support modifications.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services or equivalent child support agency
stakeholders: Parents with incarcerated obligors and their children in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy to suspend arrearages during incarceration and considers incarceration as a change of circumstance, which is a new approach in child support enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to reduce child poverty by adjusting child support obligations for incarcerated parents, thereby improving financial stability for affected children.

Title: Maryland Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council - Membership
Synopsis: Codifying provisions relating to the Maryland Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council; altering and clarifying the composition of the Council to include certain public and private sector members; requiring the Council to submit interim reports of its work to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024, and December 1, 2025; and requiring the Council to submit a final report of its work and recommendations by June 30, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council to develop plans and policies for integrating zero emission electric vehicles into the state's transportation network, including infrastructure, incentives, and public awareness campaigns.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation, Maryland Energy Administration, Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Electric vehicle manufacturers, electric companies, government agencies, environmental groups, vehicle owners, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, multi-stakeholder approach to develop infrastructure, policies, and incentives for zero emission electric vehicles, integrating public outreach and performance measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by promoting clean transportation and creating green jobs, but its direct impact is moderate.

Title: Income Tax Credit - Venison Donation
Synopsis: Allowing an individual, subject to certain requirements and limitations, to claim a credit against the State income tax for certain qualified expenses if the individual harvests an antlerless deer and donates the deer meat to certain organizations; limiting the amount of credits an individual may claim to a maximum of $300; and requiring by January 31 each year each venison donation program that received certain donations to report certain information about each donor who intended to claim the credit to the Comptroller.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a state income tax credit for individuals who harvest and donate deer meat to nonprofit organizations, with the aim of encouraging venison donation and supporting food assistance. It also provides liability protections for those donating food to nonprofits.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation (or the Comptroller's Office)
stakeholders: Hunters, nonprofit organizations, food-insecure populations, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a tax credit incentive to promote venison donation, integrating hunting, food donation, and tax policy to address food insecurity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to nutritious food for food-insecure families.

Title: Comprehensive Flood Management Grant Program - Funding for Underserved and Overburdened Communities
