Synopsis: Requiring at least 40% of funding provided under the comprehensive flood management grant program to be used for projects located in or directly benefiting underserved or overburdened communities; and authorizing the Governor to include in the annual State budget an appropriation of up to $20,000,000 for the comprehensive flood management grant program in fiscal year 2026 and each fiscal year thereafter.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funding for the Maryland comprehensive flood management grant program, mandates that a certain percentage of funds be used for projects benefiting underserved or overburdened communities starting in fiscal year 2026, and authorizes the inclusion of up to $20 million annually in the state budget for the program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Residents and communities affected by flooding, especially underserved and overburdened communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program emphasizes targeted funding for underserved communities and incorporates regulations for equitable and effective flood management, employing a strategic approach to flood mitigation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by mitigating flood impacts on vulnerable communities, thereby improving safety and economic stability.

Title: Tax Assistance for Low-Income Marylanders - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, beginning in fiscal year 2025, to distribute a certain amount of abandoned property funds to the Tax Clinics for Low-Income Marylanders Fund; requiring the Governor to include $800,000 in the annual budget for the CASH Campaign of Maryland to award grants for providing certain tax assistance through on-demand and mobile tax clinics; and requiring certain tax clinics to interact with the CASH campaign to ensure sufficient access to tax preparation services for low-income Maryland residents.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funds from abandoned property and other sources to support tax clinics for low-income Marylanders, including grants for mobile and on-demand tax clinics, and funding for the CASH Campaign to provide free tax assistance and financial education.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Comptroller and the agencies managing the Tax Clinics and CASH Campaign
stakeholders: Low-income Maryland residents, including seniors, rural communities, and under-resourced populations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated approach to expand access to tax assistance through mobile clinics, on-demand services, and financial education, leveraging technology and partnerships.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing financial stability and access to tax credits for low-income families.

Title: Individual Tax Preparers - Code of Ethics, Notification of Actions, Enforcement, and Penalties (Stop Scam Tax Preparers Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Individual Tax Preparers to publish on the Board's website a certain code of ethics and rules of professional conduct by January 1, 2026; requiring the Board to notify the Comptroller and the Field Enforcement Bureau of a violation within 5 business days after the Board determines that the violation has occurred; granting certain employees of the Bureau certain powers, duties, and responsibilities for enforcing laws pertaining to income tax preparation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a code of ethics and rules of professional conduct for individual tax preparers, requires the Maryland State Board of Individual Tax Preparers to publish these rules, enhances enforcement powers, and sets penalties for violations, including fines that support low-income tax clinics.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Individual Tax Preparers and the Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Individual tax preparers and low-income Maryland residents seeking tax assistance
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formalized code of ethics, enhanced enforcement mechanisms, and integration of technology for compliance and oversight, representing a modern approach to regulating tax preparers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting low-income residents through improved tax assistance services funded by fines.

Title: Income Tax – Technical Corrections
Synopsis: Repealing certain obsolete provisions of law concerning the distribution of income tax revenue; and correcting a certain erroneous cross-reference.
bill_summary: This bill makes technical corrections to Maryland's income tax laws, including repealing obsolete provisions, correcting cross-references, and clarifying distribution of income tax revenue to municipalities and the General Fund. It also clarifies tax credits for revitalization projects.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Maryland residents, municipalities, taxpayers, nonprofit organizations, and businesses involved in revitalization projects
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves legal and procedural corrections to existing tax laws, with no new innovative programs or approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific programs targeting it.

Title: Disclosure of Tax Information - Tax Compliance Activity and Binding Data Use Agreements
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "tax information" for purposes of law governing the confidentiality and disclosure of tax information; authorizing, subject to certain limitations, the disclosure of certain tax information to certain tax compliance organizations and governmental entities to assist the Comptroller in tax compliance activity; requiring the Comptroller to require the party to whom the information is to be disclosed to enter into a written, binding agreement regarding the use and security of the tax information; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules for disclosing tax information in Maryland, allowing certain tax compliance organizations and government entities to access tax data under strict agreements and supervision, to assist in tax compliance activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Tax compliance organizations, government entities, and Maryland taxpayers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured approach for secure sharing of tax information with third parties to improve tax compliance, including binding data use agreements and supervision.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on tax data sharing rules.

Title: Comptroller - Electronic Tax and Fee Return Filing Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring, for periods beginning after December 31, 2026, that returns for certain taxes and fees collected by the Comptroller be filed electronically, subject to certain exceptions; altering certain requirements for electronic filing of returns for certain taxes; prohibiting a certain tax return preparer or software company from charging a separate fee for the electronic filing of certain tax documents; and prohibiting a software company from selling different versions of the same tax software under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that certain taxes and fees collected by the Maryland Comptroller must be filed electronically starting in 2026, and it prohibits certain fees and sales practices related to electronic tax filing software. It also specifies the responsible agency and the populations affected.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Taxpayers, tax preparers, software companies, local governments, and specific industries such as tire dealers and water/wastewater facilities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to enforce electronic filing across multiple tax types and industries, including restrictions on software sales practices, which is a modern approach to tax administration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on tax filing processes and software practices.

Title: Environment - Synthetic Turf - Disclosure and Study
Synopsis: Requiring a producer or seller of synthetic turf to disclose to a customer typical maintenance practices and costs for removing, replacing, and disposing of synthetic turf; and requiring the Department of the Environment, in consultation with representatives of the industry, local environmental and community stakeholders, and synthetic turf producers, retailers, and users, to conduct a study on the synthetic turf industry in the State and report its findings to certain committees of the General Assembly by July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a system for tracking the chain of custody of synthetic turf installed on sports and playing fields in Maryland. It requires reporting of installation, removal, and disposal details, and mandates a study on synthetic turf industry practices and disposal methods.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Synthetic turf industry, local governments, schools, sports organizations, and community members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive tracking system and public reporting website for synthetic turf, along with a detailed industry study, representing a new approach to environmental management and transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental and industry practices.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Protection of Identity of Minor Victim
Synopsis: Providing that a court or a party in a criminal or juvenile delinquency case may not disclose or allow inspection of an electronic or paper court filing to a nonparty to the case unless the court or the party disclosing or allowing inspection of the filing redacts all identifying information relating to a minor victim that appears in the filing, unless the court finds by clear and convincing evidence that there is good cause to order otherwise.
bill_summary: The bill requires that in criminal or juvenile cases, any court filing that includes identifying information of a minor victim must be redacted to protect the victim's privacy, with certain exceptions. It also authorizes the Supreme Court of Maryland to establish rules for filing unredacted copies under seal.
responsible_party: Supreme Court of Maryland
stakeholders: Minor victims in criminal and juvenile cases, courts, legal professionals
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal framework to enhance privacy protections for minor victims by mandating redaction of their identifying information in court filings and allowing for sealed unredacted copies, which is a targeted approach to victim privacy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on privacy protections for victims.

Title: Health - State Advisory Council on Quality Care at the End of Life - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the State Advisory Council on Quality Care at the End of Life to be the State Advisory Council on Serious Illness Care.
bill_summary: The bill renames the State Advisory Council on Quality Care at the End of Life to the State Advisory Council on Serious Illness Care, and updates related references and organizational details.
responsible_party: Department of Aging and the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Individuals with serious illnesses and their families, healthcare providers, and related organizations in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates the name and organizational structure of an existing advisory council; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Health Occupations – Practice Audiology – Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "practice audiology" for the purposes of certain provisions of law governing the licensure and regulation of audiologists to include certain procedures that do not require anesthesia.
bill_summary: The bill amends the legal definition of 'practice audiology' in Maryland, clarifying the scope of audiologists' practice, including evaluation, diagnosis, management, and treatment of auditory and vestibular conditions, as well as prescribing and fitting hearing aids and sound processors, while excluding surgical procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Health or relevant licensing authority
stakeholders: Audiologists, individuals with hearing or vestibular conditions, patients requiring hearing aids or cochlear implants
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates and clarifies the legal scope of practice for audiologists without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly clarifies professional practice definitions.

Title: Workplace Fraud and Prevailing Wage - Violations - Civil Penalty and Referrals
Synopsis: Increasing, from $5,000 to $10,000, the maximum civil penalty for the knowing failure of an employer to properly classify an individual as an employee; and requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry, on a showing by clear and convincing evidence that a violation has occurred,  to refer to the Comptroller, certain State's Attorneys, the U.S. Department of Justice, the U.S. Department of Labor, and the U.S. Department of the Treasury complaints that allege a violation of certain tax laws.
bill_summary: The bill increases civil penalties for employers who knowingly misclassify workers and violate prevailing wage laws, establishes referral procedures for violations to various authorities, and enhances enforcement measures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Employers, employees, and contractors in Maryland, especially those involved in wage and classification violations
innovative_summary: The bill employs enhanced enforcement and referral mechanisms, integrating multiple state and federal agencies to improve compliance and enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by ensuring fair wages and proper classification, which can improve household income.

Title: Commission to Advance Lithium-Ion Battery Safety in Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Advance Lithium-Ion Battery Safety in Maryland to study and make legislative, regulatory, programmatic, or other recommendations regarding certain best practices, standards, and guidelines; requiring the Commission to submit an interim progress report to the Legislative Policy Committee by December 1, 2024; and requiring the Commission to submit a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Commission to Advance Lithium–Ion Battery Safety in Maryland, which will study and make recommendations on safety standards, best practices, and policies related to lithium-ion batteries, including fire prevention, recycling, and reuse.
responsible_party: Office of the State Fire Marshal
stakeholders: Battery manufacturers, first responders, recycling facilities, utility companies, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative, multi-stakeholder approach to develop safety standards and best practices for lithium-ion batteries, including considerations for recycling and reuse.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve safety and environmental conditions indirectly.

Title: Election Law - Postelection Procedures
Synopsis: Altering the records and documents that a board of canvassers is required to investigate under certain circumstances; altering the responsibilities of the State Administrator, the State Board of Elections, and the Board of State Canvassers regarding the certification of election results; authorizing the members of the Board of State Canvassers to appoint certain designees to serve on the Board of State Canvassers; and altering the responsibilities of the Governor regarding election results.
bill_summary: The bill modifies postelection procedures in Maryland, including investigation of records, verification and certification of election results, appointment processes for the Board of State Canvassers, and the responsibilities of the Governor in certifying election outcomes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and Governor's Office
stakeholders: Voters, candidates, election officials, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces clearer procedures for election result verification, dissent documentation, and appointment of designees to the Board of State Canvassers, enhancing transparency and efficiency in postelection processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on election procedures.

Title: Education - School Mapping Data Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the School Mapping Data Program in the Maryland Center for School Safety; providing that the purpose of the Program is to provide funds to local school systems to produce school mapping data for each public school and public charter school in the county to assist first responders in responding to emergencies at a school; authorizing the use of the Safe Schools Fund to provide funding to local school systems for the program; and requiring a certain custodian of records to deny inspection of school mapping data.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the School Mapping Data Program in Maryland to create standardized digital maps of public schools for emergency response, and allocates funds for school safety initiatives, including training and safety evaluations.
responsible_party: Maryland Center for School Safety and the Interagency Commission on School Construction
stakeholders: Public school students, school staff, emergency responders, and local school systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs digital mapping technology to enhance emergency response capabilities and standardizes data sharing across agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve safety and emergency response in schools, which can contribute to reducing child poverty impacts related to school safety.

Title: Education - Open-Source Phonics Matching Grant Program - Establishment (Open-Source Phonics Matching Grant Program Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Open-Source Phonics Matching Grant Program within the State Department of Education to provide free, open-source phonics learning materials to be used by adults to tutor students; requiring the Department to periodically review the open-source phonics learning materials to ensure the materials are consistent with best practices in literacy education, including the science of reading; and requiring the Governor each fiscal year to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $150,000 to the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Open-Source Phonics Matching Grant Program within the Maryland Department of Education to provide funding and support for organizations producing free, open-source phonics learning materials for adult tutors to use in literacy education.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Adult learners and literacy organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program promotes open-source educational materials and provides matching grants to organizations, encouraging free access and collaboration in literacy education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve adult literacy, which can indirectly benefit children by improving family literacy environments.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Forensic Genetic Genealogical DNA Analysis and Search - Applicability for Deceased and Missing Individuals
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of law regarding the use of a certain forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search (FGGS) do not apply when the FGGS is conducted solely for the purpose of identifying an individual who is deceased or the subject of a certain missing person report and whose whereabouts are unknown.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that certain forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search (FGGS) procedures are not applicable when used solely to identify deceased individuals or those involved in missing person reports in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland State Law Enforcement Agency or relevant law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Deceased individuals, missing persons, law enforcement agencies, and their families
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific exemption for the use of forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis in cases involving deceased individuals or missing persons, refining existing legal procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly pertains to forensic procedures for deceased or missing persons.

Title: Natural Resources - Antlerless Deer Hunting Programs - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to receive a raffle ticket for each antlerless deer hunted by the person during a certain raffle program that has as its objective the hunting of antlerless deer.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes a raffle program for hunting antlerless deer in Maryland, allowing hunters to receive a raffle ticket for each antlerless deer they hunt during a specific January raffle program that has been held at least once between January 1, 2020, and January 30, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Deer hunters and the general public interested in wildlife management and hunting programs
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a raffle-based incentive program for hunting antlerless deer, employing a new approach to encourage participation in wildlife management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily incentivizes deer hunting participation.

Title: Residential Property Sales - Contract Disclosures - Superfund Sites
Synopsis: Requiring the seller of residential real property located within 1 mile of a National Priorities List (NPL) Superfund site to provide the buyer with an addendum to the contract for the sale of the property that contains the identification of the Superfund site, the definition of an NPL Superfund site, web addresses for certain websites, and a notice that the buyer may void the contract of sale within 5 days after signing and dating the contract of sale.
bill_summary: The bill requires sellers of residential properties within 1 mile of a Superfund site in Maryland to include a disclosure addendum in the sale contract, informing buyers of the site's location, risks, and their rights to rescind the contract within 5 days.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Homebuyers and sellers near Superfund sites in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by mandating specific disclosure addendums with online resource links and a rescission window, enhancing transparency and buyer awareness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental disclosure and consumer rights.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification for Donations to Diaper Banks and Other Charitable Entities - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the termination date applicable to a subtraction under the Maryland income tax for certain donations to diaper banks and other charitable entities; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2020, but before January 1, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the Maryland income tax subtraction modification for donations to diaper banks and other charitable entities from 2024 to 2027.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Taxpayers making donations to diaper banks and charitable organizations, diaper banks, and other charitable entities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends a tax benefit for donations, which is a standard policy tool, and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a potential to support low-income families by encouraging donations of hygiene products, which can help reduce child poverty.

Title: Education - Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission - Publishing and Meetings Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission to publish the names of the candidates for appointment to the Baltimore County Board of Education on the Commission's website before interviewing the candidates; requiring meetings of the Commission that involve action on a candidate for appointment to the county board to be public; and requiring certain meetings of the Commission to be held without the public in attendance and recorded and for the recording to be provided within 48 hours of receiving a request for the recording.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission to publish candidate names, hold public meetings, and record certain meetings related to selecting nominees for the Baltimore County Board of Education. It also makes application and record requests for candidates public before interviews.
responsible_party: Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission
stakeholders: Candidates for Baltimore County Board of Education, residents of Baltimore County, and the general public interested in school board appointments.
innovative_summary: The bill employs transparency measures such as live streaming, recording, and public disclosure of candidate information and meetings, utilizing technology to enhance openness in the appointment process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on transparency and public participation in school board appointments could indirectly impact child poverty by promoting more equitable and representative governance.

Title: Criminal Law - Sexual Crimes - Definition of Consent and Repeal of Force
Synopsis: Requiring certain facts to be considered when determining whether a lack of consent exists for the purposes of determining certain sexual crimes; altering the elements of second-degree rape to remove the requirement of use of force or threat of force; and requiring the Maryland Judiciary to report to the General Assembly, beginning October 1, 2024, and each October 1 thereafter, certain data for the preceding calendar year, disaggregated by county and offender age, race, and sex.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's laws on sexual crimes by clarifying the definition of consent, considering words and conduct, and specifying circumstances that do not constitute consent. It also revises the elements of second-degree rape, mandates annual reporting of sexual offense data by the judiciary, and sets effective dates for these provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and Maryland General Assembly
stakeholders: Individuals involved in sexual crimes, victims, law enforcement, judiciary, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to defining consent and requires detailed annual reporting, enhancing transparency and clarity in sexual offense laws.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal definitions and reporting requirements.

Title: Hunting - Nonresident Sika Deer Stamp - Fee Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the fee for nonresident sika deer stamps from $25 to $200.
bill_summary: This bill increases the fee for a nonresident sika deer hunting stamp from $100 to $200, effective July 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Nonresident hunters and the Maryland Department of Natural Resources
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it mainly adjusts a fee for a hunting stamp.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Real Property - Access to Counsel in Evictions Program - Mandated Reports
Synopsis: Altering the information relating to the Access to Counsel in Evictions Program required to be reported by the Maryland Legal Services Corporation each year to include disaggregation by case type, the amount paid to attorneys for each case managed, the geographic distribution of cases, the disposition of cases decided, the amount of State and federal funds allocated to each designated organization, and the number of individuals provided legal representation for multiple cases.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a program called the Access to Counsel in Evictions Program, administered by the Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC), which provides legal representation to tenants facing eviction who meet certain income and occupancy criteria. It requires MLSC to report annually on the program's activities, case outcomes, and funding details.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC)
stakeholders: Tenants facing eviction with low income in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a proactive approach to ensure legal representation for vulnerable tenants facing eviction, with annual reporting to monitor and evaluate its effectiveness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by preventing evictions and stabilizing housing for low-income families.

Title: Health Occupations - Private Dental Offices - Infection Control
Synopsis: Requiring each owner of a private dental office to designate a licensed dentist to be the supervising dentist for the private dental office; requiring a supervising dentist to complete the registration required by the State Board of Dental Examiners and be responsible for all infection control activities within the private dental office; authorizing the Board to charge a fee for the registration of a supervising dentist under the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires owners of private dental offices in Maryland to designate a licensed dentist as the supervising dentist responsible for infection control activities, and establishes rules for registration, oversight, and interim supervision in these offices.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Private dental office owners, licensed dentists, and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured oversight system for infection control in private dental offices, including registration and supervision requirements, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on infection control regulations for dental offices.

Title: Charter Counties - Enforcement of Local Laws
Synopsis: Increasing from $1,000 to $5,000 the maximum amount of a civil or criminal fine that may be imposed by a charter county to enforce certain local laws enacted by the county.
bill_summary: This bill increases the maximum civil and criminal fines that charter counties in Maryland can impose to enforce local laws, raising the limit from $1,000 to $5,000.
responsible_party: Charter counties in Maryland
stakeholders: Residents and local governments in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes legal enforcement limits and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Department of Planning - Maryland Humanities Council - Appropriation to the Marilyn Hatza Memorial Strengthening the Humanities Investment in Nonprofits for Equity (SHINE) Grantmaking Initiative
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $1,000,000 each year to the Department of Planning to be used as a grant to the Maryland Humanities Council for the Marilyn Hatza Memorial Strengthening Humanities Investment in Nonprofits for Equity (SHINE) Grantmaking Initiative; and requiring the Maryland Humanities Council to select, award, and report on grants to qualifying nonprofit organizations under the SHINE Grantmaking Initiative.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Governor to allocate $1,000,000 annually to the Maryland Humanities Council to fund the SHINE Grantmaking Initiative, which provides grants to small and mid-size nonprofit organizations in the humanities, arts, cultural, and educational sectors.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning and Maryland Humanities Council
stakeholders: Small and mid-size nonprofit organizations in the humanities, arts, cultural, and educational sectors in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted grantmaking approach to support nonprofit organizations in the humanities, with considerations for geographic and racial diversity, and includes detailed reporting requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly by supporting cultural and educational nonprofits that may serve children and communities.

Title: Sexual Harassment Prevention Training - Morgan State University and St. Mary's College of Maryland - Training Format
Synopsis: Providing that a certain required sexual harassment prevention training for employees of Morgan State University and St. Mary's College of Maryland may consist of webinar, computer-based, or online training if the training includes a certain evaluative component.
bill_summary: The bill updates sexual harassment prevention training requirements for employees of Morgan State University and St. Mary's College of Maryland, allowing the training to be conducted via webinar, computer-based, or online formats under certain conditions, and specifies the inclusion of evaluative components.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education or relevant university administration
stakeholders: Employees of Morgan State University and St. Mary's College of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill permits the use of online and webinar formats for sexual harassment prevention training, including evaluative components to ensure engagement and comprehension, which modernizes and increases accessibility of training.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on workplace training for university employees.

Title: Allegany and Garrett Counties - Property Tax - Credit for Construction of Housing
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing bodies of Allegany County and Garrett County and municipal corporations located in Allegany County and Garrett County to grant, by law, a property tax credit on certain newly constructed dwellings; prohibiting the tax credit from exceeding $10,000; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes property tax credits for newly constructed, unoccupied residential dwellings in Allegany and Garrett Counties that meet certain criteria, and provides income tax credits for developers building middle-income homes in these counties.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Homebuyers, developers, residents of Allegany and Garrett Counties
innovative_summary: The program employs a combination of property tax credits and income tax credits to incentivize housing development and construction in specific counties, integrating local and state tax incentives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by increasing affordable housing options and encouraging development in underserved counties.

Title: Children - Labor Trafficking
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "abuse" to include labor trafficking of a child by any individual for purposes of provisions of law governing children in need of assistance cases and child abuse and neglect reporting; expanding provisions of law relating to the Safe Harbor Regional Navigator Grant Program to apply to child victims of labor trafficking; and requiring the Department of Human Services to include labor trafficking in its annual report on child sex trafficking to the Governor and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill expands Maryland law to include labor trafficking of children as a form of abuse, modifies procedures for child protection cases, and establishes a grant program to support services for child victims of sex and labor trafficking.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and local departments of social services
stakeholders: Children at risk of or victims of labor trafficking and child abuse services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a trauma-informed, victim-centered approach to addressing child labor trafficking, including a new grant program and expanded legal definitions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by providing targeted services and protections for vulnerable children involved in trafficking.

Title: Business Facade Improvement Program - Eligible Funding Recipients
Synopsis: Expanding the eligible recipients of funding provided by the Department of Housing and Community Development under the Business Facade Improvement Program to include community development organizations that serve at least one sustainable community and apply for funds.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Business Facade Improvement Program to include community development organizations as eligible recipients of funding, in addition to political subdivisions, to help improve the exterior appearance of buildings in sustainable communities.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Businesses in sustainable communities, community development organizations, and local governments
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new approach by including community development organizations as eligible recipients for facade improvement funding, fostering broader community engagement and support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by revitalizing communities and supporting local economic development.

Title: Natural Resources - Fish and Fisheries - Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring certain persons licensed or regulated with respect to fish and fisheries by the Department of Natural Resources to submit reports in accordance with regulations adopted by the Department.
bill_summary: The bill requires persons licensed or regulated by the Maryland Department of Natural Resources for fish and fisheries activities to submit reports according to regulations adopted by the Department. It updates reporting requirements for fish dealers, fish catchers, anglers, and licensees involved in fishing activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Fishers, fish dealers, anglers, and other licensed persons involved in fishing activities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes and formalizes reporting requirements for fishery-related activities, employing regulatory updates to improve data collection and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on fishery regulation and reporting.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Work Zone Speed Control Systems - Revisions (Maryland Road Worker Protection Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Altering the distribution of revenue from civil fines collected through the use of work zone speed control systems; altering the highways on which a work zone speed control system may be used; clarifying that a system operator does not need to be present when a work zone speed control system is in use; altering the maximum penalty for a civil citation issued as a result of an image from a work zone speed control system; requiring the State Highway Administration to make a certain report; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises regulations and funding allocations for work zone speed control systems in Maryland, including increasing penalties for violations, clarifying system usage, and establishing reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration and Department of State Police
stakeholders: Motorists, highway workers, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs existing technology for speed monitoring and enhances enforcement and funding transparency, but does not introduce fundamentally new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily focusing on traffic safety and enforcement.

Title: Workgroup to Study the Fiscal and Operational Viability of Public-Private Partnerships for Calvert County Public Schools
Synopsis: Establishing a Workgroup to Study the Fiscal and Operational Viability of Public-Private Partnerships for Calvert County Public Schools; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Board of Calvert County Commissioners, the Calvert County Board of Education, the Interagency Commission on School Construction, and the Calvert County Delegation on or before December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a workgroup to study the fiscal and operational viability of public-private partnerships for Calvert County Public Schools, including their potential use for new school construction and maintenance.
responsible_party: Calvert County Board of Education
stakeholders: Calvert County Public Schools, students, and local government
innovative_summary: The bill proposes studying the potential use of public-private partnerships for school funding and operations, which is a relatively innovative approach to school infrastructure financing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by improving school infrastructure and resources through innovative funding models.

Title: State Real Estate Commission - Complaints - Advertising Violations
Synopsis: Providing that a complaint filed with the State Real Estate Commission alleging an advertising violation may be made anonymously but must be accompanied by documentary or other evidence.
bill_summary: The bill amends the procedures for filing complaints with the Maryland State Real Estate Commission, specifically allowing complaints alleging advertising violations to be made anonymously and without oath, provided they are accompanied by evidence.
responsible_party: Maryland State Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate professionals and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an innovative approach by allowing anonymous complaints for advertising violations, which may encourage more reporting and transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Public Schools - Student Telehealth Appointments - State Guidelines, Policies, and Access
Synopsis: Requiring, by December 31, 2024, the State Department of Education and the Maryland Department of Health jointly to adopt certain State guidelines for school health services regarding student access to telehealth appointments during the school day on the premises of public middle and high schools in the State; and requiring each county board of education to adopt and implement a certain student telehealth policy before the start of the 2025-2026 school year.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland's Department of Education and Department of Health to develop guidelines for student access to telehealth appointments during the school day in middle and high schools. It mandates each school to designate a private space meeting certain requirements for telehealth and to implement policies to facilitate student access, with a focus on privacy, safety, and equity.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Students in middle and high schools, parents, school personnel, healthcare providers, and community organizations
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated approach to integrate telehealth services into the school environment, including developing state guidelines and designated private spaces, which is a relatively innovative approach to expanding healthcare access for students.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to healthcare services for students, especially those who face barriers to traditional healthcare access.

Title: Orphans' Court Judges - Restriction on Practicing Law
Synopsis: Altering a prohibition on judges of the orphans' court acting as attorneys to prohibit a judge of the orphans' court from acting as an attorney in matters related to the administration of an estate or a guardianship of a minor within the jurisdiction of the court in any county or Baltimore City, or the preparation of an estate plan or estate planning documents that might come within the jurisdiction of the court in any county or Baltimore City following the death of any individual.
bill_summary: The bill restricts judges of the orphans' court in Maryland from acting as attorneys in matters related to estate administration or guardianships of minors during their term of office.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or relevant Maryland State Court system
stakeholders: Judges of the orphans' court, estate and guardianship parties, legal community in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific restriction on judges serving as attorneys in related estate and guardianship matters, which is a legal ethics and conflict of interest regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may improve judicial integrity in guardianship cases involving minors.

Title: Correctional Services – Parole Supervision Fees and Drug and Alcohol Abuse Test Payment – Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement for the Maryland Parole Commission to assess a fee against an individual on parole and supervised by the Division of Parole and Probation under certain circumstances; and repealing  authorization for the Division of Parole and Probation to require a supervisee of the Division who is on parole to pay for certain drug or alcohol abuse testing under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement for the Maryland Parole Commission to assess a supervision fee against individuals on parole and the authority to require payment for drug and alcohol testing during supervision.
responsible_party: Division of Parole and Probation
stakeholders: Individuals on parole and supervised by the Division of Parole and Probation in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly removes existing fees and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily involves administrative fee removal for parole supervision.

Title: Community Development Administration - Live Near Your School Program - Extension
Synopsis: Extending the termination date for the Live Near Your School program and a related homebuyer program from September 30, 2024, to September 30, 2030.
bill_summary: The bill extends the Live Near Your School program, which provides grants to help students and recent graduates buy homes near their schools, and allocates $200,000 annually from 2026 to 2030 for this program.
responsible_party: Community Development Administration
stakeholders: Current students and recent graduates in Maryland seeking to buy homes near their schools
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to support students and graduates by providing grants for home purchases near educational institutions, which is a relatively innovative approach to community development and education support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by enabling families of limited income to purchase homes near schools, thereby improving stability and access to education.

Title: Land Use – Affordable Housing – Zoning Density and Permitting (Housing Expansion and Affordability Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing the Historic Property Revitalization Director as a position in the Department of Housing and Community Development; prohibiting a local legislative body from prohibiting the placement of certain manufactured homes or modular dwellings in a zoning district that allows single-family residential uses under certain circumstances; requiring local jurisdictions to allow an increase in density of certain qualified projects in certain districts or zones for certain properties; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Historic Property Revitalization Director within the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, and makes various changes to land use laws to promote affordable housing, including increasing density allowances for certain projects, and clarifying rules around manufactured and modular homes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents seeking affordable housing, local governments, historic property owners, and developers
innovative_summary: The bill employs innovative approaches by increasing allowable densities for affordable housing projects near transit and on former government land, and by integrating public health impact assessments into development approvals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to affordable housing and promoting development near transit stations.

Title: Public Institutions of Higher Education - Student Withdrawal Policy - Reimbursement of Tuition and Fees (Cameron Carden Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring each public institution of higher education to adopt a policy to authorize a student to withdraw from the institution under extenuating circumstances and to refund the student for tuition and fees paid by the student for a certain semester under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill requires public higher education institutions in Maryland to adopt policies allowing students to withdraw under extenuating circumstances such as illness, injury, hospitalization, or mental health issues, and to refund tuition and fees paid for the semester in which they withdraw if these circumstances prevent them from continuing their education.
responsible_party: Public institutions of higher education in Maryland
stakeholders: Students at public higher education institutions in Maryland, especially those facing extenuating circumstances
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy for refunding tuition and fees to students who withdraw due to extenuating circumstances, which is a new approach to student withdrawal policies in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce financial hardship for students facing health crises, which may help mitigate child poverty indirectly.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Student Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Educators - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Anne Arundel County Student Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Educators to assist in the repayment of certain student loans owed by educators who meet certain eligibility requirements; providing that the purpose of the Program is to attract, recruit, and retain a diverse cadre of qualified educators in the County's schools that is reflective of the student population; establishing requirements for applicants for assistance in the repayment of a commercial loan; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Anne Arundel County Student Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Educators, which provides loan repayment assistance to qualified educators employed by the Anne Arundel County Public School System, to attract and retain diverse and qualified staff.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Public School System
stakeholders: Educators employed by the Anne Arundel County Public School System, prospective educators, and the local education system
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted loan repayment assistance approach to attract and retain educators, which is a common but effective strategy; it does not specify the use of new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve educational quality and stability, which can indirectly benefit children in the community, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Department of Human Services - Children in Foster Care - Luggage
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Human Services to establish and maintain a decentralized supply of new luggage to be used to transport the personal belongings of a child in foster care; requiring the Department to provide new luggage to a child in foster care who is entering foster care, moving from one placement to another, or exiting foster care; prohibiting the Department from using disposable bags or trash bags to transport a child's belongings; and requiring the Department to maintain certain records.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Human Services to establish a supply of new, unused luggage for children in foster care, to be used when transporting their personal belongings. It prohibits the use of disposable or trash bags for this purpose and mandates record-keeping and annual reporting on luggage use.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children in foster care in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new approach by providing children in foster care with new, personal luggage and banning disposable bags, emphasizing dignity and personal property rights.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child well-being and stability, which can influence child poverty indirectly.

Title: Criminal Law - Sexual Extortion, Stalking, and Revenge Porn - Statute of Limitations and In Banc Review
Synopsis: Altering the statute of limitations applicable to the crime of sexual extortion to be 5 years; altering the statute of limitations applicable to the crime of stalking to be 10 years; providing that the State may institute a prosecution for revenge porn at any time; and providing that, for purposes of the Maryland Constitution, a person who commits revenge porn shall be deemed to have committed a misdemeanor whose punishment is confinement in the penitentiary and may reserve a point or question for a certain in banc review.
bill_summary: The bill extends the statute of limitations for the crimes of sexual extortion and stalking, makes these crimes punishable as misdemeanors with potential confinement in the penitentiary, and clarifies legal procedures and penalties related to revenge porn, stalking, and sexual extortion.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Victims of sexual extortion, stalking, and revenge porn in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates legal definitions, extends statutes of limitations, and clarifies procedures for handling revenge porn and related crimes, employing modern legal approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program - Nancy Grasmick Public School Professional Award - Public School Nurses
Synopsis: Expanding the Nancy Grasmick Public School Professional Award within the Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program to include public school nurses who are licensed as registered nurses, provide health services in public schools, and are employed by a county school system or a local health department to provide health services through an agreement with a county board.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program to include loan repayment assistance for public school nurses, in addition to teachers and mental health professionals, to help recruit and retain these professionals in public schools.
responsible_party: Office of Student Financial Assistance, Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school nurses, public school students, educational and health professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted loan repayment assistance approach to recruit and retain public school nurses, expanding existing efforts for teachers and mental health professionals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve child health and educational outcomes by supporting qualified nurses in schools, which can indirectly reduce child poverty.

Title: Task Force on Responsible Use of Natural Psychedelic Substances
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force on Responsible Use of Natural Psychedelic Substances to study existing laws, scientific data, and practices related to the use of natural psychedelic substances; requiring the Task Force to make recommendations regarding any changes to State law, policies, and practices needed to create a program that enables broad, equitable, and affordable access to psychedelic substances; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before July 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force on Responsible Use of Natural Psychedelic Substances to study and make recommendations on the use, regulation, and potential benefits and risks of natural psychedelic substances in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Public health practitioners, individuals interested in natural psychedelic substances, policymakers, and communities affected by drug laws
innovative_summary: The bill proposes creating a comprehensive, research-based approach to natural psychedelic substances, including potential legal, medical, and social frameworks, which is a relatively innovative approach to drug policy reform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly through drug policy reform and health benefits, but it is not primarily focused on child poverty.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Automated Enforcement Citations and Notices - Mailing Addresses
Synopsis: Requiring that citations and notices issued as a result of automated enforcement under the Maryland Vehicle Law be sent to the current mailing address on file with the Administration or if a mailing address is not available, the current residential address on file with the Administration.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that all citations and notices issued through automated enforcement systems in Maryland must be sent to the current mailing address on file with the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration, or the residential address if the mailing address is unavailable.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Vehicle owners and drivers in Maryland subject to automated enforcement citations
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates mailing procedures for automated enforcement citations, which is a procedural change rather than an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it mainly concerns administrative procedures for traffic citations.

Title: Sales and Use Tax Exemption - Aircraft Parts and Equipment - Repeal of Reporting Requirement and Extension of Sunset
Synopsis: Repealing a certain reporting requirement relating to an exemption from the sales and use tax for certain materials, parts, and equipment used to repair, maintain, or upgrade aircraft or certain aircraft systems; and extending the termination date of the exemption to June 30, 2030.
bill_summary: The bill extends the exemption from sales and use tax for materials, parts, and equipment used to repair, maintain, or upgrade aircraft or aircraft systems, and repeals the reporting requirement related to this exemption.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Aircraft repair and maintenance industry, aviation technicians, and related businesses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing tax exemption and repeals a reporting requirement; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns tax exemptions for aircraft maintenance.

Title: Tree Expert Licenses - Application and Renewal Fee Alterations and Insurance Requirements
Synopsis: Specifying the maximum amounts of fees for a tree expert license established by the Department of Natural Resources by regulation; authorizing the Department to permanently revoke or temporarily suspend a tree expert license if the license holder fails to maintain liability, property, or workers' compensation insurance in a certain manner; and requiring the Department to prepare an annual report on the number of licenses issued and certain receipts and expenses and submit the report to the General Assembly by November 1 each year.
bill_summary: The bill establishes licensing requirements for tree experts in Maryland, including insurance and fee regulations, and grants the Department of Natural Resources authority to revoke or suspend licenses for non-compliance or misconduct.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Tree experts, tree care businesses, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates licensing and insurance regulations for tree experts, with some emphasis on compliance and enforcement, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on professional licensing and regulatory enforcement.

Title: Special Chesapeake Bay and Coastal Sport Fishing License - Nonresidents - License Fee
Synopsis: Increasing the license fee for a special Chesapeake Bay and coastal sport fishing license for nonresident license applicants from $50 to $100.
bill_summary: The bill increases the fee for a special Chesapeake Bay and coastal sport fishing license for nonresidents from $50 to $100, and clarifies licensing provisions for boat owners.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Nonresident sport fishers and boat owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily adjusts licensing fees and clarifies existing regulations; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Correctional Services - Investigation of Suspected Homicide - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of State Police to investigate any death of an incarcerated individual suspected to be a homicide that occurs while the individual is in the custody of the Division of Correction whether within or outside a correctional facility; and requiring the Department, by December 31 each year, to report to the Governor and the General Assembly the number of investigations completed and the number of cases referred by the Department for prosecution for the preceding calendar year.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Deaths in Custody Oversight Board to review and investigate deaths of incarcerated individuals, including conducting administrative and clinical reviews, and reporting findings and recommendations to improve safety and care in correctional facilities.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals, their families, correctional facility staff, justice reform organizations, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated oversight board with a comprehensive review process for deaths in custody, including clinical and administrative assessments, and public reporting, which is a new approach to accountability in correctional health and safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving the safety and health conditions of incarcerated individuals, which can positively impact their families and children.

Title: Maryland Online Data Privacy Act of 2024
Synopsis: Establishing generally the manner in which a controller or a processor may process a consumer's personal data; authorizing a consumer to exercise certain rights in regards to the consumer's personal data; requiring a controller of personal data to establish a method for a consumer to exercise certain rights in regards to the consumer's personal data; making a violation of the Act an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice that is subject to enforcement and penalties under the Maryland Consumer Protection Act; etc.
bill_summary: The Maryland Online Data Privacy Act of 2024 establishes regulations for how businesses in Maryland process and handle consumers' personal data. It grants consumers rights to access, delete, and control their personal data, and requires businesses to provide privacy notices, conduct data protection assessments, and implement security measures. The law also sets rules for data sharing, sale, and targeted advertising, and creates enforcement mechanisms and penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Division of Consumer Protection
stakeholders: Consumers in Maryland, businesses that process personal data, data processors, and third-party advertisers
innovative_summary: The program employs advanced data privacy regulations, including consumer rights to access and delete data, mandatory data protection assessments, and new enforcement mechanisms, representing a comprehensive and technologically forward approach to data privacy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The law has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve data privacy protections for vulnerable populations, including children.

Title: Higher Education - Credit Eligibility and Transfer of Credits - English as a Second Language Courses (Credit for All Language Learning (CALL) Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a public community college to consider a course or program for English as a second language or English language learner as eligible for world language or humanities credit toward an associate's degree if the course is not classified as remedial; requiring the transferability of world language credits earned by students who transfer from community colleges to institutions of higher education; and requiring institutions of higher education to review and consider the transfer of certain credits for language or humanities courses.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland public community colleges to consider English as a Second Language (ESL) courses as eligible for credit toward an associate's degree and mandates the transferability of certain credits from community colleges to higher education institutions. It also establishes a statewide transfer agreement to facilitate credit transfer and prohibits institutions from denying credit transfer for eligible courses.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission and public community colleges
stakeholders: Students in Maryland, especially those taking ESL courses and transferring between colleges and universities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive approach to credit transfer, including specific consideration of ESL courses for degree credit and a statewide transfer agreement, employing coordinated policies to improve credit mobility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to higher education and easing credit transfer barriers for students, especially those from underserved backgrounds.

Title: Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program - Modifications
Synopsis: Modifying provisions of law governing application, administration, and enforcement of the Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program, including provisions related to the payment of contributions, the calculation of the average weekly wage, the submission of claims for benefits, the application of the Program to self-employed individuals, the Family and Medical Leave Insurance Fund, the satisfaction of Program requirements through private employer plans or insurance, and the use of contributions or other funding.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program, including changes to application procedures, contribution payments, benefit calculations, and program administration, with the goal of expanding and clarifying the program's operations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees, self-employed individuals, employers, and families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs modern technology for electronic filing, information sharing, and community partnership grants, and allows private employer plans to meet program requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting families during critical life events and health issues.

Title: Citizens Committee for the Enhancement of Communities Surrounding Baltimore-Washington International Thurgood Marshall Airport - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Citizens Committee for the Enhancement of Communities Surrounding Baltimore-Washington International Thurgood Marshall Airport by increasing the total number of members from 11 to 12 and requiring the Committee to include one member each from legislative districts 12A and 12B instead of one member from legislative district 12.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership structure of the Citizens Committee for the Enhancement of Communities Surrounding Baltimore–Washington International Thurgood Marshall Airport, increasing its members from 11 to 12 and specifying the appointment process and districts involved.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Communities surrounding Baltimore–Washington International Thurgood Marshall Airport, especially those within or near the noise zone
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies the composition of an existing community advisory committee, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Victim Compensation - Alterations (Victim Compensation Reform Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board; altering certain duties, powers, and procedures for the Board to make awards to victims of crime; altering the powers and duties of certain employees; altering the amount and types of awards the Board is authorized to make to certain victims of crime; authorizing reconsideration and judicial review of decisions of the Board; authorizing the Governor to include certain funding in the annual budget bill for the Criminal Injuries Compensation Fund; etc.
bill_summary: This bill makes comprehensive reforms to the Maryland Criminal Injuries Compensation Board, including changes to its composition, procedures, and award limits, and establishes a dedicated Criminal Injuries Compensation Fund to support victim compensation.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Crime victims and their dependents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, transparent process for victim compensation, including online application portals and reconsideration procedures, but does not employ new technologies or approaches beyond current standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on victim compensation and support services can indirectly benefit children in affected families, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Mental Health - Assisted Outpatient Treatment Programs
Synopsis: Authorizing each county to establish an assisted outpatient treatment program by July 1, 2026; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to establish an assisted outpatient treatment program in a county that does not opt to establish the program by July 1, 2026; requiring the Office of the Public Defender to provide representation in assisted outpatient treatment proceedings; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes assisted outpatient treatment programs for individuals with severe mental illness, allowing courts to order outpatient treatment to prevent relapse or deterioration, and modifies procedures for emergency evaluations and involuntary admissions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with severe mental illness, mental health providers, courts, and public defenders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by creating a court-ordered outpatient treatment system with detailed procedures, oversight, and data reporting, integrating legal and health services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving mental health treatment and reducing homelessness, hospitalizations, and incarceration among affected individuals.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Study on the Establishment of a Homeless Shelter Licensing Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Study on the Establishment of a Homeless Shelter Licensing Program in the Department of Housing and Community Development; requiring the Study to review current habitability and admissions standards of homeless shelters in the State; and requiring the Study to report to a certain Assistant Secretary in the Department and certain committees in the General Assembly by July 1, 2025, its recommendations on habitability and admission standards and a plan to establish a program in the Department to license homeless shelters.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a study to explore the creation of a licensing program for homeless shelters in Maryland, including developing standards and regulations, and reports findings by July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Homeless individuals and shelter providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by studying and potentially establishing a formal licensing program for homeless shelters, including standards for operation and building safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving shelter standards and protections for vulnerable populations, including children.

Title: Time to Serve Act of 2024
Synopsis: Increasing, from 15 to 30, the maximum number of days of disaster service leave for employees in the Executive Branch of State government; and increasing, from 15 to 30, the maximum number of days of paid leave the Secretary of Budget and Management may provide for uniformed services training or active uniformed services duty in a reserve unit of the armed forces or organized militia.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum number of days of disaster service leave for employees in the Maryland State government from 15 to 30 days and clarifies provisions related to paid leave for uniformed services training or active duty, as well as other types of paid leave.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: State government employees, especially those in the Executive Branch, and emergency service volunteers
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing leave policies and increases maximum leave days; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on leave policies for state employees does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Government - Permits, Licenses, and Certificates - Processing (Transparent Government Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring each principal department and independent unit to create a  catalog of information relating to permits, licenses, and certificates issued by the department or independent unit and to submit the catalog to the Governor on or before October 1, 2024; requiring each department and independent unit to post certain completed information relating to permits, licenses, and certificates on the website of each department or independent unit by October 1, 2025; and establishing the Government Efficiency Commission.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland state departments and independent units to create and publish detailed catalogs of their permits, licenses, and certificates, including processing times, fees, and application methods. It establishes the Government Efficiency Commission to monitor and recommend improvements in permit processing.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Office of the Governor and various state departments and agencies
stakeholders: Businesses, individuals, and organizations applying for permits, licenses, and certificates in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive data collection and transparency approach, creating a centralized effort to improve government efficiency through detailed reporting and monitoring.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce barriers and delays in obtaining permits and licenses, which can indirectly benefit low-income individuals and families.

Title: Economic Development - Entrepreneurial Innovation Programs - Establishment (Pava LaPere Legacy of Innovation Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing the Pava LaPere Innovation Acceleration Grant Program in the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to provide grants to technology-based start-up companies founded by students from institutions located in the Baltimore-Columbia-Towson Metropolitan Statistical Area; establishing the Baltimore Innovation Initiative Pilot Program within the Maryland Innovation Initiative of the Corporation; requiring certain appropriations for the programs to be included in the annual budget bill in certain fiscal years; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Pava LaPere Innovation Acceleration Grant Program to provide grants to technology startup companies in Maryland, and the Baltimore Innovation Initiative Pilot Program to support university-based entrepreneurial projects in the Baltimore area, with funding allocated for fiscal years 2025 and 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation and the Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Technology startup companies, university students and faculty, industry partners in the Baltimore area
innovative_summary: The bill introduces targeted grants and incentives for university-based tech startups and fosters collaboration between academia and industry, employing innovative approaches to regional economic development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The programs have the potential to create economic growth and job opportunities in the Baltimore region, which could help reduce child poverty.

Title: Center for Firearm Violence Prevention and Intervention - Establishment
