Synopsis: Establishing the Center for Firearm Violence Prevention and Intervention in the Maryland Department of Health to reduce firearm violence, harm from firearm violence, and misuse of firearms in the State by partnering with federal, State, and local agencies and affected communities to implement a public health approach to firearm violence reduction; requiring the Center to submit to the Governor and the General Assembly by May 1, 2025, a preliminary State Plan for a Public Health Approach to Reducing Firearm Violence; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Center for Firearm Violence Prevention and Intervention within the Maryland Department of Health. The center aims to reduce firearm violence and misuse through a public health approach by collaborating with various agencies, communities, and experts, and by developing strategic plans and programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Communities affected by firearm violence, public health professionals, law enforcement agencies, and local governments in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive public health approach, including data sharing, community engagement, and evidence-based strategies, which is a modern approach to firearm violence prevention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce firearm violence, which can contribute to lowering child poverty by creating safer environments and reducing violence-related disruptions.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Occupational Disease Presumptions - First Responders (Caring for Public Employees in the Safety Professions - CAPES Act)
Synopsis: Providing that certain firefighters, fire fighting instructors, rescue squad members, advanced life support unit members, and members of the Office of the State Fire Marshal who have thyroid, colon, or ovarian cancer are presumed, under certain circumstances, to have an occupational disease that was suffered in the line of duty and is compensable under workers' compensation law.
bill_summary: The bill provides occupational disease presumptions for certain first responders, including firefighters, police officers, and park rangers, who develop specific cancers or conditions related to their line of duty, making their claims for workers' compensation easier.
responsible_party: Maryland Workers' Compensation Commission and relevant state agencies
stakeholders: First responders such as firefighters, police officers, park rangers, and their dependents
innovative_summary: The bill employs legal presumptions to streamline workers' compensation claims for occupational diseases among first responders, which is a common approach but tailored to specific conditions and roles.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly addresses workers' compensation rules for first responders.

Title: Protecting Election Officials Act of 2024
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from knowingly and willfully making a threat to harm an election official or an immediate family member of an election official because of the election official's role in administering the election process; and establishing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 3 years or a fine not exceeding $2,500 or both.
bill_summary: The bill, known as the Protecting Election Officials Act of 2024, makes it a crime to knowingly threaten to harm election officials or their immediate family members because of their role in administering elections. It defines key terms and establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Election Board or relevant law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Election officials and their immediate family members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs legal measures to protect election officials from threats, emphasizing the importance of safeguarding election administration through criminal law.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Weinberg Center/New Spires Arts Stages Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Altering the Class C (Weinberg Center) beer, wine, and liquor license in Frederick County to be the Class C (Weinberg Center/New Spires Arts Stages) beer, wine, and liquor license; expanding the licensed premises to include the New Spires Arts Stages; altering the officials who may sign a certain license application; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor at an event held by an outside group that has rented the Weinberg Arts Center or the New Spires Arts Stages; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the alcohol license for the Weinberg Center in Frederick County to include the New Spires Arts Stages, allowing the license holder to sell and serve alcohol at events held at either location, including performances, fundraisers, and rented events, with a license fee of $325.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcohol Licensing Authority or relevant local licensing body
stakeholders: Event organizers, attendees, and the general public at the Weinberg Center and New Spires Arts Stages in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates licensing rules and expands the licensed premises to include a new venue, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns alcohol licensing and event regulations.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Manufacturer's Limited Beer, Wine, and Liquor Permit
Synopsis: Establishing a manufacturer's limited beer, wine, and liquor permit in Frederick County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue a permit to holders of certain manufacturer's licenses; establishing that the permit authorizes the holder to allow a licensed caterer or other contracted party to provide sealed beer, wine, and liquor products not manufactured by the holder during private events for on-premises consumption; and requiring the Board to adopt certain regulations.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a manufacturer’s limited beer, wine, and liquor permit in Frederick County, allowing license holders to host private events where sealed alcohol products not manufactured by the licensee can be provided during private events at the licensed premises, with regulations and approval processes set by the Board.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol manufacturers, private event hosts, and attendees in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new permit allowing licensed manufacturers to host private events with external sealed alcohol, employing a new approach to alcohol service at private events.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly pertains to alcohol licensing and private event regulations.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Municipal Golf Course License
Synopsis: Authorizing the Frederick County Board of License Commissioners to issue a municipal golf course license to an official of the City of Frederick designated by the Mayor of the City of Frederick; and authorizing the Board to transfer the license to a different city official designated by the Mayor under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Frederick County Board of License Commissioners to issue a special alcohol license (Class M–G) for use at municipal golf courses, allowing designated officials or managers to sell beer, wine, and liquor on the golf course.
responsible_party: Frederick County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Golf course operators, municipal officials, and visitors at municipal golf courses in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized alcohol license for municipal golf courses, allowing designated officials to sell alcohol on-site, which is a tailored approach to alcohol licensing for recreational facilities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly pertains to alcohol licensing at golf courses.

Title: Dorchester County - County Applicants - Polygraph Examination
Synopsis: Exempting applicants for employment as a paramedic or an emergency medical technician with Dorchester County or as a 9-1-1 specialist at the Dorchester County 9-1-1 Center from the prohibition on employers requiring or demanding that an individual submit to or take a polygraph examination as a condition of prospective employment.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain employment applicants for the Dorchester County Department of Emergency Services, Correctional, and Detention facilities from the prohibition on requiring polygraph examinations as a condition of employment.
responsible_party: Dorchester County Department of Emergency Services and Department of Corrections
stakeholders: Applicants for employment with Dorchester County emergency and correctional services, including correctional officers, paramedics, dispatchers, and related staff
innovative_summary: The bill mainly changes rules and legal restrictions regarding polygraph examinations for specific employment applicants, rather than establishing a new service or intervention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects employment screening procedures for specific county departments.

Title: Prince George's County - Judgeships - Circuit Courts
Synopsis: Altering the number of resident judges of the circuit courts by adding one additional judgeship in Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of resident judges in the Prince George's County circuit court from 24 to 25.
responsible_party: Maryland Judicial System or Prince George's County Judicial Administration
stakeholders: Residents of Prince George's County, judicial system, legal community
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it is a straightforward increase in judgeships.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Legal Advertisement or Legal Notice in Dorchester County - Publication in Newspaper or Newspaper in General Circulation - Digital Newspapers
Synopsis: Establishing for the publication of certain notices in Dorchester County that any required advertisement or notice be published and distributed through print and digital format; providing that if there is no print and digital publication meeting all the qualifications under the Act, the advertisement or notice may be placed in any digital publication that can be accessed in Dorchester County and that regularly contains local news and information for Dorchester County; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates the legal requirements for publishing legal advertisements or notices in Dorchester County to include digital newspapers that meet certain criteria, alongside traditional print newspapers.
responsible_party: Dorchester County government or relevant legal publication authorities
stakeholders: Legal notices publishers, residents of Dorchester County, legal and governmental entities
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates digital newspapers into the legal publication process, allowing for digital formats to be used alongside print, which is a modern approach to legal notices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns legal publication requirements.

Title: Growing Apprenticeships and the Public Safety Workforce (GAPS) Act
Synopsis: Altering the Law Enforcement Cadet Apprenticeship Program in the Maryland Department of Labor to be the Public Safety Apprenticeship Program; expanding the purpose and scope of the Program to promote careers with certain public safety agencies; altering the eligibility criteria and the types of grants to be awarded under the Program; requiring the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to develop certain mental health wellness policies to be implemented in certain law enforcement agencies and correctional facilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands and renames the Law Enforcement Cadet Apprenticeship Program to the Public Safety Apprenticeship Program, increasing funding, scope, and eligibility criteria. It also mandates mental health wellness policies for law enforcement and correctional agencies, and establishes a workgroup to study workforce shortages and recruitment strategies in law enforcement and corrections.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission
stakeholders: Public safety agencies, law enforcement officers, correctional officers, and young individuals interested in careers in public safety
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach including apprenticeships, mental health policies, and a dedicated workgroup to address workforce shortages and improve recruitment and retention strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by increasing employment opportunities in public safety fields, which can lead to economic stability for families.

Title: Discrimination - Military Status - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting discrimination based on military status with regard to housing and employment.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits discrimination based on military status in areas such as housing, employment, public accommodations, and public utilities, and requires enforcement by various Maryland agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland State agencies including the Maryland Civil Rights Commission, Department of Labor, and other enforcement bodies.
stakeholders: Individuals protected under anti-discrimination laws, including military members, veterans, and their families.
innovative_summary: The bill employs comprehensive anti-discrimination measures across multiple sectors, integrating enforcement and policy updates to protect military status and related identities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting fair treatment and equal access to housing, employment, and services.

Title: Maryland Community Investment Corporation - Establishment (Housing and Community Development Financing Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Community Investment Corporation as an independent unit to make investments and financial assistance available in certain low-income communities in the State; expanding the eligible uses of the Strategic Demolition and Smart Growth Impact Fund to include grants and loans for credit enhancement for certain projects; requiring that members of the investment committee to be geographically representative of the locations of low-income communities in the State; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Community Investment Corporation to make investments in low-income communities, expand the use of the Strategic Demolition and Smart Growth Impact Fund, and facilitate access to federal tax credits for community development.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce and Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Low-income communities, community development organizations, local governments, and residents in designated areas
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to community investment by creating a new state corporation, expanding existing funds, and coordinating with federal programs to foster inclusive growth and development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by investing in low-income communities and supporting revitalization projects that can create jobs and improve living conditions.

Title: Street Racing and Exhibition Driving – Prohibited Acts, Enforcement, and Penalties
Synopsis: Altering certain penalties and points assessments for certain motor vehicle violations related to participation in a race or speed contest; prohibiting a person from engaging in exhibition driving on any highway or private property that is used for driving by the public; establishing certain affirmative defenses to a certain charge of exhibition driving; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates penalties and points for illegal street racing and exhibition driving, prohibits exhibition driving on public highways and private property, and establishes defenses for certain violations. It also designates special zones for exhibition driving during events and sets enforcement rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Drivers, spectators, and residents near public highways and private properties where exhibition driving occurs
innovative_summary: The bill introduces designated 'special event zones' for exhibition driving and clarifies legal defenses, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on traffic laws and safety enforcement.

Title: Employment Discrimination – Sexual Orientation
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law prohibiting employment discrimination on the basis of sex and gender identity to also prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland employment law to prohibit discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity, including in wages and employment opportunities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees and employers in Maryland, particularly those identifying as LGBTQ+
innovative_summary: The bill extends existing employment discrimination protections to explicitly include sexual orientation and gender identity, aligning with modern anti-discrimination standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses employment discrimination protections.

Title: Consumer Protection - Online Products and Services - Data of Children (Maryland Kids Code)
Synopsis: Requiring a certain entity that offers an online product reasonably likely to be accessed by children to complete a certain data protection impact assessment by April 1, 2026, under certain circumstances; requiring certain privacy protections for certain online products; prohibiting certain data collection and sharing practices; authorizing certain monitoring practices to allow a child's parent or guardian to monitor the child's online activity or location without providing an obvious signal to the child; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Age-Appropriate Design Code Act, requiring online products likely accessed by children to undergo data protection assessments, implement privacy protections, and prohibit certain data practices to safeguard children's online privacy.
responsible_party: Division of Consumer Protection of the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Children and online service providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, proactive approach to online privacy for children, including mandatory data impact assessments and design standards, representing a significant innovation in digital child protection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child well-being by protecting their online privacy and safety, which can contribute to reducing child vulnerabilities.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Recreational Vehicle Dealer Agreements
Synopsis: Requiring recreational vehicle dealers to hold a dealer agreement with a recreational vehicle manufacturer to sell the manufacturer's recreational vehicles in the State; establishing licensing requirements for a recreational vehicle manufacturer, distributor, or factory branch; altering the required terms and conditions of a recreational dealer agreement; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes licensing requirements and regulations for recreational vehicle manufacturers, distributors, factory branches, and dealers in Maryland. It sets rules for dealer agreements, termination, transfer of ownership, warranty obligations, and dispute resolution to protect dealers and ensure fair practices.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Recreational vehicle dealers, manufacturers, distributors, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive regulations and protections for recreational vehicle dealers, including detailed rules for agreements, termination, and dispute resolution, employing a structured legal framework.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly benefit families involved in recreational vehicle businesses.

Title: Community Colleges - Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship - Requirements
Synopsis: Establishing that applicants for a Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship are not subject to certain requirements of the scholarship application process if the applicant enrolls in a noncredit vocational certificate program, enrolls in a sequence of noncredit courses leading to licensure or certification, or participates in a registered apprenticeship program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes eligibility rules and criteria for the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship, including provisions for students participating in noncredit vocational, certification, or apprenticeship programs, and clarifies application and income requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: High school graduates, community college students, vocational and apprenticeship program participants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces expanded eligibility for noncredit vocational, certification, and apprenticeship programs, broadening access to community college scholarships and integrating support for diverse educational pathways.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to affordable higher education and vocational training for low-income students.

Title: Education - Public Libraries - Collective Bargaining (Library Workers Empowerment Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing employees of public libraries to form, join, and participate in an employee organization and engage in certain other activities related to collective bargaining; requiring employers and certified exclusive representatives to engage in good faith bargaining; establishing a collective bargaining process for employees of public libraries; prohibiting employers and employee organizations from engaging in certain actions regarding the exercise of an employee's rights under the Act; applying the Act prospectively; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes public library employees in Maryland to form, join, and participate in collective bargaining, establishes procedures for certification and elections of employee organizations, and sets rules for negotiations, dispute resolution, and prohibitions on strikes and work stoppages.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education or relevant public library systems
stakeholders: Employees of public libraries in Maryland, including library staff and management
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to unionization and collective bargaining for public library employees, including certification processes, dispute resolution, and prohibitions on strikes, which is a structured approach but not employing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns labor rights and collective bargaining procedures for library employees.

Title: Electronic Transactions Protection Act - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the Electronic Transactions Protection Act.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the Electronic Transactions Protection Act in Maryland.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: General public and government agencies involved in electronic transactions
innovative_summary: The bill does not introduce new programs or technologies; it simply repeals an existing act.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Recreational Catching of Oysters or Clams - Requirements
Synopsis: Altering certain authorizations to recreationally catch clams in the State; establishing a recreational oyster license; requiring an applicant for a recreational oyster license to be at least 16 years of age; requiring the Department of Natural Resources to use a part  of the application fees collected to replenish public fishery oysters bars; requiring the Department to issue complimentary or discounted recreational oyster licenses; authorizing certain individuals to catch oysters without a license under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a recreational oyster license, sets application procedures, fees, and eligibility criteria, and authorizes the sale and issuance of licenses, including complimentary and discounted licenses for certain individuals. It also allows some individuals to catch oysters without a license under specific conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Recreational oyster harvesters, residents, and specific groups such as veterans and former prisoners of war
innovative_summary: The program introduces a formal licensing system for recreational oyster harvesting, including designated agents and special licenses for certain groups, with provisions for free or discounted licenses and a registration process for property owners.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on recreational fishing regulations.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Stadium License Annual Fee
Synopsis: Reducing the annual fee for a stadium beer, wine, and liquor license in Harford County from $10,000 to $7,000.
bill_summary: The bill reduces the annual fee for a stadium beer, wine, and liquor license in Harford County from $10,000 to $4,000, and then to $7,000, effective July 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Harford County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Stadium owners, concession managers, patrons attending baseball games in Harford County
innovative_summary: The bill mainly changes licensing fees and regulations for alcohol sales at stadiums, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Consumer Reporting Agencies - Records of Criminal Proceedings - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting consumer reporting agencies from including in a consumer report certain records relating to a criminal proceeding involving a consumer; and prohibiting consumer reporting agencies from relying on  information in certain criminal proceedings concerning the consumer to make a determination of the creditworthiness of a consumer.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits consumer reporting agencies from including certain criminal records in consumer reports, specifically records involving false accusations, acquittals, exonerations, nolle prosequi entries, or records that did not result in a guilty verdict or plea. It also prevents these agencies from relying on such records to assess a consumer’s creditworthiness.
responsible_party: Consumer Reporting Agencies and related regulatory bodies in Maryland
stakeholders: Consumers in Maryland, especially those with records that may have been expunged or are not indicative of current behavior
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new restriction on the use of certain criminal records by consumer reporting agencies, aligning with modern efforts to prevent discrimination based on outdated or irrelevant criminal information.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects credit reporting practices.

Title: Next Generation Scholars of Maryland Program - Program Administrator - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the administrator of the Next Generation Scholars of Maryland Program to be the Maryland Higher Education Commission rather than the State Department of Education; and requiring the Department to assist the Commission with the review of applications and the selection of nonprofit organizations to administer the Program in local school systems.
bill_summary: The bill changes the administrator of the Next Generation Scholars of Maryland Program from the State Department of Education to the Maryland Higher Education Commission, clarifies program duties, and establishes funding and reporting requirements for the program.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students in Maryland, especially those qualifying for financial aid or free/reduced lunch, and nonprofit organizations involved in education support
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach combining outreach, mentorship, financial literacy, and college readiness services, with a focus on collaboration among nonprofits, schools, and higher education institutions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting students from low-income backgrounds in accessing higher education.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Board of Trustees - Responsibilities and Duties
Synopsis: Clarifying the topics that may be included in certain training required for each trustee on the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System; providing that the Board of Trustees may satisfy a requirement to provide each member and retiree in the several systems with a personal statement that includes certain information about the several systems and the member's or retiree's benefits by providing each member and retiree the information through an online portal.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the topics that trustees of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System must be trained on and requires the Board of Trustees to provide members and retirees with personal benefit statements through an online portal, including information about their vested benefits, vesting date, and present value of annuities.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System Board of Trustees
stakeholders: Members and retirees of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
innovative_summary: The bill employs digital technology by requiring the distribution of personal benefit statements through a secure online portal, enhancing accessibility and efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving transparency and understanding of retirement benefits for members, which can indirectly support financial stability.

Title: Health Occupations - Clinical Marriage and Family Therapists - Reciprocal Licensure Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the licensure requirements that the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists may waive, and the circumstances under which the requirements may be waived, for applicants for a license to practice clinical marriage and family therapy in the State who are licensed or certified to practice clinical marriage and family therapy in another state, territory, or jurisdiction.
bill_summary: The bill allows licensed clinical marriage and family therapists from other states, territories, or jurisdictions to obtain licensure in Maryland through a reciprocal process, waiving certain requirements if they meet specific criteria.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Licensed clinical marriage and family therapists from other states, and residents seeking licensure in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill streamlines licensure for out-of-state licensed therapists, facilitating cross-state practice and reducing barriers to licensure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting professional licensure processes.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Consumer Price Index - Definition
Synopsis: Updating the definition of "Consumer Price Index" to replace the 1967 index with the 1982-1984 index as the reference used by the State Retirement and Pension System for certain calculations.
bill_summary: This bill updates the definition of the 'Consumer Price Index' used by the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System to reference the 1982-1984 index instead of the 1967 index.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
innovative_summary: The bill employs an update to a standard economic index, which is a common practice and not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Service Credit
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement for certain transfers of service to be calculated under a certain formula; correcting a reference to a contribution rate for transfers of service into the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System; and providing for eligibility and service credit in the Employees' Pension System for certain contractual employment by certain members.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain rules about transferring service credit in the Maryland State Retirement System, corrects a reference to contribution rates, and establishes a new program allowing contractual employees of the Department of Legislative Services to earn pension service credit for employment exceeding five years, with specific conditions and deadlines.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Contractual employees of the Department of Legislative Services, State pension system members, and retirees
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach for contractual employees to earn pension service credit based on employment duration, with specific filing and contribution requirements, which is a relatively innovative policy change.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects pension benefits for certain employees.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Golf Simulator Facility
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue a Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license to a golf simulator facility under certain circumstances; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption under certain circumstances; requiring the license holder to submit an annual gross sales report to the Board before a license may be renewed; and establishing an annual license fee of $1,500.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Harford County to issue a new Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license that allows golf simulator venues to sell alcohol for on-premises consumption under specific conditions, including food service and sales restrictions, and requires annual reporting for license renewal.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Harford County
stakeholders: Golf simulator facilities, patrons of golf simulator venues, local alcohol license holders in Harford County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized alcohol license for golf simulator facilities, integrating alcohol sales with entertainment and food service, which is a new approach for such venues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns licensing and alcohol sales regulations for golf simulator venues.

Title: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center – Student Information – United States Census Bureau
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governing Board of the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to authorize the Center to send student information to the United States Census Bureau.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to send certain student information to the United States Census Bureau and establishes protocols for data sharing and security.
responsible_party: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center and the Comptroller
stakeholders: Students, educational institutions, and government agencies involved in data collection and analysis
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a data sharing protocol between state agencies and the federal Census Bureau, including the use of de-identified data and privacy standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by improving data collection and analysis related to education and income, but direct effects are not explicitly outlined.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Performing Arts Nonprofit Organization License
Synopsis: Establishing in Harford County a performing arts nonprofit organization beer, wine, and liquor license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption at up to three locations designated at the time of application; requiring the holder of the license to comply with certain record-keeping and reporting requirements; establishing an annual license fee of $750; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new license in Harford County for performing arts nonprofit organizations, allowing them to sell or serve alcohol at certain locations during performances and related events, with specific rules on location, record-keeping, and sales.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Performing arts nonprofit organizations, event attendees, local community
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized alcohol license for performing arts nonprofits, integrating alcohol sales with cultural events, which is a tailored approach to supporting the arts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing and alcohol sales regulations for nonprofits.

Title: Allegany County - Property Tax Credit - Evergreen Heritage Center
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Allegany County or a municipal corporation in Allegany County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on property that is owned by the Evergreen Heritage Center.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Allegany County or its municipalities to grant property tax credits to certain entities, including the Evergreen Heritage Center Foundation, Inc., and Evergreen Heritage Center Holdings, LLC.
responsible_party: Allegany County government or municipal governments within Allegany County
stakeholders: Property owners and organizations in Allegany County, including the Evergreen Heritage Center Foundation and Holdings, LLC
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a local property tax credit program targeting specific organizations, which is a common approach but tailored to local economic and cultural development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily provides tax relief to specific organizations and property owners.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification - Police Auxiliary and Reserve Volunteers
Synopsis: Increasing, from $5,000 to $7,000, a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for an individual who is a qualifying police auxiliary or reserve volunteer.
bill_summary: The bill increases the income tax subtraction modification for individuals who are qualifying police auxiliary or reserve volunteers, and clarifies the qualifications and reporting requirements for these volunteers.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Comptroller and Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Police auxiliary and reserve volunteers in Maryland, and the agencies that oversee them
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates and clarifies existing tax provisions and reporting requirements for police auxiliary and reserve volunteers, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly involves tax policy and volunteer qualifications.

Title: Property and Casualty Insurance – Pet Insurance – Regulation
Synopsis: Establishing requirements and prohibitions for pet insurance policies that are issued to a resident of the State or are sold, solicited, negotiated, or offered in the State, including disclosure requirements and requirements and prohibitions related to wellness programs; and requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration, on or before June 1, 2025, to develop informational material about pet insurance policies that may be disseminated to and posted by veterinary practitioners.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for pet insurance policies in Maryland, including disclosure requirements, prohibitions on wellness program marketing, and the development of informational materials for veterinary practitioners.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Pet owners, veterinary practitioners, pet insurance companies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive regulations and transparency requirements for pet insurance, including separate wellness programs and informational outreach, representing a structured approach to pet insurance regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily regulates pet insurance policies.

Title: Labor and Employment - Equal Pay for Equal Work - Wage Range Transparency
Synopsis: Altering the requirement that an employer disclose certain wage information to an applicant for employment; requiring an employer to disclose certain wage information in certain postings and to certain employees at certain times; requiring an employer to set the wage range disclosed in good faith; requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to develop and make available to employers a form that an employer may use to comply with certain wage disclosure requirements; prohibiting certain retaliatory action by an employer; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires employers in Maryland to disclose wage ranges in job postings and to employees, develop a form for compliance, and prohibits retaliation against employees for requesting wage information. It also establishes record-keeping and enforcement provisions to ensure compliance with wage transparency and equal pay laws.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Industry
stakeholders: Employees and job applicants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by mandating wage range disclosures in job postings and creating standardized forms for compliance, enhancing transparency and enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting fair wages and reducing wage disparities.

Title: Maryland Department of Labor - Report on Apprenticeship Mentoring Ratios
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report to the General Assembly that analyzes the apprenticeship mentoring ratio for all nontraditional apprenticeable occupations in the State; and requiring the Department to submit the report to the General Assembly by October 1, 2024, with recommendations for strategies to streamline the expansion of apprenticeship ratios for all newly registered nontraditional apprenticeship occupations for purposes of meeting the goals of the Apprenticeship 2030 Commission.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to adopt regulations establishing a 3:1 apprentice-to-journeyperson ratio for nontraditional and newly registered apprenticeship occupations, and to submit a report analyzing apprenticeship mentoring ratios and strategies for expansion.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Apprentices, employers in nontraditional trades, and workers in newly registered occupations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured mentorship ratio for nontraditional and new apprenticeship occupations and mandates a comprehensive report to analyze and expand these ratios, employing a data-driven approach to workforce development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving workforce opportunities through expanded apprenticeships in nontraditional fields.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting Permit
Synopsis: Establishing a beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit in St. Mary's County; authorizing the Board to issue the permit only to a holder of a Class A license; authorizing the holder to allow the on-premises consumption of beer, wine, and liquor for tasting purposes only; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit in St. Mary's County, allowing license holders to conduct tastings on their premises for specified periods and with set fees.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, consumers, and local businesses in St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new permit for alcohol tastings, which is a common practice but structured with specific time and fee regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly pertains to alcohol licensing and tastings.

Title: St. Mary’s County – Alcoholic Beverages – Nonprofit Performing Arts Theater License
Synopsis: Establishing in St. Mary's County a performing arts theater beer and wine license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer and wine in certain performing arts theaters at retail for on-premises consumption; and establishing an annual license fee of $300.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a nonprofit performing arts theater beer and wine license in St. Mary’s County, allowing eligible theaters operated by nonprofits to sell or serve beer and wine on their premises during performances and fundraisers.
responsible_party: St. Mary’s County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Nonprofit performing arts theaters and their audiences in St. Mary’s County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized alcohol license for nonprofit theaters, integrating alcohol sales into cultural and arts events to potentially enhance revenue and attendee experience.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily supporting nonprofit arts organizations.

Title: Large Family Child Care Homes and Child Care Centers - Child Care Teachers - Minimum Age
Synopsis: Requiring that certain regulations governing the registration and operation of large family child care homes and the licensing and operation of child care centers require that child care teachers be at least 18 years old.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that child care teachers in large family child care homes and child care centers in Maryland must be at least 18 years old, and updates regulations to reflect this minimum age requirement.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Child care providers, children in care, parents, and child care staff in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing regulations to set a minimum age for child care teachers, which is a standard regulatory change rather than an innovative program employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly sets minimum age requirements for child care staff.

Title: Court Personnel - Protection of Personal Information (Judge Andrew F. Wilkinson Judicial Security Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain protected individual or the Office of Information Privacy in the Administrative Office of the Courts to request that a governmental entity or person not publish personal information of the individual on the Internet, social media, or social networks or remove the information from any existing publication; specifying certain procedures for the protection of personal information of a protected individual; authorizing certain relief for a violation of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances the protection of personal information for judicial officers and their families, establishes a Judicial Address Confidentiality Program, and creates a Task Force to Improve Judicial Facility Security in Maryland.
responsible_party: Office of Information Privacy in the Administrative Office of the Courts
stakeholders: Judicial officers, their families, and protected individuals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining privacy protections, address confidentiality, and a dedicated task force to improve courthouse security, integrating privacy technology and interagency cooperation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on judicial safety and privacy protections.

Title: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program - State Supplement
Synopsis: Lowering the minimum age from 62 to 60 years old that a member of a household must be for eligibility for a State-provided supplemental benefit under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program; and increasing the amount of the supplemental benefit that the State must provide from $40 to $50.
bill_summary: The bill lowers the minimum age for household members to qualify for a state supplement under the SNAP program, increases the supplement amount, and clarifies program administration details.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Households receiving SNAP benefits in Maryland, especially those with members aged 60 or older
innovative_summary: The bill enhances existing SNAP benefits by increasing supplement amounts and adjusting eligibility criteria, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing support for low-income households.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Sheriff - Salary
Synopsis: Making the salary of the Sheriff of Anne Arundel County equal to the salary of a captain in the Anne Arundel County Police Department at step 20 in the pay scale, beginning in calendar year 2025.
bill_summary: The bill increases the salary of the Sheriff of Anne Arundel County, setting it at a fixed amount through 2024 and then tying it to the salary of a police captain starting in 2025.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government
stakeholders: Sheriff of Anne Arundel County and residents of Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily adjusts salary levels and ties future salary to a police captain's pay scale, which is a standard approach and not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Benefits - Hearing Loss
Synopsis: Altering the frequencies in which industrial noise must be for an employer to be required to provide workers' compensation to a covered employee for hearing loss; altering the method used to determine the percentage of hearing loss deafness for purposes of workers' compensation; and altering the method used to determine the deduction required to be made to allow for the average amount of hearing loss from nonoccupational causes in the population for purposes of calculating workers' compensation benefits for occupational deafness.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's workers' compensation laws to update the criteria for assessing hearing loss due to industrial noise, including the frequencies considered, the method of calculating hearing loss, and the inclusion of tinnitus as part of hearing loss for compensation purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or Workers' Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Workers exposed to industrial noise, employers, and insurance providers
innovative_summary: The bill updates technical standards and incorporates tinnitus into the calculation of hearing loss, reflecting current scientific understanding and improving assessment accuracy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns workers' compensation for industrial hearing loss.

Title: Right to Try Act - Individualized Investigational Treatments
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law authorizing certain activity by manufacturers of investigational drugs, biological products, or devices under the Right to Try Act to apply to manufacturers of certain individualized investigational treatments; altering the definition of "eligible patient" under the Right to Try Act to include individuals who have life-threatening or severely debilitating illnesses, rather than only individuals who have terminal illnesses; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Right to Try Act to include individualized investigational treatments for patients with life-threatening or severely debilitating illnesses, allowing access to unique, genetically tailored treatments. It removes restrictions on manufacturer payments and profits, and enables insurance coverage for such treatments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Patients with life-threatening or severely debilitating illnesses seeking individualized treatments, healthcare providers, manufacturers of investigational treatments, insurance companies
innovative_summary: The program introduces personalized, genetically tailored investigational treatments, leveraging advanced genomic analysis and manufacturing, representing a significant technological and procedural innovation in healthcare.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on adult patients with severe illnesses and personalized treatments.

Title: Public Higher Education - Communities of Interest - Targeted Recruitment and Outreach Efforts
Synopsis: Altering certain principles of public higher education in the State to include a principle that public higher education in Maryland should be committed to promoting diversity and inclusion at certain institutions by attracting and graduating a diverse student body committed to service; requiring certain public senior higher education institutions to adopt a certain written policy related to targeted recruitment and outreach efforts in certain communities of interest; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires public higher education institutions in Maryland to adopt policies for targeted recruitment and outreach efforts to underrepresented communities, and to report annually on these efforts and their outcomes.
responsible_party: Public senior higher education institutions in Maryland
stakeholders: Students from historically underrepresented groups and communities of interest in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs targeted outreach strategies and community partnerships to increase diversity in higher education enrollment, which is a strategic approach but not technologically innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to higher education for underrepresented communities, but the direct impact is moderate.

Title: Environment - Nuclear Power Plants - Emergency Preparedness (Radiation and Emergency Preparedness and Protection Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Radiation Emergency Response Program in the Department of the Environment; requiring the Department to serve as an offsite response organization and the lead State agency for all nuclear incidents within the State; requiring the Department to prepare a technical emergency radiation response plan, respond to emergencies involving a nuclear power plant, participate in a certain federal program, and procure certain specialized equipment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Radiation Emergency Response Program in Maryland, designates the Department of the Environment as the lead agency for nuclear incident response, and creates a fund to support emergency preparedness and response activities related to nuclear power plants.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Residents near nuclear power plants and emergency response agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated fund and a comprehensive emergency response plan, integrating federal and state efforts, which is a standard approach but well-structured.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on emergency preparedness for nuclear incidents has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Economic Development - Maryland Aerospace and Technology Commission
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Aerospace and Technology Commission in the Department of Commerce to promote innovation in the fields of space exploration and commercial aerospace opportunities, including the integration of space, aeronautics, and aviation industries into the economy of the State; requiring the Commission to develop a strategic plan; requiring the Commission to designate aerospace and technology zones in the State; requiring the Commission to submit a certain report by October 1 each year; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Aerospace and Technology Commission to promote innovation in space exploration and aerospace industries, creates a dedicated fund for these activities, and sets up programs, zones, and collaborations to support aerospace development in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Aerospace industry, higher education institutions, government agencies, local communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach including establishing a new commission, dedicated funding, zones, and collaborations to foster aerospace innovation and industry growth in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on industry and economic development, with limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Historical Trust - Historical and Cultural Museum Assistance Program - Funding
Synopsis: Altering prohibitions on grants from the Maryland Historical Trust; authorizing the Governor beginning in fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter, to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Trust to be used to provide grants to museums under the Historical and Cultural Museum Assistance Program.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes funding for the Maryland Historical Trust's Museum Assistance Program, providing grants to museums for various activities such as research, conservation, exhibit design, education, planning, and operational support. It establishes a review panel, sets eligibility criteria, and allows the Governor to allocate $5 million annually starting in fiscal year 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Historical Trust
stakeholders: Museums, museum visitors, cultural and educational institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach to support museums through grants, technical assistance, and strategic planning, with a focus on professional standards and geographic distribution.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but supports cultural and educational development which can indirectly benefit children.

Title: Charles County - Adult Protective Services Review Board - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Adult Protective Services Review Board in Charles County to authorize the appointment of a physician's assistant or nurse practitioner in the field of psychiatry to serve on the board instead of a psychiatrist.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership composition of the Adult Protective Services Review Board in Charles County, allowing a physician's assistant or nurse practitioner in psychiatry to serve instead of a psychiatrist.
responsible_party: Charles County government or the Adult Protective Services Review Board
stakeholders: Adults receiving protective services and mental health professionals in Charles County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more flexible professional requirement for the review board by including physician assistants and nurse practitioners in psychiatry, which is a relatively innovative approach to staffing such boards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on adult protective services and board composition.

Title: Renters' Rights and Stabilization Act of 2024
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of Tenant and Landlord Affairs in the Department of Housing and Community Development to provide certain educational resources and information to tenants; requiring the Office to develop and publish a Maryland Tenants' Bill of Rights; requiring the most recently published version of the Maryland Tenants' Bill of Rights to be included as part of a residential lease; limiting the maximum security deposit required by a residential lease to 1 month's rent, except under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Tenant and Landlord Affairs Office, modifies rental assistance and eviction procedures, limits security deposits, and increases court surcharges to fund housing programs and legal services, while also implementing new tenant rights related to property transfers and purchase rights.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development and Judiciary
stakeholders: Residential tenants, landlords, families eligible for rental assistance, and child-focused housing programs in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining legal reforms, data transparency, and new tenant rights, including property transfer rights and purchase opportunities, with technological components like online resources and data dashboards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to reduce child poverty by improving housing stability and access to assistance for vulnerable families.

Title: Real Estate Brokers – Commercial Transactions – Buyer’s Rights
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements and prohibitions for commercial real estate transactions related to a buyer's right to make certain title, settlement, and escrow selections.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements and prohibitions for commercial real estate transactions in Maryland, including buyer rights to select their own title, settlement, and escrow services, and prohibits requiring buyers to use specific service providers as a condition of settlement.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation (or relevant real estate regulatory agency)
stakeholders: Buyers and sellers involved in commercial real estate transactions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces transparency and buyer rights in commercial real estate transactions by mandating clear statements and prohibitions on requiring specific service providers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on commercial real estate transaction rules.

Title: Election Law - Election Judges - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board to develop and implement a marketing campaign to recruit individuals to serve as election judges; authorizing a local board to supplement the marketing campaign implemented by the State Board; requiring that a county employee who serves as an election judge during hours that the employee is scheduled to work receive certain administrative leave and certain election judge compensation; requiring the State Board to adopt certain regulations related to service as an election judge; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Elections to develop a marketing campaign to recruit election judges, standardizes forms and documentation for election judge service, and allows public school students to earn service-learning hours and receive compensation for serving as election judges.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Election judges, public school students, voters in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted marketing campaign and standardizes administrative procedures to improve election judge recruitment and participation, including integrating service-learning hours for students.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by engaging students and improving election processes, but it is not primarily focused on direct poverty alleviation.

Title: Wage and Hour Law - Minor League Baseball Players - Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting minor league baseball players who are compensated under the terms of a collective bargaining agreement that expressly provides for the wages and working conditions of employees from the Maryland Wage and Hour Law.
bill_summary: The bill exempts minor league baseball players who are paid under a collective bargaining agreement that specifies wages and working conditions from Maryland's Wage and Hour Law.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Minor league baseball players and related sports organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized exemption for minor league baseball players based on collective bargaining agreements, which is a targeted legal change rather than a new technology or broad government approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes legal exemptions for a specific group of workers.

Title: Licensed Real Estate Brokers - Branch Offices - Designation of Managers
Synopsis: Authorizing a licensed real estate broker to designate himself or herself as the manager of a branch office maintained by the licensed real estate broker.
bill_summary: The bill allows licensed real estate brokers in Maryland to designate themselves as the manager of their branch offices, simplifying the process for managing branch offices and updating related requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Licensed real estate brokers and salespersons in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill streamlines the management designation process for real estate brokers, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Business Regulation – Household Goods Movers – Special Fund and Fees
Synopsis: Establishing the Household Goods Movers Registration Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund in the Maryland Department of Labor; requiring the Secretary of Labor to annually calculate certain costs; authorizing the Department to set by regulation certain fees based on certain calculations; prohibiting certain fees from increasing annually by more than 12.5% of certain existing and corresponding fees; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Household Goods Movers Registration Fund as a special fund within the Maryland Department of Labor, sets rules for collecting and allocating fees from household goods movers, and authorizes the department to set and regulate these fees based on calculated costs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Household goods movers and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a cost-based fee setting approach and creates a dedicated fund for household goods movers, which is a structured and transparent method for funding regulatory activities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns regulatory funding mechanisms for household goods movers.

Title: Fishing and Hunting Licenses and Trout Stamps - Complimentary Licenses and Stamp Exemption - Veterans Determined to be Unemployable
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to issue certain complimentary fishing and hunting licenses to certain veterans who the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs determines are unemployable; and exempting certain veterans who the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs determines are unemployable from the requirement to obtain a trout stamp.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to issue complimentary fishing, hunting, and trout stamps licenses to certain veterans who are deemed unemployable by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, and exempts these veterans from purchasing trout stamps.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Veterans who are deemed unemployable by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to support veterans by providing free licenses for fishing and hunting, recognizing their service and current employment status.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily benefits veterans with fishing and hunting licenses.

Title: Carroll County – Deputy Clerk or Deputy Sheriff – Oath of Office
Synopsis: Requiring that every deputy clerk or deputy sheriff in Carroll County take and sign the oath or affirmation prescribed by the Maryland Constitution.
bill_summary: The bill requires deputy clerks and deputy sheriffs in Carroll County to take and sign the oath or affirmation prescribed by the Maryland Constitution, aligning their oath with the requirements in other counties and counties with specific additional oaths.
responsible_party: Carroll County government or the relevant county officials responsible for deputy clerks and sheriffs
stakeholders: Deputy clerks and deputy sheriffs in Carroll County, county government, and the residents of Carroll County
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes the oath requirements for deputy clerks and sheriffs across multiple counties, ensuring consistency and adherence to constitutional requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns oath-taking procedures for county officials.

Title: Office of the Attorney General - Rights of Residents of Health Care Facilities - Injunctive Relief
Synopsis: Authorizing the Attorney General to seek injunctive relief on behalf of the State on the basis of an imminent or ongoing violation of certain rights of residents of certain health care facilities; requiring that the resident bill of rights for assisted living program residents include certain rights; and prohibiting the Attorney General from duplicating certain corrective action by the Maryland Department of Health.
bill_summary: The bill enhances protections for residents of health care and assisted living facilities by granting the Attorney General authority to seek injunctive relief and impose penalties for violations of residents' rights, and establishes a resident bill of rights for assisted living residents.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residents of health care facilities and assisted living programs in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a proactive legal approach by empowering the Attorney General to seek injunctive relief and penalties for violations of residents' rights, which is a strategic use of legal authority to enforce residents' rights.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on adult residents' rights and facility regulations.

Title: Health Insurance - Qualified Resident Enrollment Program (Access to Care Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to establish and implement the Qualified Resident Enrollment Program to facilitate the enrollment of qualified residents in qualified plans; providing that the operation and administration of the Program may include functions delegated by the Exchange to a third party; and providing that the implementation of the Program is contingent on approval of a certain waiver application amendment.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Qualified Resident Enrollment Program within the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to facilitate health insurance enrollment for residents regardless of immigration status, and outlines the creation of a waiver application to support this initiative.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Qualified residents seeking health insurance coverage in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by creating a dedicated enrollment pathway for all residents regardless of immigration status, contingent on federal waiver approval.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to health coverage for all residents, including minors.

Title: Baltimore City – Control Over Powers of Police Commissioner
Synopsis: Repealing a prohibition on certain Baltimore City ordinances or acts of certain municipal officials from conflicting, impeding, obstructing, hindering, or interfering with the powers of the Baltimore City Police Commissioner; and making a portion of the Act contingent on the passage and ratification, by a certain date, of a certain Baltimore City Charter amendment.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a prohibition that prevented Baltimore City ordinances or acts of municipal officials from conflicting with the powers of the Baltimore City Police Commissioner. It makes this change contingent on the ratification of a proposed Baltimore City Charter amendment regarding the appointment, terms, and powers of the Police Commissioner, which is to be decided in the 2024 general election.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Government and Baltimore City voters
stakeholders: Baltimore City residents, police department, municipal officials
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a conditional change to local governance, linking the powers of the Police Commissioner to a voter-approved charter amendment, which is a common but significant approach to local government reform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Licensing Fees
Synopsis: Increasing certain licensing fees for alcoholic beverages in Baltimore City.
bill_summary: The bill updates and increases licensing fees for various types of alcoholic beverage licenses in Baltimore City, including beer, wine, and liquor licenses, and establishes specific rules for sale hours and additional licensing options.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, businesses selling alcoholic beverages, and consumers in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill mainly adjusts licensing fees and rules; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns licensing fees and sale hours.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Slow Moving Vehicles - Right-Hand Lane
Synopsis: Repealing a certain provision of law that applies the requirement that slow moving vehicles drive in the right-hand lane or lanes only to certain highways in certain geographic areas; and altering the standards under which the State Highway Administration is required to inform drivers of the requirement.
bill_summary: The bill repeals and amends laws regarding the requirement that slow-moving vehicles drive in the right-hand lane, clarifies the standards for informing drivers about this requirement, and specifies signage and education efforts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Drivers and road users in Maryland, especially those operating slow-moving vehicles
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing traffic laws and signage requirements; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Business Regulation - Licensed Home Improvement Contractors - Liability Insurance
Synopsis: Increasing from $50,000 to $500,000 the amount of general liability insurance that an applicant for a home improvement contractor license or a licensed home improvement contractor must maintain.
bill_summary: The bill increases the required general liability insurance amount for home improvement contractors in Maryland from $50,000 to $500,000.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Business Regulation
stakeholders: Home improvement contractors and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it mainly updates legal requirements for insurance coverage.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Northwest Baltimore County Sports Tourism Facility - Feasibility Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Stadium Authority to conduct a certain feasibility study for developing, establishing, and operating a  sports tourism facility at Reisterstown Regional Park in northwest Baltimore County; requiring the Authority to consult with certain governments, stakeholders, and entities; and requiring the Authority to submit a final report of its findings, conclusions, and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Stadium Authority to conduct a feasibility study for developing a sports tourism facility at Reisterstown Regional Park in northwest Baltimore County, including economic impact, infrastructure needs, and funding sources, with a final report due by December 31, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority
stakeholders: Local community, sports industry, regional economy, government agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive feasibility study approach to evaluate a new sports tourism facility, integrating economic, infrastructural, and community impact assessments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on economic development and infrastructure.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Stadium License
Synopsis: Authorizing the holder of a stadium license in Frederick County to sell liquor for on-premises consumption in addition to beer and wine; and increasing the annual license fee for a stadium license in the county from $2,000 to $2,500.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes a stadium license in Frederick County to sell liquor for on-premises consumption, in addition to beer and wine, and adjusts the annual license fee.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Professional baseball teams, stadium visitors, local residents, and event attendees in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the sale of liquor at stadiums in Frederick County, expanding existing alcohol sales policies and allowing for a broader range of alcoholic beverages at events.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns alcohol sales regulations at stadiums.
