Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Promoter's Permit
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue a promoter's permit to a certain for-profit organization under certain circumstances; authorizing a permit holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor at an event; etc.
bill_summary: The bill alters the promoter's permit in Frederick County to be a permit for on-sale beer, wine, and liquor, allowing certain organizations to sell alcohol at events and establishing fee structures based on expected attendance.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Event organizers, attendees, and residents of Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new permit for for-profit organizations to sell alcohol at events, with a tiered fee structure, streamlining alcohol sales at public events.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting event alcohol sales regulations.

Title: Corporations and Associations – Definitions, Emergencies, and Outstanding Stock – Revisions
Synopsis: Altering certain definitions as they relate to certain Maryland business entities; authorizing a corporation to adopt certain emergency bylaws; authorizing a corporation to take certain actions during an emergency; limiting the liability of certain persons for certain corporate acts taken during an emergency; and clarifying when certain stock is outstanding.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws related to corporations and associations, including provisions for emergency bylaws, actions during emergencies, and stock management.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Maryland corporations, limited liability companies, limited partnerships, and their stakeholders
innovative_summary: The bill introduces provisions for emergency management within corporate governance, including emergency bylaws and actions, which is a relatively innovative approach to corporate law.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly impact economic stability of businesses.

Title: Economic Development - Maryland Technology Development Corporation - Application and Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring an application for investment by the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to include an option for an applicant to provide certain demographic information of the applicant and the geographic area of the applicant's primary place of business; requiring the Corporation to submit a certain report to the Governor, the Maryland Economic Development Commission, and the General Assembly by October 1 each year concerning certain applicant and investment activities and certain demographic and geographic information; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to include an option for applicants to provide demographic information in their investment applications, prohibits adverse actions against those who decline, and mandates annual reporting on investment activities and demographic data.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Technology-based businesses, applicants for investment, and underrepresented demographic groups in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach to collecting demographic data from applicants for state-backed investments, promoting transparency and inclusivity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly by fostering inclusive economic growth and supporting diverse entrepreneurs.

Title: State Board of Social Work Examiners - Board Membership and Certified Social Worker Licenses
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the State Board of Social Work Examiners; and repealing obsolete references to certified social worker licenses.
bill_summary: The bill updates the membership structure of the Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners, clarifies licensing categories, and streamlines the process for out-of-state social workers to obtain licenses in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners
stakeholders: Social workers, social work students, and individuals seeking social work licensure in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily makes administrative and regulatory updates; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing and board membership.

Title: General Provisions - State Flag - Casket of an Eligible Decedent
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of State to furnish a State flag to drape the casket of an eligible decedent; establishing the process for a State flag to be claimed after burial; providing that only one flag may be provided for the death of an eligible decedent; and prohibiting the Secretary of State from procuring a flag that is not wholly produced in the United States.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Secretary of State to provide a U.S.-made state flag to drape the casket of certain eligible decedents, such as state employees, officials, and other designated individuals, and establishes procedures for requesting and claiming the flag.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of State
stakeholders: Eligible decedents including state employees, officials, and other designated individuals, and their families or representatives
innovative_summary: The program employs a specific process for providing U.S.-made flags to honor eligible decedents, emphasizing patriotic symbolism and state recognition.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Physicians - Supervised Medical Graduates and Cardiovascular Invasive Specialists (Bridge to Medical Residency Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a supervised medical graduate to provide delegated duties under direct supervision in accordance with regulations adopted by the State Board of Physicians; prohibiting an individual from practicing as a supervised medical graduate for more than 2 years; and repealing the termination of certain provisions of law relating to delegation of duties by licensed physicians to cardiovascular invasive specialists.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes supervised medical graduates to perform delegated duties under direct supervision for up to two years, and allows certain delegation of duties related to radiology and cardiovascular procedures, with specific regulations and oversight.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Medical graduates, physicians, hospitals, and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a supervised practice pathway for recent medical graduates, expanding delegation of duties and utilizing new supervision models, including direct supervision and specialized roles.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve healthcare access indirectly.

Title: Advanced Practice Registered Nurses - Professional Liability Insurance Coverage - Notification Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring advanced practice registered nurses practicing as an advanced practice registered nurse in the State to notify patients in writing if the nurse does not maintain professional liability insurance coverage or if the coverage has lapsed and not been renewed; requiring that the notification be provided at certain visits and as part of certain informed consents, signed by a patient at certain times, and retained as part of the advanced practice registered nurse's patient records; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires advanced practice registered nurses in Maryland to notify patients in writing if they do not have professional liability insurance or if their insurance has lapsed. The notification must be provided at the first visit when insurance is not maintained and as part of informed consent before procedures, signed by the patient, and retained in records. Nurses without insurance must also post this information visibly at their practice location.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Advanced practice registered nurses and their patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a transparency approach by requiring nurses to inform patients about their liability insurance status and to display this information publicly if uninsured, enhancing patient awareness and safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on professional liability transparency for nurses.

Title: Office of Legislative Audits - Local School Systems - Report
Synopsis: Requiring each local school system, on or before November 1 of the third year of a 6-year audit cycle, to submit a report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on the status of implementation of corrective actions to address repeat findings and recommendations identified by the Office of Legislative Audits in the most recent audit; and requiring each local school system to publish the report on its website.
bill_summary: The bill requires local school systems in Maryland to address repeat findings and recommendations from annual financial audits, including audits by the Office of Legislative Audits. It mandates that each school system submit a report on the status of corrective actions to a joint committee and publish it on their website. The bill also details audit procedures and exemptions.
responsible_party: Office of Legislative Audits and local school systems
stakeholders: Local school systems, students, taxpayers, and oversight committees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a requirement for local school systems to actively address audit findings and publicly report on their progress, enhancing transparency and accountability in school financial management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on improving financial oversight and accountability in schools could indirectly benefit children, especially those in underserved communities, by promoting better resource management.

Title: Montgomery County - School Bus Stops MC 6-24
Synopsis: Prohibiting, beginning December 31, 2026, the location of a school bus stop on any highway with five or more undivided traffic lanes in Montgomery County unless a school crossing guard is posted or a certain traffic control device is placed at the school bus stop.
bill_summary: The bill allocates fines collected from violations enforced by school bus monitoring cameras in Montgomery County to fund roadway and pedestrian safety improvements, restricts the placement of school bus stops on highways with five or more undivided lanes unless safety measures are in place, and regulates the use of school bus monitoring cameras in local jurisdictions.
responsible_party: Montgomery County and Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Students, parents, and residents of Montgomery County and other impacted jurisdictions
innovative_summary: The bill employs existing camera technology and reallocates fines for safety improvements, with some restrictions on camera use and school bus stop placement, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily focusing on safety and regulatory measures.

Title: Montgomery County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B Beer, Wine, and Liquor License - Off-Premises Consumption MC 9-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the holder of a certain Class B beer, wine, and liquor license in Montgomery County to sell beer and wine in sealed containers with the manufacturer's original seal for off-premises consumption under certain circumstances; and authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Montgomery County to adopt certain regulations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Montgomery County to allow holders of certain alcohol licenses to sell beer and wine in sealed containers for off-premises consumption, with specific requirements and regulations.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Montgomery County
stakeholders: Restaurant and hotel owners, consumers, and the general public in Montgomery County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new off-premises sale option for beer and wine in sealed containers at licensed restaurants and hotels, with specific regulatory oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the membership, structure, and termination date of the Maryland Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention, including adding two Muslim community members and removing a representative of the Council on American–Islamic Relations Maryland Office.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Members of the hate crime response community, including various advocacy groups, law enforcement, and the general public, especially Muslim community members.
innovative_summary: The bill updates the composition of a state commission to include more diverse community representation and establishes a clear termination date, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on hate crime response and prevention.

Title: State Lottery Fund - Bus Rapid Transit Fund Distribution and Prince George's County Blue Line Corridor Facility Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing a certain limitation on the State Lottery Fund distribution  and allocating an amount equal to $27,000,000 each fiscal year to the Bus Rapid Transit Fund for bus rapid transit system grants; adding an authorized use for the Prince George's County Blue Line Corridor Facility Fund; requiring the Maryland Stadium Authority, by December 15, 2024, to submit to certain committees of the General Assembly a report on all public and private development activities currently under construction in the Blue Line Corridor; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reallocates funds from the Maryland State Lottery Fund to support bus rapid transit projects and the Prince George's County Blue Line Corridor, including establishing a dedicated fund, altering distribution rules, and requiring a report on development activities in the corridor.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority and Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Residents and commuters in Prince George's County and users of the Blue Line Corridor transit system
innovative_summary: The bill employs a dedicated revolving fund and allocates lottery proceeds to specific transit and development projects, integrating transportation funding with lottery revenue streams.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve transportation access, which can reduce barriers for low-income families, thereby potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Property Tax - Credit for Hotel or Residential Development Projects
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant, by law, a tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is used for certain hotel or residential development projects; and altering eligibility for a certain property tax credit in Wicomico County against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is used for certain hotel or residential development projects.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local governments in Maryland to grant property tax credits for new hotel or residential development projects, including substantial rehabilitation, with specific eligibility criteria such as minimum residential units and affordable housing requirements.
responsible_party: Local governments in Maryland (Baltimore City, counties, municipal corporations)
stakeholders: Developers, residents, and local governments involved in hotel and residential development projects in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a local property tax credit program for hotel and residential developments, encouraging revitalization and affordable housing, which is a strategic use of tax policy to promote development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by promoting affordable housing and community revitalization.

Title: Calvert County - Roadside Solicitation of Money or Donations - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from standing in a roadway, median divider, or intersection to solicit money or donations from the occupant of a vehicle in Calvert County.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits individuals in Calvert County from standing in roadways, median dividers, or intersections to solicit money or donations from vehicle occupants, starting October 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Calvert County government
stakeholders: Vehicle occupants and individuals soliciting donations in Calvert County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal restriction on roadside solicitation in Calvert County, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses solicitation regulations.

Title: Judges' Retirement System - Special Death Benefit
Synopsis: Establishing a line-of-duty special death benefit for members of the Judges' Retirement System; providing for health benefits for a surviving spouse, child, or dependent parent who is receiving a special death benefit for the death of a member of the Judges' Retirement System; and providing for the retroactive application of the Act to any member of the Judges' Retirement System who is killed prior to the effective date of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a special line-of-duty death benefit for members of the Judges' Retirement System, including health benefits for surviving spouses, children, or dependent parents, and provides for retroactive application to members killed prior to the act's effective date.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members of the Judges' Retirement System and their families
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized death benefit with retroactive application and health benefits, employing a targeted approach to judicial member deaths in the line of duty.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on benefits for families of deceased judges.

Title: Human Services - Individuals With Disabilities and Service-Disabled Veterans Boating Fund
Synopsis: Establishing the Individuals With Disabilities and Service-Disabled Veterans Boating Fund to provide sailing, boating, kayaking, canoeing, and paddleboarding and surfing opportunities for individuals with disabilities and service-disabled veterans; requiring the Department of Disabilities to administer the Fund; prohibiting the Department from providing a grant of more than $40,000 in a fiscal year; and establishing the qualifications for certain nonprofit organizations to receive a grant from the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Individuals With Disabilities and Service-Disabled Veterans Boating Fund to provide grants for sailing, boating, kayaking, canoeing, paddleboarding, and surfing opportunities for individuals with disabilities and service-disabled veterans. It details the administration, funding, and eligibility criteria for grants to nonprofit organizations.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities and service-disabled veterans in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to improve access to water-based recreational activities for disabled individuals and veterans, utilizing grants to nonprofit organizations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on recreational access for specific populations.

Title: Maryland Technology Development Corporation - Authority
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Technology Development Corporation, subject to a written agreement, to provide certain outside entities administrative services or support and to receive compensation for providing the services or support.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to provide administrative services or support to certain entities, under a written agreement, and to receive compensation for these services.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Entities receiving administrative services and support from the Maryland Technology Development Corporation
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal mechanism for the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to provide paid administrative support to other entities, which is a new approach for such a state agency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but could indirectly support economic development and innovation.

Title: Competitive Sealed Proposals - Security Contracts
Synopsis: Providing that competitive sealed proposals is the preferred procurement method for a contract for security services with an expected value that is greater than $1,000,000.
bill_summary: The bill establishes that for certain security contracts valued over $100,000, the state must use competitive sealed proposals as the preferred procurement method, and for services valued over $1,000,000, it is also preferred. It details the procurement process, including issuing requests for proposals, conducting discussions, and awarding contracts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of General Services or relevant procurement agency
stakeholders: State government, security service providers, minority business enterprises, and the public benefiting from security services
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured procurement process for security contracts, emphasizing competitive proposals and minority participation, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on procurement procedures for security services.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Lighting - Privately Owned Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing certain members of a volunteer fire company to equip their privately owned vehicles with red and green or red and white lights or signal devices.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain members of volunteer fire companies in Maryland to equip their privately owned vehicles with red and white or red and green lights or signal devices, specifically for use while responding to emergencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant emergency services agencies
stakeholders: Volunteer fire company members and their vehicles, emergency responders, and the communities they serve
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new allowance for volunteer fire members to use specific emergency lights on privately owned vehicles, which is a targeted change in vehicle lighting regulations for emergency response.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly pertains to vehicle lighting regulations for volunteer fire responders.

Title: Freedom to Read Act
Synopsis: Establishing a State policy that local school systems operate their school library media programs consistent with certain standards; requiring each local school system to develop a policy and procedures to review objections to materials in a school library media program; prohibiting a county board of education from dismissing, demoting, suspending, disciplining, reassigning, transferring, or otherwise retaliating against certain school library media program personnel for performing their job duties consistent with certain standards; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes state standards for libraries and school library media programs, requiring policies for reviewing objections to materials, and prohibits retaliation against library staff for performing their duties according to these standards. It also links funding for libraries and library programs to the adoption of policies consistent with these standards and authorizes withholding of funds if standards are not met.
responsible_party: Maryland State Library Agency
stakeholders: Students, school personnel, library users, library staff, and local government entities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to standardize library operations across the state, linking funding to policy compliance, and establishing oversight mechanisms, which is a relatively innovative approach to library governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to library resources and materials, which can support educational and informational needs of children, thereby potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Health Occupations – Limited License to Practice Dentistry – Services for Adults
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Dental Examiners to waive certain education requirements for certain applicants for a limited license to practice dentistry who provide dental services for adults.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners to waive certain educational requirements for applicants seeking a limited license to practice dentistry, specifically for those providing dental services to adults in public health settings, federally qualified health centers, or Maryland qualified health centers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Adults receiving dental services in public health clinics and federally qualified health centers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized pathway for dental practitioners to obtain licensure through waivers and targeted training, focusing on expanding access to dental care in underserved populations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to dental care for underserved populations, including children in public health settings.

Title: Allegany County - Allegany Regional Recreational Economic Development Authority - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Allegany Regional Recreational Economic Development Authority in Allegany County to support the development and construction of regional recreation facilities to benefit residents and the economic development of Allegany County, including athletic fields, indoor athletic facilities, and other facilities for recreational tourism; and requiring the Authority to annually report its activities to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly beginning October 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Allegany Regional Recreational Economic Development Authority in Allegany County to support the development of regional recreation facilities such as athletic fields and indoor athletic facilities to benefit residents and promote economic development.
responsible_party: Allegany Regional Recreational Economic Development Authority
stakeholders: Residents of Allegany County, local governments, and regional recreational users
innovative_summary: The program creates a new regional authority to coordinate and develop recreational facilities, integrating local government and educational institutions in a structured manner.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve community well-being and economic opportunities, which can indirectly impact child poverty.

Title: Carroll County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of Carroll County to borrow not more than $29,800,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in Carroll County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Carroll County to issue up to $29,800,000 in bonds to finance public facilities, water and sewer projects, and volunteer fire department facilities, including emergency equipment. It also allows the county to make loans to volunteer fire departments for emergency-related equipment and facilities, and to acquire land easements to preserve agricultural and woodland land.
responsible_party: Carroll County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents of Carroll County, volunteer fire departments, landowners, and public facility users
innovative_summary: The program employs traditional bond financing mechanisms for public infrastructure and emergency services, with a focus on land easements for land preservation, which is a common approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily through improved public facilities and emergency services which can indirectly benefit community well-being.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Committed Persons - Release Proceedings
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of the Maryland Rules relating to discovery in civil matters apply in a certain administrative proceeding; requiring a court that receives a certain report to promptly notify counsel of record for the committed person; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to notify the court and certain persons if the Department receives a certain report; requiring a court to hold a hearing on request by any party after a certain application is made; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures for release and conditional release of committed persons in Maryland, including notification requirements, application processes, and court procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and courts
stakeholders: Committed persons, their legal counsel, the Department of Health, and the courts
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies and updates existing legal procedures without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Cannabis - Licensee Locations - Restrictions
Synopsis: Altering the distance restrictions from 2000 feet to one-half mile applicable to a licensed cannabis dispensary; prohibiting a political subdivision from establishing certain zoning requirements that are more restrictive than certain zoning requirements that existed on June 30, 2023; authorizing at least 10 individuals who are residents, commercial tenants who are not holders of or applicants for a license, or real estate owners, and are located within 1,000 of the licensed premises to file a protest against a license; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies zoning restrictions and protest procedures related to licensed cannabis dispensaries and growers in Maryland. It limits the ability of political subdivisions to impose more restrictive zoning requirements than those for other retail businesses, clarifies distance restrictions for dispensaries, and establishes a process for residents to protest license renewals.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Cannabis licensees, residents living near dispensaries, local governments, social equity licensees
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new process allowing residents to protest license renewals and limits local governments from imposing overly restrictive zoning, employing regulatory and procedural innovations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on zoning and licensing procedures.

Title: Physician Assistants - Revisions (Physician Assistant Modernization Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring that a physician assistant have a collaboration agreement, rather than a delegation agreement, in order to practice as a physician assistant; altering the scope of practice of a physician assistant; altering the education required for licensure as a physician assistant; authorizing physician assistants who are employees of the federal government to perform acts, tasks, or functions during a certain disaster; and requiring the State Board to review and update the list of duties for physician assistants.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes the practice of physician assistants in Maryland by replacing delegation agreements with collaboration agreements, expanding their scope of practice, updating education and certification requirements, and establishing new rules for prescriptive authority and advanced duties. It also sets procedures for supervision, reporting, and discipline of physician assistants.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Physician assistants, healthcare providers, patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by replacing delegation agreements with collaboration agreements, allowing for expanded practice scopes and prescriptive authority, and establishing detailed oversight and reporting mechanisms, representing a significant modernization of physician assistant practice.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve healthcare access and quality, which can contribute to reducing child poverty by ensuring better health outcomes and access to services.

Title: Natural Resources – Submerged Aquatic Vegetation Surveys
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "aerial survey" for purposes of surveying submerged aquatic vegetation to include other surveys that encompass certain geographic areas and use certain methodologies; and requiring the Department of Natural Resources to study and report to the General Assembly on the implications and feasibility of using alternative methods other than an aerial survey to delineate SAV protection zones on or before December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill updates the definition of 'aerial survey' for mapping submerged aquatic vegetation (SAV) to include other survey methods, requires the Department of Natural Resources to study and report on alternative methods for delineating SAV protection zones, and makes adjustments to SAV zone management and survey protocols.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Environmental agencies, conservation groups, and communities involved in Chesapeake Bay and Atlantic Coastal Bays ecosystems
innovative_summary: The bill explores the use of alternative technologies and methods beyond traditional aerial surveys for environmental mapping, aiming to improve efficiency and accuracy in SAV protection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on environmental protection and survey methodologies, with limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages – Retail Delivery – Local Delivery Service Permit
Synopsis: Establishing a local delivery service permit that authorizes the holder to deliver alcoholic beverages from a retail license holder that is authorized to deliver alcoholic beverages to purchasers in a certain jurisdiction under certain circumstances; authorizing retail license holders to deliver alcoholic beverages to purchasers in a certain jurisdiction through a third-party contractor, an independent contractor, or an agent that holds a certain delivery service permit under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a local delivery service permit allowing retail license holders to deliver alcoholic beverages through third-party or independent contractors, with specific regulations, fees, and age restrictions.
responsible_party: Maryland local licensing boards
stakeholders: Retail alcohol license holders, delivery contractors, consumers aged 21 and over in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regulated third-party delivery permit for alcohol, enabling new delivery methods and electronic order facilitation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on alcohol delivery regulations.

Title: Members of Boards, Committees, Commissions, Task Forces, or Workgroups – Removal or Suspension
Synopsis: Providing that a member of a board, committee, commission, task force, or workgroup created by State law may be removed or suspended for misconduct, incompetence, neglect of duties, or other good cause by the individual or entity that appointed the member under certain circumstances; authorizing the removal or suspension of an appointed member only after consultation with the chair of the board, committee, commission, task force, or workgroup and the member has been given an opportunity to be heard regarding the removal or suspension; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes procedures for the removal or suspension of members of boards, committees, commissions, task forces, or workgroups created by Maryland state law, including requirements for notice, hearing, and consultation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Members of state-created boards, committees, commissions, task forces, and workgroups
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal process for removal or suspension, including hearings and consultation, which is a structured approach to governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but improves governance processes.

Title: Criminal Law - Rapid-Fire Activator - Switch/Auto-Sear
Synopsis: Altering the term "rapid fire trigger activator" to be "rapid fire activator"; adding "switch/auto-sear" to the definition of "rapid fire activator" for purposes of certain prohibitions on rapid fire activators; and prohibiting a person from transporting a rapid fire activator into the State or manufacturing, possessing, selling, offering for sale, transferring, purchasing, or receiving a rapid fire activator with a certain exception.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the manufacture, possession, sale, transfer, or import of switch/auto-sears and rapid fire activators, and establishes penalties for violations, including increased prison sentences for using certain weapons in crimes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police or relevant law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Gun owners, law enforcement, general public, and individuals involved in firearm transactions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal definitions and restrictions on certain firearm devices, with no new technological approaches or innovative programs introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but aims to reduce gun violence, which can indirectly benefit children and families.

Title: Higher Education - Financial Well-Being Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Financial Well-Being Pilot Program at the University of Maryland, College Park Campus and Morgan State University to provide comprehensive financial guidance and coaching to help students who may benefit from financial coaching services; requiring by August 1, 2024, each participating institution to hire one full-time financial well-being coach; requiring each financial well-being coach to create a document with best practices and guidance for other institutions to use to create a financial well-being program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Financial Well-Being Pilot Program at the University of Maryland, College Park Campus and Morgan State University to provide financial guidance, support, and coaching to students who may benefit from such services, aiming to improve their financial literacy and reduce financial stress.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission and the governing entities of the participating universities
stakeholders: College students at the University of Maryland, College Park Campus and Morgan State University
innovative_summary: The program employs personalized financial coaching, behavioral focus, and data collection to improve student financial literacy and well-being, which is a relatively innovative approach in higher education support services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving financial literacy and stability among students, which can have long-term benefits for their families.

Title: Tri–County Council for Southern Maryland – Southern Maryland Agricultural Development Commission – Funding
Synopsis: Increasing from $900,000 to $1,000,000 the amount of an appropriation that the Governor is required to include in the annual budget bill each year for the Tri-County Council for Southern Maryland from the Cigarette Restitution Fund; repealing the termination of certain provisions of law that require the Governor to include the appropriation in the annual budget bill each year and the Council to use the appropriation to fund the activities of the Southern Maryland Agricultural Development Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual appropriation for the Tri–County Council for Southern Maryland from $900,000 to $1,000,000, and allows the Governor to allocate an additional 5% of the funds from the Master Settlement Agreement to support the Southern Maryland Agricultural Development Commission. It also repeals the sunset clause that ended the law in 2025, making the funding permanent.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Department of Economic Development
stakeholders: Southern Maryland agricultural community and residents of the Tri–County area
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward funding increase and allocation mechanism, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's direct impact on child poverty is likely minimal, as it primarily funds agricultural development activities.

Title: Juvenile Law - Reform
Synopsis: Altering the jurisdiction of the juvenile court over a child of a certain age alleged to have committed a certain offense; altering certain provisions relating to the taking of a child into custody by a law enforcement officer; expanding certain provisions of law relating to the entry onto certain school or other property by, and the education of, certain sex offender registrants; altering certain provisions relating to the Commission on Juvenile Justice Reform and Emerging and Best Practices; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a comprehensive juvenile justice reform framework in Maryland, including the creation of the Governor's Office for Children, the Children's Cabinet, and the Commission on Juvenile Justice Reform and Emerging and Best Practices. It enhances oversight, reporting, and coordination among agencies, expands juvenile court jurisdiction, updates procedures for juvenile detention, custody, and intake, and emphasizes evidence-based, culturally competent programs to prevent juvenile involvement in the justice system and reduce child fatalities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Juvenile Services and related agencies such as the Governor’s Office for Children and the Office of Crime Prevention and Policy.
stakeholders: Children and youth involved in or at risk of entering the juvenile justice system, their families, juvenile justice professionals, schools, and community organizations.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated, data-driven approach with new oversight bodies, enhanced reporting, and integration of evidence-based practices, including the use of technology for monitoring and reporting, making it a highly innovative reform effort.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to impact child poverty by reducing juvenile justice involvement, improving access to services, and supporting families, which can contribute to breaking the cycle of poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Issuance of License Near a Place of Worship or School PG 307-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue an alcoholic beverages license for an establishment that is within 500 feet of a place of worship or 1,000 feet of a school building if a license of the same class had been issued and was held by the same person seeking the new license and was in effect for the establishment before the place of worship or school building was built.
bill_summary: This bill allows the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue alcohol licenses to establishments that are within certain distances of places of worship or schools, provided the same license was held before the construction of the place of worship or school.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County
stakeholders: Establishments seeking alcohol licenses, places of worship, schools, and the local community in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific exception to distance restrictions for alcohol licenses, allowing certain existing license holders to operate closer to places of worship or schools if they held the license before the construction.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting licensing rules.

Title: State Finance – Catastrophic Event Account and Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund – Noncivilian Federal Employees
Synopsis: Altering the purposes of the Catastrophic Event Account and the Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund to provide financial assistance to noncivilian federal employees.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Catastrophic Event Account and the Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund to provide financial assistance and loans to noncivilian federal employees affected by federal government shutdowns, and makes related amendments to the State Finance and Procurement laws.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Noncivilian federal employees in Maryland affected by government shutdowns
innovative_summary: The bill creates dedicated funds and a loan program specifically for federal employees impacted by shutdowns, utilizing state funds and investment earnings, and establishing procedures for loans and assistance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly assist federal employees facing financial hardship during shutdowns, which could help mitigate child poverty among affected families.

Title: Prince George's County - Student Support - Specialist Networks and Success Action Plans (Student Supports and Success Act) PG 502-24
Synopsis: Establishing a Student Support Specialist Network consisting of certain school-based personnel at each public high school in Prince George's County; requiring the Prince George's County Board of Education to develop a certain template using certain guidelines by December 31, 2024; and requiring each Student Support Specialist Network in the county to develop, complete, and implement a certain plan, subject to review and approval by the Prince George's County Board of Education.
bill_summary: The bill establishes Student Support Specialist Networks in each public high school in Prince George's County, requiring the development and implementation of Student Support Success Action Plans to improve behavioral and mental health supports, reduce suspensions and expulsions, and foster a positive school climate.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, school staff, and families in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated network approach with standardized metrics and plans to improve student support services and school climate, integrating various school-based personnel and community resources.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving mental health support, reducing disciplinary actions, and fostering a positive school environment that can support at-risk students.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Employed Individuals With Disabilities
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to provide Maryland Medical Assistance Program services for qualified applicants who are at least 16 years old and for existing Program recipients under the Employed Individuals with Disabilities Program in accordance with certain requirements; prohibiting the Department from limiting eligibility to receive services under the EID Program based on certain criteria; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's Medicaid program to expand services for employed individuals with disabilities, removing previous restrictions based on income, assets, or age, and establishing new eligibility and program rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities seeking employment, Medicaid recipients, and the disability advocacy community in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more inclusive Medicaid program for employed individuals with disabilities, removing income and asset restrictions, and establishing ongoing stakeholder engagement and federal compliance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting employment and health coverage for individuals with disabilities, thereby improving economic stability.

Title: Fire Protection and Prevention - Residential Rental Property - Requirements (Melanie Nicholle Diaz Fire Safety Act)
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements relating to the installation of certain fire safety equipment in residential rental high-rise buildings and certain other property; authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant, by law, a certain property tax credit; establishing the Workgroup to Develop Fire Safety Best Practices for Pre-1974 High-Rise Apartment Buildings; requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations by December 31, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes fire safety requirements for high-rise residential buildings, including installation of smoke alarms, notification appliances for the deaf and hard of hearing, and emergency lighting. It also mandates posting notices about sprinkler system coverage, provides funding source identification for sprinkler system installation, and creates a workgroup to develop fire safety best practices for pre-1974 high-rise buildings. Additionally, it offers property tax credits for fire safety improvements.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development in coordination with the State Fire Marshal
stakeholders: Residents of high-rise residential buildings, property owners, fire safety professionals, and local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining regulations, funding information dissemination, and a specialized workgroup to improve fire safety in high-rise buildings, including considerations for older structures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving safety and possibly reducing fire-related risks in residential buildings.

Title: Libraries - Regional Resource Centers - Governing Board Membership
Synopsis: Increasing, from one member to two members, the number of public members from each area served by the participating library systems on the governing board for each regional resource center.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of public members on the governing boards of regional resource centers for libraries from one to two members.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education or local library systems
stakeholders: Public library users and community members served by regional resource centers
innovative_summary: The bill primarily makes administrative changes to governance structures and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on governance of library resource centers.

Title: Maryland Insurance Administration – Professional Employer Organizations – Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration to study professional employer organizations in the State to review certain regulations, histories, health plans, requirements, and regulatory structures in other states and to address any potential impacts of proposed statutory changes in the State relating to the offering of health coverage by professional employer organizations on the small group market in the State; and requiring the Administration to report to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Insurance Administration to study professional employer organizations (PEOs) in Maryland, focusing on regulation, health plans, membership requirements, and impacts on the small group health insurance market. The study aims to compare laws, review industry history, and examine regulatory structures, with a report due by December 31, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Professional employer organizations, small employers, employees, and health insurance market regulators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive study approach to understand the regulation and impact of professional employer organizations, which is a standard policy analysis approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly influence employment and health coverage for workers.

Title: General Provisions - Damages or Losses - Definition
Synopsis: Defining "damages" or "losses" in statutory causes of action to protect civil rights or consumer rights and providing that "damages" or "losses" includes reasonable nominal damages.
bill_summary: The bill defines 'damages' or 'losses' in certain civil rights and consumer rights causes of action to include reasonable nominal damages, ensuring these damages are recognized as a form of redress.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly / Maryland courts
stakeholders: Individuals seeking civil rights or consumer protections in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill clarifies and explicitly includes nominal damages as a form of damages in civil rights and consumer protection cases, reinforcing existing legal remedies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily clarifies legal definitions.

Title: Parents in Substance Use Disorder Treatment - Children in Need of Assistance and Treatment Facilities
Synopsis: Establishing a presumption that placement with a child's parent is in the best interest of the child, the child is receiving proper care and attention, and there is not a certain emergency situation if the child's parent is receiving certain substance use disorder treatment and the child is in the presence of the child's parent for the duration of the child's parent's treatment; authorizing the Behavioral Health Administration to require a facility providing certain treatment to provide beds and services to the patient's children; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a presumption that placement with a child's parent is in the child's best interest if the parent is receiving substance use disorder treatment and the child is present during the treatment. It also requires treatment facilities to provide beds and services for patients' children and allow children to be with their parent during treatment, and clarifies procedures for child shelter care and placement.
responsible_party: Behavioral Health Administration and local departments of social services
stakeholders: Children in need of assistance, parents receiving substance use disorder treatment, treatment facilities, child welfare agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by presuming that children are best placed with parents receiving substance use disorder treatment if the child is present during the treatment, and mandates treatment facilities to accommodate children, integrating child care into substance use disorder treatment programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting family stability and reducing foster care placements.

Title: Calvert County - Ethics - Conflict of Interest and Commissioner Expulsion
Synopsis: Requiring that the conflict of interest provisions enacted by Calvert County include certain provisions relating to judicial relief for certain violations of the county's conflict of interest provisions; requiring the ethics provisions enacted by Calvert County to include a provision requiring the Calvert County Ethics Commission to make public any recommendation it makes to expel a Commissioner; and requiring Calvert County to enact a law or regulation that authorizes the removal of a county elected official for certain violations.
bill_summary: The bill requires Calvert County to include specific conflict of interest provisions, including judicial relief and public disclosure of expulsion recommendations, and mandates the county to enact laws allowing the removal of elected officials for conflict violations.
responsible_party: Calvert County government
stakeholders: Calvert County elected officials and residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces transparency measures and specific legal procedures for conflict of interest violations, including public disclosure and judicial enforcement, which are relatively innovative for local government ethics enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but aims to improve governance and ethical standards, which could indirectly benefit public trust and effective service delivery.

Title: Calvert County - Procurement - Local Preference
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Calvert County to enact an ordinance that establishes a local percentage preference for certain procurement contracts; and requiring the County Commissioners to comply with certain provisions of law under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Calvert County to enact an ordinance that provides a local preference in procurement contracts, allowing resident businesses to be awarded contracts even if their bids are slightly higher than nonresident businesses.
responsible_party: Calvert County County Commissioners
stakeholders: Local resident and nonresident businesses in Calvert County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a local preference policy in procurement processes, which is a common approach but tailored to local government procurement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it focuses on procurement preferences for local businesses.

Title: Prince George's County Family Child Care Home Expansion Grant Program - Establishment PG 505-24
Synopsis: Establishing the Prince George's County Family Child Care Home Expansion Grant Program in the Prince George's County public school system; providing that the purpose of the Program is to increase the number of registered family child care providers, registered family child care homes, and registered large family child care homes in low-income communities in the county; requiring a local school system to develop a certain application process; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Prince George's County Family Child Care Home Expansion Grant Program to increase the number of registered family child care providers and homes in low-income communities within Prince George's County. The program provides grants to nonprofit organizations to support training and financial assistance for individuals aiming to become registered family child care providers.
responsible_party: Division of Early Childhood Development in the Prince George's County Public School System
stakeholders: Individuals in low-income communities in Prince George's County seeking to become family child care providers, children in those communities, and families using child care services
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted grant approach to support local nonprofit organizations in training and assisting new child care providers, focusing on low-income communities, which is a strategic approach to expanding access to quality child care.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to affordable, quality child care in low-income communities, thereby supporting working families and early childhood development.

Title: Carroll County - Contracts and Purchasing
Synopsis: Increasing from $25,000 to $50,000 the cost of a public work or improvement or the purchase price of supplies or equipment for which the County Commissioners of Carroll County may enter into a contract; and requiring that when the cost of a public work or improvement or the purchase price of supplies or equipment in Carroll County exceeds $50,000 under certain conditions, the Procurement Officer for the County Commissioner shall advertise for bids for at least 1 week in a media accessible to the general public.
bill_summary: The bill increases the contract and purchase price threshold in Carroll County from $25,000 to $50,000, and modifies procedures for public notice and bidding for public works and supplies exceeding this amount.
responsible_party: Carroll County Procurement Officer or County Commissioners
stakeholders: Carroll County government, local vendors, and residents of Carroll County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates procurement thresholds and procedures, with no new technological or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly impact local economic activity.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Annual Vehicle Shows - Motor and Trailer Homes
Synopsis: Altering the number of annual vehicle shows in which motor and trailer home dealers, and salesmen employed by dealers, may participate.
bill_summary: The bill amends vehicle laws to remove restrictions on the number of annual vehicle shows that motor and trailer home dealers and salesmen employed by them can participate in, allowing more participation for certain types of dealers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Motor and trailer home dealers, salesmen, and manufacturers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes participation limits for vehicle shows, which is a regulatory adjustment rather than an innovative program employing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly alters regulations for vehicle dealers.

Title: Income Tax - Individual Income Tax Credit Eligibility Awareness Campaign
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller to implement and administer a certain individual income tax credit eligibility awareness campaign to identify and encourage individuals to apply for certain individual income tax credits; authorizing the Comptroller to enter into a certain data sharing agreement with other State agencies to carry out the awareness campaign; and requiring, in each of fiscal years 2026 through 2030, the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $300,000 for the awareness campaign.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Comptroller to implement an awareness campaign to identify and encourage underserved individuals to apply for certain individual income tax credits, with funding allocated annually from 2026 to 2030.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Underserved individuals eligible for income tax credits in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs data sharing and targeted outreach to increase awareness and application for tax credits, leveraging inter-agency cooperation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to tax credits that benefit low-income families.

Title: State Investment Portfolio and Local Government Investment Guidelines - Investment Standards
Synopsis: Requiring the Treasurer to consult with governmental entities prior to proposing certain regulations; repealing the limitations on investment in certain assets in which the Treasurer may invest or reinvest certain unexpended or surplus funds; authorizing the Treasurer to retain investments made prior to the effective date of the Act until the investments have reached their respective maturity dates; authorizing the Treasurer and governmental entities to invest or reinvest in certain surplus funds under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's investment standards for the state's and local governments' public funds, including requiring the Treasurer to consult with entities before proposing regulations, repealing certain investment limitations, and establishing new regulations for asset classes and thresholds.
responsible_party: Maryland State Treasurer's Office
stakeholders: Maryland state and local government entities managing public funds
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates investment guidelines and standards, with some provisions for transparency and minority business enterprise participation, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly impact public financial management.

Title: State Procurement - Small Business Preference Procurement
Synopsis: Requiring each procurement unit to establish a price preference for small businesses; and designating the Board of Public Works as the regulatory authority for the Small Business Preference Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Small Business Preference Program requiring procurement units to set a price preference for small businesses, with specific criteria, procedures, and goals to increase small business participation in state contracts, including a target of 15% of total procurement value.
responsible_party: Board of Public Works and relevant state procurement agencies
stakeholders: Small businesses seeking government contracts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured preference system with tiered benefits for veteran- and disabled veteran-owned small businesses, and integrates small business participation goals into state procurement processes, including a small business reserve component.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by supporting small businesses, which can create jobs and economic opportunities for families.

Title: Shellfish Aquaculture - Harvest Hours
Synopsis: Repealing a restriction which prohibited the harvesting of shellfish between the hours of sunset and sunrise from certain areas leased for aquaculture; and requiring the Department of Natural Resources to establish by regulation the hours for harvesting shellfish within leased areas.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a restriction on harvesting hours for shellfish in leased aquaculture areas and requires the Department of Natural Resources to establish new harvesting hours by regulation.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Shellfish aquaculture leaseholders and the shellfish industry in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regulatory process to establish harvesting hours, allowing for potentially adaptive management of shellfish harvesting times.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns shellfish harvesting regulations.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Community Action Boards
Synopsis: Requiring certain community action boards to meet certain federal requirements for tripartite boards; and repealing certain requirements relating to the composition of community action boards.
bill_summary: The bill updates the requirements for community action boards in Maryland, including aligning their composition with federal tripartite board standards and repealing previous composition requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Low-income community members, public officials, community organizations, and local governments in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces federal tripartite board standards to Maryland's community action boards, promoting more inclusive and representative governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve services and representation for low-income populations, which could help reduce child poverty.

Title: Energy Efficiency and Conservation Plans
Synopsis: Requiring each electric company, each gas company, and the Department of Housing and Community Development to develop a plan for achieving certain energy efficiency, conservation, and greenhouse gas emissions reduction targets through certain programs and services and superseding certain existing energy efficiency and conservation goals; requiring the Public Service Commission to establish a working group to study and make recommendations on extending certain program assistance to certain moderate-income households; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the development and implementation of comprehensive energy efficiency, conservation, demand response, and greenhouse gas emissions reduction plans by electric and gas utilities, the Department of Housing and Community Development, and the Department of the Environment. It establishes targets, programs, and funding coordination to support these initiatives, especially focusing on low- and moderate-income households, and sets reporting and monitoring requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission, Department of Housing and Community Development, Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Electric and gas utility customers, low- and moderate-income residents, environmental agencies, state government agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, multi-agency approach with detailed planning, coordination, and monitoring to achieve greenhouse gas reduction and energy efficiency goals, integrating federal funding and focusing on equitable benefits for low- and moderate-income households.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to reduce child poverty by improving energy affordability and efficiency for low-income households, thereby reducing utility costs and supporting housing stability.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and Health Insurance - Coverage for Prostheses (So Every Body Can Move Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide certain coverage related to prostheses; establishing that certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations must comply with certain provider network requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain health insurers to provide coverage for orthoses and prostheses, including related replacements and repairs, starting January 1, 2025. It also establishes provider network requirements and mandates nondiscriminatory utilization review.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Individuals requiring orthoses and prostheses, healthcare providers, insurers, and the Maryland Medical Assistance Program
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to standardize coverage, provider access, and data reporting for orthoses and prostheses, integrating health policy with technology and data analysis.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to necessary medical devices for children with disabilities.

Title: Business Regulation - Detached Catalytic Converters - Record-Keeping Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring records of junk dealers, scrap metal processors, and automotive dismantlers and recyclers to include certain information about the vehicle from which a detached catalytic converter, or part of a detached catalytic converter, was obtained from a person.
bill_summary: The bill requires junk dealers, scrap metal processors, and automotive dismantlers to keep detailed records of their transactions, including specific information about vehicles and catalytic converters, to prevent theft and illegal resale.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and Business Regulation agencies
stakeholders: Junk dealers, scrap metal processors, automotive dismantlers, law enforcement, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs detailed record-keeping requirements and vehicle identification to combat theft and illegal resale of catalytic converters, utilizing technology for tracking.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on regulation and theft prevention.

Title: Appraisal Gap From Historic Redlining Financial Assistance Program – Alterations
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility for financial assistance under the Appraisal Gap From Historic Redlining Financial Assistance Program to include individuals who purchase certain qualified property after a qualified project is completed, at an affordable sales price as determined by certain regulations, and as an owner-occupant.
bill_summary: The bill expands the eligibility for the Appraisal Gap From Historic Redlining Financial Assistance Program to include individuals who purchase certain qualified properties as owner-occupants, aiming to help close appraisal gaps in historically redlined neighborhoods.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Individuals purchasing qualified properties in low-income census tracts and sustainable communities, affordable housing developers, and residents of historically redlined neighborhoods
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted financial assistance to address appraisal gaps caused by historic redlining, focusing on equitable housing opportunities in underserved communities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing affordable homeownership opportunities in underserved areas.

Title: State Board of Long-Term Care Administrators - Requirements for Assisted Living Managers
Synopsis: Extending, from October 1, 2024, to July 1, 2026, the date by which an individual must be licensed by the State Board of Long-Term Care Administrators before practicing as an assisted living manager in the State; altering the requirements for the manager training course that certain assisted living managers are required to complete; altering the requirements for serving as an interim assisted living manager; and requiring the Board to submit certain reports on assisted living managers to certain committees of the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill extends the deadline for assisted living managers in Maryland to become licensed, modifies training requirements, and establishes licensure and interim management procedures for assisted living managers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Long–Term Care Administrators
stakeholders: Assisted living managers, assisted living facilities, residents, and prospective employees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a phased licensure approach with reporting requirements and updates to the licensing process, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing and management of assisted living facilities.

Title: Board of Public Works - Transparency Data Dashboard
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller to develop and maintain on the Board of Public Works' website a procurement transparency data dashboard; establishing a governance committee composed of the liaisons to the Board from the offices of the Governor, the Comptroller, and the State Treasurer to review the contents of the dashboard for accuracy and completeness; and requiring the Governor, beginning in fiscal year 2025, to include in the annual budget bill such sums as are necessary for one full-time position and data dashboard development software.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Comptroller to develop and maintain a public, interactive, and searchable transparency data dashboard on the Board of Public Works' website. The dashboard will include information on state procurement activities, meeting announcements, agendas, related materials, and procurement preference program goals. A governance committee will review the dashboard for accuracy and completeness.
responsible_party: Comptroller's Office and Board of Public Works
stakeholders: State procurement agencies, vendors, and the general public interested in state procurement activities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a modern, interactive online dashboard integrated with payment processing data, enhancing transparency and accessibility of procurement information.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves transparency in government procurement, which can indirectly benefit public welfare.

Title: Business Regulation - Sale of Motor Fuel - Pricing Signage (Gas Price Clarity Act)
Synopsis: Establishing that certain provisions governing signage at retail service stations supersede inconsistent local law; altering a signage requirement for retail service stations relating to the price of regular gasoline so that the signage prominently displays clearly and visibly the credit and debit price, if higher than the cash price, or the credit and debit price and the cash price; repealing an exemption from a certain signage requirement for retail service station dealers with not more than 3 dispensing units; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates signage requirements for retail motor fuel stations in Maryland, including how prices are displayed and which local laws they override, effective October 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation (or equivalent agency responsible for business regulation)
stakeholders: Retail fuel stations, motorists, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates signage regulations and clarifies legal superseding of local laws; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns signage regulations for fuel stations.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Health Commissions and Maryland Insurance Administration - Study
