Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to contract with an independent consultant to conduct a certain study of the Health Services Cost Review Commission, the Maryland Health Care Commission, the Maryland Insurance Administration, and the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission; and requiring the Department to submit a report on the results of the study to the Governor, the Senate Finance Committee, and the House Health and Government Operations Committee on or before January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to hire an independent consultant to study the roles, overlaps, and efficiencies of several health-related commissions and the Maryland Insurance Administration, and to recommend improvements. The study's findings are due by January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: State health commissions, Maryland Insurance Administration, and the public served by these agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive review and analysis approach to streamline and improve existing health agencies through an independent study, which is a strategic and analytical approach rather than a new technological innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but aims to improve the efficiency of health agencies, which could indirectly benefit vulnerable populations including children.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Ratification of Defective Corporate Acts - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the process by which a defective corporate act may be ratified; and altering rules for certain legal actions by persons claiming to be adversely affected by a ratification.
bill_summary: This bill amends the process by which defective corporate acts can be ratified, including rules for legal actions related to ratification and the procedures for validation of such acts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant corporate regulatory authority
stakeholders: Corporations registered in Maryland, their directors, stockholders, and legal entities involved in corporate governance
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formalized legal process for ratifying defective corporate acts, including court procedures and notifications, which is a structured approach to corporate governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Tort Claims Act - Sheriffs and Deputy Sheriffs - County Responsibility
Synopsis: Clarifying that a county assumes the responsibilities of a certain tort claim against a sheriff or deputy sheriff under the Maryland Tort Claims Act; clarifying that, for certain tort claims against a sheriff or deputy sheriff, the State is the proper defendant; and specifying that it is the intent of the General Assembly that the Office of the Attorney General and the State Treasurer work with certain entities when disputes arise regarding the allocation of responsibility for tort claims under the Act.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that counties are responsible for tort claims against sheriffs and deputy sheriffs related to law enforcement and detention center functions, and that the state is the proper defendant in such claims. It also specifies insurance and liability provisions and promotes cooperation between state agencies and counties.
responsible_party: Maryland counties and the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Sheriffs, deputy sheriffs, counties, and residents affected by law enforcement and detention center activities
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies legal responsibilities and liability allocations; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly impact communities through clarified law enforcement responsibilities.

Title: Higher Education - Charles W. Riley Firefighter and Ambulance and Rescue Squad Member Scholarship - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the Charles W. Riley Firefighter and Ambulance and Rescue Squad Member Scholarship to make the scholarship applicable to all programs at institutions of higher education in the State; altering the maximum award available, when a scholarship should be credited, and to whom initial awards should be provided under the scholarship; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a scholarship program for firefighters and emergency medical services providers in Maryland, expanding eligibility and funding, and creates a loan repayment assistance program for public rescue personnel who pursue higher education.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Firefighters, emergency medical services providers, and fire and rescue squads in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive scholarship and loan repayment program aimed at recruiting and retaining fire and emergency medical personnel, with a focus on education support and service obligations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve child safety and community well-being by strengthening emergency services, but its direct impact on child poverty is moderate.

Title: Higher Education - Part-Time Senatorial and Delegate Scholarships - Alterations
Synopsis: Allowing an applicant of a part-time senatorial or delegate scholarship with a documented disability to request from the Maryland Higher Education Commission a waiver from the requirement to carry at least 6 semester hours of courses each semester.
bill_summary: The bill allows applicants with documented disabilities for the Maryland senatorial and delegate scholarships to request a waiver from the requirement to carry a certain number of semester hours each semester.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students with disabilities applying for or receiving scholarships in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible accommodation process for scholarship recipients with disabilities, allowing for waivers of course load requirements upon request.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting scholarship accessibility for students with disabilities.

Title: Prekindergarten - Ulysses Currie Head Start Program - Eligibility for State Funds
Synopsis: Authorizing a provider in the Ulysses Currie Head Start Program to receive certain State funds under certain circumstances; and exempting providers in the Program from certain State requirements for eligible prekindergarten providers.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes providers in the Ulysses Currie Head Start Program to receive full state funding regardless of federal funding, increases funding to at least $3 million annually, and sets new structural and quality standards for prekindergarten providers, including specific requirements for Montessori programs, starting in the 2027-2028 school year.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Prekindergarten children, families, and providers in Maryland, especially those in the Ulysses Currie Head Start Program
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive set of evidence-based standards for prekindergarten programs, including specific provisions for Montessori programs, and links quality ratings to funding and public recognition, representing a structured approach to improving early childhood education quality.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to quality early childhood education and providing full funding to Head Start providers, which can improve long-term educational and economic outcomes for children in need.

Title: Education - Access to Attorneys, Advocates, and Consultants for Special Education Program and Fund - Established
Synopsis: Requiring certain information to be provided to the parents of a child with a disability under certain circumstances; establishing the Access to Attorneys, Advocates, and Consultants for Special Education Program; establishing the Access to Attorneys, Advocates, and Consultants for Special Education Fund; requiring interest earnings of the Fund to be credited to the Fund; requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $1,000,000 to the Fund beginning in fiscal year 2026; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Access to Attorneys, Advocates, and Consultants for Special Education Program and Fund in Maryland, aimed at providing legal and advocacy support to eligible students with disabilities and their families, especially those with limited financial resources.
responsible_party: Maryland Volunteer Lawyers Service
stakeholders: Students with disabilities and their families, especially those with limited financial resources
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated fund, referral system, and training for advocates and consultants, integrating legal support into the special education process with a focus on accessibility and targeted support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by providing legal and advocacy support to low-income families navigating special education services.

Title: Garrett County – Sheriff’s Salary – Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the salary of the Sheriff of Garrett County; and repealing the requirement for the Garrett County Salary Study Commission to study and issue a report that contains recommendations relating to the salary of the Sheriff.
bill_summary: The bill alters the salary of the Sheriff of Garrett County to be 80% of the salary of the County's State's Attorney, repeals the requirement for a salary study commission to recommend sheriff salaries, and specifies that the new salary provisions take effect at the start of the next term of office beginning after October 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Garrett County government or County Commissioners
stakeholders: Sheriff of Garrett County, residents of Garrett County, county government officials
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward, fixed percentage approach to setting the sheriff's salary, replacing a previous study and recommendation process, which is a common method and not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal, as it primarily concerns sheriff salary adjustments.

Title: Garrett County - Procurement - Bids and Contracts
Synopsis: Increasing the minimum dollar amount of contracts for which the County Commissioners, or any employee of Garrett County, are required to advertise for bids from $25,000 to $50,000; exempting certain contracts for professional services from a requirement to advertise for bids; and authorizing contracts for professional services required to be licensed by the State to be solicited by written bids.
bill_summary: The bill increases the minimum contract amount requiring Garrett County to advertise for bids from $25,000 to $50,000, and clarifies bidding procedures for contracts, including exemptions for certain professional services and emergency repairs.
responsible_party: Garrett County Government
stakeholders: Garrett County residents and businesses involved in county contracts
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates procurement rules and thresholds, with no new technology or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Winery and Vineyard Economic Development Grant Program - Modifications
Synopsis: Altering procedures for the claiming and awarding of grants under the Winery and Vineyard Economic Development Grant Program to allow an individual or corporation who paid or incurred qualified capital expenses during the immediately preceding calendar year to submit a grant application.
bill_summary: The bill modifies procedures for claiming and awarding grants under the Winery and Vineyard Economic Development Grant Program in Maryland, including application timing and grant distribution methods.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Economic Development
stakeholders: Wineries and vineyards in Maryland, economic development sector
innovative_summary: The program employs a proportional distribution method for grants when total applications exceed available funds, which is a common approach but not highly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific measures targeting children or low-income families.

Title: State Treasurer and Comptroller - Membership Responsibilities
Synopsis: Removing the State Treasurer from the Board of Trustees for the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation and repealing related authority and duties; removing the State Treasurer or the State Treasurer's designee from the Maryland Commission on Climate Change and the Coast Smart Council; and adding the Comptroller or the Comptroller's designee as a member of the Maryland Commission on Climate Change and the Coast Smart Council.
bill_summary: The bill modifies membership responsibilities of the State Treasurer and Comptroller, removes the State Treasurer from certain boards and councils, and adds the Comptroller to others. It also updates the composition and appointment processes of various environmental and land preservation boards and commissions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and related agencies
stakeholders: Environmental organizations, landowners, farmers, local governments, and the general public interested in climate change and land preservation
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates governance structures and membership compositions of existing environmental and land preservation bodies, with no new technological or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on land preservation and climate change adaptation could indirectly benefit children by promoting environmental health and sustainable land use, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Washington County - Alcoholic Beverages - Multi-Use Sports and Events Facility Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Altering the stadium beer and wine license in Washington County to be a multi-use sports and events facility beer, wine, and liquor license; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption in the multi-use sports and events facility; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the existing stadium beer and wine license in Washington County to a multi-use sports and events facility license, allowing the sale of beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption at such facilities, and sets requirements for employee training and licensing fees.
responsible_party: Washington County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Visitors and attendees of multi-use sports and events facilities in Washington County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new licensing category for multi-use sports and events facilities, expanding alcohol sales and requiring specific employee training, which is a moderate innovation in licensing practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns licensing and alcohol sales at sports facilities.

Title: Maryland Building Performance Standards – Local Requests for Guidance – Religious Considerations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor, on request of a local jurisdiction and in consultation with the Office of the Attorney General, to provide guidance for the implementation and enforcement of the Maryland Building Performance Standards in relation to any religious observance, practice, or belief.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to provide guidance to local jurisdictions on implementing and enforcing the Maryland Building Performance Standards in a way that respects religious observances, practices, or beliefs. It also establishes procedures for technical assistance, training, and conflict resolution related to building standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Local jurisdictions, religious communities, building officials, general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by requiring the department to provide tailored guidance on religious considerations in building standards, fostering inclusivity and respect for religious practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly support community well-being by ensuring inclusive building practices.

Title: Washington County - Procurement - Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Washington County to enter into a certain contract for the purchase of one or more vehicles without advertising for bids if the amount involved in the contract does not exceed $100,000.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Washington County to purchase vehicles without advertising for bids if the cost does not exceed $100,000.
responsible_party: Washington County Government
stakeholders: Washington County residents and government officials involved in procurement
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined procurement process for vehicle purchases, reducing the need for competitive bidding under certain conditions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Agriculture – Nuisance Insects
Synopsis: Requiring, instead of authorizing, the Secretary of Agriculture to implement, under certain circumstances, a program to use Bacillus thuringiensis israelensis to control or eliminate nuisance insects in the State; and requiring, instead of authorizing, the Secretary to carry out a certain project to control or eliminate nuisance insects if the county or municipality in which the nuisance insects are located agrees to pay 50% of the costs associated with the project.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Secretary of Agriculture to implement a program using Bacillus thuringiensis israelensis to control nuisance insects, specifically black flies, with funding shared by counties or municipalities that agree to pay 50% of the costs.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of Agriculture
stakeholders: Residents, local governments, and property owners affected by nuisance insects, especially black flies
innovative_summary: The program employs biological pest control using Bacillus thuringiensis israelensis, a targeted biological pesticide, and involves coordinated spraying and community notification.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve public health and recreational opportunities.

Title: Health Insurance - Utilization Review - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering and establishing requirements and prohibitions related to health insurance utilization review; altering requirements related to internal grievance procedures and adverse decision procedures; altering certain reporting requirements on health insurance carriers relating to adverse decisions; and establishing requirements on health insurance carriers and health care providers relating to the provision of patient benefit information.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance carriers in Maryland to establish online systems for electronic prior authorization requests, real-time benefit information, and out-of-pocket costs, and sets standards for utilization review and grievance processes to improve transparency, efficiency, and patient protections.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration and Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Health insurance carriers, healthcare providers, and insured individuals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new technologies such as online portals for real-time benefit and cost information, and establishes standardized electronic prior authorization processes, representing a significant modernization of health insurance procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to timely and affordable healthcare services, especially for vulnerable populations.

Title: Behavioral Health Crisis Response Services - 9-8-8 Trust Fund Fees
Synopsis: Establishing a 9-8-8 fee to be paid by each subscriber to switched local exchange access service, commercial mobile radio service, or other 9-8-8-accessible service; establishing a prepaid wireless 9-8-8 fee to be paid on certain retail transactions; requiring the Comptroller to deposit the 9-8-8 fees and the prepaid wireless 9-8-8 fees in the 9-8-8 Trust Fund; and requiring the Comptroller to adopt procedures for auditing fee collection and remittance by telephone companies and commercial mobile radio service providers.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a 9-8-8 Trust Fund funded by fees collected from subscribers of certain telecommunications services, including a monthly fee and a retail transaction fee on prepaid wireless services. The funds are used to support behavioral health crisis response services such as crisis call centers, mobile crisis teams, and stabilization centers across Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland requiring behavioral health crisis services, telecommunications providers, and consumers of prepaid wireless services.
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated trust fund financed by specific telecommunication fees to systematically support behavioral health crisis response services, integrating telecommunications billing with mental health crisis infrastructure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to mental health crisis services, which can benefit vulnerable children and families.

Title: State Board of Physicians - Performance of X-Ray Duties Without a License
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which individuals without a license to practice medicine may perform X-ray duties; authorizing the State Board of Physicians to impose a civil penalty of up to $5,000 for each violation on the physician's office and $1,000 for each individual violation of the Act; and requiring the Board, by October 1, 2029, to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the number of individuals registered to perform limited X-ray duties and the continuation or replacement of the registration process.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a licensing and regulatory system for limited licensed radiologic technologists in Maryland, defining the duties, qualifications, and supervision requirements for individuals performing X-ray procedures without a full medical license, and creating a committee to oversee these regulations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Individuals performing limited X-ray duties, healthcare providers, and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new licensing category for radiologic technologists, with oversight and regulation by the State Board of Physicians, integrating education, examination, and supervision standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting healthcare workforce regulation.

Title: State–Owned Nursing Homes – Deficiencies, Citations, and Fines – Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the department charged with oversight of a State-owned nursing home operated by a contractor, instead of the contractor, to provide notice of certain deficiencies and enforcement actions to the Governor and certain members of the General Assembly; requiring the department charged with oversight, rather than the contractor, to provide certain information to certain persons within 30 days after the contractor's final acceptance of a plan of correction or completion of an informal dispute resolution; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the department overseeing State-owned nursing homes operated by contractors to notify relevant authorities and stakeholders of deficiencies and enforcement actions within specific timeframes. It also mandates annual reporting on survey activities and enforcement actions at these nursing homes.
responsible_party: Department charged with oversight of State-owned nursing homes
stakeholders: State-owned nursing homes, residents, government agencies, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill enhances transparency and accountability through mandatory timely notifications and annual reporting, leveraging existing oversight structures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but improves oversight of nursing homes, which may indirectly benefit vulnerable populations.

Title: Education - Initial Teacher Certification - Requirements
Synopsis: Repealing a provision of law that requires a teacher preparation program to require a student to pass a certain assessment as a graduation requirement; altering the requirements for initial teacher certification; authorizing a local school system to establish a comprehensive induction program to aid in meeting a certain requirement for initial teacher certification; altering the qualification requirements for a teacher who holds a professional license or certificate from another state; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's teacher certification requirements, including removing certain assessment requirements, establishing new standards for literacy and subject-specific exams, and allowing local school systems to develop induction programs. It also promotes reciprocity with other states for teacher certification.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Prospective and current teachers, students, and local school systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new assessment standards and local induction programs, and enhances reciprocity agreements, employing modern evaluation and collaboration approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving teacher certification processes, which can lead to better educational quality.

Title: Civil Actions - Public Nuisances - Firearm Industry Members (Gun Industry Accountability Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Prohibiting firearm industry members from knowingly creating, maintaining, or contributing to a public nuisance through the sale, manufacture, distribution, importation, or marketing of a firearm-related product under certain circumstances; requiring a firearm industry member to establish and implement certain reasonable controls regarding the sale, manufacture, distribution, importation, marketing, possession, and use of certain firearm-related products; authorizing certain civil actions for violations of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes civil actions against firearm industry members for creating, maintaining, or contributing to public harm through the sale, manufacture, importation, or marketing of firearm-related products. It requires these members to implement reasonable controls to prevent harm and allows government entities and individuals to bring legal actions for violations.
responsible_party: Attorney General of Maryland, in consultation with the Department of State Police
stakeholders: Firearm industry members, public, government agencies, and individuals affected by firearm-related harm
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a civil nuisance framework targeting firearm industry practices, emphasizing the establishment of reasonable controls and civil enforcement actions, which is a novel approach in firearm regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on legal accountability and public safety.

Title: Maryland Transit Administration - Locally Operated Transit Systems - Mandatory Funding
Synopsis: Requiring, beginning in fiscal year 2026, the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation from the Transportation Trust Fund of $80,533,314 for the Locally Operated Transit System Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that starting in fiscal year 2026, the Maryland Governor must include at least $80,533,314 annually in the state budget from the Transportation Trust Fund for the Locally Operated Transit System Grant Program.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Transportation Trust Fund
stakeholders: Residents and users of locally operated transit systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a dedicated, mandatory funding stream for local transit systems, ensuring consistent financial support from the state.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly benefit children by improving access to transportation, but it is not specifically targeted at child poverty.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange - State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program - Amount of Annual Subsidies
Synopsis: Altering the amount of funds the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange is authorized to designate for annual subsidies under the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program for certain fiscal years to include unspent funds designated for subsidies for young adults in a previous calendar year.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange's Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program by allowing the use of unspent funds from previous years to increase annual subsidies for young adults aged 18 to 40 with income between 133% and 400% of the federal poverty level, and establishes regulations for subsidy coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Young adults aged 18-40 with income between 133% and 400% of the federal poverty level in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a flexible funding approach by allowing unspent funds from previous years to be carried over, and provides full premium coverage for some young adults, which is a relatively innovative approach to health subsidies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing health coverage among young adults, which can have positive effects on families and future generations.

Title: Health Occupations - Certified Dialysis Technicians - Continuing Education Requirement
Synopsis: Altering the continuing education requirement for certified dialysis technicians to complete 3 hours of continuing education approved by the Board.
bill_summary: The bill amends the continuing education requirements for certified dialysis technicians in Maryland, reducing the required hours of continuing education from 3 hours to 3 hours and updating the effective date to June 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Nursing or relevant health occupations board
stakeholders: Certified dialysis technicians and healthcare facilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing certification renewal requirements with a minor change in continuing education hours and an earlier effective date; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly involves professional certification requirements for healthcare workers.

Title: City of Frederick - Assignment of Offenders to Road Work - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a provision of law requring a District Court judge to assign, if practicable, an offender to work the public roads of Frederick County or the City of Frederick as a penalty for a violation of a municipal law or ordinance of the City of Frederick.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the existing provisions that assign offenders who violate municipal laws in Frederick to work on public roads, effectively ending the practice of using court-ordered road work as a penalty in Frederick.
responsible_party: City of Frederick or Frederick County courts and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Offenders convicted of municipal law violations in Frederick, law enforcement, and municipal courts
innovative_summary: The bill removes a traditional form of community service involving road work, which is a common but somewhat outdated approach to municipal penalties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily involves legal procedures and penalties for municipal violations.

Title: State Procurement - Small Business Reserve Program - Goals and Outreach Program
Synopsis: Increasing a participation goal from a minimum of 15% to 20% for certain small businesses for certain procurement contracts; requiring the certification agency, in consultation with Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs to develop an outreach program to increase the participation of small businesses that are owned by economically disadvantaged individuals; requiring, by each December 1, the certification agency to submit a report on the outreach program and the dollar amount of certain awards; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Small and Minority Business Reserve Program in Maryland, setting procurement goals for direct contracts to certified minority and small businesses, establishing outreach and reporting requirements, and initiating a study to evaluate the program's compliance with federal and constitutional standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs
stakeholders: Small businesses, minority business enterprises, economically disadvantaged individuals, state government agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach including setting procurement goals, establishing outreach programs, and conducting a study to evaluate program compliance, which is a relatively innovative approach to government procurement and minority business support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting economically disadvantaged individuals and minority-owned small businesses.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System - Reemployment as Sheriff
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to suspend the retirement benefit of a retiree of the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System who is elected as a sheriff within 1 year after retirement; providing for the reinstatement of a benefit; providing that a suspension of a benefit does not affect survivor benefits; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill requires the suspension of retirement benefits for retirees of the Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System who are elected as sheriffs within one year of retirement, and provides for reinstatement of benefits once they cease serving as sheriffs. It also clarifies rules around reemployment of retirees and survivor benefits.
responsible_party: Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pensions System
stakeholders: Retirees of the Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System, law enforcement officers, and the public served by sheriffs
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to manage pension benefits for law enforcement retirees who take on sheriff roles, including suspension and reinstatement procedures, which is a specific policy intervention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses pension benefit rules for retirees and sheriffs.

Title: Town of Keedysville - Parking of Vehicles - Restrictions
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from parking certain vehicles in the Town of Keedysville, Washington County.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits parking certain types of vehicles in the Town of Keedysville, Washington County, Maryland, and specifies the types of vehicles and locations where parking restrictions apply.
responsible_party: Town of Keedysville, Washington County
stakeholders: Residents and vehicle owners in Keedysville, Washington County
innovative_summary: The bill employs standard parking restrictions without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Death Certificates - Cause or Manner of Death Determinations - Requirements After Change or Correction (Katherine Morris Death Reclassification Act)
Synopsis: Requiring, if a victim's initial determination of death recorded on the victim's death certificate was amended or corrected to be undetermined or homicide, an assistant State's Attorney with knowledge of the case to meet with a person in interest on the request of the person in interest for a certain purpose; requiring a law enforcement agency to reopen or reinvestigate an investigation involving the death of a victim whose cause or manner of death was amended or corrected to be undetermined or homicide; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes procedures for handling cases where a death certificate's cause or manner of death is amended to undetermined or homicide, including requirements for meetings with interested parties, notifications to law enforcement, and reinvestigation of cases.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Victims' families, law enforcement, medical examiners, and the public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured process for reviewing and acting upon amendments to death certificates, including mandatory meetings and reinvestigation protocols, which is a new approach to death case management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly impact families involved in death investigations.

Title: Washington County - Interscholastic Athletics - Student Eligibility Waiver and School Classification
Synopsis: Authorizing the Washington County Board of Education to waive a certain eligibility requirement for participation in interscholastic athletics at a certain Maryland Public Secondary Schools Athletic Association member school for students who attend certain public high schools; requiring the Washington County Superintendent of Schools to report to the Maryland Public Secondary Schools Athletic Association the school enrollment of member schools in grades 9, 10, and 11 as of September 30 of each even-numbered year; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Washington County Board of Education to waive certain eligibility requirements for students to participate in interscholastic athletics at public high schools, specifically for students attending non-zoned schools that lack athletic programs, and requires reporting on school enrollment for athletic classification.
responsible_party: Washington County Board of Education and Washington County Superintendent of Schools
stakeholders: Public high school students in Washington County, schools, and athletic associations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tailored eligibility waiver process and modifies school enrollment reporting for athletic classification, employing a localized approach to student participation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on athletic participation rules.

Title: Public Safety - Law Enforcement Agencies - Positive Community Feedback
Synopsis: Adding positive community feedback that was not solicited by the police officer who is the subject of the feedback to the list of records that are not considered personnel records; requiring the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to develop a process for citizens to submit positive community feedback; requiring each law enforcement agency to adopt the uniform citizen positive community feedback process; and requiring a law enforcement agency to maintain a certain record that is subject to public inspection.
bill_summary: The bill adds positive community feedback about law enforcement officers to the list of records that are not considered personnel records, and establishes a process for citizens to submit such feedback. It requires law enforcement agencies to adopt a uniform process for collecting and maintaining positive community feedback, which must be publicly accessible.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Law enforcement officers, community members, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a standardized process for collecting and publicly sharing positive community feedback for law enforcement officers, leveraging transparency and community engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on community relations and transparency.

Title: Somerset County – Fire, Rescue, and Emergency Medical Services
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Somerset County to enact local laws and adopt other measures to manage, direct, and regulate fire, rescue, and emergency medical services in the County; authorizing the County Commissioners to authorize or create an entity or a body to administer the County's affairs in the County relating to fire, rescue, and emergency medical services; and requiring the County Commissioners to establish an Emergency Services Advisory Council to make certain recommendations under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Somerset County to enact laws and create entities to manage fire, rescue, and emergency medical services, and to establish an Emergency Services Advisory Council for recommendations.
responsible_party: Somerset County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and emergency service providers in Somerset County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces local governance structures and an advisory council to improve emergency services management, which is a strategic approach but not highly technological or innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may improve emergency services for all residents, including children.

Title: Somerset County - Fire Companies - Appropriations
Synopsis: Requiring the County Commissioners of Somerset County to appropriate to certain organized volunteer fire companies in the county certain amounts for fiscal years 2025 through 2030; and requiring that the appropriations required for fiscal year 2030 remain in effect for subsequent fiscal years unless altered by a future enactment.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that Somerset County allocate specific annual funds to various volunteer fire companies, with the amounts set for fiscal years 2024 through 2030, and these amounts to remain in effect unless changed by future legislation.
responsible_party: Somerset County Government
stakeholders: Volunteer fire companies and residents of Somerset County
innovative_summary: The program employs a fixed, legislatively mandated funding schedule for volunteer fire companies, ensuring consistent funding over multiple years, which is a structured approach but not highly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on fire company funding does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Somerset County – Sale of Property – Revells Neck Road
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Somerset County to sell the property at Map 32, Parcel 149 on Revells Neck Road under terms considered appropriate by the county commissioners.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Somerset County to sell certain surplus properties, including property on Revells Neck Road, through various methods such as sealed bids, public auction, or direct sale to government units, under terms deemed appropriate by the county commissioners.
responsible_party: Somerset County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and government entities in Somerset County, including schools and local government units
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates and clarifies procedures for the sale of county surplus property, including direct sales without advertising and sales to government units, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Agriculture - Invasive Plant Species - Regulation (Biodiversity and Agriculture Protection Act)
Synopsis: Altering the regulatory approach for controlling invasive plant species in the State, including repealing certain provisions of law relating to a two-tiered regulatory approach and requiring the Secretary of Agriculture to establish a list of prohibited invasive plants by regulation in a certain manner on or before October 1, 2024; establishing certain protocols for assessing certain nonnative plants and determining whether those plants are invasive or whether the plants may be placed on a certain watch list; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's regulations on invasive plant species by establishing a new regulatory framework, including the creation of lists of prohibited invasive plants, protocols for assessing nonnative plants, and requirements for posting and distributing these lists. It also sets rules for the sale, propagation, and disposal of invasive plants.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture and Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Nurseries, plant dealers, landscapers, environmental agencies, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a science-based, assessment protocol approach and creates a comprehensive, publicly accessible list system for invasive plants, integrating expert assessments and regulatory measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but contributes to environmental health and biodiversity, which can indirectly benefit communities.

Title: Public Health - Opioid Restitution Advisory Council and Fund - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of Health to present decisions for the allocations of money from the Opioid Restitution Fund to the Opioid Restitution Fund Advisory Council; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to post on the Department's website certain information regarding allocations of money from the Fund; and requiring the Department to report to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2024, on the best process for making the expenditures of all opioid settlement agreements accessible to the public.
bill_summary: The bill revises the administration and reporting requirements for Maryland's Opioid Restitution Fund, including how decisions on fund allocations are made, posted, and reported, and mandates support for community-based recovery organizations and evidence-based programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with substance use disorders, community recovery organizations, and the general public affected by opioid use and overdose prevention programs.
innovative_summary: The bill enhances transparency and accountability in opioid settlement fund allocations, supports evidence-based and innovative overdose prevention programs, and promotes public access to expenditure data.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to substance use disorder treatment and recovery services, which can stabilize families and communities.

Title: Principal Departments - Individuals With Limited English Proficiency - Access to Public Services
Synopsis: Requiring, on or before July 1, 2025, the principal departments of the Executive Branch to fully implement certain provisions of law requiring equal access to public services for individuals with limited English proficiency.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that all principal departments of the Maryland Executive Branch fully implement laws ensuring equal access to public services for individuals with limited English proficiency by July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with limited English proficiency in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured, phased approach to ensure language access across government agencies, including translation of vital documents and oral language services, with a clear deadline for full implementation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to services for non-English speaking families, which can indirectly support children’s well-being.

Title: State Personnel - Maryland Department of Health - Pay Rates
Synopsis: Increasing the number of certain bargaining units for the purpose of specifying certain pay rates for certain employees of the Maryland Department of Health; and requiring that the pay rates of certain Department employees who are in certain bargaining units and who work at certain facilities be equal to certain pay rates of the employees who work at Clifton T. Perkins Hospital.
bill_summary: The bill increases pay rates for certain Maryland Department of Health employees, especially those working at the Regional Institutes for Children and Adolescents and the Clifton T. Perkins Hospital, by setting their pay at or above specific higher grades.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Employees of the Maryland Department of Health working at specified facilities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted pay adjustment approach based on facility type and historical admission rates, but does not introduce new technologies or novel government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on employee pay rates does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Coverage for the Treatment of Obesity - Required Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to study the impact of requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to provide comprehensive coverage for the treatment of obesity, including coverage for intensive behavioral therapy, bariatric surgery, and FDA-approved antiobesity medication; and requiring the Department to report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to study the impact of mandating comprehensive coverage for obesity treatment under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, including therapies like behavioral therapy, bariatric surgery, and FDA-approved medications, and report findings by December 31, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Medicaid recipients and individuals with obesity in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a study approach to evaluate the impact of expanding coverage for obesity treatments, which is a strategic and data-driven approach to policy development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve health outcomes for individuals with obesity, which may indirectly benefit children in affected families, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Montgomery County – Subdivision Plats – Conditions PG/MC 111–24
Synopsis: Providing that the Montgomery County Planning Board may tentatively approve a subdivision plat subject to specified conditions; and providing for the approval and submission of a certain subdivision plat to the county land records.
bill_summary: This bill allows the Montgomery County Planning Board to tentatively approve subdivision plats with conditions before improvements are completed, and specifies procedures for approval and recording.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Planning Board
stakeholders: Developers, residents, and landowners in Montgomery County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a process for tentative approval of subdivision plats with conditions, streamlining development approvals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly impact community development.

Title: Environment - Greenhouse Gas Emissions Reductions - Manufacturers
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "manufacturing" for purposes of certain greenhouse gas emissions reduction requirements to exclude the production of cement; altering the application of certain provisions of law regarding the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions from the manufacturing sector to apply only to persons that engaged in manufacturing in 2023; requiring the Department of the Environment to make certain considerations and consult with certain stakeholders related to the regulation of the production of cement; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's greenhouse gas emissions reduction laws by excluding cement production from the definition of manufacturing and adjusting regulations to only apply to manufacturers active in 2023. It also requires the Department of the Environment to consider specific factors and consult stakeholders when regulating cement production.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Manufacturers, cement producers, environmental regulators, and stakeholders involved in greenhouse gas emissions reduction
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tailored approach to regulating greenhouse gas emissions for cement manufacturing, including considerations for industry-specific factors and stakeholder consultation, which is a nuanced and targeted regulatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on industry-specific regulation and potential financial incentives could indirectly impact economic stability, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Agriculture - Food Processing Residuals Utilization Permit - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing a food processing residuals utilization permit; prohibiting a person from utilizing food processing residuals in the State unless the person obtains a permit; requiring the Department of Agriculture to provide a certain notice and information to certain persons in a county where food processing residuals will be stored; establishing the Food Processing Residuals Administration Fund; authorizing a representative of the Department to enter and inspect any site where food processing residuals are utilized; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a permit system for the utilization of food processing residuals, including industrial sludge, in agricultural operations in Maryland. It creates the Food Processing Residuals Administration Fund, sets regulations for permits, inspections, and enforcement, and introduces a certification program for commercial haulers of residuals.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Farmers, food processing companies, commercial haulers, local governments, and residents near agricultural land where residuals are applied.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive regulatory framework with permit, inspection, and certification programs, and establishes a dedicated fund, representing a structured approach to managing food processing residuals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve child health and economic conditions by promoting safe and sustainable agricultural practices, but its direct impact on child poverty is moderate.

Title: Environment - Delegated Authorities - Well and Septic Program Permits
Synopsis: Requiring a local health department or county government to which the Department of the Environment has delegated authority to administer a septic and well program to submit, by December 1, 2024, a schedule of review times for certain well and septic program permits for approval; and requiring a local health department or county government to submit well and septic program permit data to the Department for review beginning 3 months after the original schedule submission approved by the Department and every 3 months thereafter.
bill_summary: The bill requires local health departments or county governments with delegated authority to submit schedules and data related to well and septic program permits to the Maryland Department of the Environment, starting with a schedule submission by December 1, 2024, and ongoing data submissions every three months.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Local health departments, county governments, residents with well and septic systems
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured schedule and regular data reporting system for well and septic permits, enhancing oversight and data collection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve environmental health conditions.

Title: Washington County Board of Education - Members - Residency Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring that a member of the Washington County Board of Education be a resident of Washington County for at least 6 months and the State for at least 12 months immediately preceding the date the member takes office; and requiring members of the county board to maintain a primary residence in Washington County during their term.
bill_summary: The bill requires members of the Washington County Board of Education to be residents of Washington County and the State for specified periods before taking office, and mandates that they maintain a primary residence in Washington County during their term. It also establishes a nominating commission to fill vacancies.
responsible_party: Washington County Board of Education and County Commissioners
stakeholders: Students, residents, and educational community of Washington County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal residency requirement for school board members and creates a public nominating process for vacancies, enhancing transparency and local representation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses residency requirements and vacancy procedures.

Title: Consumer Protection - Consumer Council - Name Change
Synopsis: Changing the name of the Consumer Council in the Division of Consumer Protection in the Office of the Attorney General to the Consumer Protection Commission.
bill_summary: The bill changes the name of the Consumer Council to the Consumer Protection Commission within the Division of Consumer Protection in the Office of the Attorney General, and modifies provisions related to the commission's composition, compensation, and functions.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General, Division of Consumer Protection
stakeholders: Consumers, consumer advocacy groups, businesses, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily renames and reorganizes an existing consumer protection advisory body, with minor adjustments to its structure and compensation, without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly involves administrative and organizational changes to a consumer protection body.

Title: Maryland Department of Labor – Unemployment Insurance – Study on Actively Seeking Work Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor, on or before December 1, 2024, to conduct a study on the actively seeking work requirement of the unemployment insurance system in the State and other states to evaluate the effects of ghosting on actively seeking work requirements and report on the study to the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to conduct a study on the actively seeking work requirements for unemployment insurance, focusing on the impact of ghosting (failing to attend scheduled interviews or maintain contact) and how verification processes can be improved.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Unemployment benefit claimants and employers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill proposes a study to evaluate and improve verification processes for actively seeking work requirements, including examining the use of online systems and reporting mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on administrative procedures for unemployment insurance.

Title: Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network to identify and analyze options for establishing and maintaining an open access science, technology, and innovation network or hub of citizen scientists and experts in science, technology, and industry for certain purposes; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Workgroup to develop a science and technology best practices and innovation network in Maryland, including creating a virtual referral network of experts and facilitating open exchange of ideas.
responsible_party: University of Maryland, Baltimore County
stakeholders: Scientists, industry experts, community organizations, and the general public interested in science and technology innovation in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill proposes creating an open access, digital network of science and technology experts to facilitate collaboration, data sharing, and policy informing, which is a modern approach to fostering innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by fostering innovation and education, but its direct impact is moderate.

Title: Office of the Attorney General - Investigative Authority - Health Care Fraud
Synopsis: Authorizing the Office of the Attorney General, a Deputy Attorney General, or an Assistant Attorney General to issue a subpoena to a person to produce certain materials, answer written interrogatories, and give certain testimony in furtherance of an ongoing health care fraud investigation under the Maryland False Health Claims Act or other civil authority; authorizing the Attorney General to report a failure to obey a certain subpoena to the circuit court with jurisdiction over the matter; etc.
bill_summary: The bill grants the Office of the Attorney General the authority to issue subpoenas, administer oaths, and take depositions in investigations related to health care fraud, waste, and abuse involving Maryland Department of Health funds. It establishes procedures for court enforcement of subpoenas and clarifies the investigative powers of the Attorney General and related officials.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Individuals and organizations involved in health care fraud investigations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances investigative powers of the Attorney General by formalizing subpoena authority and court enforcement procedures, employing existing legal tools in a more structured way.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but could indirectly impact vulnerable populations through improved enforcement of health care fraud laws.

Title: Montgomery County - Clerk of the Circuit Court - Plat Recordation PG/MC 110-24
Synopsis: Authorizing a plat in Montgomery County to be drawn, recorded, and maintained in electronic form in a manner approved by the State Archivist.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Montgomery County to draw, record, and maintain subdivision plats in electronic form in a manner approved by the State Archivist, and updates recordation procedures for plats.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Clerk of the Circuit Court and the State Archivist
stakeholders: Property owners, surveyors, county officials, and residents of Montgomery County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of electronic recordation for subdivision plats, employing digital technology and approval processes to modernize land record management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly updates land record procedures.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Average Final Compensation - Compensation Adjustments
Synopsis: Establishing that certain adjustments to compensation may not be considered an extraordinary salary increase when determining the average final compensation of a member in the State Retirement and Pension System; and requiring a member to submit certain information to the State Retirement Agency in a certain manner at the time of retirement.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that certain salary adjustments, such as those related to promotions or market adjustments, cannot be considered extraordinary salary increases when calculating the average final compensation for retirement benefits in the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System. It also requires members to submit certification forms at retirement if they received such adjustments.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, especially those receiving salary adjustments related to promotions or market adjustments
innovative_summary: The bill employs a procedural approach requiring certification and documentation from employers and members to ensure accurate calculation of retirement benefits, but it does not introduce new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects retirement benefit calculations for public employees.

Title: Correctional Officers' Retirement System - Membership
Synopsis: Altering membership in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System to include certain employees of the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Maryland Department of Health; requiring the State Retirement and Pension System to transfer the creditable service of employees transferred into the Correctional Officers' Retirement System under the Act unless the employee elects not to transfer service on or before June 1, 2025; authorizing certain employees to elect not to transfer service; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands membership in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System to include certain employees from the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Department of Health, and provides rules for transferring and calculating service credits, including unused sick leave, for these employees.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Employees of the Department of Public Safety, Correctional Services, and the Department of Health, and their beneficiaries
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to integrating different retirement systems and credits, including unused sick leave and service transfers, which is a relatively innovative approach to retirement system management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns retirement system membership and benefits for employees.

Title: Public Health – Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program – Recovery of Funding
Synopsis: Altering the number of years after completion of a project funded in part by a grant of the Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program after which the State may recover funding under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules for recovering funds from federally qualified health centers in Maryland, specifically changing the time limits for the state's recovery of funds if a property is sold, transferred, or ceases to be a qualified health center, extending the period for leased properties to more than 15 years and for owned properties to more than 30 years after project completion.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Health
stakeholders: Federally qualified health centers, patients served by these centers, and the Maryland public health system
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward legal adjustment to existing recovery rules, without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting the financial recovery process of health centers.

Title: State Officers and Employees – Required Surety Bonds – Insurance Policies Authorized
Synopsis: Altering the requirements that certain officers and employees of the State be covered by certain surety bonds to allow the officers and employees to be covered by certain insurance policies; transferring certain duties and responsibilities of the Maryland State Employees Surety Bond Committee to the State Treasurer; and repealing certain provisions of law related to the approval, form, and record of certain surety bonds required for certain officers and employees of the State.
bill_summary: The bill allows officers and employees of the State of Maryland to be covered by insurance policies instead of surety bonds, and transfers certain duties related to bond approval to the State Treasurer. It repeals some existing provisions and updates requirements for bond and insurance coverage across various state agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland State Treasurer's Office
stakeholders: Maryland state officers and employees, government agencies, and the public they serve
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a shift from traditional surety bonds to insurance policies for state officers and employees, employing a modern approach to bonding and risk management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily changes bonding and insurance requirements for state employees.

Title: State Employees - Paid Sick Leave - Certificate of Illness or Disability Signed by a Licensed Clinical Professional Counselor
Synopsis: Authorizing a licensed clinical professional counselor to sign a certificate of illness or disability when a State employee uses sick leave for 5 or more consecutive workdays.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes licensed clinical professional counselors to sign certificates of illness or disability for state employees taking sick leave beyond a certain number of days.
responsible_party: Maryland State Personnel and Pensions Department
stakeholders: State employees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill expands the list of healthcare professionals authorized to sign sick leave certificates to include licensed clinical professional counselors, which is a minor regulatory update.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Frederick County - School Construction Master Plan Workgroup
Synopsis: Establishing the Frederick County School Construction Master Plan Workgroup; and requiring the Workgroup to comprehensively evaluate all school facility needs in Frederick County and report its findings and recommendations to certain Frederick County officials, the Interagency Commission on School Construction and the Frederick County House and Senate Delegations by December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Frederick County School Construction Master Plan Workgroup to evaluate school facility needs, explore solutions for funding and maintaining schools, and report findings by December 31, 2024.
responsible_party: Frederick County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, families, and school staff in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated workgroup to comprehensively evaluate and address school construction and maintenance needs, potentially employing collaborative and strategic planning approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving school facilities, which can enhance educational environments and opportunities.

Title: Boundary of the Frederick County Soil Conservation District - Alteration
Synopsis: Establishing the Frederick County Soil Conservation District to include the Catoctin Soil Conservation District and the Frederick Soil Conservation District.
bill_summary: The bill alters the boundary of the Frederick County Soil Conservation District to include the Catoctin Soil Conservation District and the Frederick Soil Conservation District, effectively expanding the district's coverage within Frederick County.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Landowners and water users within Frederick County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves administrative boundary changes for a soil conservation district, which is a standard governmental process with no new technological approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on boundary adjustments for soil conservation efforts.

Title: Washington County - Public Facilities Bonds
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of Washington County to borrow not more than $50,000,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in Washington County and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Washington County to issue up to $50 million in bonds to finance public facilities, water and sewer projects, and volunteer fire department facilities and equipment, including the ability to issue refunding bonds and installment purchase obligations for land easements.
responsible_party: Washington County Government
stakeholders: Residents of Washington County, volunteer fire departments, public facility users, and landowners with agricultural or woodland easements
innovative_summary: The program employs traditional bond issuance and financing mechanisms for public infrastructure and emergency services, with no notably new or emerging technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily supporting infrastructure and emergency services.

Title: Prince George's County and Montgomery County - The Washington Suburban Transit Commission Reform Act PG/MC 103-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of Transportation's designee to attend meetings of the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority Board of Directors on behalf of the Secretary when the Secretary is not available; authorizing the Washington Suburban Transit Commission to reappoint a certain appointee to be a principal member of the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority Board of Directors; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms the governance of the Washington Suburban Transit Commission, including clarifying appointment procedures for its members and their roles in the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority Board of Directors, and grants the Commission authority to make contracts necessary for its operations.
responsible_party: Washington Suburban Transit Commission and Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Residents of Prince George's County and Montgomery County using transit services
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates governance structures and appointment procedures; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it focuses on transit governance.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - Connection Pipe Emergency Replacement Loan Program - Expansion PG/MC 101-24
Synopsis: Expanding the Connection Pipe Emergency Replacement Loan Program to include certain sewer pipes and diagnostic actions; altering the maximum amount of a loan that may be made under the Program from $5,000 to $10,000; altering the total amount of loans that the Program may provide or have outstanding from $1,000,000 to $2,000,000; and increasing to $200,000 the amount of funding through fiscal year 2034  which the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission must include for the Program in the Commission's budget.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission's Connection Pipe Emergency Replacement Loan Program to include sewer pipes and diagnostic actions, increases the maximum loan amount to $10,000, and extends the program's duration until 2034, with increased funding and administrative provisions.
responsible_party: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission
stakeholders: Residential customers with malfunctioning water or sewer service pipes in the Commission's service area
innovative_summary: The program employs a loan and lien system to finance pipe replacements and diagnostic actions, with funding managed through a dedicated fund, but does not employ new technologies or approaches beyond typical loan programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily improving infrastructure for residents.

Title: Armed Forces - Support of Military Families and Addition of Space Force
Synopsis: Adding the Space Force to certain provisions of law related to the armed forces; authorizing military spouses and residents of the State who are members of the National Guard of another state or a reserve component of the armed forces to terminate certain contracts at any time after the date the service member receives certain military orders to relocate; altering the definition of a "military-connected student" for purposes of the Purple Star Schools Program; and authorizing the Governor to make certain posthumous awards.
bill_summary: The bill expands Maryland laws to include the Space Force in military-related provisions, allows military spouses and residents of Maryland who are members of the National Guard or reserve forces of other states to terminate certain contracts after receiving military orders to relocate, and updates definitions related to military-connected students and military service. It also authorizes posthumous military promotions and clarifies legal protections for military personnel.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Military families, military personnel, students connected to military families, and residents of Maryland who are members of the National Guard or reserve forces of other states.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to support military families and personnel, including legal protections, contract termination rights, and expanded definitions, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting military families and ensuring stability for children of service members.

Title: Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment Workgroup
Synopsis: Establishing the Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment Workgroup to study certain standards related to EV charging stations; and requiring the Workgroup to report its framework and recommendations to the Senate Education, Energy, and the Environment Committee and the House Economic Matters Committee on or before November 1, 2024.
