bill_summary: The bill establishes a workgroup to develop regulations for the retail use of electric vehicle supply equipment in Maryland, including standards for reliability, payment options, labeling, and customer support, with a focus on ensuring accessibility and high uptime.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission in collaboration with the Office of the Comptroller and other agencies
stakeholders: Electric vehicle owners, EV service providers, and the general public using EV charging stations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive regulatory framework for EV charging stations, including reliability standards, transparency, and accessibility, integrating multiple agencies and stakeholder input.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting clean transportation infrastructure, which can improve community health and economic opportunities.

Title: Highways – Tourist Area and Corridor Signage Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Tourist Area and Corridor Signage Program to create a system of supplemental guide signs to direct motorists to eligible individual attractions by directing the motorists first to groups of attractions; requiring the State Highway Administration and the Department of Commerce to develop standards and procedures for determining the eligibility of an attraction for a sign; requiring the Administration to notify certain committees of the General Assembly at least 30 days before amending the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Tourist Area and Corridor Signage Program, which creates a system of signs to direct motorists to eligible attractions in Maryland, with the Maryland State Highway Administration and the Department of Commerce overseeing the program.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration in collaboration with the Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Tourist attractions, motorists, and visitors to Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured approach to signage for attractions, including standards, approval processes, and collaboration between transportation and commerce departments, but does not introduce new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily supporting tourism and local economies.

Title: Baltimore City Sheriff - Staffing
Synopsis: Increasing from one to three the number of assistant sheriffs required to be appointed by the Baltimore City Sheriff; authorizing the Baltimore City Sheriff to appoint social workers and any additional sworn or civilian personnel if the funding for the personnel is provided in the ordinance of estimates or any other source; and applying the Act to all full-time sworn law enforcement officers who are deputy sheriffs at the rank of lieutenant or below and court security officers.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of assistant sheriffs required for the Baltimore City Sheriff, authorizes the Sheriff to appoint additional staff, and establishes collective bargaining rights and procedures for sworn law enforcement officers and court security officers in the Baltimore City Sheriff’s Office.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Sheriff’s Office
stakeholders: Sworn law enforcement officers, court security officers, Baltimore City residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces formal collective bargaining rights and procedures for law enforcement officers in the Baltimore City Sheriff’s Office, including mediation and arbitration processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on staffing and labor relations within the Sheriff’s Office.

Title: Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services to identify reentry services in the State, develop a plan to establish a new division within the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, and develop a plan to expand certain services for individuals after release from incarceration; and requiring the Task Force to submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the General Assembly on or before December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force to create a Division of Returning Citizens and expand reentry services for formerly incarcerated individuals in Maryland. It aims to assess current services, identify gaps, and develop plans to improve housing, employment, health, legal, and educational support for returning citizens.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Returning citizens, formerly incarcerated individuals, their families, and reentry service providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, multi-sector approach to reentry, including the creation of a new division and expansion of services, integrating various agencies and community organizations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by supporting formerly incarcerated parents and improving their access to housing, employment, and health services.

Title: State Agency Workforce Policy for the 21st Century Act
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement that an appointing authority send a copy of the selection plan and job announcement to the Secretary of Budget and Management at least 1 week before posting a job announcement; and repealing the requirement that the appointing authority wait until after the close of a position announcement to review qualified applicants.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's state employment laws by prohibiting discrimination based on educational achievement in hiring and promotion, streamlining recruitment processes, and establishing apprenticeship programs and position classification standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: State employees, job applicants, and Maryland residents seeking employment
innovative_summary: The bill introduces modernized recruitment practices, including active recruitment strategies and apprenticeship programs, and updates classification standards to improve government workforce management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving employment opportunities within the state government.

Title: Consumer Protection – Self–Administered Sexual Assault Evidence Collection Kits
Synopsis: Providing that a party in a criminal trial involving an allegation of sexually assaultive behavior may not introduce information that physical evidence of sexually assaultive behavior was obtained using certain materials; providing that selling, offering for sale, or distributing a certain self-administered sexual assault evidence collection kit is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice; establishing the Forensic Nurse Examiner Training Grant Program and the Forensic Nurse Examiner Training Grant Program Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the sale, offer for sale, or distribution of self-administered sexual assault evidence collection kits, establishes a grant program to train forensic nurse examiners, and sets rules for the admissibility of evidence obtained using certain materials in sexual assault cases.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault, forensic nurses, nonprofit organizations, law enforcement, legal system
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new grant program for forensic nurse examiner training and establishes specific legal protections and restrictions related to evidence collection kits, employing new legal and funding approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal protections and training programs related to sexual assault evidence.

Title: Behavioral Health Advisory Council and Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the membership and terms of members of the Behavioral Health Advisory Council; altering the membership of the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access; and requiring the Commission, in coordination with the Council, to make recommendations regarding the continuation of the State's behavioral health carve-out and the financing structure and quality oversight necessary to integrate somatic and behavioral health services and ensure compliance with the Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act.
bill_summary: The bill establishes and modifies the structure, membership, and responsibilities of the Behavioral Health Advisory Council and the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access in Maryland. It mandates joint meetings, assessments, and recommendations to improve behavioral health services, integrate care, and ensure compliance with federal laws.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with behavioral health disorders, their families, healthcare providers, and state agencies involved in behavioral health services
innovative_summary: The bill promotes coordinated assessments, recommendations, and the potential application for participation in the federal Innovation in Behavioral Health Model, employing a comprehensive, data-driven approach to reform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access and quality of behavioral health services for vulnerable populations, including youth.

Title: Maternal Health – Assessments, Referrals, and Reporting (Maryland Maternal Health Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing requirements on local health departments and certain health care providers and facilities regarding maternal health, including requirements regarding prenatal risk assessment forms and postpartum infant and maternal referral forms; requiring hospitals and freestanding birthing centers to participate in the Severe Maternal Morbidity Surveillance Program to identify risk factors and causes of Severe Maternal Morbidity; requiring the Program to report its findings and recommendations by December 1, 2025;  etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for maternal health assessments, referrals, and reporting in Maryland. It mandates the development of a report card for birthing facilities, requires hospitals and birthing centers to complete postpartum referral forms and provide resources, and initiates a study on severe maternal morbidity.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health in collaboration with the Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Pregnant women, new mothers, birthing facilities, healthcare providers, and public health officials in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive report card for birthing facilities, including qualitative patient input and risk adjustment, and mandates a statewide study on severe maternal morbidity, employing data collection, transparency, and quality improvement approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving maternal health outcomes and reducing disparities, which can lead to better economic stability for families.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 46th Alcoholic Beverages District - Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a total of 10 new Class B-D-7 licenses and a total of 2 new Class A-7 licenses within a certain bounded area; providing that, in the 46th alcoholic beverages district in Baltimore City, a certain license may be issued and an existing license may be moved to a building that is within 300 feet of a place of worship or school under certain circumstances; prohibiting the Board from authorizing a license to a recipient of a certain State grant; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises regulations for alcoholic beverage licenses in Baltimore City's 46th district, including issuing new licenses, transferring licenses, and extending license expiration dates, with specific provisions for certain areas and types of licenses.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents, and businesses in Baltimore City, especially the 46th district
innovative_summary: The bill employs targeted licensing adjustments and geographic restrictions to manage alcohol sales, including license conversions and area-specific regulations, which are innovative approaches to local alcohol regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing regulations.

Title: State Board of Nursing - Executive Director Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for the executive director of the State Board of Nursing.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to form a stakeholder workgroup to study and recommend changes to the qualifications for the executive director of the State Board of Nursing. It also adjusts the timeline for implementing certain provisions related to the qualifications of the executive director.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Nursing professionals, healthcare regulators, and the public served by the State Board of Nursing
innovative_summary: The bill employs a stakeholder workgroup to study and recommend changes, which is a collaborative and evidence-based approach, but it does not introduce new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it focuses on professional qualifications and administrative processes.

Title: State Board of Pharmacy - Prohibition on Discrimination Against 340B Drug Distribution
Synopsis: Prohibiting a 340B manufacturer from taking certain direct or indirect  actions to limit or restrict the acquisition or delivery of a 340B drug; making a violation of the Act an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice within the meaning of the Consumer Protection Act; and requiring the Maryland Prescription Drug Affordability Board to conduct a study of the 340B Program and report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits certain actions by 340B drug manufacturers and related entities that limit or restrict the distribution of 340B drugs, makes violations an unfair trade practice, and requires a study on the 340B program's implementation and impact in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Prescription Drug Affordability Board in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Covered entities, 340B drug manufacturers, pharmacies, and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs legal and regulatory measures to enforce fair distribution practices for 340B drugs and mandates a comprehensive study to evaluate the program's impact, integrating legal enforcement with policy analysis.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to affordable medications through fair distribution practices and oversight.

Title: Carroll County – Sheriff – Salary
Synopsis: Increasing the annual salary of the Sheriff of Carroll County to $191,078.10 beginning in 2026 and $212,309 beginning in 2027.
bill_summary: The bill increases the salary of the Sheriff of Carroll County over time, tying it to the salary of a Department of State Police lieutenant colonel starting in 2026, with specific salary amounts and adjustments every few years.
responsible_party: Carroll County government
stakeholders: Sheriff of Carroll County and residents of Carroll County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured, formula-based approach to determine the sheriff's salary, linking it to a state police pay plan, which is a relatively innovative method for setting local government salaries.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Criminal Organizations - Underlying Crime
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "underlying crime" that is applicable to certain prohibitions against participation in criminal organizations.
bill_summary: The bill establishes civil and criminal procedures to combat criminal organizations, including civil actions for damages, injunctions, and property forfeiture related to participation in such organizations, and sets a statute of limitations for these actions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Law Enforcement Agencies and Courts
stakeholders: Individuals and communities affected by criminal organizations, law enforcement, legal system, and property owners involved in forfeiture proceedings
innovative_summary: The bill employs comprehensive civil and criminal legal tools, including civil forfeiture, injunctions, and enhanced investigative powers, to dismantle criminal organizations and recover proceeds.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by disrupting criminal organizations that may contribute to community instability and economic hardship.

Title: Income Tax Subtraction Modification – Death Benefits – Law Enforcement Officers and Fire Fighters
Synopsis: Allowing a subtraction under the Maryland income tax for the payment of a death benefit under a collective bargaining agreement to a spouse or beneficiary of a law enforcement officer or fire fighter whose death arises out of the course of employment; and applying the Act retroactively to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2021.
bill_summary: The bill allows a subtraction from Maryland income tax for the payment of death benefits to the surviving spouse or beneficiary of a deceased law enforcement officer or firefighter, under certain circumstances.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Surviving spouses and beneficiaries of deceased law enforcement officers and firefighters in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward tax subtraction modification to support families of fallen law enforcement and firefighters, which is a common approach and not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily provides tax relief to families of deceased public safety workers.

Title: Public Safety - Maryland Entertainment District Security Grant Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Entertainment District Security Grant Program to assist community organizations, nonprofit entities, and local governments in funding security operations during times of high pedestrian traffic in certain entertainment districts; establishing the Maryland Entertainment District Security Grant Program Fund; authorizing the Governor, beginning in fiscal year 2026 and each fiscal year thereafter, to include up to $1,000,000 in the annual budget bill for the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Entertainment District Security Grant Program to fund security operations in entertainment districts with high pedestrian traffic and reported crimes, through grants to community organizations, nonprofits, and local governments.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Community organizations, nonprofits, local governments, residents, and visitors in entertainment districts
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted grant approach to enhance security in entertainment districts with high crime and pedestrian activity, utilizing state funding and community partnerships.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is not directly aimed at reducing child poverty but may improve safety in entertainment districts, indirectly benefiting residents including children.

Title: Income Tax - Opportunity for Filers to Register to Make Anatomical Gift
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller to implement procedures to offer certain income tax return filers the opportunity to register to make an anatomical gift in accordance with the Maryland Revised Uniform Anatomical Gift Act through a hyperlink to the anatomical gift donor registry.
bill_summary: The bill allows Maryland income tax filers to register as organ donors when they file their taxes by indicating their consent on their tax return, and it establishes procedures for the Comptroller to transmit this information to the organ registry.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office and the State's organ registry organization
stakeholders: Taxpayers in Maryland, potential organ donors, and recipients of organ transplants
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by integrating organ donor registration into the existing income tax filing process, using electronic checkoffs and hyperlinks to streamline registration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on organ donor registration.

Title: Workgroup for the Deaf, Deafblind, and Hard of Hearing - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup for the Deaf, Deafblind, and Hard of Hearing to study and make recommendations regarding certain services, programs, advocacy, outreach efforts, and other items to improve the quality of life of individuals who are deaf, deafblind, or hard of hearing; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by June 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Workgroup and a Commission for the Deaf, Deafblind, and Hard of Hearing in Maryland to study, assess, and make recommendations on services, programs, and policies to improve the quality of life and accessibility for these communities.
responsible_party: Office of the Deaf and Hard of Hearing, Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Deaf, Deafblind, and Hard of Hearing individuals in Maryland and the Washington, D.C. area
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach by establishing dedicated workgroups and commissions to directly study and recommend improvements, utilizing community input and inter-agency coordination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to education, health, and social services for deaf and hard of hearing children.

Title: Health Insurance - Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Benefits - Sunset Repeal and Modification of Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Altering certain reporting requirements on health insurance carriers relating to compliance with the federal Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act; altering requirements for certain analyses of nonquantitative treatment limitations required of health insurance carriers; establishing certain remedies the Commissioner may use to enforce compliance with the Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act and related reporting requirements; repealing the requirement that a certain form be used for the reporting requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies reporting requirements for health insurance carriers regarding compliance with the federal Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act, including analysis and disclosure of nonquantitative treatment limitations, and establishes enforcement mechanisms.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance carriers, mental health and substance use disorder service providers, and plan members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces detailed, standardized reporting and analysis requirements for nonquantitative treatment limitations, with oversight and review by the Maryland Insurance Commissioner, employing federal data collection tools and public transparency measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve access to mental health and substance use disorder benefits, which can contribute to reducing child poverty by supporting mental health needs.

Title: Education - Blind and Visually Impaired Students - Textbook Equity
Synopsis: Establishing requirements for each county board of education regarding provision of the instructional materials that will be used in the upcoming school year for students with individualized education programs; requiring the county board to coordinate with the Instructional Resources Center to provide the materials in a specialized format to blind or visually impaired students; requiring, beginning January 1, 2025, certain textbook publishers to provide an electronic file of pupil edition textbooks; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for Maryland county school boards to ensure that instructional materials for blind and visually impaired students are available in specialized formats such as braille, large print, audio, or digital text. It mandates coordination with the Instructional Resources Center and publishers to provide these materials in a timely manner, allocates funding, and sets reporting and standard-setting responsibilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Instructional Resources Center
stakeholders: Blind and visually impaired students in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated approach involving federal standards (NIMAS), collaboration with publishers, and systematic reporting to improve access to instructional materials for visually impaired students, leveraging technology and standardized formats.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving educational access and equity for visually impaired students, which can influence long-term educational and economic outcomes.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Remote Ultrasound Procedures and Remote Fetal Nonstress Tests
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to provide remote ultrasound procedures and remote fetal nonstress tests if the patient is in a residence or a location other than the office of the patient's provider and the provider follows the same standard of care that the provider would follow when providing the services on-site.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to provide remote ultrasound procedures and remote fetal nonstress tests for eligible pregnant women, including provisions for reimbursement and use of secure digital technology.
responsible_party: Maryland Medical Assistance Program
stakeholders: Pregnant women eligible for Medicaid, healthcare providers, and remote diagnostic service providers
innovative_summary: The program employs telehealth technology and remote monitoring solutions, including FDA-approved devices and secure digital transmission, to expand prenatal care.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve prenatal care access for low-income pregnant women, which can contribute to reducing child poverty.

Title: Public Safety - Automatic License Plate Readers - Captured Plate Data Storage and Upload
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "historical data" to include automatic license plate reader data stored by cloud computing; establishing that certain captured automatic license plate reader data is the property of a certain law enforcement agency and may not be sold for any purpose; establishing that certain captured automatic license plate reader data may be uploaded to the Maryland Coordination and Analysis Center; and extending certain penalties for a violation of the Act to a vendor contracted by a law enforcement agency.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to clarify that automatic license plate reader data stored in the cloud is considered property of law enforcement, restricts the sale and unauthorized sharing of this data, and establishes procedures for its use and security.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new legal restrictions and procedural safeguards for the use and storage of automatic license plate reader data, including cloud storage and data security measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on data privacy and law enforcement procedures.

Title: Blueprint for Maryland's Future Implementation - Funding for Implementation Coordinators
Synopsis: Requiring for each fiscal year each county board of education to provide $150,000 for the salary and benefits of the Blueprint for Maryland's Future implementation coordinator in the county; and requiring the implementation coordinator's salary and benefits to be paid for by the State and the county in a certain proportion.
bill_summary: The bill requires each Maryland county to fund the salary and benefits of a Blueprint implementation coordinator, with costs shared between the state and county. It also mandates independent evaluations of the Blueprint's progress and sets reporting requirements to assess implementation and outcomes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, teachers, and families in Maryland public schools
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, ongoing evaluation process of a statewide education reform initiative, including independent assessments and detailed reporting, which employs new evaluation and accountability approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving educational outcomes and access through targeted reforms and evaluations.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - Class 4 Limited Winery License - Requirements and Authorizations
Synopsis: Altering certain cultivation or production requirements applicable to a holder of a Class 4 limited winery license by basing them on certain agricultural products instead of grapes and other fruit; and altering the standards for the purchase of certain wine by a license holder.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the requirements and standards for Class 4 limited winery licenses in Maryland, including allowing the use of Maryland-grown agricultural products other than grapes and fruit, and updates rules for production, sale, and storage of wine and pomace brandy.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture and Alcoholic Beverages Administration
stakeholders: Winemakers, wine consumers, Maryland agricultural producers, and related industry stakeholders
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a broader definition of Maryland-grown agricultural products for winemaking and allows for more flexible production and sales activities, employing updated standards and regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on industry regulation and agricultural standards.

Title: Compensation for Individuals Erroneously Convicted - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain benefits that a certain individual who has been erroneously convicted of a crime is entitled to receive; requiring the State to notify a certain individual of certain information in writing under certain circumstances when the State intends to reduce or prevent an award of compensation to the individual; and repealing obsolete provisions of law relating to the filing of a certain petition for compensation.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland's laws on compensation for individuals who have been erroneously convicted, including changes to benefits, notification procedures, and eligibility criteria.
responsible_party: Board of Public Works and Office of Administrative Hearings
stakeholders: Individuals wrongfully convicted and their estates in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured legal process for compensation and benefits, including a comprehensive set of services and a reporting requirement, but does not introduce new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal and financial remedies for wrongfully convicted individuals.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B Beer, Wine, and Liquor Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license in a certain area; and establishing the requirements for a holder of the license.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City to issue a special Class B beer, wine, and liquor license to certain restaurants in the Downtown Management District, with specific requirements related to food sales and health classifications. It also sets a deadline of June 30, 2028, after which no new licenses can be issued, but existing licenses can be renewed.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Restaurants and food service establishments in Baltimore City's Downtown Management District
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized license for restaurants in a designated district, with specific operational requirements, and a limited issuance period, representing a targeted approach to licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: 9-1-1 Trust Fund - Purposes - Training in Telecommunications Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation
Synopsis: Altering the purposes of the 9-1-1 Trust Fund to including funding the costs of telecommunications cardiopulmonary resuscitation training.
bill_summary: The bill expands the purposes of the Maryland 9-1-1 Trust Fund to include funding for telecommunications cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) training for public safety answering point personnel, establishes training standards for this CPR, and specifies the content of the training.
responsible_party: Maryland 9-1-1 Board
stakeholders: Public safety answering point personnel, emergency responders, and the general public who benefit from improved emergency response services.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces high-quality, nationally recognized telecommunications CPR training standards for emergency dispatch personnel, including recognition protocols and continuing instruction, which is a new approach to emergency responder training.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve emergency response effectiveness, which can indirectly benefit children, but it is not specifically targeted at child poverty.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Human Relations Commission - Subpoena Enforcement
Synopsis: Authorizing the Human Relations Commission of Anne Arundel County to apply to a circuit court in any county to seek relief if a party fails to comply with a subpoena.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Anne Arundel County Human Relations Commission to seek court enforcement if a party fails to comply with a subpoena, including applying for court orders and issuing body attachments to compel compliance.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Human Relations Commission
stakeholders: Individuals and entities subject to subpoenas by the Anne Arundel County Human Relations Commission
innovative_summary: The bill enhances the enforcement powers of a local human relations commission through court procedures, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners - Veterinary Technicians and Veterinary Assistants
Synopsis: Authorizing a veterinary assistant to perform certain tasks under the immediate or direct supervision of a veterinary practitioner or a veterinary technician under the direct supervision of a veterinary practitioner; and authorizing a veterinary technician to perform certain procedures, including certain emergency procedures and euthanasia, if the veterinary practitioner determines the veterinary technician is qualified to perform the procedures.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes veterinary assistants to perform certain tasks under supervision, expands the roles of veterinary technicians, and establishes an alternative pathway for employed veterinary assistants to become licensed veterinary technicians, with a focus on improving veterinary service delivery.
responsible_party: State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners
stakeholders: Veterinary assistants, veterinary technicians, veterinarians, animal patients, and pet owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an alternative credentialing pathway for veterinary assistants to become licensed veterinary technicians, which is a new approach to workforce development in veterinary medicine.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving veterinary services, which can benefit pet-owning families and communities.

Title: Standing - Environmental and Natural Resources Protection Proceedings (Clean Water Justice Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Providing certain persons standing in environmental and natural resources protection proceedings; authorizing persons that meet standing requirements to bring certain civil actions under certain circumstances; requiring a plaintiff, under certain circumstances, to give certain notice and provide certain documentation to the Department of the Environment and the Attorney General and to file a certain affidavit; authorizing a court to grant certain relief, award certain costs, and impose certain civil penalties; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the 'Clean Water Justice Act' which expands standing rights for individuals and associations to bring civil actions and intervene in environmental water protection proceedings, including violations of water quality standards, and sets procedures for enforcement and penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Individuals, associations, environmental groups, and communities concerned with water quality and natural resources in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances legal standing and intervention rights for private parties in environmental water protection cases, employing legal reforms to improve enforcement and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve water quality and environmental health, which can indirectly benefit children, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Miriam Kelty Aging and Senior Social Connection Hub and Spoke Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Miriam Kelty Aging and Senior Social Connection Hub and Spoke Pilot Program in the Maryland Department of Aging; establishing that the purpose and the goals of the Pilot Program are to support the "village" concept of local, volunteer-led organizations that aim to provide certain services to community members who choose to age in place and to expand those services to more residents in the geographic region; and requiring the Montgomery County Village Consortium to establish a certain plan and submit certain reports.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Miriam Kelty Aging and Senior Social Connection Hub and Spoke Pilot Program in Maryland to support social connections and aging in place for seniors through a hub and spoke model, with funding and oversight provided by the Maryland Department of Aging.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Aging
stakeholders: Seniors aging in place, local volunteer-led organizations, developing villages, and underserved communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a hub and spoke model to coordinate resources, streamline administration, and expand social services for seniors, integrating best practices and community engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by supporting community stability and family well-being, but its primary focus is on seniors.

Title: Advanced Practice Registered Nurses - Certification Requirement and Exceptions
Synopsis: Requiring an individual, subject to certain exceptions, to be certified as an advanced practice registered nurse before practicing advanced practice registered nursing in the State.
bill_summary: The bill requires individuals to be certified as advanced practice registered nurses before practicing in Maryland, with certain exceptions such as students, federal employees, and disaster responders.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Advanced practice registered nurses, nursing students, healthcare facilities, and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes certification requirements for advanced practice registered nurses, aligning with existing licensing and multistate licensure frameworks.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve healthcare access through better-qualified nursing practice.

Title: Maryland Intrastate Emergency Management Assistance Compact - City of Frederick
Synopsis: Authorizing the City of Frederick to participate in the Maryland Intrastate Emergency Management Assistance Compact.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the City of Frederick to participate in the Maryland Intrastate Emergency Management Assistance Compact, which facilitates mutual aid and cooperation among jurisdictions in Maryland during emergencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Jurisdictions within Maryland, including the City of Frederick, emergency management agencies, and the general public during emergencies.
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a formal interstate compact for emergency management mutual assistance, enhancing coordination and resource sharing during emergencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but improves emergency response coordination, which can indirectly benefit vulnerable populations including children.

Title: County Boards of Education – Budgets – Notice (Transparency in Education Spending Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Education to adopt a process for the uniform and timely reporting of certain county board of education budget information to a county governing body; requiring a county board to post certain budget information on the county board's public-facing website, in an easily identifiable location; requiring a certain audit to be sent to the county council or the county commissioners; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland State Board of Education to establish a standardized process for the timely and uniform reporting of county school budget information to county governing bodies. It also requires county school boards to post budget information on their websites, submit annual budgets to local authorities, conduct audits, and report on financial and operational status, enhancing transparency and accountability.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Education and county school boards
stakeholders: County school districts, local government officials, and the public interested in education funding and transparency
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive digital transparency approach by requiring online posting of budgets and reports, standardizing reporting processes, and integrating audits, which modernizes government transparency practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing transparency and accountability in school funding, which can lead to better resource allocation for underserved communities.

Title: Business Regulation - Restaurants and Traders - Licensing Requirements
Synopsis: Altering an exception for licensed restaurants to the requirement that a person who does business as a trader or an exhibitor have a trader's license to apply only to restaurants that generate 10% or less of their annual sales from nonfood items.
bill_summary: The bill modifies licensing requirements for traders and exhibitors in Maryland, specifically creating an exception for certain restaurants that generate 10% or less of their sales from nonfood items, exempting them from needing a trader's license.
responsible_party: Maryland Business Regulation Department
stakeholders: Restaurants that generate 10% or less of sales from nonfood items, traders, exhibitors, and related businesses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted exemption based on sales composition for restaurant licensing, which is a specific regulatory adjustment rather than a new technology or approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily changes licensing rules for certain businesses.

Title: Landlord and Tenant - Failure to Repair Serious and Dangerous Defects - Tenant Remedies (Tenant Safety Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing that a landlord that offers a residential dwelling unit for rent is deemed to warrant the dwelling fit for human habitation; authorizing multiple tenants to join as plaintiffs in a civil action against a landlord and authorizing a court to issue an order for separate trials or other orders necessary to prevent delay or avoid prejudice; providing that a court may order certain relief in civil actions relating to the breach of warranty of habitability, including actual damages, abatement of rent, and lease termination; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes that landlords offering residential units for rent are deemed to warrant the units as fit for human habitation, especially concerning serious and dangerous defects such as mold, structural issues, or fire hazards. It provides tenants with remedies, including rent escrow, rent abatement, and the ability to sue for damages if landlords fail to repair dangerous conditions, and clarifies procedures for notification and court actions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Tenants in Maryland, especially those living in units with serious defects or hazards
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive legal framework to enforce landlord obligations and tenant remedies for dangerous housing conditions, including rent escrow and court-ordered repairs, which is a proactive approach to housing safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving housing safety, which can lead to better health and stability for children in affected households.

Title: Harford County – Alcoholic Beverages – Performing Arts Theater License
Synopsis: Altering eligibility for a performing arts theater license in Harford County by altering the definition of "performing arts theater" and authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue the license to a certain for-profit theater, rather than a nonprofit theater; authorizing the holder of the license to sell liquor for on-premises consumption in addition to beer and wine; and altering the license fee from $500 to $1,500.
bill_summary: The bill allows Harford County to issue a performing arts theater license to for-profit theaters, expanding eligibility beyond nonprofits. It permits the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor during performances and related events, with an increased annual fee of $1,500.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Harford County
stakeholders: Performing arts theaters, theater audiences, local businesses, and the general public in Harford County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new licensing option for for-profit theaters to sell alcohol during performances, expanding traditional nonprofit-focused licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns licensing and alcohol sales in theaters.

Title: Maryland Health Care Commission – Nursing Homes – Acquisitions
Synopsis: Requiring a person, at least 60 days before the closing date of the acquisition of a nursing home, to submit a request for acquisition to the Maryland Health Care Commission and provide certain notice to residents, resident representatives, and employees of the nursing home; establishing requirements regarding the approval or denial of a request for acquisition of a nursing home; providing for judicial review of a final decision of the Commission regarding a request for acquisition of a nursing home; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires prior approval from the Maryland Health Care Commission before acquiring a nursing home, including submitting a request and providing notice to residents and staff. It establishes procedures for review, approval, or denial of acquisitions, and mandates reporting and regulation of post-acquisition changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Nursing home residents, staff, owners, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured regulatory process with detailed review, public comments, and ongoing reporting, integrating regulatory oversight with quality and safety standards for nursing home acquisitions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve nursing home quality and stability, which can indirectly benefit vulnerable populations including children in affected families.

Title: Certified Nursing Assistants - Licensing Requirements and Administrative Updates
Synopsis: Exempting an individual who practices as a certain nursing assistant for less than 4 months under federal regulations from the State's certification requirement; altering the designation of, and licensure requirements for, certified nursing assistants and geriatric nursing assistants; requiring an applicant for certification as a certified nursing assistant to complete a nursing assistant competency evaluation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates licensing requirements for certified nursing assistants (CNAs) in Maryland, including exemptions for short-term practice, new categories of CNAs, and training program standards. It also establishes procedures for certification, renewal, and program approval.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Certified nursing assistants, nursing homes, healthcare facilities, and residents in need of care
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new categories of CNAs and updates training and certification processes, including potential use of online instruction and on-the-job experience for certification.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving healthcare staffing and quality, but it is primarily focused on professional licensing.

Title: Sexual Assault Forensic Examinations Conducted Through Telehealth - Reimbursement and Study
Synopsis: Authorizing the reimbursement of a sexual assault forensic exam conducted through peer-to-peer telehealth under certain circumstances; requiring the Maryland Sexual Assault Evidence Kit Policy and Funding Committee to conduct a study on the feasibility of a telehealth program that includes a pilot program for conducting sexual assault forensic examinations through telehealth; and requiring the Committee to report its findings and recommendations to the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes reimbursement for sexual assault forensic exams conducted via telehealth, and mandates a study on the feasibility of a telehealth pilot program called TeleSAFE for conducting such exams.
responsible_party: Maryland Sexual Assault Evidence Kit Policy and Funding Committee
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault and child sexual abuse, healthcare providers, hospitals
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a telehealth-based approach to conduct sexual assault forensic examinations, including a pilot program and a study on its feasibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve access to forensic exams, which may help reduce barriers for victims, indirectly impacting child poverty.

Title: Labor and Employment – Workforce Development – Talent Innovation Program and Fund
Synopsis: Establishing the Talent Innovation Program in the Maryland Department of Labor to increase access to high-quality job training by using innovative and sustainable talent financing mechanisms to help meet skill needs in the State's prominent and emerging industry sectors; and requiring the Department, beginning on January 1, 2025, and each January 1 thereafter, to report to the Governor, the President of the Senate and Speaker of the House on Program activities and use of the Talent Innovation Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Talent Innovation Program and Fund within the Maryland Department of Labor to enhance access to high-quality job training in key industry sectors such as cybersecurity, healthcare, biotechnology, manufacturing, and artificial intelligence. It supports innovative talent financing mechanisms, including pay-it-forward models and apprenticeships, and creates a dedicated, nonlapsing fund to finance these initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Workers and residents seeking high-quality job training in prominent and emerging industries in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs innovative talent financing mechanisms like pay-it-forward models, pay-for-performance programs, and supports regional cyber ranges, representing a new approach to workforce development funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to high-quality job training and employment opportunities for residents.

Title: Hospitals and Related Institutions – Residential Treatment Centers – Accreditation
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "accredited residential treatment center" for certain provisions of law governing hospitals and related institutions to include residential treatment centers accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities or the Council on Accreditation.
bill_summary: The bill updates the definition of 'accredited residential treatment center' to include centers accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities or the Council on Accreditation, in addition to the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residential treatment centers, healthcare providers, patients in treatment centers
innovative_summary: The bill broadens accreditation standards for residential treatment centers, potentially improving quality and oversight through multiple accreditation organizations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve care quality for children in treatment centers.

Title: Growing Family Child Care Opportunities Pilot Program – Permanent Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Growing Family Child Care Opportunities Pilot Program as a permanent program; and extending the appropriation that the Governor is required to make in the annual budget bill to the Program to fiscal year 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Growing Family Child Care Opportunities Program as a permanent initiative to provide grants and support for family child care providers in Maryland, focusing on increasing supply and sustainability, especially in underserved areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education in partnership with the Maryland Child Care Resource Network
stakeholders: Family child care providers, children, families, and local communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach combining grants, technical assistance, multilingual outreach, and partnerships with local organizations to support small, diverse, and minority-owned family child care providers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to affordable, quality child care in underserved areas.

Title: Emergency Medical Services - Maryland Emergency Department Wait Time Reduction Commission - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Emergency Department Wait Time Reduction Commission to address factors throughout the health care system that contribute to increased emergency department wait times; authorizing the Commission to request data from certain entities; and requiring the Commission, beginning November 1, 2025, to report annually to the Governor and General Assembly on its activities and findings including updates on the development, impact and, implementation of the recommended programs on emergency department wait times.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Emergency Department Wait Time Reduction Commission to develop strategies, protocols, and technological solutions to reduce emergency department wait times and improve patient care. It also mandates annual reporting on progress and hospital compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Hospital emergency departments, emergency medical services, patients, healthcare providers, and state health agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated, data-driven approach with standardized protocols, advanced technology solutions, and training programs to improve emergency department efficiency and patient outcomes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve healthcare access and reduce disparities, which can indirectly impact child poverty.

Title: Environment - Playground Surfacing Materials - Prohibitions
Synopsis: Prohibiting, on or after October 1, 2024, a person from installing, supplying, selling, soliciting, or offering for sale playground surfacing materials that contain a certain concentration of lead or a component product, material, or substance to which PFAS chemicals were previously intentionally added for certain purposes; prohibiting a county, municipality, or unit of local government from adopting any ordinance, rule, or regulation related to playground surfacing materials that is less stringent than of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the use, sale, or installation of playground surfacing materials containing high levels of lead, PFAS chemicals, or PAHs starting October 1, 2024. It also requires manufacturers to provide compliance certificates and limits local regulations to be no less strict than state rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Children using playgrounds, playground equipment manufacturers, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs chemical safety standards and certification requirements to regulate playground surfacing materials, integrating environmental health considerations into playground safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves safety and health for children, which can contribute to overall well-being.

Title: Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act – Maryland 529 Program – Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting certain accounts under the Maryland 529 Program from the provisions of the Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain accounts and sums payable from the Maryland 529 Program from the provisions of the Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act, specifically clarifying which accounts are affected and establishing an exemption starting June 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education or relevant state agency overseeing the Maryland 529 Program
stakeholders: Participants in the Maryland 529 College Savings Plan and related account holders
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies legal exemptions for specific accounts rather than introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting account management and legal exemptions.

Title: Environment – Water Pollution Control – Protecting State Waters From PFAS Pollution (Protecting State Waters From PFAS Pollution Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to identify significant industrial users that currently and intentionally use PFAS chemicals by July 1, 2026; requiring the Department to develop certain PFAS monitoring and testing criteria for certain significant industrial users by January 1, 2025; requiring the Department by June 1, 2025, to develop PFAS action levels for addressing PFAS contamination from industrial discharge for pretreatment permits; requiring the Department to develop mitigation plans by September 1, 2025; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations and limits on PFAS chemicals in water discharges from industrial users in Maryland. It requires significant industrial users to eliminate PFAS in their discharges by October 1, 2024, develop monitoring protocols, and reduce PFAS levels to 4 parts per trillion by 2025. The Department of the Environment is tasked with identifying users, developing testing criteria, setting action levels, and enforcing compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Industrial users, environmental agencies, residents near water bodies, public water treatment facilities
innovative_summary: The program employs new regulations, testing protocols, and strict discharge limits for PFAS chemicals, integrating federal guidance and advanced testing methods to address water pollution.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on water pollution and industrial regulation has an indirect impact on child health and environment, but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Hospitals - Opioid Overdose and Opioid-Related Emergency Medical Conditions - Treatment
Synopsis: Requiring hospitals to establish and maintain certain protocols and capacity related to the treatment of patients who are being treated for an opioid-related overdose or opioid-related emergency medical condition; requiring hospitals to make a referral for patients who are diagnosed with opioid use disorder or administered or prescribed medication for opioid use disorder to an appropriate provider to voluntarily continue treatment in the community and work with peer support professionals for a certain purpose; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland hospitals to establish protocols for treating opioid overdoses and opioid use disorder, including providing medication-assisted treatment and making referrals for ongoing community treatment. It also allocates funds from the Opioid Restitution Fund to support these initiatives and related programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Hospitals, patients with opioid use disorder, community treatment providers, peer support professionals
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach combining hospital protocols, medication-assisted treatment, referrals, and community support, supported by dedicated funding and data reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving health outcomes and reducing the impact of opioid disorder on families.

Title: Grow Your Own Educators Grant Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Grow Your Own Educators Grant Program to provide grants to local school systems for employees who pledge to fulfill a certain service obligation as a full-time teacher in the State; requiring the State Department of Education to administer the Program and to take certain actions to develop and implement the Program; establishing the eligibility for certain teacher candidates in the Program and requiring teacher candidates to be paid a certain rate and offered certain benefits under the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Grow Your Own Educators Grant Program to support local school systems in training and employing noncertified education support professionals and provisional teachers as full-time teachers in high-need areas, with a service obligation in the state.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Noncertified education support professionals, provisional teachers, local school systems, students in high-need schools
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach combining grants, mentorship, and service obligations to develop a diverse teaching workforce, integrating partnerships among school systems, unions, and higher education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing the number of qualified teachers in high-need schools, improving educational outcomes.

Title: State Government – Attorney General – Reports
Synopsis: Altering certain reporting requirements for the Attorney General; and requiring the Attorney General to publish certain documents on the website of the Attorney General.
bill_summary: The bill updates reporting requirements for the Maryland Attorney General, including publishing certain documents on the Attorney General's website and providing annual reports and opinions online.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, legal community, government agencies
innovative_summary: The bill enhances transparency by requiring the Attorney General to publish reports and opinions online annually.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but improves government transparency and accountability.

Title: 9-1-1 Specialist Recruitment and Retention Workgroup
Synopsis: Establishing the 9-1-1 Specialist Recruitment and Retention Workgroup to identify and examine recruitment and retention challenges that affect 9-1-1 specialists in the State; and requiring the Workgroup to submit an interim report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024, and a final report on or before December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the 9–1–1 Specialist Recruitment and Retention Workgroup to examine challenges and make recommendations for improving recruitment, retention, and support for 9–1–1 specialists in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management and Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: 9–1–1 specialists, emergency response agencies, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative workgroup approach to analyze workforce challenges and develop tailored recommendations, including potential integration into pension systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but aims to improve emergency response workforce stability.

Title: State Department of Education - Division of Rehabilitation Services - Funding
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill a certain appropriation to the Division of Rehabilitation Services in the State Department of Education to ensure the State match amount for the Division is met as required by certain federal acts.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Governor to include funding in the annual budget to support the Division of Rehabilitation Services within the State Department of Education, ensuring the state's share of federal funding is met.
responsible_party: State Department of Education
stakeholders: Individuals requiring rehabilitation services, including students and persons with disabilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily establishes a funding mechanism and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on funding mechanisms for rehabilitation services.

Title: Watershed, Stream, and Floodplain Restoration - Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Restoration and Stream and Floodplain Restoration Funding (Whole Watershed Act)
Synopsis: Requiring, in each fiscal year from 2026 through 2030, up to $100,000 from the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays 2010 Trust Fund to be used to fund certain operations grants at a rate of $20,000 per project sponsor each fiscal year; authorizing the use of the Waterway Improvement Fund for projects that involve the beneficial use of dredged material and for certain water quality monitoring; prohibiting the Department of the Environment from reducing certain monitoring requirements for certain projects; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a licensing and regulatory framework for stream restoration contractors, creates a Whole Watershed Restoration Partnership and Fund to accelerate restoration efforts in Maryland's watersheds, and sets procedures for project approval, community engagement, and monitoring to improve water quality and ecosystem health in the Chesapeake Bay and Atlantic Coastal Bays.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Stream restoration contractors, local communities, environmental organizations, state agencies, property owners, and residents in Maryland's watersheds
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, multi-agency approach utilizing new funding mechanisms, a dedicated partnership, and community engagement strategies to accelerate watershed restoration and improve water quality.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by improving environmental conditions and public health in overburdened and underserved communities, fostering local employment, and supporting sustainable development.

Title: Maryland Center for School Safety - Secure Schools Emergency Response Grant Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Secure Schools Emergency Response Grant Program to be administered by the Maryland Center for School Safety to provide funds to improve emergency notification systems and communications between public elementary and secondary school personnel, a public safety answering point, and a public safety agency during emergency events; requiring the Center to ensure that the Program is operating and available to each county board by September 1, 2026; and authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation in the annual budget bill.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Center for School Safety's Secure Schools Emergency Response Grant Program to fund improvements in emergency notification systems and communication between schools and public safety agencies, including the implementation of a secure emergency communication platform with features like panic buttons and automated alerts.
responsible_party: Maryland Center for School Safety
stakeholders: Public elementary and secondary schools, students, school staff, public safety agencies, first responders
innovative_summary: The program employs advanced emergency communication technology, including integrated panic buttons, automated alerts, and a certified emergency notification platform, to enhance school safety and emergency response.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve school safety significantly, which can contribute to reducing child poverty by creating safer school environments.

Title: Human Remains - Alkaline Hydrolysis and Natural Organic Reduction (Green Death Care Options Act)
Synopsis: Establishing a regulatory system for reduction operators and reduction facilities; establishing requirements and prohibitions related to the performance of alkaline hydrolysis and natural organic reduction and the disposition of hydrolyzed or soil remains by certain facilities; requiring the Director of the Office of Cemetery Oversight and the Director of the State Board of Morticians and Funeral Directors to adopt regulations governing the performance of natural organic reduction; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a regulatory framework for natural organic reduction and alkaline hydrolysis as new methods of human body disposition, including licensing, standards, and prohibitions on soil remains use.
responsible_party: Office of Cemetery Oversight and the State Board of Morticians and Funeral Directors
stakeholders: Individuals choosing natural organic reduction or alkaline hydrolysis, funeral service providers, cemeteries, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces innovative environmentally friendly death care options employing new technologies and regulatory approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on death care regulations.

Title: Nonprescription Drugs and Devices – Provision by Registered Nurses and Sale of Contraceptives Through Automatic Devices
Synopsis: Prohibiting the sale of natural membrane condoms, rather than all nonlatex condoms, through a vending machine or other automatic device; excluding the violation of a certain provision of the Act from certain penalties; and authorizing registered nurses to provide, without a prescription, nonprescription drugs and devices in a local health department under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill allows registered nurses in Maryland to provide nonprescription drugs and devices without a prescription in certain circumstances, prohibits the sale of natural membrane condoms via vending machines, and makes related legal and regulatory changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Registered nurses, local health departments, consumers seeking nonprescription drugs and reproductive health products
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by enabling registered nurses to directly provide certain nonprescription drugs and devices, expanding access and reducing barriers to care.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to reproductive health services and contraception, thereby supporting family stability.

Title: Video Lottery Facility Operations - Crimes of Moral Turpitude and Value of Table Game Chips - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission is required to disqualify an applicant who committed a certain crime involving moral turpitude from holding a video lottery employee license; and altering the definition of "value" as it relates to crimes involving theft to include the face value of a chip designated for use in table games.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules for disqualifying applicants from holding video lottery employee licenses, specifically addressing crimes involving moral turpitude and theft of table game chips. It clarifies how the value of chips is determined and sets criteria for license eligibility.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Applicants for video lottery employee licenses, gaming operators, and the general public involved in gaming activities
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal definitions and licensing rules; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns licensing and legal definitions within the gaming industry.

Title: Child Care Providers - Anaphylactic Food Allergies - Guidelines and Indemnity (Elijah's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health to develop guidelines to reduce the risk of exposure to anaphylactic major food allergens in child care settings; requiring the State Department of Education to create a certain model policy; requiring certain large family child care homes and child care centers to adopt a policy to reduce the risk of exposure to anaphylactic major food allergens; and providing that certain child care providers and employees are immune from civil liability.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland's Department of Education and Department of Health to develop guidelines and a model policy for child care providers to reduce the risk of exposure to anaphylactic food allergens. It mandates certain child care facilities to adopt these policies and provides immunity from civil liability for providers responding in good faith to allergic reactions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Child care providers, children with food allergies, parents of children with food allergies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured approach to managing food allergies in child care settings, including guidelines, policies, and training resources, with legal protections for responders.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing instead on health and safety protocols.

Title: Baltimore City – Alcoholic Beverages – 40th Alcoholic Beverages District – Revisions
Synopsis: Establishing a Class M-F (Municipal Family Fun Center) alcoholic beverages license in the 40th alcoholic beverages district in Baltimore City; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a certain Class B beer, wine, and liquor license to a restaurant in a certain location; and authorizing a certain Class A license issued for a certain location to remain unexpired until the end of July 1, 2025, for the purpose of renewal.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Municipal Family Fun Center alcohol license in Baltimore City, allows certain new licenses for specific districts, and extends the renewal period for some existing licenses until July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Businesses operating in Baltimore City, residents, and visitors in the specified districts
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new license type and special provisions for existing licenses, including a temporary extension, which are innovative approaches to local alcohol licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal, as it mainly concerns licensing regulations and district-specific licenses.

Title: Transportation - MobilityLink Paratransit Service Improvements - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transportation Institute at the University of Maryland to conduct a study to identify methods to improve the Maryland Transit Administration's ADA MobilityLink paratransit service; requiring the Institute to submit a report on its findings and recommendations to the Governor, the General Assembly, and certain  officials by July 1, 2025; and authorizing the Governor in fiscal year 2026 to include in the annual budget bill at least $150,000 for the study.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transportation Institute at the University of Maryland to conduct a study to identify ways to improve the Maryland Transit Administration's ADA MobilityLink paratransit service, including comparing service models nationwide, analyzing costs, performance, workforce metrics, and developing recommendations for service improvements.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Institute at the University of Maryland
stakeholders: MobilityLink riders, individuals with disabilities, Maryland Transit Administration, Maryland residents outside fixed routes
