innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive nationwide comparison and analysis approach, including public input and workforce metrics, to develop tailored service improvement recommendations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve transportation access for individuals with disabilities, which can indirectly impact child poverty by improving access to education and services.

Title: Economic Development - Strategic Infrastructure Revolving Loan Program and Tax Increment Financing
Synopsis: Establishing the Strategic Infrastructure Revolving Loan Program in the Maryland Economic Development Corporation to make loans for targeted investments in real estate and infrastructure projects located in sustainable communities, priority funding areas, and transit-oriented development areas; establishing the Strategic Infrastructure Revolving Loan Fund; authorizing the Corporation, with certain approval of a certain governing body, to pledge certain revenues generated within a certain area for certain purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Strategic Infrastructure Revolving Loan Program and Fund in Maryland to provide loans for targeted real estate and infrastructure projects that support community development, transit-oriented development, and inclusive economic growth.
responsible_party: Maryland Economic Development Corporation
stakeholders: Communities, real estate developers, local governments, and residents in targeted areas such as sustainable communities and transit-oriented development zones.
innovative_summary: The program employs a revolving loan fund model to finance infrastructure projects with a focus on underutilized assets and community development, integrating public and private investment strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by fostering economic growth and revitalization in underserved communities.

Title: Allegany County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class BWLT Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting Permit
Synopsis: Authorizing a Class BWLT beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit to be issued by the Board of License Commissioners for Allegany County.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class BWLT beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit in Allegany County, allowing license holders to permit on-premises tasting events of alcoholic beverages.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Allegany County
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders and consumers in Allegany County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized tasting permit with specific regulations and fees, streamlining the process for alcohol tastings at licensed venues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland-Ireland Trade Commission - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland-Ireland Trade Commission in the Department of Commerce to study and make recommendations regarding bilateral trade relations and investment opportunities between Maryland and Ireland; and requiring the Commission by December 1 2025, to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland–Ireland Trade Commission within the Department of Commerce to study and promote trade relations between Maryland and Ireland. It details the composition, responsibilities, and reporting requirements of the commission, and sets its duration from October 1, 2024, to September 30, 2026.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Maryland government, Irish-American community, Maryland businesses, educational institutions, and trade organizations involved in Maryland–Ireland relations
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated trade commission focused on fostering international trade and economic cooperation between Maryland and Ireland, employing a structured approach to bilateral engagement and policy recommendations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly through economic development and job creation, but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Employees' and Teachers' Retirement and Pension Systems - Reemployment of Retirees
Synopsis: Repealing a certain exemption from certain reemployed retiree earnings offsets for certain retirees of the Employees' and Teachers' Retirement and Pension Systems; repealing certain requirements that certain participating employers pay certain offsets under certain circumstances; establishing an exemption from a reemployed retiree earnings offset for retirees of the Teachers' Pension System who are reemployed by certain employers if the retiree's salary is funded from certain sources; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises rules regarding reemployed retirees of the Employees' and Teachers' Retirement Systems in Maryland, including exemptions from salary offsets and specific funding conditions for reemployment, especially for teachers and state employees.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Retirees of the Employees' and Teachers' Retirement Systems, local school systems, state government employees, and grant-funded positions
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific exemptions and funding conditions for reemployed retirees, including retroactive application and detailed documentation requirements, which are relatively innovative approaches to managing retiree reemployment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting retiree employment rules and funding.

Title: State Retirement Agency - Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion and Governance Program
Synopsis: Establishing that the Executive Director of the State Retirement Agency shall employ a Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion of the State Retirement Agency; requiring the Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion to identify and minimize barriers to ensure access and opportunities to underrepresented groups; requiring the Executive Director to terminate the Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the position of a Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion within the Maryland State Retirement Agency, and creates a governance program within the Investment Division to promote diversity and responsible investment practices. It sets requirements for employment, reporting, and termination procedures for these roles.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Employees, underrepresented groups, and stakeholders of the Maryland State Retirement Agency and its investment division
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion director and a governance program focused on integrating environmental, social, and governance factors into investment decisions, employing new roles and structured oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly by promoting equitable access and inclusive investment practices that can benefit broader economic stability.

Title: Baltimore County - Sheriff - Salary
Synopsis: Altering the annual salary of the Sheriff of Baltimore County.
bill_summary: This bill increases the annual salary of the Sheriff of Baltimore County to $90,000 for 2024 and 2025, and then adjusts it for subsequent years, with the amount for 2026 set at $138,000, and for 2027 at $143,000, and for 2028 at $150,000, and for 2029 at $157,500, with future increases determined by the Baltimore County Council's budget.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Government
stakeholders: Sheriff of Baltimore County, residents of Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it primarily adjusts salary levels through legislative action.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Public and Nonpublic Middle and High Schools - Venue-Specific Emergency Action Plans for Athletic Facilities (The Bailey Bullock Act)
Synopsis: Requiring that each public middle school and high school alter the venue-specific emergency action plan for athletic facilities to incorporate a cardiac emergency response plan; requiring each nonpublic middle school and high school that receives State funding to develop a venue-specific emergency action plan for athletic facilities; specifying the contents of a nonpublic venue-specific emergency action plan; and requiring that the emergency action plans be reviewed and updated annually.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland public middle and high schools to develop and implement a comprehensive cardiac emergency response plan as part of their venue-specific emergency action plans for athletic facilities, starting in the 2024-2025 school year. Nonpublic schools receiving state funding are encouraged to follow similar guidelines.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, school staff, coaches, parents, and emergency responders involved in school athletic activities
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured, evidence-based approach to emergency preparedness for cardiac incidents in school sports, integrating training, planning, and coordination with local emergency services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving safety and health outcomes for student athletes, which can contribute to overall well-being and educational stability.

Title: Condominiums - Mandatory Insurance Coverage - Detached Units
Synopsis: Altering the types of elements and units for which a council of unit owners is required to maintain certain property insurance; requiring the council of unit owners to annually notify, in writing, owners of detached units of certain property insurance obligations; limiting instances when an owner of a detached unit within a condominium is required to carry homeowners insurance on the entirety of the unit; and authorizing a council of unit owners to carry homeowners insurance on the entirety of all units located within a certain condominium.
bill_summary: The bill requires condominium councils to maintain property insurance for attached, multifamily, and detached units, and to notify owners of detached units about insurance obligations. It also allows councils to carry insurance on all detached units in a condominium composed entirely of similar detached units, and clarifies owners' insurance requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or the relevant condominium regulatory authority
stakeholders: Condominium unit owners, especially owners of detached units within condominiums
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific insurance notification and coverage requirements for detached units within condominiums, including the possibility for councils to insure all detached units collectively, which is a new approach to condominium insurance management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting property insurance policies and owner notifications.

Title: Consumer Protection - Telephone Solicitation - Exemptions and Remedies
Synopsis: Establishing that certain provisions of law that prohibit a person from making or causing to make a certain telephone solicitation that involves using a certain automated system or playing a recorded message do not apply to a noncommercial telephone solicitation for public opinion research; authorizing a certain called party who is aggrieved by a person who violates certain provisions of law to bring an action to enjoin further violations and to recover certain damages; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies exemptions and enforcement provisions related to Maryland's telephone solicitation laws, including allowing noncommercial public opinion research calls to be exempt from certain restrictions, and establishes that certain legal remedies cannot be waived.
responsible_party: Maryland State Legislature and enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, telephone solicitors, noncommercial organizations conducting public opinion research
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal exemptions and enforcement rules; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Public Health - Kratom Consumer Protection Act
Synopsis: Requiring a retailer that prepares, distributes, sells, or exposes for sale a kratom product to disclose the factual basis on which the representation is made; establishing prohibitions related to the preparation, distribution, and sale of kratom products, including prohibitions related to the sale of kratom to individuals under the age of 21 years and the marketing of kratom to minors; establishing certain penalties for violations of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for the sale and marketing of kratom products in Maryland, including disclosure requirements, restrictions on sale to minors, and prohibitions on certain advertising practices. It also mandates reporting on adverse health events related to opioid-like substances.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Kratom consumers, retailers, minors, public health officials
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive regulatory approach to control kratom sales and marketing, including disclosure, age restrictions, and advertising limitations, with a focus on public health safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but aims to protect minors from unsafe products and marketing practices.

Title: Public Health - Tianeptine Consumer Protection Act
Synopsis: Prohibiting a retailer from distributing, selling, exposing for sale, or advertising for sale a tianeptine product to an individual; and establishing a penalty for a retailer who violates the Act of a fine of up to $5,000 or imprisonment for up to 90 days or both.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations to protect consumers from unregulated tianeptine products, including disclosure requirements, age restrictions, and advertising limitations, and creates enforcement penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Consumers, retailers, minors, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs regulatory measures and advertising restrictions to control the sale and marketing of tianeptine products, focusing on consumer protection and youth prevention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but aims to protect minors from harmful products, which may indirectly benefit child well-being.

Title: Natural Resources - Fisheries - Oyster Management
Synopsis: Repealing a provision of law prohibiting the Department of Natural Resources from taking any action to reduce or alter the boundaries of certain oyster sanctuaries until the Department has developed a certain updated fishery management plan for oysters; requiring the fishery management plan to end the overfishing of oysters in all areas and regions of the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries where overfishing has occurred; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates oyster management policies in Maryland, including developing a new fishery management plan to end overfishing, increase oyster populations and habitat, and facilitate sustainable harvests. It also revises regulations on oyster harvesting methods and allows dredging by power boat in certain areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Oyster fishers, environmental agencies, local communities, and the public interested in oyster sustainability
innovative_summary: The bill employs a science-based modeling approach and stakeholder engagement to develop a comprehensive oyster management plan, integrating environmental science and public input.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but supports environmental sustainability which can benefit communities.

Title: Baltimore City – Alcoholic Beverages – License Extensions
Synopsis: Extending until July 1, 2025, the expiration date of certain alcoholic beverages licenses in Baltimore City that are issued for certain areas for certain transferal and renewal purposes under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill extends the expiration dates of certain alcoholic beverage licenses in Baltimore City until July 1, 2025, allowing transfers and renewals under specific conditions, including community agreements and safety measures.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Department or relevant local licensing authority
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, Baltimore City residents, community associations, local businesses
innovative_summary: The bill employs community engagement and safety measures as conditions for license extensions, integrating community input into licensing processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing and community safety.

Title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Academic Program Approval and Institutional Mission Statements - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor, the Department of Commerce, and the Maryland Higher Education Commission to each have a certain staff member who performs certain duties related to defining, identifying, and compiling data regarding the workforce needs in the State; requiring the Commission to establish a Program Review Process Advisory Council; authorizing the Commission or an institution of higher education to file an objection to implementation of a proposed online program under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Higher Education Commission and related agencies to improve data collection and collaboration on workforce needs, establish a program review process, and develop a grant fund to support new collaborative graduate programs. It also updates procedures for academic program approval, mission statement review, and online program oversight, with a focus on emerging workforce needs and historically Black colleges and universities.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Higher education institutions, students, workforce, historically Black colleges and universities
innovative_summary: The bill employs new collaborative approaches, data-driven planning, and a dedicated grant fund to foster innovative graduate programs aligned with workforce needs, including online and emerging fields.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by aligning higher education with workforce needs, improving access, and supporting historically Black colleges.

Title: Electricity – Tariffs, Distributed Energy Resources, and Electric Distribution System Support Services (Distributed Renewable Integration and Vehicle Electrification (DRIVE) Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a certain electric company to file certain time-of-use tariffs with the Public Service Commission by July 1, 2025; requiring a certain electric company to attempt to achieve a certain enrollment target for certain tariffs by January 1, 2028; authorizing the Commission to require the automatic enrollment of certain customers in a time-of-use tariff on an opt-out basis; requiring the Commission to certain adopt regulations on or before May 1, 2025; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes programs and regulations to promote the integration of distributed energy resources, time-of-use tariffs, and electric vehicle support services in Maryland, including pilot programs for system support and incentives for renewable energy systems.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Electric utility customers, renewable energy owners, low- and moderate-income households, electric vehicle owners
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches such as pilot programs, temporary tariffs, and performance-based incentives to integrate distributed energy resources and promote beneficial electrification.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to renewable energy and reducing energy costs for low- and moderate-income households.

Title: Health Insurance - Breast and Lung Cancer Screening - Coverage Requirements
Synopsis: Including image-guided breast biopsy in the definition of "supplemental breast examination" for the purpose of certain provisions of law requiring insurers, health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for supplemental breast examinations; clarifying that coverage requirements for lung cancer screening apply to follow-up diagnostic imaging; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance plans in Maryland to cover certain breast and lung cancer screening procedures without requiring prior authorization, and clarifies coverage details for supplemental breast examinations and follow-up diagnostic imaging for lung cancer.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Individuals with health insurance in Maryland, particularly those at risk for breast and lung cancer
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes coverage requirements for cancer screenings and eliminates prior authorization for certain diagnostic procedures, streamlining access to essential health services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses insurance coverage policies for cancer screening.

Title: Clean Water Commerce Account - Contracts for the Purchase of Environmental Outcomes
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment, in entering into a certain contract under the Clean Water Commerce Account for the purchase of an environmental outcome, to allow for nonuniform payment schedules for certain purposes; and authorizing the Department to require a certain payment or certain financial protections for contracts of a certain size to ensure certain outcomes.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Clean Water Commerce Account, which funds projects aimed at reducing nitrogen loads in support of Chesapeake Bay cleanup efforts. It allows for flexible payment schedules and financial incentives for projects that meet environmental outcomes, with contracts lasting up to 20 years.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Environmental project owners, Maryland residents, Chesapeake Bay ecosystem
innovative_summary: The bill introduces flexible payment schedules and financial incentives for environmental projects, including performance-based payments and financial protections, which are innovative approaches to funding environmental outcomes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on environmental outcomes and funding mechanisms, with no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages - License Applications - Notice
Synopsis: Altering a certain notice requirement before the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County may approve an application for an alcoholic beverages license; and authorizing the Board to fulfill the notice requirement by posting online notice of an application hearing for an alcoholic beverages license at least 14 days before the application hearing date.
bill_summary: The bill allows the Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners to fulfill the notice requirement for alcohol license applications by posting online a notice of the application hearing at least 14 days before the hearing, instead of only publishing notices in newspapers.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, Baltimore County residents, local businesses
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an online posting option for license application notices, replacing some newspaper notices, which is a modern approach to public notification.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Manufacturers and Dealers - Delivery of Vehicles
Synopsis: Establishing that certain requirements for motor vehicle manufacturers, distributors, and factory branches to deliver new motor vehicles to licensed dealers apply after receipt of an electronic order.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for motor vehicle manufacturers, distributors, and factory branches to deliver new vehicles to licensed dealers, including rules about delivery after receipt of an electronic order or allocation acceptance, and mandates fair allocation systems and transparency.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant motor vehicle regulatory agency
stakeholders: Motor vehicle manufacturers, distributors, factory branches, licensed vehicle dealers, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces transparency and fairness in vehicle allocation and delivery processes, including disclosure of allocation methods and fair system requirements, which are relatively innovative approaches in the automotive distribution sector.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on automotive industry regulations.

Title: Economic Development - Tourism Zones - Designation and Benefits
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipality to designate, by law, an area within that political subdivision as a tourism zone under certain circumstances; providing that the designation of an area as a tourism zone may not preclude the area from also being designated as an arts and entertainment district; authorizing a county or municipality to exempt from the admissions and amusement tax gross receipts from certain admissions or amusement charges levied in a tourism zone; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the designation of tourism zones within Maryland counties and municipalities, allowing for tax exemptions and credits for qualifying tourism enterprises within these zones to promote travel and tourism development.
responsible_party: Local governments of Maryland counties and municipalities, and the Maryland State Comptroller for notifications
stakeholders: Tourism businesses, local governments, and visitors within designated tourism zones
innovative_summary: The bill employs targeted tax incentives and zone designations to stimulate tourism development, which is a common approach but tailored to local economic growth strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily focuses on tourism development and tax incentives for businesses.

Title: School Leadership Training Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the school leadership training program developed by the State Department of Education and the Accountability and Implementation Board to require that the State Superintendent, county superintendents, and the chair and vice chair of the State Board, a county board, and the Accountability and Implementation Board complete the training; combining two leadership trainings into a single training; and providing for the content of the school leadership training.
bill_summary: The bill requires the inclusion of a school leadership course or program in employment contracts for the State Superintendent, county superintendents, and the Chief Executive Officer of Baltimore City Schools, starting July 1, 2024. It also establishes a school leadership training program for education leaders and members of education boards, emphasizing evidence-based, cohort-based, and job-embedded training, with options for virtual participation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and the Accountability and Implementation Board
stakeholders: State and county education leaders, school principals, and education board members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, evidence-based, cohort–based, and job-embedded approach to leadership training, with virtual options, which is a modern and collaborative approach to government training programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by improving school leadership and educational quality, which can lead to better student outcomes.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Public Education Campaign on Prostate, Lung, and Breast Cancer Prevention
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop and implement a 3-year public education campaign on prostate, lung, and breast cancer prevention that targets communities disproportionately impacted by prostate, lung, and breast cancer on or before December 1, 2026; requiring the Department to implement the public education campaign on or before January 1, 2027; requiring the Governor to appropriate, in certain fiscal years, certain funding to the Department for the public information campaign from the Cigarette Restitution Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to develop and implement a three-year public education campaign focused on prostate, lung, and breast cancer prevention, targeting communities disproportionately impacted by these cancers. It includes collaboration with healthcare providers and organizations, and allocates funding from the Cigarette Restitution Fund.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Communities disproportionately impacted by prostate, lung, and breast cancer in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted community outreach, partnerships with healthcare providers, and accessible communication strategies to improve cancer prevention awareness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving health awareness and access to preventive services in impacted communities.

Title: Electricity - Offshore Wind Projects - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to open a revised Round 2 proceeding on June 1, 2024, to evaluate certain offshore wind projects; prohibiting the Commission from approving an application for an offshore wind project unless the application includes commitments for in-State expenditures and investments; requiring the Commission to develop a certain plan to include a schedule of offshore wind energy procurements and proposed amounts of offshore wind energy for procurement through 2031; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the evaluation, approval, and procurement of offshore wind projects in Maryland, including setting goals for capacity, establishing procedures for project revisions, and creating a plan to reach 8,500 MW of offshore wind energy by 2031. It also authorizes the Department of General Services to enter into power purchase agreements for offshore wind energy and associated credits, with specific requirements for project approval, community benefits, and labor standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of General Services and Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Offshore wind project developers, Maryland residents, local businesses, environmental groups, and workers in the renewable energy sector
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to offshore wind development, including procurement processes, project revisions, community benefits, and labor standards, integrating federal funding considerations and environmental impact mitigation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting local economic development and job creation through offshore wind projects.

Title: Cosmetologists - Esthetic Services - Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "provide esthetic services" to include certain services and to provide that it does not include the diagnosis of illness, disease, or injury or performing ablation of the dermis or hypodermis.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of 'provide esthetic services' for cosmetologists in Maryland, expanding the scope of services included and clarifying exclusions such as diagnosis and ablation procedures. It takes effect on October 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists
stakeholders: Cosmetologists, esthetic service providers, and consumers of esthetic services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates the legal definition of esthetic services to include new procedures and clarifies exclusions, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly updates professional definitions and scope of practice.

Title: Maryland Department of Health and Department of Aging - Earned Income Tax Credit - Distribution of Information and Training
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop a process for providing information about the availability of the State's earned income tax credits to individuals enrolled or participating in certain programs or services, or potential enrollees in certain programs, administered by the Maryland Department of Health; and requiring the Department of Aging to provide training to the Maryland Access Point network to increase awareness of the availability of the State's earned income tax credit.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland health and aging departments to distribute information about the state's earned income tax credit to individuals enrolled in or eligible for certain programs, and to provide training to increase awareness of the tax credit through the Maryland Access Point network.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Department of Aging
stakeholders: Individuals enrolled in or eligible for health and aging programs in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated information distribution and training approach to increase awareness of the state's earned income tax credit among program participants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing awareness of tax credits that can support low-income families.

Title: Real Property - Recordation of Instrument With False Information - Penalties and Actions to Quiet Title
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from recording a deed or other instrument that the person knows contains false information; establishing a 3-year limitation on when a prosecution for a violation of the Act may be commenced; establishing a fine not to exceed $500 for a violation of the Act; and authorizing a court to award certain costs and attorney's fees in an action to quiet title if the action or a defense to an action is based on the alleged recordation of a deed containing false information.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits recording deeds or instruments with false information, establishes penalties for such violations, and clarifies procedures and costs related to quiet title actions, including a three-year statute of limitations for offenses under the false information recording law.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and Maryland Department of Real Property (implied)
stakeholders: Property owners, potential buyers, real estate professionals, and legal entities involved in property transactions in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces stricter penalties for recording false property information and clarifies legal procedures for quiet title actions, employing legal reforms but not new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on property law and recordation practices.

Title: Land Use - Southern Maryland Code Counties - Subdivision Regulations - Property Dedication and Fee
Synopsis: Authorizing a Southern Maryland code county to provide in the county's subdivision regulations for a dedication of real property for recreation, or the payment of a fee in lieu of dedication, to be used by the county for the purchase, development, and improvement of real property for recreational facilities.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Southern Maryland code counties to include in their subdivision regulations provisions for property dedication or fees in lieu of dedication for recreational purposes.
responsible_party: Southern Maryland code counties' local government or planning departments
stakeholders: Residents and developers in Southern Maryland counties, recreational facility users, local government planning agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible approach allowing counties to choose between property dedication or fees for recreational development, which is a common practice but tailored here for specific counties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly pertains to land use regulations for recreational facilities.

Title: Division of Parole and Probation – Private Home Detention Monitoring – Earned Compliance Credits
Synopsis: Authorizing individuals under supervision by a private home detention monitoring agency to receive earned compliance credits; requiring a private home detention monitoring agency to provide a report of an individual's compliance to the Division of Parole and Probation during the monitoring period; and establishing certain minimum elements to be included in the report.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes individuals under private home detention supervision to earn compliance credits that can reduce their supervision period, establishes reporting requirements for private home detention agencies, and allocates savings from these credits.
responsible_party: Division of Parole and Probation
stakeholders: Supervised individuals on probation, parole, or mandatory release monitored by private agencies, and the criminal justice system in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a system of earned compliance credits for supervised individuals, utilizing automation and private agencies to incentivize compliance and potentially reduce supervision periods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce recidivism and support reintegration, which can indirectly impact child poverty.

Title: Allegany County - Alcoholic Beverages - Underage Employees
Synopsis: Lowering, from 18 to 16 years of age, the minimum age of an individual that may be employed by a license holder in Allegany County.
bill_summary: The bill alters the minimum age for employment by license holders in Allegany County to 16 years old and specifies age requirements for selling or serving alcohol.
responsible_party: Allegany County licensing authorities
stakeholders: Underage individuals seeking employment, alcohol license holders, and the local community in Allegany County
innovative_summary: The bill updates employment age requirements for alcohol-related jobs in Allegany County, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting employment age regulations.

Title: Public Health - Maryland Commission on Health Equity and Commission on Public Health - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Commission on Health Equity to develop and monitor the statewide health equity plan required under a cooperative grant funding agreement with the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation; requiring the Maryland Commission on Health Equity to coordinate with the Maryland Department of Health and the Health Services Cost Review Commission when establishing a certain advisory committee; and altering the reporting requirements for the Commission on Public Health.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Commission on Health Equity to develop and monitor a statewide health equity plan, coordinate with relevant agencies, and report on progress. It also revises the composition, duties, and reporting requirements of the Commission on Public Health.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission on Health Equity and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, especially underserved and minority communities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, multi-sectoral approach to health equity, including data collection, collaboration, and development of a statewide health equity plan, utilizing new data standards and advisory committees.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by addressing social determinants of health and reducing disparities affecting children.

Title: Housing and Community Development – Continuing the CORE Partnership Fund – Extension
Synopsis: Repealing the termination of the Continuing the CORE Partnership Fund; and requiring the Governor to include an appropriation in the annual budget bill for fiscal year 2026 and each fiscal year thereafter of $50,000,000 to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination date of the Continuing the CORE Partnership Fund, which is used to assist in removing blighted property in Baltimore City, and increases the annual funding allocations for the fund from 2024 onward.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore City, local government, housing advocates
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to urban blight reduction through dedicated funding and collaboration with local authorities, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve living conditions and neighborhood stability, which can contribute to reducing child poverty.

Title: Health Insurance - Appeals and Grievances Process - Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring carriers to report additional data on the number of members entitled to health care benefits under a policy, plan, or certificate and the number of clean claims for reimbursement processed by a carrier to Maryland Health Commissioner.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance carriers in Maryland to report detailed data on members and claims, and establishes a workgroup to study the appeals and grievances process for health insurance claims, with a report due by December 31, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration and the Office of the Attorney General's Health Education and Advocacy Unit
stakeholders: Consumers of health benefit plans, health insurance carriers, and the Maryland state government
innovative_summary: The bill employs data reporting and analysis, and establishes a workgroup to study and improve the appeals and grievances process, including exploring the use of artificial intelligence.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve access and fairness in health insurance appeals, which can indirectly benefit children in affected families.

Title: Howard County Agricultural Preservation Advisory Board - Term Length - Alteration Ho. Co. 15-24
Synopsis: Limiting the term of a member serving on the agricultural preservation advisory board in Howard County to 3 years; and authorizing members currently serving on the agricultural preservation advisory board in Howard County to complete their terms.
bill_summary: This bill changes the term length for members of the Howard County Agricultural Preservation Advisory Board to 3 years, limits members to two consecutive terms, and allows current members to complete their existing terms.
responsible_party: Howard County government
stakeholders: Farmers, land preservation advocates, and residents of Howard County interested in agricultural land preservation
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward approach to limit term lengths and promote fresh perspectives on the advisory board, without employing new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on land preservation governance.

Title: Health Insurance - Hearing Aids for Adults - Coverage
Synopsis: Requiring insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations that provide certain health insurance benefits under certain insurance policies or contracts to provide certain coverage for certain hearing aids for adults; authorizing a limit on the benefit payable of $1,400 per hearing aid every 36 months; and authorizing an insured or enrollee to choose a certain hearing aid and pay a certain amount for the hearing aid without financial or contractual penalty to the provider of the hearing aid.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance providers in Maryland to cover hearing aids for both minors and adults, with specific provisions for coverage limits and the ability for individuals to pay extra for higher-cost hearing aids. It also specifies that hearing aids must be prescribed, fitted, and dispensed by licensed audiologists or audiologists.
responsible_party: Maryland health insurance providers, including insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations
stakeholders: Individuals requiring hearing aids, including children and adults covered under health insurance plans in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program standardizes coverage for hearing aids, including for adults, and allows individuals to pay extra for higher-quality devices, which is a notable approach to expanding access and choice.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve quality of life for children with hearing impairments, which could contribute to reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: Wicomico County - Alcoholic Beverages - Monopoly of Liquor Control Board and Dispensary - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the monopoly of the Liquor Control Board for Wicomico County and its dispensaries on the sale and distribution of certain liquor at wholesale in the county; authorizing the holders of certain alcoholic beverages licenses to purchase alcoholic beverages from a dispensary or a wholesaler; repealing the prohibition on delivery of certain liquor by certain wholesalers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the liquor control monopoly in Wicomico County, allowing private license holders to purchase alcohol from dispensaries or wholesalers, and modifies regulations on alcohol sales and distribution.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Liquor Control Board and State of Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Authority
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents of Wicomico County, and alcohol retailers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a shift from government-controlled alcohol sales to a more privatized system, allowing license holders to purchase from dispensaries or wholesalers, and relaxes some restrictions on alcohol sales and distribution.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting alcohol sales regulations.

Title: Wicomico County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B Beer, Wine, and Liquor Licenses - Purchases From Licensed Wholesalers and Self-Distribution
Synopsis: Authorizing a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license holder to purchase liquor for retail sale from a licensed wholesaler; and authorizing a Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant license holder that has been issued a Class 9 limited distillery license to sell certain products manufactured under the distillery license in a manner consistent with the underlying Class B license for on- and off-premises consumption.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain license holders in Wicomico County to purchase liquor from licensed wholesalers, allows a limited distillery license holder to sell and produce specific spirits under certain conditions, and permits a Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant license holder with a Class 9 distillery license to sell products manufactured under that license.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, distillery operators, restaurants, and consumers in Wicomico County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new licensing and sales provisions for distilleries and licensed establishments, including allowing distillery products to be sold at retail and in conjunction with restaurant licenses, which is a relatively innovative approach to local alcohol regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns licensing and sales regulations for alcohol.

Title: Howard County - Payment in Lieu of Taxes Agreements - Moderate Income Housing Ho. Co. 8-24
Synopsis: Authorizing certain owners of real property and the governing body of Howard County to enter into payment in lieu of taxes agreements for maintaining a certain number of moderate income housing units at the property; requiring the County Executive of Howard County to publish on the county's website the methodology used to calculate the negotiated payment amount under a payment in lieu of taxes agreement authorized under the Act and to reevaluate the methodology at least once every 5 years; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Howard County to enter into agreements with property owners to maintain moderate income housing units in exchange for property tax exemptions, with a focus on transparent calculation of negotiated payments and periodic reevaluation of the methodology.
responsible_party: Howard County Government
stakeholders: Moderate income households, property owners, Howard County residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a transparent, periodic reevaluation process for negotiated payments in tax agreements for moderate income housing, employing a methodology published online.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to increase affordable housing options, which can help reduce child poverty by improving housing stability and access to resources.

Title: Natural Resources - Gwynns Falls State Park - Focus Group, Advisory Committee, and Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources and Baltimore City to convene focus group meetings on the establishment of the Gwynns Falls State Park with community members and stakeholders that reside or operate in the vicinity of the proposed State park; requiring the Department and Baltimore City to establish a stakeholder advisory committee; and requiring the Department to submit a report to the General Assembly by December 1, 2025, on properties suitable for inclusion in the State park and certain funding requirements.
bill_summary: The bill establishes Gwynns Falls State Park as a partnership park between the Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Baltimore City, including conducting surveys, focus groups, and creating an advisory committee to develop a plan for park improvements and management.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Baltimore City
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore City, local community organizations, environmental and historic preservation groups, and park visitors.
innovative_summary: The program employs community engagement through surveys, focus groups, and advisory committees to collaboratively develop and manage a new state park, integrating community input and partnerships.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve community access to outdoor recreation and natural resources, which can contribute to reducing child poverty.

Title: State Board of Cosmetologists - Membership - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the State Board of Cosmetologists by adding one licensed esthetician and decreasing the number of consumer members from two to one.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership structure of the Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists, including the addition of a consumer member who is a member of the general public and not subject to regulation by the Board.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists
stakeholders: Cosmetologists, estheticians, cosmetology school educators or owners, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a consumer member to the Board, enhancing public representation and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Brewery and Distillery Licenses
Synopsis: Establishing in Frederick County a Class DBR brewery license and a Class DDS distillery permit; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue to the holder of a certain brewery license a Class DBR license to sell certain amounts of beer for on-premises consumption; authorizing the Board to issue to the holder of a certain distillery license a Class DDS permit to sell certain amounts of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new licensing options in Frederick County for breweries and distilleries, including the creation of Class DBR brewery licenses and Class DDS distillery permits, which allow on-premises sales of beer and spirits, respectively.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Breweries, distilleries, and consumers in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new licensing categories that streamline and expand on-site alcohol sales for breweries and distilleries, employing regulatory innovations to facilitate local alcohol commerce.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns licensing and sales regulations for alcohol establishments.

Title: Education - School Employee Antibias Training - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to develop guidelines for an antibias training program for school employees; requiring each county board of education to offer training based on the guidelines;  requiring each county board, every other year, to provide antibias training to each public school employee whose job duties include frequent interaction with students; requiring that antibias training be job-embedded, paid professional development training that is provided during nonteaching time; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates annual antibias training for school employees and nonpublic school staff in Maryland, focusing on preventing antisemitism and Islamophobia. It requires the development of guidelines for such training, updates to existing programs, and a study on Holocaust education in schools.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: School employees, students, teachers, and staff in Maryland public and participating nonpublic schools
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, evidence-based approach to antibias training, including guidelines development, periodic updates, and integration of lessons from real incidents, with a focus on cultural responsiveness and inclusivity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by fostering inclusive and respectful school environments, which can improve educational outcomes for marginalized students.

Title: Labor and Employment - Noncompete and Conflict of Interest Clauses for Veterinary and Health Care Professionals and Study of the Health Care Market
Synopsis: Applying to certain veterinary and health care professionals certain provisions of law stating that certain noncompete and conflict of interest provisions in certain employment contracts are null and void as being against the public policy of the State; establishing certain prohibitions regarding noncompete and conflict of interest provisions for certain health care employment contracts and similar documents and agreements; and requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to study certain issues related to the health care market in the State.
bill_summary: The bill restricts noncompete and conflict of interest clauses in employment contracts for veterinary and health care professionals, making them void if they restrict employment or self-employment in certain conditions. It also requires a study on the impact of private equity on the health care market in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Veterinary and health care professionals, patients, health care providers, and the health care market in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs legal restrictions on noncompete clauses specific to health care and veterinary professionals, and mandates a comprehensive study on private equity's impact on the health care system, which is a proactive approach to health care policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on employment law and health care market analysis.

Title: Public Schools - Public School Construction - Funding and Administration
Synopsis: Establishing that the State share of eligible costs for certain school construction projects that meet certain criteria is 100%; repealing the provision of law that would have repealed the School Safety Grant Program on June 30, 2026; reducing the appropriation for the Nancy K. Kopp Public School Facilities Priority Fund to $70,000,000 annually beginning in fiscal 2027; altering the uses of the Fund, giving the highest priority to schools with a severe facility issue; establishing the Workgroup on the Assessment and Funding of School Facilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates and extends funding and administrative provisions for public school construction in Maryland, including establishing new funding mechanisms, repealing certain previous programs, and creating a workgroup to assess and improve school facilities funding.
responsible_party: Interagency Commission on School Construction
stakeholders: Public school students, school staff, and local school districts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new workgroup to assess school facilities and potentially incorporate new assessment methods into funding decisions, and establishes a dedicated fund for addressing severe school facility issues, including the use of artificial intelligence weapon detection systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving school facilities, which can enhance learning environments and safety for students in need.

Title: Electric System Planning - Scope and Funding
Synopsis: Altering the scope of certain policy goals with regard to energy systems; requiring the Public Service Commission to report on certain projects relating to certain goals; altering the scope of certain funds that may be used for certain projects; requiring the Commission to adopt regulations to require investment in certain demand-side reliability and efficiency improvement methods; requiring that certain regulations adopted and orders issued by the Commission by December 31, 2025, be developed in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's electric system planning policies to focus on reducing greenhouse gases, increasing renewable energy, improving system resiliency, and promoting energy efficiency. It requires the Public Service Commission to report on progress, encourages pursuit of federal funds for these goals, and mandates regulations to support demand-side improvements and fair labor standards on federally funded projects.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission and Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Electric utilities, residents, vulnerable communities, and workers involved in federally funded electric projects
innovative_summary: The bill promotes a comprehensive, data-driven approach to modernizing the electric grid with emphasis on federal funding, stakeholder participation, and demand-side solutions, integrating new technologies and policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by promoting clean energy, energy efficiency, and equitable access to infrastructure, which can lead to economic and environmental benefits for vulnerable communities.

Title: Civil Rights - Discrimination Based on Protected Characteristics and Reproductive Freedom
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law prohibiting discrimination based on certain protected characteristics to include prohibitions on discrimination based on sexual orientation, gender identity, race, religious beliefs, marital status, and disability; and withdrawing and repealing Chapter 244 of the Acts of the General Assembly of 2023.
bill_summary: The bill broadens anti-discrimination laws in Maryland to explicitly include protections based on sexual orientation, gender identity, race, religious beliefs, marital status, and disability across various sectors such as employment, housing, education, health care, and public utilities. It repeals a previous chapter from 2023 and establishes new legal standards to prevent discrimination.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, various agencies including the Maryland Department of Labor, Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, Maryland State Department of Education, and others involved in enforcement and compliance.
stakeholders: Individuals protected under anti-discrimination laws, including employees, students, consumers, and residents of Maryland, especially those belonging to marginalized groups based on sexual orientation, gender identity, race, religion, disability, and other protected categories.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to anti-discrimination, explicitly including sexual orientation and gender identity in all relevant legal protections, and mandates consistent enforcement across multiple sectors, which is a progressive step in legal protections.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty by ensuring equal access to opportunities and protections, thereby promoting economic stability for marginalized families.

Title: Montgomery County – State’s Attorney’s Office Personnel – Application of County Personnel Laws and Collective Bargaining MC 12–24
Synopsis: Establishing the right of certain employees of the Office of the State's Attorney in Montgomery County to organize and collectively bargain in accordance with certain personnel law governing county employees; establishing that employees of the Office of the State's Attorney are subject to the county merit system law and personnel regulations; establishing certain requirements related to collective bargaining for employees of the Office; etc.
bill_summary: The bill grants collective bargaining rights to employees of the Montgomery County State's Attorney's Office, designates the County Executive and the State's Attorney as the respective employers for different employment terms, and establishes procedures for negotiations, agreements, and dispute resolution.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Government and Montgomery County State's Attorney's Office
stakeholders: Employees of the Montgomery County State's Attorney's Office, Montgomery County government, and the residents of Montgomery County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured collective bargaining process for a government office, aligning it with county personnel laws and creating a unified approach to negotiations and employment terms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns employment rights and procedures within a government office.

Title: Dorchester County - Definition of Public School Employee - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "public school employee" to include supervisory noncertificated employees in Dorchester County for purposes of collective bargaining.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of 'public school employee' in Dorchester County to include supervisory noncertificated employees for collective bargaining purposes.
responsible_party: Dorchester County Public Schools or relevant local education authority
stakeholders: Supervisory noncertificated employees in Dorchester County, school districts, and potentially other public school employees involved in collective bargaining
innovative_summary: The bill expands the definition of public school employees to include supervisory noncertificated staff, which is a targeted change to improve collective bargaining rights.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects employment classifications and collective bargaining rights.

Title: Education - Blueprint for Maryland's Future - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Department of Education to award funding for a new Judy Center or Family Support Center for planning and development under a certain circumstance; requiring the State Board to approve certain specifications for teachers and administrators relating to time spent in the classroom and time spent on other teacher activities; altering certain requirements relating to student-to-classroom personnel ratios and funding timelines for the Prekindergarten Expansion Grant Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various changes to Maryland's education policies, including funding for new Judy Centers, adjustments to teacher certification and time allocation, expansion of prekindergarten programs, and establishing pathways for post-secondary readiness. It also includes evaluation and reporting requirements for the implementation of the Blueprint for Maryland's Future.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, families, educators, and school systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to early childhood education, teacher development, and postsecondary pathways, integrating new funding models, program expansions, and evaluation mechanisms, which represent innovative approaches to education reform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by expanding access to early childhood education and support services in underserved communities.

Title: Emergency Services - Funding
Synopsis: Increasing the motor vehicle registration emergency medical system surcharge for certain motor vehicles; providing for the distribution of revenues derived from the surcharge; altering certain provisions of law related to the Maryland Trauma Physician Services Fund; increasing the fines for certain violations related to driving while impaired; requiring the Governor, beginning in fiscal year 2026, to include an annual appropriation to the Senator William H. Amoss Fire, Rescue, and Ambulance Fund of at least $16,500,000; etc.
bill_summary: The bill increases funding and surcharges for trauma centers and emergency medical services in Maryland, allocates grants to pediatric trauma centers, and enhances penalties for impaired driving, including driving while impaired or under the influence of drugs, especially when transporting minors.
responsible_party: Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems and Maryland Trauma Physician Services Fund
stakeholders: Trauma patients, trauma centers, emergency medical services, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining increased funding, targeted grants, and stricter penalties to improve trauma care and reduce impaired driving, integrating financial incentives with legal enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving trauma care and reducing injuries from impaired driving, especially involving minors.

Title: Howard County Public Schools - Differences in Capital Budget Proposals - Report Ho. Co. 16-24
Synopsis: Requiring the Howard County Board of Education, under certain circumstances, to publish on the website of the Howard County public school system a report that details the differences between the Howard County Superintendent of Schools' proposed capital budget and the capital budget approved by the Howard County Board of Education and the detailed rationale for each difference; requiring the Howard County Board of Education to submit the report to the General Assembly; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Howard County Board of Education and the Superintendent of Schools to publish reports on their websites and submit them to the General Assembly whenever there are differences between proposed and approved capital budgets or capital improvement programs.
responsible_party: Howard County Board of Education and Howard County Superintendent of Schools
stakeholders: Howard County public school students, staff, and community members
innovative_summary: The bill promotes transparency by mandating public posting and reporting of budget differences, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may improve transparency and resource allocation.

Title: Early Childhood Education - Publicly Funded Prekindergarten Programs - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering staff qualifications in eligible prekindergarten programs; authorizing a county board to apply for funding to lease space for  prekindergarten programs; establishing an early childhood educator career ladder; requiring the Department of Education to establish prekindergarten provider hubs; requiring the Department to distribute a list of eligible private prekindergarten providers; requiring the Governor to appropriate in fiscal year 2026 an amount that is at least equal to the amount appropriated in fiscal year 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates and expands Maryland's publicly funded prekindergarten programs by establishing new staff qualifications, increasing private provider slots, creating an early childhood educator career ladder, and establishing provider hubs and support programs to improve quality and access.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Children aged 3 and 4, families, prekindergarten providers, educators, and local education agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured career ladder for early childhood educators, provider hubs for coordination, and a phased increase in private provider slots, employing new approaches to improve quality and access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to quality prekindergarten for low-income children and supporting workforce development.

Title: Howard County Task Force to Study Revenue Options for School Capital Needs Ho. Co. 18-24
Synopsis: Establishing the Howard County Task Force to Study Revenue Options for School Capital Needs to identify capital needs of Howard County Public Schools and study options for closing any identified funding gaps; requiring the Howard County Council to submit a resolution to the Howard County Delegation to the General Assembly if the county council makes a certain determination; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Howard County members of the House of Delegates and the Senate by October 31, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Howard County Task Force to study revenue options for funding the capital needs of Howard County Public Schools, including identifying funding gaps and recommending solutions.
responsible_party: Howard County government and Howard County Public Schools
stakeholders: Howard County Public School students, families, and residents
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach involving multiple stakeholders and explores various revenue sources, including potential new taxes, to fund school capital needs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by improving school infrastructure and resources, which can benefit students from low-income families.

Title: Arts Incubator Workgroup - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Arts Incubator Workgroup to study how arts and cultural institutions can support local artists; requiring the Workgroup to submit to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 1, 2025, a preliminary report on its findings, including research, case studies, and examples of approaches used to support artists in other areas; and requiring the Workgroup to submit a final report by October 1, 2025, with recommendations on any necessary budget, facilities, or in-kind services to support local artists.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Arts Incubator Workgroup to study how arts and cultural institutions can support local artists, and requires the group to submit preliminary and final reports with recommendations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Arts Council
stakeholders: Local artists, arts and cultural institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated workgroup to research and recommend new ways for arts institutions to support local artists, including studying approaches used in other areas.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to support local artists, which could indirectly benefit communities including children, but it is primarily a research and recommendation effort.

Title: Soil Conservation Districts - Small Ponds - Plan Review Fees
Synopsis: Authorizing a soil conservation district to recommend a fee system to cover the cost of reviewing plans for small ponds; establishing that any fees collected under the Act shall be supplemental to county and State funds; requiring a soil conservation district, in developing a fee system for small pond plans, to determine for the succeeding year the reasonable cost of reviewing the plans; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes soil conservation districts in Maryland to recommend a fee system to cover the costs of reviewing plans for small ponds, including exempt ponds, and establishes procedures for implementing these fees.
responsible_party: Soil Conservation Districts and local governing bodies in Maryland
stakeholders: Landowners, soil conservation districts, environmental agencies, and residents affected by pond and waterway management
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured fee system for plan review services provided by soil conservation districts, including for small ponds, which is a new approach to funding these services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental management and local government procedures.

Title: Professional and Volunteer Firefighter Innovative Cancer Screening Technologies Program - Funding
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor, beginning in fiscal year 2025, to include at least $500,000 in the annual budget for the Professional and Volunteer Firefighter Innovative Cancer Screening Technologies Program.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes funding for the Professional and Volunteer Firefighter Innovative Cancer Screening Technologies Program, increasing annual budget allocations starting from at least $100,000 in 2021-2024 to at least $500,000 from 2025 onward.
responsible_party: State of Maryland (Governor's Office)
stakeholders: Firefighters and fire service organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily allocates funding for an existing program; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is not directly aimed at reducing child poverty.

Title: State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists - Appointment of Members
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to appoint the licensed audiologist members to the State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists from a list submitted by the Maryland Academy of Audiology rather than by the Board.
bill_summary: The bill changes the appointment process for licensed audiologist members on the Maryland State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech–Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists, requiring the Governor to appoint members from a list submitted by the Maryland Academy of Audiology.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Governor and the Maryland Academy of Audiology
stakeholders: Licensed audiologists and related professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new appointment process by requiring the Governor to select audiologist members from a list submitted by a professional organization, streamlining and formalizing the appointment process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Uninsured Driving Penalties - Funding for the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund, Driver Education, and Transportation to Field Trips
Synopsis: Altering the penalty for failing to maintain certain required security for certain motor vehicles and the distribution of the revenue derived from the penalties; establishing the Driver Education in Public High Schools Grant Program to provide grants to public high schools and nonprofit organizations to assist public schools in offering driver education courses; establishing the State-Aided Institutions Field Trip Grant Program to assist public schools in transporting students to field trips at State-aided educational institutions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes programs to fund driver education in public high schools and transportation for school field trips to state-aided institutions, funded by fines from uninsured vehicle security lapses. It also modifies penalties for uninsured driving and allocates revenue from these penalties to various funds, including the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund, driver education, and transportation programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Public high school students, non-profit organizations offering driver education, public school students attending field trips, vehicle owners with lapses in required security
innovative_summary: The bill employs a funding mechanism based on fines from uninsured vehicle lapses to support driver education and transportation programs, integrating enforcement revenue into educational and safety initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The programs have the potential to improve access to driver education and transportation for students in low-income areas, thereby supporting youth mobility and safety.

Title: Maryland Entertainment Council - Alterations
Synopsis: Reestablishing the Maryland Entertainment Council to be the Maryland Entertainment Industry Council within the Department of Commerce to assess the State's existing assets, study certain existing State programs, agencies, and offices, and make recommendations on the development of a strategic plan for Maryland's future in the entertainment industry; and requiring the Council to submit an annual report by January 1 each year and a report of certain recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill reestablishes the Maryland Entertainment Council as the Maryland Entertainment Industry Council within the Department of Commerce.
