It tasks the council with studying Maryland's film, television, and entertainment industry, assessing assets, opportunities, and competitive position, and making recommendations to develop a strategic plan to grow the industry and its economic impact.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Maryland's film, television, and entertainment industry, including creators, workers, and related businesses
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a comprehensive, government-led strategic planning process for Maryland's entertainment industry, including assessments, recommendations, and industry development initiatives, leveraging existing assets and emerging technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly by fostering economic growth and job creation in the entertainment sector.

Title: Education - Armed Services Vocational Aptitude Battery - Student Information
Synopsis: Requiring public schools in the State to notify students taking the ASVAB and parents or guardians of students taking the ASVAB of the option to prohibit the release of a student's ASVAB test scores to military recruiters; and repealing the requirement that certain schools provide certain notice to certain individuals regarding the release of student information and ASVAB test scores.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland public schools to notify students and parents about the option to prevent the release of student ASVAB scores and contact information to military recruiters. It also establishes procedures for students to later choose to release their information if they initially opt out.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students taking the ASVAB and their parents or guardians, military recruiters, and public schools in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a clear notification process and provides students with the option to later release their information, but it does not introduce new technologies or fundamentally new approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns information sharing and opt-out procedures.

Title: State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners - Scope of Practice, Reinstatements, and Examinations by Health Care Providers
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "practice massage therapy" to include, subject to certain education and training requirements, instrument-assisted soft tissue manipulation techniques that enhance or imitate manual techniques; altering the circumstances under which the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners is required to reinstate a license or registration; and requiring the Board to require a licensee or an applicant to submit to an examination by a health care provider under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill updates the scope of practice for massage therapy, including certain techniques, and establishes procedures for license reinstatement and examinations by healthcare providers for massage therapists in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners
stakeholders: Massage therapists, applicants, and licensees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a requirement for examinations by healthcare providers for license applicants or licensees suspected of causing harm, which is a new approach to licensing oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on professional licensing and scope of practice.

Title: State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners - Aiding or Abetting Unauthorized Practice - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from aiding or abetting the unauthorized practice of massage therapy; and providing penalties for a first violation of the Act of a fine of up to $5,000 or imprisonment not to exceed 1 year and for a subsequent offense, a fine of up to $20,000 per day or imprisonment not to exceed 5 years.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits aiding or abetting the unauthorized practice of massage therapy in Maryland, establishes penalties for practicing without a license or registration, and sets fines and imprisonment terms for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners
stakeholders: Massage therapists, individuals seeking massage therapy, regulatory agencies
innovative_summary: The bill primarily enforces existing licensing laws and penalties, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Government - Office of Legislative Audits - Performance Audits
Synopsis: Altering the frequency of certain performance audits of the Board of Liquor License Commissioners for Baltimore City to once every 6 years instead of 4 years, and the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to at least once every 6 years instead of 3 years that are required to be conducted by the Office of Legislative Audits.
bill_summary: The bill changes the frequency of performance audits conducted by the Office of Legislative Audits for certain liquor licensing boards in Maryland, increasing the interval from 3 years to 6 years.
responsible_party: Office of Legislative Audits
stakeholders: Liquor licensing boards in Baltimore City, Prince George's County, and Annapolis
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies audit frequency, which is a procedural change rather than an innovative program or technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Election Law - Campaign Finance Activities - State Treasurer
Synopsis: Prohibiting, during a regular session of the General Assembly, the State Treasurer and a person acting on behalf of the State Treasurer, as to a candidate for federal, State, or local office or certain campaign finance entities, from receiving a contribution, conducting a fund-raising event, soliciting a contribution, or depositing or using any contribution of money that was not deposited prior to the session.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the State Treasurer and persons acting on their behalf from participating in certain campaign finance activities during the regular session of the Maryland General Assembly, including receiving contributions, conducting fundraisers, soliciting contributions, or depositing contributions not made prior to the session.
responsible_party: Maryland State Treasurer's Office
stakeholders: State Treasurer, campaign finance entities, candidates, and the general public interested in campaign finance transparency
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific restrictions on the campaign finance activities of the State Treasurer during legislative sessions, aiming to reduce conflicts of interest and increase transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on campaign finance rules for government officials.

Title: Transportation - Major Change in Bus Service - Publication on Website
Synopsis: Altering the information that the Maryland Transit Administration is required to publish on its website before holding a public hearing on a major service change to include certain demographic information, a summary of any publicly available minutes, records, or documents related to the service change, and a brief statement explaining the reason for the service change; and requiring the Administration to distribute the report to certain officials and entities, including each member of the General Assembly whose district would be impacted.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transit Administration to compile and publish detailed reports on the impacts of proposed bus service reductions or cancellations, including public outreach and analysis, before implementing major service changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Bus riders, community members, local governments, and affected populations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs comprehensive impact analysis, community outreach, and transparency measures, integrating equity and cost-benefit analyses into transit decision-making.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving transit access and equity, but its direct impact is moderate.

Title: Baltimore Regional Water Governance Model Workgroup - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Baltimore Regional Water Governance Model Workgroup to study the regional water governance approach in the Baltimore region; requiring the Governor to include an appropriation of $500,000 in the annual budget bill for the Workgroup; and requiring the Workgroup to report, on or before June 30, 2027, its findings to the Mayor of Baltimore City, the County Executive of Baltimore County, the Governor, and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Baltimore Regional Water Governance Model Workgroup to study and analyze the implementation of a regional water governance approach in the Baltimore area, including equity, financial, legal, operational, and management considerations, and to report findings by June 30, 2027.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Residents and ratepayers in Baltimore City, Baltimore County, and surrounding counties
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative regional governance model, involving independent consultants and comprehensive analysis of equity, legal, financial, and operational factors, which is a relatively innovative approach to regional water management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact vulnerable residents through equity analysis and assistance programs, but its primary focus is on governance and infrastructure.

Title: Forest Conservation Act – Modifications
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "qualified conservation" for purposes of provisions of law related to forest mitigation banks; requiring the Department of Natural Resources to update a certain model local government ordinance by July 1, 2025, and adopt certain regulations relating to forest conservation on or before July 1, 2026; providing that a solar voltaic facilities granted a certificate of public convenience and necessity before July 1, 2023, may not be subject to certain afforestation requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Forest Conservation Act by updating definitions, adjusting requirements for afforestation and conservation, delaying certain provisions' effective dates, and clarifying rules for forest mitigation banks and priority retention areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Developers, local governments, environmental conservation groups, and residents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces updated standards for forest conservation, including the use of technology and new criteria for prioritizing forest retention and mitigation, and updates to technical manuals and regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental and land use regulations.

Title: Bay Restoration Fund - Use of Funds - Municipal Wastewater Facilities - Sunset Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the termination date for certain provisions of law that expand the authorized uses of the Bay Restoration Fund to include certain costs associated with the connection of a property using an on-site sewage disposal system to a certain existing municipal wastewater facility.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset date for provisions that expand the use of the Bay Restoration Fund to include costs related to connecting properties with on-site sewage systems to municipal wastewater facilities, and it details the funding and implementation of these programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Property owners with on-site sewage disposal systems, local governments, environmental agencies, and residents in priority funding areas
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted funding and technical support to upgrade sewage systems and connect properties to municipal wastewater facilities, with a focus on nitrogen removal and environmental health.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on environmental infrastructure and public health.

Title: Real Property Assessments - Notice of Change in Value or Classification - Time Period
Synopsis: Increasing, for taxable year 2024, the time period after which a failure to send a notice of change in value or classification creates an irrebuttable presumption that the prior value or classification of certain real property has not changed.
bill_summary: The bill extends the period during which a failure to send a notice of change in real property value or classification creates an irrebuttable presumption that the value has not changed. Specifically, it increases the deadline from 30 days after January 1 to May 1 for the taxable year beginning after June 30, 2024, but before July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Real property owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal presumption to streamline property assessment processes, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects property assessment notification procedures.

Title: Maryland Children's Health Program - Eligibility and Administration
Synopsis: Altering the eligibility requirements for the Maryland Children's Health Program; and repealing the requirement that the Program be administered, based on the family income of eligible individuals, through the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and managed care organizations or the MCHP premium plan.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the eligibility requirements for the Maryland Children’s Health Program, increasing the family income limit from 200% to 300% of the federal poverty guidelines, and repeals certain administration rules based on income. It also establishes outreach and enrollment initiatives, including school-based outreach and expedited eligibility processes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Children and families in Maryland eligible for or seeking health coverage under the Maryland Children’s Health Program
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive outreach strategy, including school-based programs and streamlined enrollment processes, to increase participation in the health program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by expanding health coverage to more children in low- and moderate-income families.

Title: Horse Racing - Racing Facility Ownership and Construction - Racing Operations
Synopsis: Altering the location, type, and ownership of horse racing facilities that the Maryland Stadium Authority is authorized to finance; increasing the amount of debt that the Maryland Stadium Authority may issue for certain purposes in connection with certain racing facilities; requiring the Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority to prepare certain financial statements; requiring the Authority to submit a copy of any lease of the Pimlico racing facility to the Legislative Policy Committee for review and comment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes financing and development of horse racing facilities in Maryland, including the transfer of ownership of Pimlico Race Course, and establishes programs for racing operations, community development, and workforce housing related to horse racing.
responsible_party: Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority
stakeholders: Horse racing industry, local communities near racing facilities, Maryland residents, workforce development programs
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches by integrating racing facility development with community and workforce development, and establishing financial mechanisms for ongoing support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty through workforce and community development initiatives associated with racing facilities.

Title: Maryland Stadium Authority - Camden Yards Football Sports Facility Special Funds - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Camden Yards Football Sports Facility Capital Works Fund and the Camden Yards Football Sports Facility Emergency Repair Fund as special, nonlapsing funds to be administered by the Maryland Stadium Authority; providing that the purpose of the funds is to enable the Authority to pay all expenses related to capital improvements and repairs at the Camden Yards football sports facility; and requiring the transfer of certain amounts from a certain source into the funds.
bill_summary: The bill establishes two funds for the Camden Yards football sports facility: a Capital Works Fund for capital improvements and repairs, and an Emergency Repair Fund for urgent repairs. It allocates $5 million from bonds to each fund and sets rules for their management and use.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority
stakeholders: Visitors, sports teams, and residents affected by Camden Yards facilities
innovative_summary: The bill creates dedicated funds with specific rules for managing capital and emergency repairs at a major sports facility, including bond proceeds allocation and investment rules.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on infrastructure improvements.

Title: Maryland Protecting Opportunities and Regional Trade (PORT) Act
Synopsis: Establishing the Fallen Transportation Workers Scholarship Program and the Fallen Transportation Workers Scholarship Fund; authorizing the Secretary of Labor to exempt an individual from the requirement to be actively seeking work for unemployment insurance benefits eligibility; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor and the Department of Commerce to establish certain temporary relief programs to provide assistance to individuals and certain entities impacted by a certain closure of the Port of Baltimore; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Fallen Transportation Workers Scholarship Program and Fund to provide tuition assistance to dependents and spouses of transportation workers who died due to work-related accidents after January 1, 2022. It also creates temporary relief programs for individuals and businesses affected by the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge and the reduced operations of the Port of Baltimore, including financial aid and legal recovery efforts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Dependents and spouses of fallen transportation workers, individuals and businesses impacted by the Port of Baltimore collapse and reduced operations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a combination of scholarship programs, temporary relief funds, and legal recovery efforts, integrating existing state agencies and legal mechanisms to address the economic and educational impacts of a transportation infrastructure disaster.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by providing educational scholarships and economic relief to families affected by transportation industry tragedies and disruptions.

Title: Electricity and Gas - Retail Supply - Regulation and Consumer Protection
Synopsis: Altering a certain charge that may be assessed to a public service company; providing for the recovery of certain costs through rates; establishing an energy salesperson license for certain persons that offer or sell electricity supply agreements or gas supply agreements to customers in the State; establishing an energy vendor license for certain persons that provide energy sales services in the State; prohibiting a certain electricity supplier from marketing electricity as green power unless certain conditions are met; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms Maryland's retail energy market by establishing licensing requirements for energy salespersons and vendors, creating a new division within the Public Service Commission for consumer protection, and setting standards for green power marketing and renewable energy credits. It also updates rules for electricity and gas suppliers, including disclosure, marketing, and complaint procedures, and aims to enhance consumer protections and promote renewable energy.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Residential and small commercial electric and gas customers, energy suppliers, energy salespersons, energy vendors, renewable energy producers
innovative_summary: The bill employs new licensing, disclosure, and marketing regulations, and establishes a dedicated division within the Public Service Commission for consumer protection, integrating renewable energy credits and green power claims into market oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting renewable energy and consumer protections, which can lead to lower energy costs and improved services for vulnerable populations.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Expungement - Vendor Contracts
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to include system upgrades required to allow for automated expungement of charges and partial expungement of charges in any vendor contracts being negotiated at a certain time.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes individuals to file for partial expungement of charges even if related charges are not eligible for full expungement, and requires the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to include system upgrades for automated expungement in vendor contracts.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals seeking expungement of criminal charges and related records in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new technology by requiring system upgrades for automated expungement of charges, streamlining the process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to criminal record relief, which can aid in employment and housing opportunities.

Title: Failure to Pay Rent Proceedings - Shielding of Court Records
Synopsis: Requiring the District Court to shield all court records within 60 days after the final resolution of a failure to pay rent proceeding that did not result in a judgment of possession; authorizing the District Court, on motion of a tenant, to shield all court records relating to a failure to pay rent proceeding that results in a judgment of possession under certain circumstances; requiring the Maryland Judiciary to develop and publish on its website a certain form; etc.
bill_summary: This bill restricts landlords from increasing rent solely because of a failure to pay rent judgment and establishes procedures for shielding court records related to failure to pay rent proceedings, especially when no judgment of possession is issued.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Tenants involved in failure to pay rent proceedings in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new process for shielding court records related to failure to pay rent proceedings, including the development of a specific form for petitions, which is a new approach to managing court records and tenant privacy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce long-term adverse effects of eviction proceedings on tenants, which can help mitigate child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Board of License Commissioners
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor, rather than the Mayor and the President of the City Council of Baltimore City, to appoint the members of the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City with the advice and consent of the Senate; authorizing the Governor, rather than the Mayor and the President of the City Council of Baltimore City, to remove a member of the Board for certain infractions; requiring certain members of the Board to be residents of the City or to have served in City government for a minimum of 5 years immediately preceding the appointment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms the appointment, removal, and composition of the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners, including changing the appointing authority to the Governor, and sets residency and service requirements for board members and employees, with a focus on increasing local and qualified representation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Office of the Governor and the Maryland State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Baltimore City, especially those involved in alcohol licensing and regulation
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach to appointing and regulating the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners, emphasizing local residency and service requirements, and aligning ethics and employment standards with state laws.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on governance and regulatory structures for alcohol licensing.

Title: More Opportunities for Career–Focused Students Act of 2024
Synopsis: Requiring each public high school to inform students of certain employment and skills training opportunities in the same manner the school informs students of postsecondary educational options; requiring, when informing certain students about certain career opportunities, each public high school to highlight opportunities in high-skilled careers that do not require completion of a college degree and are in high demand; and requiring a county board to assist public high schools in completing the requirements of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill promotes career-focused education by recognizing vocational certificates, industry certifications, and apprenticeships as equivalent to postsecondary education. It requires high schools to inform students about employment and skills training opportunities, and to facilitate student authorization for sharing information with apprenticeship sponsors and employers. It also provides funding for apprenticeship entrance and certification exams.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public high school students in Maryland, apprenticeship sponsors, employers, and students interested in vocational training
innovative_summary: The bill employs a digital platform to streamline the recognition of vocational and apprenticeship pathways as equivalents to college education, and enhances information sharing and student authorization processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by expanding access to high-demand, high-skill careers without requiring college degrees.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - License Renewal
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to extend the deadline by which a holder of an alcoholic beverages license must file an application for renewal; and extending the expiration date for certain licenses issued by the Board to July 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners to extend renewal deadlines for alcoholic beverage licenses and adjusts expiration dates. It also provides a grace period for licenses that were not renewed between March 5, 2020, and December 31, 2023, allowing them to be renewed until July 1, 2025, if certain conditions are met.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a flexible, administrative approach to license renewal deadlines, providing extensions and grace periods, which is a common regulatory adjustment rather than a new technological or innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses administrative procedures for license renewals.

Title: Hospitals - Care of Infants After Discharge (Safe Sleep Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring a hospital to take certain actions relating to the care of infants as soon as practicable before the hospital discharges an infant after the birth of the infant, including providing oral and written educational resources to the parent or legal guardian on how to provide a safe sleep environment and providing a list of resources available for an infant's parent or legal guardian; requiring each hospital, by January 1, 2025, to establish a process for providing and confirming the receipt of the educational resources; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the development and implementation of a public awareness campaign about safe sleep practices for infants, establishes the Maryland Safe Sleep Certification Program for child care centers, hospitals, and birthing centers, and sets requirements for hospitals to educate parents on safe sleep environments before discharge.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Infants, parents, child care providers, hospitals, birthing centers, local health departments
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining public awareness campaigns, certification programs, and hospital education protocols to promote safe sleep practices for infants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving infant health and reducing infant mortality, which can contribute to better long-term outcomes for children in poverty.

Title: Legally Protected Health Care - Gender-Affirming Treatment
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "legally protected health care" to include certain gender-affirming treatment, including medications and supplies, for the purposes of certain provisions of law that prohibit health occupations disciplinary actions and certain actions in criminal and civil proceedings and the use of certain resources in furtherance of certain investigations and proceedings related to legally protected health care.
bill_summary: The bill expands the definition of 'legally protected health care' to include gender-affirming treatment and related medications and supplies, and prohibits state actions and resources from being used to support investigations or proceedings related to such treatment that are not criminal in nature within Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland State government agencies and health care regulatory boards
stakeholders: Individuals receiving or providing gender-affirming treatment, health care providers, and legal entities involved in health care law in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal and regulatory approach to protect gender-affirming health care from interstate investigations and state actions, emphasizing legal protections and resource restrictions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal protections for gender-affirming health care.

Title: Office of the Correctional Ombudsman - Establishment and Funding
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of the Correctional Ombudsman; authorizing the Justice Reinvestment Oversight Board to make a recommendation for the distribution of money from the Performance Incentive Grant Fund to the Office for fiscal year 2025 only; requiring the Office to conduct investigations, reviews, and assessments of administrative acts taken by the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, by the Department of Juvenile Services, or in relation to individuals confined by either department; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Office of the Correctional Ombudsman to investigate and review administrative acts within correctional and juvenile facilities, and creates related oversight and reporting structures.
responsible_party: Office of the Correctional Ombudsman in the Maryland Attorney General's Office
stakeholders: Individuals confined in correctional and juvenile facilities, their families, correctional staff, and oversight agencies.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated independent office with investigative powers, including subpoena authority, to oversee correctional and juvenile facilities, which is a relatively new approach to correctional oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving conditions and rights for juveniles in detention, but its direct impact is moderate.

Title: Workgroup to Study Funding for the Westernport Wastewater Treatment Facility - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup to Study Funding for the Westernport Wastewater Treatment Facility to identify and examine existing funding sources that support the Facility and study whether increased funding could enhance operations at the Facility, the funding sources of comparable facilities in the region, and available and potential federal, State, and local funding sources for the Facility; and requiring the Workgroup to report, on or before December 1, 2024, its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a workgroup to study funding options for the Westernport Wastewater Treatment Facility, including current funding sources, potential for increased funding, and comparisons with similar facilities in the region. The workgroup will report its findings and recommendations by December 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Residents and local government of Westernport and Allegany County, wastewater treatment facility operators, regional environmental agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach to evaluate funding sources for a specific wastewater treatment facility, involving multiple government agencies and regional entities, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on funding for a wastewater treatment facility.

Title: Teachers' Retirement and Pension Systems - Reemployment
Synopsis: Clarifying a certain exemption from a certain reemployment offset for retirees of the Teachers' Retirement System and Teachers' Pension System who are reemployed by a local school system under certain conditions; and providing for the retroactive application of the Act to certain retirees who were reemployed by the Harford County Board of Education.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies rules regarding reemployment of retirees from the Teachers' Retirement System and Teachers' Pension System, including maximum rehire limits and exemptions from benefit reductions, and applies retroactively to certain retirees reemployed after January 1, 2020.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Retired teachers and local school systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly clarifies existing rules and limits on reemployment of retirees, with some retroactive application, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly addresses rules for retiree reemployment and benefit offsets.

Title: Qualifying Nonprofit Organizations - Training and Reentry Services - Funding
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $1,000,000 in the annual budget bill for fiscal years 2026 through 2028 to provide operating grants to certain qualifying nonprofit organizations for the purpose of providing training in automotive repair to incarcerated or formerly incarcerated individuals; and requiring the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to administer the grant funds.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland government to allocate $1 million annually from 2026 to 2028 to fund grants to nonprofit organizations that provide automotive repair training and reentry services to incarcerated and formerly incarcerated individuals, with a focus on employment outcomes.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated and formerly incarcerated individuals seeking employment in automotive repair, nonprofit organizations providing reentry services
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted funding and specific training and employment outcome metrics to support reentry and employment for formerly incarcerated individuals, integrating workforce development with criminal justice reform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by improving employment opportunities for formerly incarcerated individuals, thereby increasing family income.

Title: Prince George's County - Public School Employees Property Tax Credit and Office of Integrity and Compliance PG 503-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Prince George's County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on dwellings that are owned by certain eligible employees of the Prince George's County Public School System; requiring the Prince George's County government to submit a certain report concerning the credit to certain persons on or before a certain date; providing that the Office of Integrity and Compliance is an independent unit within the school system; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to grant a property tax credit to eligible public school system employees who own a dwelling in the county, and establishes an independent Office of Integrity and Compliance within the local school system to oversee accountability, investigations, and reporting.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government and the Office of Integrity and Compliance within the Prince George's County Public School System
stakeholders: Prince George's County public school employees and the local school system
innovative_summary: The bill establishes an independent Office of Integrity and Compliance within the school system, employing standards similar to government auditing, which is a relatively innovative approach to internal oversight in school systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting employees through tax credits and improving accountability within the school system, but direct impact is moderate.

Title: State Procurement - Preferred Provider Requirements - Waiver
Synopsis: Authorizing the Pricing and Selection Committee for Preferred Providers to grant a waiver from a certain requirement to use a certain preferred provider for the procurement of supplies and services under certain circumstances; requiring the Committee to review a certain request for a certain waiver to the State or a State aided or controlled entity under certain circumstances; and requiring Maryland Correctional Enterprises to report the length of time between each order and delivery of supplies and services for each fiscal year.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Department of General Services to grant waivers to state entities from the requirement to purchase supplies and services from Maryland Correctional Enterprises if the price is at least 10% above market rates or delivery times do not meet needs. It establishes a Pricing and Selection Committee to oversee preferred providers, ensure fair pricing, and support employment opportunities for individuals with disabilities. The bill also requires annual reporting from preferred providers on employment and delivery times.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: State agencies, individuals with disabilities, employment programs, Maryland Correctional Enterprises, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach involving a dedicated committee to oversee preferred providers, ensure fair market pricing, and support employment for individuals with disabilities, integrating employment and procurement policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting employment opportunities for individuals with disabilities and promoting fair procurement practices.

Title: Department of Aging - Caregiver Expense Grant Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Caregiver Expense Grant Program in the Department of Aging to award grants to certain caregivers for up to 30% of the qualified expenses that exceed $2,000 paid or incurred by the caregiver to provide care or support to certain qualified family members; and authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of up to $5,000,000 to the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Caregiver Expense Grant Program in the Maryland Department of Aging, providing grants to certain caregivers for qualified expenses related to caring for qualified family members. It also allows caregivers to claim a tax credit against Maryland income tax based on these expenses.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Aging
stakeholders: Caregivers and qualified family members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program combines direct grants with a tax credit, leveraging both financial support and tax incentives to assist caregivers, which is a relatively innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting family caregivers, especially those caring for children with disabilities or elderly family members.

Title: University System of Maryland - Board of Regents - Membership
Synopsis: Requiring that certain appointing officials in making appointments to the Board of Regents of the University System of Maryland ensure that one member of the Board is a graduate of a historically Black college or university in the University System of Maryland; and applying the Act only after the next vacancy occurs on the Board of Regents after July 1, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill requires that when appointing members to the Board of Regents of the University System of Maryland, at least one member must be a graduate of a historically Black college or university within the system.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland
stakeholders: Members of the University System of Maryland, historically Black colleges and universities, and the general public interested in higher education governance.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a diversity requirement for the Board of Regents by ensuring representation from historically Black colleges or universities, which is a policy change rather than a technological innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on governance and diversity in higher education.

Title: Economic Development – Maryland Economic Development Commission – Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements relating to industry representation on the Maryland Economic Development Commission and the purpose of the Commission; repealing a requirement that the Office of International Trade make a certain report to the Commission; and repealing a requirement that the Maryland Tourism Development Board submit certain plans to the Commission.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the structure and requirements of the Maryland Economic Development Commission, including industry representation, reporting, and the roles of related agencies such as the Office of International Trade and the Maryland Tourism Development Board.
responsible_party: Maryland Economic Development Commission
stakeholders: Businesses, economic development agencies, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates governance and reporting structures; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly support economic growth.

Title: Emergency Medical Services - Paramedics - Immunization Administration - Effective Date
Synopsis: Delaying the effective date to January 1, 2030, of certain provisions of law that repeal the authority of paramedics to administer influenza and COVID-19 immunizations under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill delays the effective date of laws that allow paramedics to administer influenza and COVID-19 immunizations under certain conditions until 2030, extending the previous start date from 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland State EMS Board and health departments
stakeholders: Paramedics, public safety personnel, and the general public receiving immunizations
innovative_summary: The bill extends paramedics' authority to administer immunizations, which is a public health initiative, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns immunization authority for paramedics.

Title: Maryland Military Installation Council - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Military Installation Council to include the Maryland Secretary of Labor or a designee, the State Superintendent of Schools or a designee, and the President of the Military Alliance Council of Charles County; and increasing the number of members selected by the Governor from 5 to 6 and requiring that at least one is a spouse of a service member.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership structure of the Maryland Military Installation Council, including the addition of new members and specific representation requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Military Installation Council
stakeholders: Military communities, local governments, and military installations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates the composition of an existing council without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Failure to Insure - Penalties
Synopsis: Increasing, from $10,000 to $25,000, the cap on penalties for an employer's failure to secure required workers' compensation insurance or comply with an order of the State Workers' Compensation Commission regarding an employer's failure to secure required workers' compensation insurance.
bill_summary: The bill increases the penalties for employers in Maryland who fail to secure workers' compensation insurance for their employees. It establishes higher fines, up to $25,000, and clarifies enforcement procedures, including liens on assets and liability of corporate officers or members for unpaid penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Workers' Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Employers and employees in Maryland, especially those without workers' compensation insurance
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates and increases penalties for non-compliance with existing workers' compensation laws, with some provisions for enforcement and liability of corporate officers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but aims to ensure workers are protected and compensated, which can indirectly benefit families.

Title: Senior Prescription Drug Assistance Program – Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending to December 31, 2030, the termination date of the Senior Prescription Drug Assistance Program.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the Senior Prescription Drug Assistance Program in Maryland to December 31, 2030, allowing the program to continue providing subsidies for prescription drugs to eligible seniors enrolled in Medicare Part D plans.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Medicare-eligible seniors in Maryland who need prescription drug assistance
innovative_summary: The program employs a traditional subsidy approach for prescription drugs, with no mention of employing new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program directly supports low-income seniors, which can help reduce child poverty indirectly by alleviating financial burdens on families.

Title: State Board of Environmental Health Specialists – Quorum, Examination, and Apprenticeships
Synopsis: Clarifying that a quorum of the State Board of Environmental Health Specialists consists of a majority of appointed members; altering the circumstances under which an applicant for licensure is qualified to take the examination by adding completion of an apprenticeship approved by the Board as an alternative to obtaining experience in an environmental health specialist-in-training program; and authorizing the Board to approve an examination provider to administer the examination.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the composition of the State Board of Environmental Health Specialists, updates licensure examination requirements to include approved apprenticeships as an alternative to training programs, and authorizes the Board to approve examination providers.
responsible_party: State Board of Environmental Health Specialists
stakeholders: Environmental health professionals and applicants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the approval of apprenticeships and examination providers, modernizing and expanding pathways for licensure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on professional licensing pathways.

Title: Cemeteries - Burial-Transit Permits - Required Information
Synopsis: Requiring a person in charge of a cemetery to write on a burial-transit permit, the date of final disposition, the name and physical address of the cemetery, the burial, inurnment or scattering section and the lot and space number, or if the body or fetus was cremated and a certain authorizing agent takes control of the cremains, the name and address of the authorizing agent and the authorizing agent's relationship to the deceased or fetus.
bill_summary: The bill updates requirements for burial-transit permits, including what information a cemetery must record and how permits are handled for disinterment and reinterment, to improve the process and record-keeping.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Cemeteries, funeral homes, families of the deceased, and historical site authorities
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal requirements and procedures for burial permits and disinterment, with no new technology or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns burial procedures and permits.

Title: Occupational Safety and Health Advisory Board – Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the Occupational Safety and Health Advisory Board in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to June 1, 2034, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the Occupational Safety and Health Advisory Board in Maryland to July 1, 2034, ensuring its continued existence and authority.
responsible_party: Occupational Safety and Health Advisory Board
stakeholders: Workers and employers in Maryland concerned with occupational safety and health standards
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing advisory board's authority without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Acupuncture Board – Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Acupuncture Board in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the State Acupuncture Board in Maryland from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, and then further to July 1, 2030, ensuring the continued existence and authority of the Board.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Practitioners of acupuncture and patients receiving acupuncture services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends the existing regulatory framework for acupuncture without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals, delaying its termination from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2030.
responsible_party: Department of Health (or relevant Maryland State Department)
stakeholders: Residential child care professionals and children in residential care programs in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns regulatory extension.

Title: State Board of Dietetic Practice – Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Dietetic Practice in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Dietetic Practice in Maryland from 2025 to 2028, and then further to 2030, ensuring its continued operation.
responsible_party: State Board of Dietetic Practice in the Department of Health
stakeholders: Dietitians and public health consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Occupational Therapy Practice – Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Occupational Therapy Practice in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date of the State Board of Occupational Therapy Practice in Maryland, delaying its termination from 2025 to 2030.
responsible_party: State Board of Occupational Therapy Practice in the Department of Health
stakeholders: Occupational therapists and the public receiving occupational therapy services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Examiners in Optometry – Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners in Optometry in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Examiners in Optometry from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, and then further to July 1, 2030, ensuring the continuation of the Board's authority and functions.
responsible_party: Department of Health or relevant state health department
stakeholders: Optometrists, patients requiring optometry services, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches; it primarily extends the existing regulatory framework.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board of Examiners of Psychologists - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists in Maryland, delaying its termination from 2025 to 2030.
responsible_party: State Board of Examiners of Psychologists in the Department of Health
stakeholders: Psychologists and mental health professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Social Work Examiners - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Social Work Examiners in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Board, by December 1, 2024, to report to certain committees of the General Assembly information from the preceding 6-month period on processing times for license issuance and renewal, complaint resolution times, and the rate of compliance with certain requirements.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination date of the State Board of Social Work Examiners from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, and requires the Board to report certain operational data to legislative committees before December 1, 2024.
responsible_party: State Board of Social Work Examiners in the Department of Health
stakeholders: Social workers, licensing applicants, and the public seeking social work services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body and mandates reporting requirements; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists - Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee within the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2026, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Committee.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee within the Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists from July 1, 2024, to July 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Behavior analysts, therapists, and related professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing advisory committee's sunset date; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Community Health Resources Commission – Sunset Extension and Program Evaluation
Synopsis: Adding the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission to the governmental activities and units subject to the Maryland Program Evaluation Act; and extending the termination date to June 30, 2035, for certain provisions of law related to the Commission.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission to 2035, adds the Commission to the Maryland Program Evaluation Act for review, and requires an evaluation of the Commission by 2025.
responsible_party: Office of Program Evaluation and Government Accountability in the Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Community health resources and populations accessing healthcare in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves extending existing programs and conducting evaluations; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to healthcare, but the direct impact is moderate.

Title: County Public Libraries - Minors, Children, and Teens - Prohibited Practices
Synopsis: Prohibiting a county public library from charging a fine for overdue library materials borrowed by a minor or intended for children or teens; prohibiting a county public library from charging a reserve fee for library materials reserved by a minor or intended for children or teens; prohibiting a county public library from prohibiting the borrowing of library materials by a minor or the borrowing of library materials intended for children or teens because of previous overdue library materials; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits Maryland county public libraries from charging fines, reserve fees, or replacement fees to minors or for materials intended for children or teens. It also limits the circumstances under which replacement fees can be charged and mandates refunds if materials are returned in good condition within certain timeframes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education or local library authorities
stakeholders: Minors, children, teens, and their families using public libraries in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy change to eliminate fines and certain fees for minors and materials for children and teens, promoting equitable access to library resources.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By removing fines and fees for minors, the bill reduces barriers to library access, which can help support educational and social development for children in low-income families.

Title: Public Safety - 9-1-1 Trust Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the 9-1-1 Trust Fund to authorize the use of certain allocated funds for the payment of the salary of certain personnel.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the use of funds from the Maryland 9–1–1 Trust Fund to include paying the salaries of certain personnel involved in 9–1–1 services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Public safety answering point personnel, emergency response agencies, and residents relying on 9–1–1 services
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates fund allocation rules and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns fund allocation and personnel salaries for emergency services.

Title: Public Safety - Volunteer Company Assistance Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Transferring certain duties relating to the Volunteer Company Assistance Fund from the Military Department to the Maryland Department of Emergency Management.
bill_summary: The bill transfers the duties related to the Volunteer Company Assistance Fund from the Military Department to the Maryland Department of Emergency Management, and establishes reporting and oversight requirements for grants and loans made to volunteer fire, ambulance, and rescue companies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Volunteer fire, ambulance, and rescue companies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves administrative transfer and reporting requirements; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty.

Title: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners, delaying its termination from 2025 to 2028, and then further to 2030.
responsible_party: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners in the Department of Health
stakeholders: Physical therapists and applicants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Department of General Services - State Buildings and Facilities - Energy Conservation and Greenhouse Gas Emissions Reductions
Synopsis: Altering the State's goals for reducing energy consumption in State buildings; requiring the Maryland Green Building Council to update the High Performance Green Building Program to ensure that the Program aligns with certain greenhouse gas emissions reduction goals; requiring the Department of General Services to identify State-owned facilities that are potential candidates for energy performance contracts; etc.
bill_summary: The bill sets new energy reduction and greenhouse gas emissions goals for Maryland's state buildings, updates green building standards, and mandates energy audits and efficiency measures for state-owned facilities, with annual reporting and collaboration among state agencies.
responsible_party: Department of General Services and Maryland Green Building Council
stakeholders: State government agencies and employees, Maryland residents, environmental groups
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining updated green building standards, energy audits, performance contracts, and data tracking to achieve significant energy and emissions reductions in state facilities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is primarily on energy efficiency and emissions reduction; it does not directly target child poverty but may have indirect environmental benefits.

Title: State Board of Barbers - Sunset Extension and Report
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Barbers in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2027, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2025, with information regarding the Board as determined by the Committee.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Barbers from 2024 to 2027, requiring a report from the Maryland Department of Labor by 2025, and takes effect on June 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Barbers and related professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Cosmetologists - Sunset Extension and Report
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Cosmetologists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2027, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a certain report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Cosmetologists from 2024 to 2027, allowing it to continue operating and regulating the profession. It also requires the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report on the Board to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee by July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Cosmetologists and consumers of cosmetology services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory agency and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Program - Enforcement
Synopsis: Altering the enforcement and after-the-fact application approval procedures required as minimum elements of a local jurisdiction's Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Program to apply to all critical area violations; repealing the 30-day waiting period with which the Chair of the Critical Area Commission for the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays must comply before referring certain enforcement matters to the Attorney General; and expanding the authority of the Attorney General to take certain equitable actions.
bill_summary: The bill enhances enforcement procedures and authority under the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Program, including expanding the authority of the Attorney General to take legal action against violations and clarifying procedures for enforcement and penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Attorney General and the Critical Area Commission
stakeholders: Local jurisdictions, property owners, environmental agencies, and the general public concerned with Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays
innovative_summary: The bill strengthens enforcement mechanisms and legal authority, including the ability of the Attorney General to take equitable actions, which is a significant enhancement of existing enforcement approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on environmental enforcement and does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Adult Protective Services - Review Boards - Membership and Terms
Synopsis: Altering provisions relating to the membership of, and the terms of members appointed to, adult public guardianship review boards.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership and terms of adult public guardianship review boards in Maryland, reducing the number of members from 11 to 8, and clarifying appointment processes and member terms.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Family Law or relevant local authorities
stakeholders: Adults under guardianship, review board members, local government agencies
innovative_summary: The bill primarily makes administrative changes to review board composition and terms, with no new technology or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it focuses on adult guardianship review boards.

Title: Election Law - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the information that clerks of the circuit court for each county and administrative clerks for each District Court are required to report to the State Administrator of Elections to include the names and addresses, if available, of individuals convicted of a felony in the respective court and sentenced to imprisonment with commitment papers; requiring the State Board of Elections to adopt regulations establishing an appeals process regarding certain requests to use public buildings as early voting centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various revisions to Maryland's election laws, including reporting requirements for court clerks regarding individuals convicted of felonies, establishing an appeals process for public officials contesting the use of public buildings as early voting centers, and allowing incumbent members of a political party central committee who are candidates for office to act as responsible officers of the committee.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, public officials, political candidates, and local election boards in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an organized appeals process for public officials to contest early voting center locations, which is a structured approach to resolving disputes in election logistics.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: State and Local Correctional Facilities - Operation of Unmanned Aircraft - Image Recording and Delivery of Contraband
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from intentionally operating an unmanned aircraft over a correctional facility to record images of the facility without the authorization of the managing official of the correctional facility or the Secretary of Public Safety and Correctional Services; prohibiting a person from using an unmanned aircraft to deliver contraband to a person detained or confined in a place of confinement; and requiring a correctional facility to post signage warning of the prohibitions in a visible area on the exterior of the property.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the operation of unmanned aircraft over correctional facilities to record images and to deliver contraband, establishing penalties for violations and requiring signage warning of these restrictions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Correctional facilities, inmates, public safety officials, general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology restrictions and signage requirements to enhance security at correctional facilities, but does not introduce new technological solutions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on correctional facility security.

Title: Notarial Acts - Protest Form Requirement - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement that a notary public use a certain protest form.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement that notary publics use a specific protest form when performing certain notarial acts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Office of the Comptroller
stakeholders: Notaries Public and individuals involved in notarial acts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies existing legal requirements by removing a specific form mandate, which is a procedural change rather than an innovative technological or approach-based initiative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Homeowners' Property Tax Credit - Application - Attestation of Gross Income
Synopsis: Authorizing an applicant for the homeowners' property tax credit to attest to gross income on an application in lieu of providing an income tax return to the State Department of Assessments and Taxation under certain circumstances; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill allows applicants for the Maryland homeowners' property tax credit to attest to their gross income instead of providing an income tax return under certain circumstances, streamlining the application process.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Homeowners applying for property tax credits in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a simplified attestation process for income verification, reducing the need for tax return submission, which is a new approach to income verification for tax credits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by making property tax credits more accessible to eligible homeowners, potentially reducing financial burdens.

Title: State Board of Individual Tax Preparers - Sunset Extension and Report
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Individual Tax Preparers in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2027, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a certain report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Individual Tax Preparers from 2026 to 2027, and requires the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report on the board by July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Individual tax preparers and related professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory board and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Department of Assessments and Taxation - Office of the Director - Administrative Expenses
Synopsis: Increasing from 5% to 15% the percentage of the administrative expenses of the Office of the Director of the State Department of Assessments and Taxation that the Department may pay from a certain fund.
bill_summary: This bill increases the maximum percentage of administrative expenses of the Office of the Director of the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation that can be paid from a specific fund from 5% to 15%.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Owners of ground rents and entities involved in property assessments and tax administration in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily adjusts existing financial rules and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Certified Local Farm and Fish Program - Annual Waiver Reports - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the annual deadline, from July 31 to October 31, for the Office for the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program to submit to the Board of Public Works a report of waivers requested and waivers granted under the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program; and altering the annual deadline, from October 1 to December 31, for the Board of Public Works to submit to certain standing committees a copy of a record of information regarding any waivers requested under the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program.
bill_summary: The bill modifies deadlines for reporting on waivers related to the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program, changing the deadline for the Office to submit waiver reports from July 31 to October 31, and the deadline for the Board to submit records from October 1 to December 31.
responsible_party: Office for the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program and the Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Local farms, Chesapeake invasive species providers, state procurement agencies, and the public interested in local food sourcing
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates reporting deadlines and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns administrative reporting requirements.

Title: State Government - Deputy Secretary of State - Title
Synopsis: Altering the title of the Assistant Secretary of State to be "Deputy Secretary of State".
