bill_summary: The bill changes the title of the Assistant Secretary of State to Deputy Secretary of State and clarifies the roles and delegation powers associated with this position.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Secretary of State's Office
stakeholders: State government officials and employees, particularly the Secretary and Deputy Secretary of State
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves administrative title changes and delegation rules, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty or related programs.

Title: Department of Planning - Inventory Responsibilities
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the Department of Planning prepare and periodically revise inventory lists of the natural resources of the State and certain public works and facilities.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement for the Maryland Department of Planning to prepare and update inventory lists of the state's natural resources and major public works and facilities.
responsible_party: Department of Planning
stakeholders: State agencies, General Assembly, public resources and facilities
innovative_summary: This bill reduces the administrative responsibilities of the Department of Planning by removing the requirement to maintain resource inventories.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board for Professional Land Surveyors - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board for Professional Land Surveyors in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2027, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a certain report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board for Professional Land Surveyors from 2024 to 2027 and requires a report from the Maryland Department of Labor by 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Professional land surveyors and related industry stakeholders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends existing regulatory authority and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board for Professional Engineers - Engineer Members - Qualifications
Synopsis: Reducing from 12 to 10 the number of years that an engineer member of the State Board for Professional Engineers must have practiced engineering.
bill_summary: The bill reduces the required years of engineering practice for engineer members of the State Board for Professional Engineers from 12 to 5 years.
responsible_party: State Board for Professional Engineers in the Department of Maryland
stakeholders: Professional engineers and the public served by the Board
innovative_summary: This bill makes a straightforward change to the qualifications for engineer members of the Board, which is a rule change rather than an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Electricians - Licensing - Penalties
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Electricians to impose a civil penalty of up to $5,000 instead of or in addition to reprimanding a licensee or suspending or revoking a license for certain violations; requiring the Board to consider certain factors to determine the amount of a penalty imposed under the Act; and requiring by October 1, 2024, the Board to submit to certain committees of the General Assembly a report, covering years 2018 through 2023, on the Board's practices and processes for the timely resolution of complaints against licensees.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Electricians to impose civil monetary penalties of up to $5,000 for violations, in addition to or instead of disciplinary actions like reprimands or license suspensions. It also requires the Board to report on its complaint resolution practices and processes.
responsible_party: State Board of Electricians
stakeholders: Electricians licensed in Maryland and the public they serve
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of civil monetary penalties as a disciplinary tool for the State Board of Electricians, which is a new approach to enforcement in this context.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly pertains to licensing enforcement and disciplinary procedures for electricians.

Title: Coast Smart Council - Duties and Authority
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Coast Smart Council to include the development of eligibility criteria, standards, and procedures for categorical exemptions from the application of the Coast Smart requirements for proposed capital projects that have been designed to include adaptation and resiliency features to prevent or mitigate damage to the maximum extent practicable; and authorizing the Council to recommend certain regulations for adoption by the Secretary of Natural Resources.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the duties of the Coast Smart Council to include developing criteria and procedures for categorical exemptions from Coast Smart requirements for projects that include adaptation and resiliency features to mitigate damage from coastal flooding, sea level rise, and extreme weather events.
responsible_party: Coast Smart Council
stakeholders: Construction projects, environmental agencies, local governments, communities vulnerable to coastal flooding and sea level rise
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by establishing categorical exemptions for projects with adaptation and resiliency features, streamlining approval processes for climate-resilient infrastructure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on climate resilience and infrastructure standards.

Title: Natural Resources - Wildland Areas - Belt Woods Wildland
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources, with prior approval of the Maryland Historical Trust and after an internal departmental review, to authorize within the Belt Woods Wildland archeological inventories, studies, and research that involve surface examination or limited subsurface sampling, salvage and excavation of archeological sites, and stabilization and restoration of historic structures existing as of December 1, 1985; etc.
bill_summary: The bill designates the Belt Woods area in Prince George's County as a protected wildland and establishes rules for its management, including reforestation of agricultural fields, preservation of existing structures, and regulation of archaeological activities and ecological management.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Environmental conservation efforts, local communities, historical and ecological preservation groups
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates ecological management, archaeological activities, and preservation of historical structures within a protected wildland area, employing a comprehensive approach to land conservation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but contributes to environmental and community well-being.

Title: Aquaculture - Placement of Shellfish, Bags, Nets, and Structures on Submerged Aquatic Vegetation - Extension
Synopsis: Extending to June 30, 2027, the authorization of a leaseholder of certain aquaculture leases to, with prior written approval from the Department of Natural Resources, place shellfish, bags, nets, and structures on submerged aquatic vegetation, subject to certain requirements; and requiring, on or before June 1, 2025, and each June 1 for the next 2 years thereafter, the Department to report certain information to the Aquaculture Coordinating Council, the Chesapeake Bay Program, and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill extends the authorization for aquaculture leaseholders in Maryland to place shellfish, bags, nets, and structures on submerged aquatic vegetation with prior approval from the Department of Natural Resources, and specifies conditions for such placements. It also requires the Department to report on the impacts of these activities on submerged aquatic vegetation over the next few years.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Aquaculture leaseholders, environmental agencies, and the general public interested in aquatic ecosystems
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regulatory approach that balances aquaculture activities with environmental conservation, including specific conditions and reporting requirements, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Aquaculture - Definition of Shellfish - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "shellfish" as it relates to certain provisions of law governing aquaculture to include live bivalves and bivalve shells.
bill_summary: The bill amends the legal definition of 'shellfish' in Maryland to include live mollusks, molluscan bivalves, and bivalve shells, and sets regulations regarding the importation and possession of shellfish from outside the state waters.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Shellfish farmers, aquaculture industry, environmental regulators, and consumers involved in shellfish harvesting and importation
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal definitions and import regulations; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Public Safety - Board of Boiler Rules - Membership, Sunset Extension, and Report
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Board of Boiler Rules to include a representative with at least 10 years of experience in constructing, installing, and repairing boilers and pressure vessels; extending the termination date for the Board to July 1, 2029; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a certain report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill extends the membership of the Maryland Board of Boiler Rules, increases the number of appointed members from nine to ten, and extends the termination date of the Board from 2024 to 2029. It also requires the Department of Labor to submit a report on the Board to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee by July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Owners, users, manufacturers, insurers, engineers, and consumers involved with boilers and pressure vessels in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily makes administrative and structural changes to an existing regulatory board, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Department of Planning - State Repository and Clearinghouse for Federal and State Financial and Technical Assistance
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the Department of Planning serve as a repository and clearinghouse for information concerning federal and State grants, loans, and other financial and technical assistance; repealing a requirement that the Department adopt certain regulations and publish certain information in the Maryland Register; and altering a requirement that the Department publish certain information concerning State financial and technical assistance offered through State assistance programs.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain requirements for the Department of Planning to serve as a repository and clearinghouse for information on federal and state financial and technical assistance, and modifies the publication requirements for State assistance program information.
responsible_party: Department of Planning
stakeholders: State government agencies and organizations seeking financial and technical assistance from the state
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies and reduces the regulatory burden on the Department of Planning by removing certain information submission and publication requirements, and instead mandates annual publication of assistance information on the Maryland InfoPortal.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes information management and publication procedures.

Title: Property Tax - Credit for Hotel or Residential Development Projects
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant, by law, a tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is used for certain hotel or residential development projects; and altering eligibility for a certain property tax credit in Wicomico County against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is used for certain hotel or residential development projects.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local governments in Maryland to grant property tax credits for new hotel or residential development projects, including substantial rehabilitation or revitalization, with specific eligibility criteria such as minimum residential units and affordable housing requirements.
responsible_party: Local governments in Maryland (Baltimore City, counties, municipal corporations)
stakeholders: Developers, residents, and local governments involved in hotel and residential development projects in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a local property tax credit program for hotel and residential developments, encouraging revitalization and affordable housing, which is a strategic use of tax policy to promote development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by promoting affordable housing and revitalization, but its direct impact is moderate.

Title: Transportation - Vision Zero - Implementation
Synopsis: Establishing certain standards and requirements for implementing the Vision Zero program under the Maryland Department of Transportation.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the implementation standards for Maryland's Vision Zero program, including creating a coordinator position, a public advisory commission, and requirements for public meetings, reporting, and data collection to reduce vehicle-related deaths and injuries on roadways by 2030.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists, local and state transportation agencies, law enforcement, and community members
innovative_summary: The program employs data-driven strategies, public engagement through quarterly meetings, and comprehensive data collection and analysis to improve roadway safety, with a focus on transparency and community involvement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve safety for vulnerable populations, including children, by reducing traffic-related injuries and fatalities.

Title: Budget Bill (Fiscal Year 2025)
Synopsis: Making the proposed appropriations contained in the State Budget for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2025, in accordance with Article III, Section 52 of the Maryland Constitution; etc.
bill_summary: The bill is a comprehensive fiscal appropriations act for Maryland's fiscal years 2024 and 2025, detailing allocations across numerous state agencies, programs, and initiatives, including education, transportation, health, public safety, and infrastructure, with specific provisions for supplemental and supplemental budget amendments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management and various state agencies
stakeholders: Maryland residents, state employees, students, healthcare recipients, public safety personnel, and local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs a detailed, multi-year budget planning approach with supplemental amendments, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill allocates significant funds toward education, health, and social services, which can have a direct impact on child poverty, but the impact depends on implementation and effectiveness.

Title: Creation of a State Debt - Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2024, and the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023
Synopsis: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $1,845,046,000, the proceeds to be used for certain necessary building, construction, demolition, planning, renovation, conversion, replacement, and capital equipment purchases of the State, for acquiring certain real estate in connection therewith, and for grants to certain subdivisions and other organizations for certain development and improvement purposes, subject to certain matching fund requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the issuance of multiple series of bonds to fund various capital projects across Maryland, including infrastructure, education, health, and public safety facilities, with specific allocations and project descriptions.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Works and various state agencies
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local governments, public institutions, and organizations involved in the funded projects
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves the allocation and management of bond funds for capital projects; it does not establish new services or initiatives employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on infrastructure, health, and education projects can indirectly impact child poverty by improving community resources and services.

Title: Budget Reconciliation and Financing Act of 2024
Synopsis: Altering or repealing certain required appropriations; authorizing the use of certain funds for certain purposes; altering, from December 1, 2024, to January 15, 2027, the date by which the Accountability and Implementation Board has to conduct and submit a certain independent evaluation; altering the sales and use tax rate on certain electronic smoking devices; repealing a certain small business relief tax credit; requiring interest earnings for certain special funds to accrue to the General Fund of the State during certain fiscal years; etc.
bill_summary: This bill is a comprehensive budget and finance act that makes numerous changes to appropriations, funding allocations, and legal provisions across various state programs, including education, transportation, health, and public safety. It establishes new funds, reallocates existing funds, and sets funding levels for multiple state agencies and initiatives, including programs for behavioral health, transportation infrastructure, higher education, and trauma care.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Department of Budget and Management, and various state agencies involved in the programs
stakeholders: State residents, students, educators, healthcare providers, trauma patients, transportation users, and local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs a mix of traditional funding allocations and introduces new funds and revenue streams, such as impact fees and special funds, but does not primarily focus on employing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill includes funding for programs that could impact child poverty, such as prekindergarten expansion and behavioral health supports, but does not directly target child poverty reduction as a primary goal.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Military Service Credit - Eligibility
Synopsis: Repealing a limitation for members of the State Retirement and Pension System to receive certain service credit for active duty with the commissioned corps of the Public Health Service, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, or the Coast and Geodetic Survey.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a restriction that limited members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System from receiving service credit for active duty with certain U.S. government agencies, specifically the Public Health Service, NOAA, or the Coast and Geodetic Survey, and allows such service to be counted for retirement benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System with military service in the specified agencies
innovative_summary: The bill updates existing retirement policy to include military service in additional federal agencies, which is a straightforward policy change rather than an innovative technological or approach-based initiative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects retirement benefits for certain members.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Personal Care Aides - Wage Reports
Synopsis: Requiring residential service agencies to submit certain reports to the Maryland Department of Labor regarding wage rates for personal care aides by September 1 each year, beginning in 2025; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to report to the Senate Finance Committee and the House Health and Government Operations Committee by the 180th day after the release of the final federal Ensuring Access to Medicaid Services rule on an overview of the final rule and plans or steps that the Department will take to operationalize the rule.
bill_summary: The bill requires residential service agencies to submit annual wage reports for personal care aides to the Maryland Department of Labor, and the Department of Health to report on Medicaid reimbursement rates and plans to implement federal Medicaid rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Personal care aides, residential service agencies, Medicaid recipients, and related service providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs data collection and reporting to improve transparency and alignment of wages and reimbursement rates for personal care services, integrating federal Medicaid rule implementation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by improving wages and funding for personal care services, which can support families and caregivers.

Title: State Contracts - Prohibited Provisions
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain provisions from being included in State contracts; specifying that certain provisions are void if included in a State contract; specifying the applicable law and interpretation of State contracts; exempting a State contract relating to the purchase, redevelopment, or operation of a racing facility or training facility site from the prohibitions; and applying the Act prospectively to State contracts executed on or after October 1, 2024, and to the renewal or extension of a State contract on or after October 1, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits certain provisions from being included in Maryland state contracts, declares those provisions void if included, and specifies the legal framework for state contracts. It aims to prevent the state from agreeing to terms that could impose unfair liabilities or obligations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of General Services or relevant state agency responsible for contracts
stakeholders: Maryland state government, contractors, and the public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal framework to restrict certain contractual provisions, ensuring fairer and more transparent state contracts, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns contractual legal provisions.

Title: Higher Education - University of Maryland School of Medicine and MPowering Joint Steering Council - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include $5,000,000 in the annual budget for the University of Maryland School of Medicine to provide clinical care at the University of Maryland Capital Region Medical Center; and requiring the Governor to include in the budget for the the MPowering Joint Steering Council to use exclusively on the University of Maryland Institute for Health Computing appropriations of $1,500,000 in fiscal year 2026, $3,000,000 in fiscal year 2027, $4,500,000 in fiscal year 2028, and $6,000,000 in fiscal year 2029 and after.
bill_summary: The bill mandates funding for the University of Maryland School of Medicine to provide clinical care at the University of Maryland Capital Region Medical Center and allocates funds to the MPowering Joint Steering Council for various initiatives, including the University of Maryland Institute for Health Computing.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Governor's Office and the University of Maryland system
stakeholders: Students, faculty, healthcare providers, and residents in Maryland benefiting from medical and research programs
innovative_summary: The bill allocates significant funding to support joint university initiatives, clinical care, and health computing, fostering collaboration and technological advancement in healthcare and education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve healthcare and educational opportunities, which can indirectly reduce child poverty.

Title: Task Force to Study Crime Classification - Renaming, Membership, and Duties
Synopsis:
Extending the Task Force to Study Crime Classification and renaming it to be the Task Force to Study Crime Reclassification and Penalties; requiring the Task Force to study the penalties for crimes and civil offenses under State law, the potential need for reclassification of certain crimes, the alteration of penalties, and whether certain changes should be made to crimes lacking an explicit mens rea; and
requiring the Task Force to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill renames and expands the duties of the Task Force to Study Crime Classification, now called the Task Force to Study Crime Reclassification and Penalties. It broadens the scope to include studying penalties, reclassification of crimes, and issues related to mens rea, and extends the reporting deadline to December 31, 2025.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General and other appointed members
stakeholders: Legal system, crime victims, offenders, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive review of criminal classifications and penalties, including potential reclassification and legal reforms, which is a systematic approach but not highly technological or innovative in nature.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on criminal classification and penalties may indirectly impact child poverty through criminal justice reform, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Catalytic Revitalization Project Tax Credit - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the amount of a certain credit against the State income tax that certain persons may claim for certain construction and rehabilitation costs for certain catalytic revitalization projects in the State; repealing a certain limitation on the number of initial tax credit certificates the Secretary of Housing and Community Development may award within a 2-year period; prohibiting the Secretary from revoking a tax credit certificate awarded on or before July 1, 2024, except under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland catalytic revitalization project tax credit program by increasing the credit amount, changing rules for issuing and revoking certificates, and establishing procedures for project phases. It also sets the program's start date and limits on application periods.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Individuals, nonprofit organizations, and business entities involved in catalytic revitalization projects in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a phased approach to tax credits and establishes procedures for project phase approval, which is a new approach to incentivize revitalization projects.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by encouraging revitalization projects that may include affordable housing and community development.

Title: Correctional Training Commission - Membership - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Correctional Training Commission; requiring certain members of the Commission appointed by the Governor to represent certain geographic regions; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership structure of the Maryland Correctional Training Commission by requiring certain members appointed by the Governor to represent specific geographic regions of the state.
responsible_party: Maryland Correctional Training Commission
stakeholders: Correctional officers and officials in Maryland, regional correctional facilities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regional representation approach to diversify the composition of the Correctional Training Commission, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Election Administration - State Administrator, Local Boards, and Election Directors
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections to evaluate the performance of the State Administrator of Elections; requiring the State Administrator to provide a performance evaluation of the election director of each local board of elections to the local board; requiring each local board to confer with the State Administrator in appointing an election director, maintain a warehouse, and provide for early voting center expenses; requiring, rather than authorizing, election directors to take certain actions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances election administration in Maryland by requiring the State Board of Elections to evaluate the performance of the State Administrator of Elections annually, and to provide performance evaluations of local election directors. It clarifies roles and responsibilities of the State Administrator and local boards, including appointment procedures, operational duties, and security measures for voting systems.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, election officials, local election boards, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured performance evaluation system for election officials and emphasizes the use of technology and cybersecurity in election processes, which are relatively modern approaches to election management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on election administration and security.

Title: Seed Community Development Anchor Institution Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Expanding the purpose and use of the Seed Community Development Anchor Institution Fund administered by the Department of Housing and Community Development to include providing grants and loans to anchor institutions for a certain purpose in sustainable communities; and repealing a requirement that certain matching funds be from a private source.
bill_summary: The bill expands the use and purpose of the Seed Community Development Anchor Institution Fund to include providing grants and loans to anchor institutions for community development projects in sustainable communities and blighted areas, and removes the requirement that matching funds come from a private source.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Anchor institutions, communities in sustainable areas and blighted areas, local governments, residents, small businesses, nonprofit organizations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted fund to support community development through anchor institutions, with a focus on sustainable communities and blighted areas, and involves a competitive grant and loan process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by revitalizing communities, improving housing, and supporting local economic development.

Title: Real Property - Recordation - Procedures
Synopsis: Requiring a county treasurer, tax collector, or director of finance to provide a certificate enumerating certain taxes, assessments, and charges against a property and to establish certain procedures to facilitate the issuance of a certificate; requiring a collecting agent presented with a certificate to endorse a deed on payment of transfer and recordation taxes and all charges stated in the certificate and establishing that this endorsement is sufficient authority for a transfer on the assessment books; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures for recording real estate instruments in Maryland, including requiring counties to provide certificates of taxes and charges, facilitating electronic payments and approvals, and establishing new protocols for recording and transferring property.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation and county treasurers, tax collectors, or directors of finance
stakeholders: Property owners, buyers, real estate professionals, county and state tax authorities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces electronic processes for recording property transactions and payments, streamlining procedures and reducing paper-based transactions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on property recordation procedures.

Title: Garrett County Alcoholic Beverages Act of 2024
Synopsis: Establishing a resort beer license, a resort beer and wine license, and a beer, wine, and liquor festival license in Garrett County; altering the hours of sale for alcoholic beverages on Sundays for certain licenses; altering the residency requirements for certain applicants for an alcoholic beverages license in the county to require that at least one of the applicants be a resident of the State; prohibiting alcoholic beverages from being brought into places of adult entertainment and consumed or transferred; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new alcohol licensing options in Garrett County, including resort beer, wine, and liquor licenses, and a beer, wine, and liquor festival license. It also modifies hours of sale, residency requirements, and penalties related to alcohol laws in the county.
responsible_party: Garrett County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, festival organizers, and consumers in Garrett County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specialized resort and festival alcohol licenses, allowing for large-scale events and resort-based sales, employing new licensing categories and regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing and sale regulations.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Protestant Episcopal Church, Diocese of Washington
Synopsis: Repealing uncodified provisions of law relating to the Protestant Episcopal Church, Diocese of Washington, commonly known as the "Vestry Act"; and providing for the governance of religious corporations in union with the Protestant Episcopal Church, Diocese of Washington.
bill_summary: This bill repeals certain laws related to the governance of religious corporations in the Diocese of Washington, Maryland, and recognizes the legal existence of specific parishes and vestries within the Episcopal Church in Maryland. It also updates procedures for recording certificates of incorporation and reports on the impact of repealing certain property trust laws for Methodist Churches.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Religious organizations, specifically Episcopal and Methodist churches in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal and procedural frameworks for religious corporations, with some recognition of existing entities, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on religious corporation governance and property laws.

Title: Community Health and Safety Works Grant Program and Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Community Health and Safety Works Grant Program in the Department of Housing and Community Development to support certain eligible projects that improve the quality of life within and economic potential of Maryland communities by making targeted investments in crime prevention strategies to address certain concerns in certain areas; establishing the Community Health and Safety Works Grant Program Fund to provide financial assistance in the form of grants under the provisions of the Program for eligible projects; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Community Health and Safety Works Grant Program and Fund in Maryland to provide grants for projects that improve community safety, reduce crime, and enhance quality of life through targeted investments in environmental, health, and safety strategies.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Maryland communities, residents, local organizations, law enforcement, and neighborhood groups
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted grants for community safety projects, including surveillance, environmental improvements, and violence prevention, integrating partnerships and evidence-based interventions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by improving community safety and quality of life, which can lead to better opportunities and stability for children.

Title: Education - State Library Resource Center - Funding
Synopsis: Altering the calculation of certain funding for the State Library Resource Center for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter.
bill_summary: The bill adjusts the funding calculation for the Maryland State Library Resource Center, increasing the per-resident funding amount for fiscal years 2024 through 2031 and beyond.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Library users and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates funding formulas and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on library funding does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Family Law - Victims of Domestic Violence Program - Certification and Grant Fund
Synopsis: Requiring a victims of domestic violence program to be certified by the federally recognized State domestic violence coalition as a comprehensive domestic violence program; establishing the Victims of Domestic Violence Program Grant Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund in the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services;  requiring interest earnings of the Fund to be credited to the Fund; and authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a certification requirement for domestic violence programs, creates a Victims of Domestic Violence Program Grant Fund to support certified programs, and sets rules for funding and oversight.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Victims of domestic violence and their children in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a dedicated grant fund and certification process for domestic violence programs, enhancing coordination and funding mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting victims and their children through shelter and services.

Title: Commission to Study African American Civil War Soldiers in Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Study African American Civil War Soldiers in Maryland to study the history of the African American soldiers who fought for the Union Army in Maryland and to make findings and recommendations regarding the funding, design, construction, and location of an appropriate memorial dedicated to the African American Civil War soldiers; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Commission to Study African American Civil War Soldiers in Maryland, tasked with researching their history and making recommendations for memorials.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans Affairs, in coordination with the State Archives and other entities
stakeholders: African American Civil War soldiers, Maryland historical and cultural organizations, and the general public interested in Civil War history
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated commission to study historical data and make memorial recommendations, which is a traditional approach but focused on cultural heritage.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on historical research and memorials.

Title: Courts - Prohibited Liability Agreements - Recreational Facilities
Synopsis: Establishing that a provision in a contract or agreement relating to the use of a recreational facility that purports to limit the recreational facility's liability, or release the recreational facility from or indemnify or hold harmless the recreational facility against liability, for injury caused by or resulting from the negligence or other wrongful acts of the recreational facility or its agents or on-duty employees is void and unenforceable under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill makes it illegal for recreational facilities to include contract provisions that limit their liability or release them from responsibility for injuries caused by negligence or wrongful acts.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system, or enforcement agencies responsible for contract law and recreational safety
stakeholders: Recreational facility operators, users of recreational facilities, and the general public engaging in recreational activities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal approach to protect consumers by voiding liability-limiting clauses in recreational facility contracts, which is a common legal practice but applied specifically to recreational facilities in this context.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses liability clauses in recreational contracts.

Title: Criminal Law - Private Home Detention Monitoring - Notification
Synopsis: Requiring a private home detention monitoring agency to notify the court within 24 hours after a defendant subject to home monitoring as a condition of pretrial release has violated a condition of home detention monitoring; requiring a private home detention monitoring agency to notify the Division of Parole and Probation within 1 hour after an individual subject to home monitoring as a condition of probation violated a condition of home detention monitoring; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances notification requirements for private home detention monitoring agencies when a monitored individual violates conditions, tamper with equipment, or enters restricted areas. It also authorizes civil penalties for failure to notify and establishes a workgroup to study and recommend improvements to home detention monitoring processes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals under private home detention monitoring, courts, law enforcement, and the Division of Parole and Probation
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology and improved notification protocols to enhance monitoring and accountability in home detention programs, and establishes a workgroup to streamline processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on monitoring and legal procedures.

Title: Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity and Related Approvals - Definition of Generating Station (Critical Infrastructure Streamlining Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Altering and establishing the definition of "generating station" for the purpose of exempting the construction of certain generating facilities used to produce electricity for the purpose of on-site emergency backup and certain test and maintenance operations from the requirement to obtain a certificate of public convenience and necessity or certain other related approvals under certain circumstances; and altering the distribution of income tax revenue from corporations that is attributable to certain data centers.
bill_summary: The bill redefines 'generating station' to exempt certain small and emergency backup electricity facilities from requiring permits and approvals, and establishes reporting and regulatory requirements for backup generation units, especially those used for critical infrastructure and emergency purposes. It also modifies the distribution of income tax revenue from data centers to fund energy programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Operators of backup and emergency power generation facilities, critical infrastructure facilities, data center owners, and the general public in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach to streamline regulations for emergency backup power facilities and integrates cybersecurity and critical infrastructure considerations into energy regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on energy infrastructure and regulatory processes.

Title: Families Serve Act of 2024
Synopsis: Authorizing employers to grant a preference in hiring and promotion to spouses of eligible service members; and requiring the appointing authorities in the Executive Branch of State government to apply a credit of 10 points on any selection test for eligible spouses and veterans of certain uniformed services.
bill_summary: The Families Serve Act of 2024 authorizes employers to give hiring and promotion preferences to military spouses, veterans, and their families, including applying test score credits for eligible individuals in state employment processes.
responsible_party: State government agencies responsible for employment and human resources
stakeholders: Military spouses, veterans, and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted approach by providing test score credits and hiring preferences for military families, which is a strategic use of existing employment policies to support military families.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting military families' employment stability and income.

Title: Governor's Office for Children - Engaging Neighborhoods, Organizations, Unions, Governments, and Households (ENOUGH) Grant Program (ENOUGH Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing the Governor's Office for Children and the Special Secretary of the Governor's Office for Children as the head of the Office; requiring the Special Secretary to chair the Children's Cabinet; requiring the Office to staff the Children's Cabinet; requiring the Children's Cabinet to meet not less than four times each year; requiring the Accountability and Implementation Board, in consultation with certain departments, to submit a certain recommendation to the General Assembly by December 1, 2025; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the ENOUGH grant program to fund place-based strategies targeting child poverty, including community engagement, neighborhood assessments, and regional initiatives, with a dedicated fund and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office for Children
stakeholders: Children, youth, families, community organizations, local governments, and schools in high-poverty neighborhoods
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, place-based approach leveraging community partnerships, data-driven neighborhood assessments, and regional collaborations to address child poverty.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly reduce child poverty through targeted neighborhood interventions and resource coordination.

Title: Education - Child Care Career and Professional Development Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for an award from the Child Care Career and Professional Development Fund to include a service obligation to work in an approved child care setting for at least 20 hours per week; requiring the Office of Child Care to prioritize grant awards to certain applicants; requiring award recipients who do not perform the service obligation to repay certain award funding except under certain circumstances; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the qualifications and service obligations for awards from the Maryland Child Care Career and Professional Development Fund, including prioritizing certain applicants and establishing repayment conditions for award recipients.
responsible_party: Office of Child Care
stakeholders: Individuals pursuing early childhood education careers in Maryland, child care providers, and early childhood education students
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a service obligation requirement and prioritization criteria for the existing child care professional development fund, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve the quality and availability of qualified child care providers, which can help reduce child poverty by supporting early childhood development.

Title: General Assembly - Committee Chairs and Vice Chairs - Gender-Neutral Language
Synopsis: Altering certain terminology that refers to chairs and vice chairs of committees of the General Assembly to be gender-neutral.
bill_summary: This bill updates the language used to refer to chairs and vice chairs of committees in the Maryland General Assembly to be gender-neutral, replacing terms like 'Chairman' and 'Vice Chairman' with 'Chair' and 'Vice Chair' in various statutes.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland General Assembly and the public interacting with legislative committees
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward language update to promote gender-neutral terminology in government titles, which is a common practice and not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it mainly involves language updates for legislative titles.

Title: Cecil County – Annual Financial Report – Filing Date
Synopsis: Altering the date by which Cecil County is required to file a certain financial report with the Department of Legislative Services.
bill_summary: This bill changes the deadline for Cecil County to file its annual financial report with the Maryland Department of Legislative Services, moving it to December 31 starting in 2024.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Cecil County and the Maryland state government
innovative_summary: The bill primarily adjusts administrative deadlines and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Commercial Law – Consumer Protection – Sale and Resale of Tickets
Synopsis: Requiring the listing for a ticket and each step of a transaction to purchase a ticket to disclose certain information, including the total price of the ticket; repealing the exceptions to the prohibition against a reseller selling or offering to sell speculative tickets; prohibiting a secondary ticket exchange from providing a marketplace for the resale of a ticket that violates the Act; and requiring a ticket issuer, secondary ticket exchange, or reseller to provide a refund under certain conditions.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new regulations for the sale and resale of tickets in Maryland, including disclosure requirements, resale price limits, and refund policies, to protect consumers.
responsible_party: Consumer Protection Division of the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Consumers purchasing tickets for entertainment events in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs comprehensive transparency and refund policies, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting adult consumers and the ticket resale market.

Title: Real Estate Brokers - Brokerage Agreements - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring items to be included in a brokerage agreement between a real estate broker and a seller or lessor or a buyer or lessee.
bill_summary: The bill updates the requirements for brokerage agreements between real estate brokers and clients in Maryland, specifying what must be included in such agreements and when the brokerage relationship begins and ends.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission or relevant licensing authority
stakeholders: Real estate brokers, sellers, buyers, lessors, and lessees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies and standardizes legal requirements for brokerage agreements; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns legal procedures for real estate transactions.

Title: Procurement – Construction Contingency Fund
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the Secretaries of Budget and Management and General Services may request the Board of Public Works to authorize a certain expenditure from the Construction Contingency Fund to include consideration of price adjustments for material price fluctuations of identified eligible project-specific materials.
bill_summary: The bill modifies rules regarding the Construction Contingency Fund, allowing expenditures for project cost adjustments due to material price fluctuations, and requires procurement contracts for construction to include clauses for contract modifications related to substantial changes in material prices.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of General Services and the Board of Public Works
stakeholders: State construction projects, contractors, and the public benefiting from state infrastructure
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new contractual clause allowing for price adjustments due to material cost fluctuations, employing a proactive approach to managing construction costs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by ensuring more reliable and potentially less costly public infrastructure projects.

Title: Real Estate Brokers - Licensing - License Renewals and Continuing Education
Synopsis: Repealing certain processes regarding the expiration of certain licenses for real estate brokers, associate real estate brokers, and real estate salespersons; requiring that certain licenses expire on a staggered basis; modifying and setting certain time frames for certain processes regarding the expiration of certain licenses; authorizing the State Real Estate Commission to set a certain fee under certain circumstances; altering certain regulatory requirements for conducting certain continuing education courses; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates licensing renewal procedures for real estate brokers, associate brokers, and salespersons in Maryland. It modifies license expiration dates to be staggered, revises continuing education requirements, and allows for virtual or remote course delivery.
responsible_party: Maryland State Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate licensees and the public seeking real estate services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of virtual or remote means for conducting continuing education courses, including online and other digital delivery methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing procedures and education requirements for real estate professionals.

Title: Primary and Secondary Education - Breakfast and Lunch Programs - Universal Expansion Report
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education, on or before December 1, 2024, to report to the General Assembly on a cost estimate for providing free breakfast and lunch to all students in public schools in the State; and requiring the Department, as part of its report, to compile research completed in other states that have established universal meal programs and prepare a summary of any findings presented in those reports.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Maryland school meal programs to offer free breakfast and lunch to all students in public schools starting in the 2026 fiscal year, and requires the Department of Education to report on the costs of providing universal free meals.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students in Maryland public schools
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to universal free school meals, including a detailed reporting requirement and phased implementation, which is a relatively innovative approach to school nutrition policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly reduce child poverty by removing the cost barrier to school meals for all students.

Title: Sales and Use Tax - Nonprofit Organizations Maintaining Memorials - Exemption
Synopsis: Providing that the sales and use tax does not apply to a sale by a nonprofit organization that maintains a memorial on property that is owned by the State if the proceeds of the sale are used to maintain a memorial on property that is owned by the State.
bill_summary: The bill exempts nonprofit organizations from sales and use tax on sales related to maintaining memorials on state-owned property, provided the proceeds are used for that purpose.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations maintaining memorials on state-owned property
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific tax exemption for nonprofit organizations maintaining memorials on state property, which is a targeted policy change rather than a new technological approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns tax exemptions for nonprofit memorials.

Title: Public School Construction Program - Maryland School for the Blind - State and Local Cost-Share
Synopsis: Altering the State and local cost-share formula for the Public School Construction Program for the Maryland School for the Blind to set the State share at 100%.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Public School Construction Program to include the Maryland School for the Blind in the funding and cost-share calculations, establishes a loan fund to support school construction costs for local governments and the Maryland School for the Blind, and sets funding levels for the loan program from fiscal years 2023 to 2026.
responsible_party: Interagency Commission for Public School Construction
stakeholders: Local governments and the Maryland School for the Blind
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated low-interest loan fund for school construction projects, including the Maryland School for the Blind, with specific eligibility and priority criteria, and sets phased funding levels over multiple years.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving school infrastructure for the Maryland School for the Blind and supporting local school construction.

Title: Procurement - Minority Business Participation - Real Property Title Insurance Services Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring certain reporting relating to minority business participation in State procurement by industry type to include real property title insurance services, including commercial real property title insurance services; and prohibiting the Special Secretary for the Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs from waiving a certain reporting requirement related to real property title insurance services.
bill_summary: The bill requires reporting on minority business participation in Maryland state procurement, including a new category for real property title insurance services, and prohibits waivers of this reporting requirement for that category.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs
stakeholders: Minority business enterprises participating in state procurement, state agencies, and contractors involved in procurement processes
innovative_summary: The bill introduces detailed reporting requirements for minority business participation, including a new industry category for real property title insurance services, and establishes stricter oversight and accountability measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve economic opportunities for minority businesses, which could contribute to reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: General Provisions - Commemorative Days - Maryland Veterans Suicide Prevention Day
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to annually proclaim September 30 as Maryland Veterans Suicide Prevention Day.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland governor to annually proclaim a day, from July 11 to September 30, as Maryland Veterans Suicide Prevention Day, to raise awareness and promote mental health support among veterans and the community.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Veterans, service members, their families, and the general Maryland public
innovative_summary: The bill establishes an annual awareness day focused on veteran suicide prevention, emphasizing community reflection and mental health support, which is a traditional awareness initiative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on veteran mental health awareness.

Title: Maryland Self-Service Storage Act - Sale of Personal Property in Satisfaction of Liens - Means of Advertising
Synopsis: Authorizing an operator or a manager of a self-service storage facility to advertise in a newspaper, by electronic mail, or on a website the sale of the personal property in a self-service storage unit to satisfy a certain lien without the occupant's prior written authorization in the storage agreement; and altering a certain statement that must be contained in a self-service storage facility rental agreement.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes self-service storage facility operators to advertise the sale of stored personal property to satisfy liens without prior written occupant authorization, and modifies advertising requirements for such sales.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant self-service storage regulatory authority
stakeholders: Self-service storage facility operators and storage unit occupants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of online websites and electronic mail for advertising storage unit sales, modernizing the process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Public Information Act - Surveillance Images - Illegal Dumping in Baltimore City
Synopsis: Altering a requirement that a custodian deny inspection of certain surveillance images of illegal dumping in Baltimore City to allow inspection by employees or agents of the Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development; and authorizing the Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development to publicly disseminate a surveillance image as part of an investigation.
bill_summary: The bill modifies laws regarding the inspection and dissemination of surveillance images related to illegal dumping in Baltimore City. It allows certain city employees and agents to inspect and publicly disseminate these images under specific circumstances.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents and authorities involved in illegal dumping investigations in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a change in the handling and public dissemination of surveillance images, allowing more transparency and access for specific city officials.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on surveillance and illegal dumping enforcement.

Title: Department of Juvenile Services – Report on Shootings (Department of Juvenile Services Transparency Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Juvenile Services to report to the Commission on Juvenile Justice Reform and Emerging and Best Practices and the General Assembly, on or before December 1, 2024, and each December 1 thereafter, certain information regarding shootings of and by juveniles under the supervision of the Department and the actions the Department took after the shooting incidents, including the timeline of the actions.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Juvenile Services to report annually on incidents involving shootings of or by juveniles under their supervision, including details about the incidents, actions taken, and juvenile demographics.
responsible_party: Department of Juvenile Services
stakeholders: Juveniles under supervision, their families, and the community
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a reporting requirement for transparency and data collection on juvenile shootings, which is a standard practice rather than a new technological approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on reporting incidents and does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority - Modifications
Synopsis: Requiring the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority to meet at least four times per year; and requiring staff of the Prince George's County Redevelopment Authority to provide support for the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority in consultation with the Department of Housing and Community Development.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority by requiring it to meet at least four times per year and clarifies support and funding management roles, including support from the Prince George's County Redevelopment Authority and the Department of Housing and Community Development.
responsible_party: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority and Prince George's County Redevelopment Authority
stakeholders: Communities within the target area in Prince George's County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies governance and support roles for the development authority; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific programs targeting it.

Title: Maryland Condominium Act - Amendments to the Declaration
Synopsis: Reducing the percentage of unit owners listed on the current roster of a condominium needed to consent to an amendment of a condominium's declaration if none of the units of the condominium are owned by a developer of the condominium from 80% to 66 2/3%.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Condominium Act to lower the percentage of unit owners' consent required to amend a condominium declaration from 80% to 66 2/3%, with certain exceptions, especially when no units are owned by a developer. It also clarifies procedures for amendments, court corrections, and suspension of use of common elements for delinquent owners.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Condominium unit owners, developers, mortgagees, and residents of condominiums in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal procedures and consent thresholds for condominium amendments, which is a regulatory change rather than an innovative program employing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on condominium legal procedures does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Commission on Civil Rights - Monetary Relief
Synopsis: Altering certain maximum amounts of monetary relief the Maryland Commission on Civil Rights is authorized to award if the Commission finds that a respondent has engaged in a discriminatory act under provisions of law regarding public accommodations and persons licensed or regulated by the Maryland Department of Labor; requiring, by July 1, 2025, and by each July 1 for the next 4 years, the Commission to submit a report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the impact of the Act on persons against whom complaints have been filed; etc.
bill_summary: This bill increases the maximum monetary relief the Maryland Commission on Civil Rights can award in discrimination cases related to public accommodations and employment, clarifies procedures for civil actions, and establishes reporting requirements for the impact of these changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission on Civil Rights
stakeholders: Persons alleging discrimination in public accommodations and employment in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal procedures and relief limits; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal remedies for discrimination.

Title: State Government - Attorney General - Reports
Synopsis: Altering certain reporting requirements for the Attorney General; and requiring the Attorney General to publish certain documents on the Attorney General's website.
bill_summary: The bill updates reporting requirements for the Maryland Attorney General, including publishing certain documents and reports on the Attorney General's website, and clarifies the scope of the Attorney General's authority to investigate federal actions affecting the state.
responsible_party: Office of the Maryland Attorney General
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, legal and governmental entities, federal agencies
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes transparency by requiring the Attorney General to publish opinions and reports online annually, leveraging digital platforms for public access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on legal transparency and federal-state relations.

Title: Abandoned or Sunken Vessels and Waterway Improvement Fund Grants
Synopsis: Requiring the owner of a vessel that is required to be numbered to include certain contact information for each owner of the vessel with the application for a certificate of number; requiring the Department of Natural Resources, before and after seizing, removing, or taking an abandoned or sunken vessel into custody, to attempt to contact certain individuals in a certain manner; requiring the Department to distribute at least $250,000 from the Waterway Improvement Fund each fiscal year to a certain organization for a certain purpose; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a program for voluntary vessel turn-in to prevent vessels from becoming abandoned or sunken, requires vessel owners to provide contact information when registering vessels, and mandates the Department of Natural Resources to manage abandoned or sunken vessels, including seizing, removing, and disposing of them. It also allocates funds from the Waterway Improvement Fund to support maritime heritage preservation.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Vessel owners, maritime heritage organizations, residents and visitors of Maryland waterways
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a voluntary vessel turn-in program and uses digital media and public notifications for vessel disposition, employing modern communication and government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on vessel management and heritage preservation has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Government - Attorney General - Determinations and Settlements
Synopsis: Requiring the judge or jury in certain actions to make a certain determination and assign responsibility and liability in a certain manner; authorizing the State to continue to pursue certain actions if it does not obtain complete relief from certain responsible persons; establishing that certain provisions of law requiring uniform contribution among joint tort-feasors do not apply to certain actions; and establishing the impact of a certain settlement on the liability of certain responsible persons.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new procedures for public welfare claims in Maryland, including how liability and responsibility are determined and how settlements affect liability. It clarifies that certain laws about joint tort–feasors do not apply to these claims and allows the state to continue pursuing claims if full relief isn't obtained from responsible parties.
responsible_party: Maryland Attorney General and relevant state agencies
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland involved in or affected by public welfare claims, environmental, infrastructure, and natural resources sectors
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new legal framework for handling public welfare claims, including specific procedures for liability determination and settlement effects, which is a novel approach in Maryland law.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on public welfare claims and liability could indirectly impact child poverty by improving the state's ability to address issues affecting residents' welfare.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Bail Bonds - Seventh Judicial Circuit
Synopsis: Repealing certain provisions of law relating to bail bonds in the Seventh Judicial Circuit.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain bail bond provisions specific to the Seventh Judicial Circuit in Maryland, establishes a 1% license fee for approved bail bondsmen in that circuit, and clarifies rules for property bondsmen using real estate as collateral. It also sets the effective date as July 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Defendants, bail bondsmen, property bondsmen, and the judicial system in Maryland's Seventh Judicial Circuit
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific licensing fee structure for bail bondsmen and clarifies rules for property bonds, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting bail bond procedures and fees.

Title: Maryland National Guard - Tricare Premium Reimbursement Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Removing a certain reimbursement limit on grant awards to certain members of the National Guard for the cost of certain health care and dental care premiums, subject to the limitation that the total amount of grants awarded to eligible recipients in a fiscal year may not exceed the annual appropriation in the State budget for the Tricare Premium Reimbursement Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Tricare Premium Reimbursement Program for Maryland National Guard members, allowing the state to reimburse eligible members and their families for certain health and dental insurance premiums, with a limit on monthly reimbursements and an overall annual funding cap.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety or relevant state agency
stakeholders: Maryland National Guard members and their families
innovative_summary: The program employs a government-funded reimbursement approach to support military families' health insurance costs, which is a common but targeted approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily supports military families' health insurance costs.

Title: Family Law - Kinship Care
Synopsis: Altering the definition of relative to mean an individual who is a kinship caregiver for purposes of provisions of law relating to children in need of assistance; and altering provisions of law relating to the kinship care program in the Department of Human Services and certain procedures for the placement of children in need of out-of-home placement.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to expand the definition of 'relative' to include a broader range of kinship caregivers, and establishes a kinship care program within the Department of Human Services that prioritizes placement of children with kinship caregivers in out-of-home placements.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children in need of assistance, kinship caregivers, child welfare agencies
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes kinship care placement preferences and broadens the definition of kinship caregivers, promoting family-based placements and potentially improving child welfare outcomes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could reduce child poverty by promoting family-based placements that support stability and well-being.

Title: Maryland Pathway to Nursing Pilot Program and Advisory Committee - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Pathway to Nursing Pilot Program in the Maryland Higher Education Commission to support students in licensed practical nursing education programs who intend to practice nursing as a career in the State; requiring the Secretary of Higher Education to issue grants to at least two pilot sites on or before July 1, 2025; requiring the Secretary, on or before each December 15 annually through 2029, to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the implementation of the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Pathway to Nursing Pilot Program to support nursing students, address the nursing shortage, and increase diversity among nurses. It creates an advisory committee to assist in developing and implementing the program, which includes funding, evaluation, and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Nursing students, educational institutions, healthcare providers, and diverse communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach combining financial support, diversity initiatives, and evaluation to improve nursing education and workforce development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting students with financial barriers and increasing healthcare workforce diversity.

Title: Business Occupations and Professions - Security Guards - Use of Force Reporting, Standards, and Certifications
