Synopsis: Prohibiting a use of force report from including information that is prohibited from disclosure by State or federal law; requiring the employer of a security guard providing security guard services on the premises of a health care facility to report certain information to the Secretary of State Police every 7 days; and altering the effective date of certain provisions of law relating to security guards from June 1, 2024, to January 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that health care-related physical interventions do not constitute use of force and establishes reporting requirements for security guards' use of force incidents, including specific details to be reported to the Maryland State Police.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police
stakeholders: Security guards, health care facilities, individuals receiving security services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces detailed reporting standards for use of force incidents involving security guards, including specific demographic and incident data, and clarifies legal definitions to improve transparency and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but improves oversight and accountability in security practices at health care facilities.

Title: Higher Education - Harford Community College Board of Trustees - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring that a member of the Harford Community College Board of Trustees be a resident of Harford County for the duration of the member's term; altering the membership of the Harford Community College Board of Trustees so that all members are at large; requiring the Governor to consider certain factors when appointing members to the Board; and altering meeting requirements so that the Harford Community College Board of Trustees and the Harford County Board of Education are no longer required to attend certain meetings.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the composition and appointment process of the Harford Community College Board of Trustees, including residency requirements, appointment factors, and meeting obligations, effective June 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Harford Community College and the Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Residents of Harford County, students, and local government entities
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates governance rules and appointment procedures; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on governance and appointment procedures.

Title: Operating a Vessel While Under the Influence of Alcohol - Enforcement (Nick's Law)
Synopsis: Altering the time period within which a court may prohibit a person convicted under certain circumstances of operating a vessel while under the influence of alcohol from operating a vessel on the waters of the State; requiring the Department of Natural Resources, in coordination with the Natural Resources Police Force, to establish and maintain a database of persons prohibited from operating a vessel on the waters of the State due to a certain conviction for operating a vessel while under the influence of alcohol; etc.
bill_summary: The bill, known as Nick's Law, enhances enforcement against operating vessels under the influence of alcohol or drugs in Maryland. It establishes a database of individuals prohibited from operating vessels due to convictions, extends the prohibition period, and increases penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources in coordination with the Natural Resources Police Force
stakeholders: Vessel operators, law enforcement, and the general public using watercraft in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a centralized electronic database to track and enforce vessel operation prohibitions, integrating law enforcement and judicial notifications.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on law enforcement and safety regulations.

Title: Consumer Protection - Retail Sales of Gift Cards (Gift Card Scams Prevention Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a merchant from selling a certain open- or closed-loop gift card to a consumer unless the merchant meets certain requirements; requiring a certain merchant to provide training to all employees of the merchant on identifying and responding to gift card fraud; requiring the Division of Consumer Protection to create a certain notice and issue certain guidelines regarding gift card fraud; requiring a certain third-party gift card reseller to record and maintain a copy of certain information for at least 3 years; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new regulations and requirements for the sale and resale of gift cards in Maryland, including registration, packaging, employee training, and record-keeping to prevent gift card fraud and scams.
responsible_party: Division of Consumer Protection in the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Consumers, merchants, third-party gift card resellers, law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs new regulations, record-keeping, and training requirements to combat gift card fraud, integrating legal and procedural approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by reducing financial scams and fraud affecting consumers.

Title: Frederick County - Property Tax Credit for Property Located in Historic District - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing certain requirements for the amount and duration of a tax credit against the property tax imposed on certain improved real property owned by the Emmitsburg Civic Association and located in a historic district in Frederick County; authorizing the governing body of Frederick County to provide, by law, for the amount and duration of the credit and certain other matters relating to the credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain fixed requirements for the amount and duration of a property tax credit for properties in a historic district in Frederick County and authorizes the county's governing body to set these details by law.
responsible_party: Frederick County governing body
stakeholders: Property owners in historic districts in Frederick County, civic associations, local government
innovative_summary: The bill allows local government to customize property tax credits for historic properties, providing flexibility in implementation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Economic Development - Regional Additive Manufacturing Partnership of Maryland - Alterations
Synopsis: Renaming the Regional Additive Manufacturing Partnership of Maryland to be the Regional Advanced Manufacturing Partnership of Maryland; altering the purposes and duties of the Partnership and composition of the Executive Board of the Partnership; and renaming the Regional Additive Manufacturing Partnership of Maryland Fund to be the Regional Advanced Manufacturing Partnership of Maryland Fund.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Regional Additive Manufacturing Partnership of Maryland to the Regional Advanced Manufacturing Partnership of Maryland, updates its purposes, composition, and related fund, and establishes a program to promote advanced manufacturing in Cecil and Harford counties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or designated agency
stakeholders: Businesses, educational institutions, government agencies, and workers involved in advanced manufacturing in Cecil and Harford counties
innovative_summary: The program promotes advanced manufacturing through regional collaboration, workforce development, and marketing, employing a coordinated regional approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by fostering economic development and job opportunities in the region.

Title: Public Utilities - Solar Energy Systems and Programs, Maryland Strategic Energy Investment Fund, and Prevailing Wage (Brighter Tomorrow Act)
Synopsis: Requiring that certain home improvement contracts for the installation of a solar energy generating system on the roof of a building include the installation of a certain wildlife barrier under certain circumstances; requiring a county or municipality to implement certain software for features supporting the tracking and approval of residential building permits for residential solar energy and energy storage systems and main electric panel urgrades and derates on or before August 1, 2025, except under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The Brighter Tomorrow Act updates Maryland's policies on solar energy, including expanding incentives, establishing new programs for low-income households, requiring certain safety features in solar installations, and modifying tax and property assessments related to solar energy systems.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration and Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Solar energy system owners, low- to moderate-income households, local governments, utility companies, and solar industry contractors
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new incentive programs, certification standards, and a consumer protection policy for solar energy, employing advanced software for permit tracking and expanding community solar and net metering policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to affordable solar energy for low-income families and supporting community solar projects.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Employed Individuals With Disabilities
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to provide Maryland Medical Assistance Program services for individuals under the Employed Individuals with Disabilities Program in accordance with certain requirements; prohibiting the Department from limiting eligibility to receive services under the EID Program based on certain criteria; requiring the Department, on or before December 1, 2024, to submit a report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the impact of implementing an EID Program that serves certain individuals; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to provide services under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program for individuals with disabilities participating in the Employed Individuals with Disabilities (EID) Program. It repeals previous provisions related to the Employed Persons with Disabilities Program, establishes eligibility and program rules, including income-based premiums, and mandates reporting on potential expansion to serve individuals over 65.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities, especially those participating in the EID Program and potentially individuals over 65
innovative_summary: The program introduces income-based premiums and aims to expand services for employed individuals with disabilities, including potential expansion to older adults, employing a flexible and inclusive approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to healthcare for employed individuals with disabilities, which could reduce child poverty indirectly by supporting family stability and employment.

Title: Anaerobic Digestion Technology - Coordination and Guidance
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Agriculture to coordinate with the Maryland Energy Administration, the Department of the Environment, the Department of Commerce, the University of Maryland College of Agriculture and Natural Resources, the University of Maryland Eastern Shore, electric companies, farmers, and industry to ensure anaerobic digestion technology projects are appropriately coordinated; and requiring the Department, in coordination with certain agencies, to establish guidance for farmers on anaerobic digestion technology.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Agriculture to coordinate with various state agencies and stakeholders to ensure the proper development and implementation of anaerobic digestion technology projects. It also mandates the establishment of guidance for farmers on permits, incentives, and regulations related to anaerobic digestion.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Farmers, energy companies, environmental agencies, and industry stakeholders involved in anaerobic digestion projects in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill promotes coordinated guidance and streamlined processes for adopting anaerobic digestion technology, which is a relatively modern approach to renewable energy and waste management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on environmental and agricultural development.

Title: Economic Development – Cyber Maryland Fund and Program – Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to administer the Cyber Maryland Fund; altering the uses of the Fund to include administrative expenses of the Program, including hiring staff, consultants, and other professionals as necessary to implement, maintain, and administer the Program and the Fund; requiring the Corporation to adopt standards for awarding grants; and requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $99,000 for the Fund to be used for talent pipeline management.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Cyber Maryland Program and Fund, managed by the Maryland Technology Development Corporation, to develop a cybersecurity workforce, support cybersecurity research, and improve government cybersecurity. It allocates funding, sets program goals, and creates a governing board.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Cybersecurity workforce, educational institutions, government agencies, private sector employers, and diverse communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a strategic, data-driven approach to workforce development, including industry research, partnerships, and diversity initiatives, with a focus on talent pipeline management and innovative workforce solutions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to high-quality cybersecurity education and careers, especially through diversity and inclusion efforts.

Title: Information Technology - Artificial Intelligence - Policies and Procedures (Artificial Intelligence Governance Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring each unit of State government to conduct certain inventories and a certain assessment on or before certain dates; prohibiting the Department of Information Technology from making certain information publicly available under certain circumstances; requiring the Department, in consultation with a certain subcabinet, to adopt certain policies and procedures concerning the development, procurement, deployment, use, and assessment of systems that employ artificial intelligence by units of State government; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a comprehensive framework for the responsible development, procurement, deployment, and assessment of artificial intelligence systems within Maryland state government. It mandates inventories, impact assessments, and policies to ensure ethical and safe AI use, creates a dedicated Artificial Intelligence Subcabinet, and promotes innovation and oversight.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Information Technology and the Governor’s Artificial Intelligence Subcabinet
stakeholders: State government agencies, public higher education institutions, and Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured, multi-agency approach to AI governance, including impact assessments, inventories, and a dedicated subcabinet, integrating AI oversight into state policy and procurement processes, which is a relatively innovative approach to government AI management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on responsible AI use and oversight could indirectly benefit children by promoting ethical and equitable AI applications, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification - State Law Enforcement Officers
Synopsis: Altering a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for the first $5,000 of income earned by certain law enforcement officers to include State law enforcement officers who reside in a political subdivision in which the crime rate exceeds the State's crime rate; and applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland income tax law to expand the subtraction modification for law enforcement officers, allowing certain officers who reside in high-crime areas to subtract the first $5,000 of their income from taxable income.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Law enforcement officers in Maryland, especially those residing in high-crime areas
innovative_summary: This bill employs a targeted tax incentive to support law enforcement officers working in high-crime areas, encouraging residency in these communities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly benefit communities with high crime rates, which can include impoverished areas.

Title: State Personnel - Line-of-Duty Death and Funeral Benefits
Synopsis: Increasing to $25,000 the maximum amount of funeral expenses that may be provided for a line-of-duty death of certain public safety officers and indexing the benefit to inflation; repealing an offset against certain funeral expenses for the line-of-duty death of certain public safety officers; increasing the maximum amount of line-of-duty death benefits for State employees and indexing the benefit to inflation; providing a funeral expense benefit for a line-of-duty death for State employees and indexing the benefit to inflation; etc.
bill_summary: This bill increases the maximum funeral expenses and death benefits for public safety officers and State employees killed in the line of duty, indexes these benefits to inflation, and extends eligibility for these benefits retroactively to deaths occurring before the bill's effective date.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Public safety officers, State employees, their families, and dependents
innovative_summary: The bill employs inflation indexing for death and funeral benefits, ensuring benefits keep pace with inflation, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily providing death and funeral benefits to families of deceased public safety and State employees.

Title: Courts - Immunity From Liability - Maryland Safe Haven Program
Synopsis: Altering, clarifying, and expanding certain provisions of law relating to the immunity from liability of a parent who leaves an unharmed newborn with a responsible adult within 60 days of the birth under certain circumstances; requiring the Secretary of Human Services to develop, implement, and maintain a public information program to inform the public about the Maryland Safe Haven Program; and requiring the Secretary of Human Services to submit a report to the General Assembly about the Maryland Safe Haven Program.
bill_summary: This bill expands the Maryland Safe Haven Program, which allows parents to leave unharmed newborns at designated facilities without facing liability, and mandates the development of a public information campaign about the program.
responsible_party: Secretary of Human Services
stakeholders: Parents, newborns, healthcare providers, social services, and the general public
innovative_summary: The program employs modern technology such as climate-controlled newborn safety devices with alert systems, video surveillance, and automated locks, combined with a comprehensive public education campaign.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child abandonment and improve child welfare, which can contribute to reducing child poverty.

Title: Public Health – Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program – Recovery of Funding
Synopsis: Altering the number of years after completion of a project funded in part by a grant of the Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program after which the State may recover funding under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the recovery period for funds used in federally qualified health centers, reducing the timeframe from 30 years to 15 years for leased properties and from 30 years to 30 years for owned properties, after which the state cannot recover funds if the property ceases to be a health center or is transferred to an unapproved entity.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Federally qualified health centers, public health organizations, and communities served by these health centers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a change in recovery periods for federally funded health center properties, which is a legal adjustment rather than an innovative technological or approach-based program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting the legal and financial aspects of health center funding.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Licensing Fees
Synopsis: Altering certain licensing fees for alcoholic beverages in Baltimore City.
bill_summary: The bill updates licensing fees for various classes of alcoholic beverage licenses in Baltimore City, increasing the fees for most license types.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders and consumers in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill mainly adjusts fees and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority Task Force
Synopsis: Establishing the Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority Task Force to study and make recommendations concerning the membership, purpose, and function of an entity or strategy to govern the renovation, revitalization, financing, and ongoing maintenance and management of the Baltimore Convention site and certain surrounding areas; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Mayor of Baltimore City, the Governor, and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a task force to study and make recommendations on creating an entity or strategy to govern, redevelop, and manage the Baltimore Convention Center and surrounding areas, including potential ownership, renovation, and operational models.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Baltimore City, local businesses, residents, and visitors to the Baltimore Convention Center
innovative_summary: The bill proposes studying new governance and operational models for the convention center, including options that do not rely on public-private partnerships, which is a relatively innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on redevelopment and revitalization of the convention center area could indirectly benefit local economic development, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Public Safety – Extreme Risk Protective Orders – Review of Court Records
Synopsis: Authorizing researchers affiliated with institutions of higher education who are conducting research to review a court record related to a petition for an extreme risk protective order; requiring the Maryland Judiciary to require an institution of higher education that has researchers reviewing court records to enter into an agreement providing for the storage and handling of the records; authorizing the Judiciary to institute an injunction or other remedy for a violation of the agreement and to prevent disclosure of certain records; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes researchers affiliated with higher education institutions to review court records related to petitions for extreme risk protective orders, under strict confidentiality agreements. It also establishes protocols for storage, handling, and use of these records for research purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Researchers at higher education institutions, individuals involved in extreme risk protective orders, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by allowing academic and policy researchers to access sensitive court records under strict confidentiality agreements to inform research and policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on research and legal procedures.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Bus Lane Obstruction - Monitoring Systems Expansion and Workgroup (Better Bus Service Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from parking or standing certain vehicles in a dedicated bus lane; making statewide the authority of a local jurisdiction to use, in accordance with certain standards and procedures, a bus lane monitoring system to enforce the prohibition against driving, standing, or parking a motor vehicle in a designated bus lane; and establishing the Workgroup on Curb Space Management.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of automated bus obstruction monitoring systems to enforce parking violations in bus lanes, establishes a workgroup on curb space management, and sets rules for citations and enforcement related to bus lane violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Public transit users, drivers, local governments, and transportation agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs automated monitoring technology and data collection systems to enforce bus lane regulations and improve curb space management, integrating new enforcement and data analysis approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving transit efficiency and accessibility, but its primary focus is on enforcement and management.

Title: Assisted Living Programs - Assisted Living Referrers - Requirements and Prohibitions
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements for assisted living referrers, including requirements related to the maintenance of general liability insurance, criminal history records checks, and the provision of certain agreements and descriptions of services; prohibiting an assisted living referrer from requesting payment for a referral more than 2 years after the referral was made; requiring the Office of Health Care Quality to maintain a certain database of approved assisted living programs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements and prohibitions for assisted living referrers, including registration, disclosure, insurance, criminal background checks, and data privacy rules, and creates a database of licensed assisted living programs.
responsible_party: Office of Health Care Quality
stakeholders: Individuals seeking assisted living, assisted living programs, and referrers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive regulations for assisted living referrers, including data privacy and a centralized database, which are relatively innovative approaches to oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on regulatory oversight of assisted living services.

Title: Maryland Clean Energy Center - Climate Technology Founder's Fund
Synopsis: Establishing the Climate Technology Founder's Fund in the Maryland Clean Energy Center; requiring the Maryland Energy Administration to use the Maryland Strategic Energy Investment Fund to provide at least $1,200,000 in each fiscal year for fiscal years 2025 through 2028 to the Climate Technology Founder's Fund; authorizing the Governor, on or before June 30, 2024, to transfer up to $2,200,000 of funds in the the Small, Minority, and Women-Owned Businesses Account to the Climate Technology Founder's Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Climate Technology Founder’s Fund within the Maryland Clean Energy Center to support early-stage funding for startups in climate technologies, with specific provisions for funding sources, administration, and priorities for minority, women, and veteran-owned businesses.
responsible_party: Maryland Clean Energy Center and Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Start-up companies in climate technology, minority, women, and veteran-owned businesses, and the broader community impacted by climate change mitigation
innovative_summary: The bill employs a dedicated fund specifically for early-stage climate technology startups, with targeted support for minority, women, and veteran-owned businesses, integrating public and private funding sources.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by fostering green jobs and economic development in underserved communities.

Title: Carroll County – Alcoholic Beverages Licenses – Alcohol Awareness Training
Synopsis: Requiring the holder of a Class B or Class D alcoholic beverages license in Carroll County or an individual designated by the license holder who has completed training in an approved alcohol awareness program to be present on the licensed premises at certain times when alcoholic beverages may be sold; providing for certain penalties; and requiring at least one license holder to maintain alcohol awareness program certification while listed on the license.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain alcohol license holders and designated employees in Carroll County to complete approved alcohol awareness training and be present on the premises during sale hours. It establishes penalties for violations and mandates that at least one license holder maintain certification.
responsible_party: Carroll County Alcohol Licensing Authority or relevant local licensing department
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, employees, and patrons in Carroll County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted training and certification approach to improve alcohol service and safety at licensed premises, with specific enforcement and compliance requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prior Authorizations of State Debt - Alterations
Synopsis: Amending certain prior authorizations of State Debt to change the names of certain grantees, alter the authorized uses of certain grants, and extend the termination date of certain grants.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes various grants and funding for infrastructure, recreational, cultural, and community development projects across Maryland, including parks, community centers, museums, and housing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources, Maryland Sports Council, Maryland Stadium Authority, and other local agencies
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, local governments, community organizations, and specific populations benefiting from community and recreational projects
innovative_summary: The bill employs a broad approach to community development, leveraging grants and infrastructure investments, with some projects involving innovative recreational and cultural facilities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving community resources, recreational facilities, and housing.

Title: Hospitals - Private Hospital Grant Program - Funding
Synopsis: Codifying a private hospital grant program for the purpose of making recommendations to the Governor for funding for capital projects at private hospitals in the State; requiring the Maryland Hospital Association to establish a certain review committee to develop a certain process for hospitals in the State to submit requests for funding; authorizing the Governor to include in the capital or operating budget bill in certain fiscal years an appropriation of $20,000,000 for the Private Hospital Grant Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Private Hospital Grant Program in Maryland, which makes recommendations to the Governor for funding capital projects at private hospitals. It requires the Maryland Hospital Association to create a review committee to develop processes for requesting and selecting projects, and authorizes funding of $20 million annually starting in fiscal year 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Hospital Association and the Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Private hospitals and their patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured review process and a dedicated committee to allocate funding for private hospital projects, which is a relatively organized approach to hospital funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily funds hospital capital projects.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Reproductive Health Care Clinic Security Grant Program - Establishment (Supporting Reproductive Health Care Clinics Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Reproductive Health Care Clinic Security Grant Program in the Maryland Department of Health to assist reproductive health care clinics in the State with costs associated with security improvements and safety operational expenses; prohibiting the Department from disclosing certain personal information of an individual associated with the Program; and authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill for fiscal year 2026 an appropriation of $500,000 to the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Reproductive Health Care Clinic Security Grant Program within the Maryland Department of Health to assist reproductive health care clinics with security improvements and safety expenses.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Reproductive health care clinics and their patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted grant approach to enhance security at reproductive health care clinics, focusing on safety improvements and operational expenses.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on security for clinics providing reproductive health services.

Title: Information Technology - Modernization of Information Technology Projects
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Secretary of Information Technology related to modernization of information technology systems; renaming the Major Information Technology Development Fund; requiring 20% of the amount appropriated to the Fund to be set aside for expedited projects each fiscal year; requiring the Board of Public Works to expedite the placement on an agenda and approval of certain contracts; altering the name, duties, and membership of the Modernize Maryland Oversight Commission; and providing for the terms of certain Commission members.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a comprehensive modernization initiative for Maryland's state information technology systems, including the creation of a new Investment Fund, a Modernize Maryland Commission, and a strategic plan to upgrade legacy systems and improve cybersecurity.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: State government agencies, Maryland residents, and IT vendors
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated approach with dedicated funds, a new oversight commission, and strategic planning to modernize state IT infrastructure, which is a relatively innovative government approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve public services that can indirectly reduce child poverty, but its primary focus is on IT infrastructure.

Title: Behavioral Health - Language Assistance Services Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Language Assistance Services Pilot Program in the Behavioral Health Administration to provide grants to local behavioral health authorities to reimburse behavioral health providers for language assistance services for children with limited English proficiency accessing and receiving behavioral health services and for parents and legal guardians coordinating the provision of behavioral health services and making health care decisions regarding the services on behalf of a child; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a pilot program to provide grants to local behavioral health authorities in Maryland to reimburse providers for language assistance services, including interpretation and translation, to improve access to behavioral health care for children with limited English proficiency and their families.
responsible_party: Behavioral Health Administration of Maryland
stakeholders: Children with limited English proficiency, their parents and legal guardians, behavioral health providers, and local behavioral health authorities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to improve access to behavioral health services through language assistance, using grants and a structured reporting and training framework, which is a relatively innovative approach to addressing language barriers in healthcare.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to behavioral health services for children with limited English proficiency, which can contribute to better health and social outcomes.

Title: State Government - Executive Appointments
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor to appoint individuals to the State Board of Elections and the Accountability and Implementation Board during the recess of the Senate under certain circumstances; requiring the Governor to submit a certain nomination to the Senate if the term of office will end during the next upcoming recess of the Senate; authorizing the Governor to submit a certain nomination to the Senate more than 40 days after the commencement of the regular legislative session and before Sine Die only if the Senate consents; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies rules regarding the appointment, nomination, and service of individuals in certain state offices that require Senate advice and consent, including provisions for appointments during Senate recesses, nomination timelines, and limits on acting service.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Office of the Governor and the Maryland Senate
stakeholders: State officials, government employees, and the general public relying on state governance processes
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific rules for appointments and nominations during Senate recesses, including time limits for acting appointments, which adds structure to existing appointment procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may influence the stability and effectiveness of state governance.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages - Individual Storage Permits
Synopsis: Requiring an alcoholic beverages retailer in Baltimore County to have written approval from the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County before applying to the Executive Director of the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission for an individual storage permit for alcoholic beverages.
bill_summary: The bill requires alcoholic beverage retailers in Baltimore County to obtain written approval from the Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners before applying for an individual storage permit, which allows storing alcoholic beverages in a warehouse.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners and the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage retailers in Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approval process for storage permits, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Procurement - Procurement Forecast and Outreach
Synopsis: Requiring the Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs to consult with each primary procurement unit to identify potential contracting opportunities for and increase outreach efforts to small businesses; requiring each unit, on or before June 30 each year, to submit to the Office a procurement forecast for all procurement contracts over $100,000; requiring each unit, on or before August 15 each year, to submit its reconciliation of the prior fiscal year's procurement forecast in accordance with certain requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires state agencies to publish annual procurement forecasts, including minority business participation goals, and to develop programs to increase awareness and assist small businesses in bidding for contracts.
responsible_party: Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs in the Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Small businesses, minority business enterprises, state procurement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured approach to improve transparency and outreach for small and minority businesses through annual forecasts and targeted programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve economic opportunities for small and minority businesses, which can contribute to reducing child poverty.

Title: Frederick County - Juveniles - Truancy Reduction Pilot Program
Synopsis: Authorizing the Circuit Administrative Judge of the Sixth Circuit to establish a Truancy Reduction Pilot Program in the juvenile court in Frederick County.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the establishment of a Truancy Reduction Pilot Program in Frederick County's juvenile court, as well as in other counties in Maryland, to address truancy among juveniles.
responsible_party: Circuit Administrative Judge of the Sixth Circuit and Maryland Supreme Court
stakeholders: Juvenile students, families, schools, and juvenile justice system in Frederick County and other participating counties
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted pilot program to reduce truancy through judicial intervention, potentially employing new approaches to juvenile truancy prevention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly impact child poverty by reducing truancy, which can improve educational outcomes and future opportunities for at-risk youth.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - Breweries, Wineries, and Distilleries - Direct Delivery
Synopsis: Establishing direct-to-consumer alcoholic beverages delivery permits authorizing the direct delivery of beer, wine, or liquor to a consumer in the State; establishing the requirements an individual must meet to qualify for a direct-to-consumer alcoholic beverages delivery permit; establishing a maximum amount that a recipient of an alcoholic beverages delivery may receive annually; and repealing a maximum amount that a consumer may purchase when visiting certain alcoholic beverage manufacturers.
bill_summary: The bill establishes permits and regulations for the direct delivery and shipment of alcoholic beverages, including wine, beer, and liquor, to consumers in Maryland. It sets licensing requirements, limits on quantities, labeling, reporting, and tax obligations for permit holders, and creates a framework for direct-to-consumer alcohol sales.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission
stakeholders: Consumers of alcoholic beverages in Maryland, licensed manufacturers, and permit holders
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches by creating a comprehensive framework for direct-to-consumer alcohol shipping and delivery, including digital age verification systems, which is a modern approach to alcohol regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by regulating alcohol sales and ensuring responsible distribution, but it is not primarily targeted at child poverty alleviation.

Title: Cigarettes, Other Tobacco Products, and Electronic Smoking Devices - Revisions (Tobacco Retail Modernization Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Prohibiting licensees that sell cigarettes, other tobacco products, or electronic smoking devices at retail from displaying cigarettes, other tobacco products, or electronic smoking devices for sale unless located behind a counter; requiring certain licensed retailers to verify an individual's date of birth before selling cigarettes, other tobacco products, or electronic smoking devices in a certain manner; altering the application fee for a county license to sell cigarettes or tobacco products at retail; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws on the sale and display of tobacco products, electronic smoking devices, and related licensing, including restrictions on display, age verification, inspections, and licensing requirements for retailers and manufacturers. It also enhances enforcement and reporting on tobacco and electronic smoking device sales, especially to minors.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission
stakeholders: Tobacco and electronic smoking device retailers, manufacturers, and consumers, especially minors and military personnel
innovative_summary: The bill employs modern enforcement strategies, including unannounced inspections and use of minors in compliance checks, and updates licensing and display regulations to adapt to current tobacco and vaping markets.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but aims to reduce youth access to tobacco and vaping products, which can contribute to long-term health benefits.

Title: Department of Information Technology - Evaluation and Development of a 3-1-1 Portal Using Artificial Intelligence
Synopsis: Stating the intent of the General Assembly that the Department of Information Technology evaluate the feasibility of creating a 3-1-1 portal utilizing artificial intelligence and that the Department prioritize the creation of the portal if feasible.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a statewide 2–1–1 and 3–1–1 system in Maryland, integrating existing county systems, and directs the Department of Information Technology to evaluate and potentially develop a 3–1–1 portal utilizing artificial intelligence.
responsible_party: Department of Information Technology and Maryland 2–1–1 and 3–1–1 Board
stakeholders: Maryland residents seeking nonemergency information and services, government agencies, and community organizations
innovative_summary: The bill employs new technology by evaluating and potentially creating an artificial intelligence-based virtual 3–1–1 portal to improve access to nonemergency government information and services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by improving access to social services and resources for vulnerable populations.

Title: Public Schools - School Security Employees - Appropriations
Synopsis: Authorizing local school systems to use certain funds for school security employees.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funds and establishes programs to improve school security in Maryland, including grants for school security employees, safety evaluations, and updated emergency plans for schools.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and related agencies
stakeholders: Public school students, school staff, local school systems, law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining funding, safety evaluations, emergency planning, and interagency reviews to enhance school security, integrating data collection and joint assessments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by creating safer school environments, which can improve educational outcomes and stability for vulnerable children.

Title: Emergency Services - Funding
Synopsis: Increasing the motor vehicle registration emergency medical system surcharge to $40.00 per year for certain motor vehicles; altering certain provisions of law related to the Maryland Trauma Physician Services Fund, including provisions related to the contents and sources of the funding and the determination of eligibility for disbursements; requiring the Governor, beginning in fiscal year 2026, to include an annual appropriation of at least $16,500,000 to the Senator William H. Amoss Fire, Rescue, and Ambulance Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill increases the surcharge on motor vehicle registration fees to fund emergency medical services and trauma care, allocates funds to trauma centers and emergency services, and adjusts related fines and funding mechanisms.
responsible_party: Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Trauma patients, trauma centers, emergency medical services, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a dedicated funding mechanism through increased surcharges and allocates grants to trauma centers, with some adjustments to funding percentages and hours, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving trauma care and emergency services, which can benefit vulnerable populations including children.

Title: Workgroup on Home Detention Monitoring
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Home Detention Monitoring to study and make recommendations regarding the costs and availability of both publicly and privately provided pretrial home detention monitoring systems; and requiring the Workgroup to submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the General Assembly on or before December 31 each year.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Workgroup on Home Detention Monitoring to study and make recommendations on the costs and availability of pretrial home detention monitoring systems, both public and private.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals involved in pretrial detention, detention centers, law enforcement, and the justice system
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated workgroup to evaluate and recommend improvements for home detention monitoring, potentially incorporating new approaches or technologies in pretrial supervision.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on the justice and detention system.

Title: Correctional Services - Diminution Credits - Sexual Offenses
Synopsis: Prohibiting the earning of diminution credits to reduce the term of confinement of an incarcerated individual who is serving a sentence for rape in the first degree in a State or local correctional facility.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits incarcerated individuals serving sentences for first-degree rape from earning diminution credits to reduce their confinement term, effective October 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals, victims of sexual offenses, correctional facilities, and the Maryland public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal restriction on the earning of diminution credits for a specific category of offenders, rather than introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly addresses correctional policy for sexual offenders.

Title: Emergency Services - Automated External Defibrillator and Naloxone Co-Location Initiative - Requirements for Public Buildings
Synopsis: Requiring the State Emergency Medical Services Board, in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health, to develop and implement an initiative under the Public Access Automated External Defibrillator Program to require that naloxone be co-located with each automated external defibrillator placed in a public building; establishing a certain immunity from liability for individuals who administer naloxone made available under the initiative in response to a known or suspected drug overdose; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the development of a program to co-locate naloxone with automated external defibrillators (AEDs) in public buildings, establishes immunity from liability for owners and responders, and allocates funds from the Opioid Restitution Fund for this initiative.
responsible_party: Maryland Emergency Medical Services Board and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Public building owners, emergency responders, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated approach to enhance emergency response by integrating naloxone with AEDs in public spaces, utilizing existing programs and funds, and establishing legal protections.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving emergency health responses, but it is not directly targeted at child poverty.

Title: Higher Education - Maryland Police Officers and Probation Agents Scholarship Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the definition of an eligible institution for the Maryland Police Officers and Probation Agents Scholarship Program to include a community college in the State.
bill_summary: The bill establishes scholarship programs and policies to support police officers, probation agents, and their dependents in Maryland, including expanding eligible institutions and creating new scholarship funds and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Police officers, probation agents, their dependents, and students attending Maryland postsecondary institutions
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining scholarships, recruitment policies, and data reporting to enhance law enforcement recruitment and support in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by supporting the education of children of public safety employees and military personnel.

Title: Hospitals and Related Institutions – Outpatient Facility Fees
Synopsis: Altering the required contents of the written notice regarding outpatient facility fees; requiring the Maryland Health Services Cost Review Commission, in consultation with certain entities, to study and make recommendations regarding hospital outpatient facility fees; requiring the Commission to convene a workgroup on outpatient facility fees notices; and requiring the Commission to submit, on or before December 1, 2024, a report to certain committees of the General Assembly on certain recommendations.
bill_summary: The bill requires hospitals in Maryland to provide patients with detailed notices about outpatient facility fees, studies the impact of these fees on healthcare costs and access, and establishes a workgroup to recommend further regulations and transparency measures.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Services Cost Review Commission
stakeholders: Patients, hospitals, healthcare providers, insurers, and consumer advocacy groups in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining transparency, study, and regulation of outpatient facility fees, including the use of electronic notices and stakeholder workgroups.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by influencing healthcare costs and access.

Title: Annual Corrective Bill
Synopsis: Correcting certain errors or omissions in certain articles of the Annotated Code; clarifying language; correcting certain obsolete references; reorganizing certain sections of the Annotated Code; providing that this Act is not intended to affect any law other than to correct technical errors; and providing for the correction of certain errors and obsolete provisions by the publishers of the Annotated Code.
bill_summary: This bill is an annual correction bill that amends various sections of Maryland law to fix errors, update terminology, and clarify language across multiple articles, including Business Regulation, Commercial Law, Correctional Services, Courts and Judicial Proceedings, Criminal Law, Criminal Procedure, Economic Development, Education, Environment, Estates and Trusts, General Provisions, Health, Health Occupations, Insurance, Labor and Employment, Local Government, Natural Resources, Public Safety, Public Utilities, Real Property, State Finance and Procurement, State Government, Tax, and Transportation.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly and publishers of the Annotated Code of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents, government agencies, legal professionals, and organizations affected by the legal and procedural updates
innovative_summary: This bill employs a systematic approach to correcting and updating legal terminology, references, and language to ensure clarity, consistency, and accuracy in Maryland law, but does not introduce new programs or initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily corrects technical and terminological issues in the law and does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Fish and Fisheries - Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring certain persons licensed or regulated with respect to fish and fisheries by the Department of Natural Resources to submit reports in accordance with regulations adopted by the Department.
bill_summary: The bill requires persons licensed or regulated by the Maryland Department of Natural Resources for fish and fisheries activities to submit reports according to regulations adopted by the Department. It updates reporting requirements for fish dealers, fish catchers, anglers, and recreational fishers, and mandates submission of reports in accordance with Department regulations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Fishers, fish dealers, anglers, and recreational fishers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes and formalizes reporting requirements for fishery activities, employing regulatory updates to improve data collection and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on fishery reporting regulations.

Title: University System of Maryland – Academic Facilities Bonding Authority
Synopsis: Approving certain projects for the acquisition, development, and improvement of certain academic facilities for the University System of Maryland; authorizing the issuance of bonds by the University System of Maryland for financing the projects; and providing that the bonds are not a debt or obligation of the State or any of its subdivisions.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the University System of Maryland to issue bonds totaling $30 million to finance and refinance projects related to academic facilities, including campus-wide infrastructure improvements at the University of Maryland, College Park, and systemwide facility renewal projects.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland
stakeholders: Students, faculty, and staff of the University System of Maryland, and the broader Maryland community benefiting from improved academic facilities.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a traditional bond financing approach for funding academic infrastructure projects, which is a common method and not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on infrastructure improvements is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Tax Assistance for Low-Income Marylanders - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter, to distribute $500,000 from the remaining net abandoned property funds after certain distributions to the Tax Clinics for Low-Income Marylanders Fund; requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget, for fiscal year 2026 and each year thereafter, an appropriation of $800,000 for the CASH Campaign of Maryland to award grants for providing certain tax assistance through certain on-demand and mobile tax clinics; etc.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funds from abandoned property and state budgets to support tax assistance programs for low-income Marylanders, including grants for tax clinics and the CASH Campaign, and establishes the Tax Clinics for Low-Income Marylanders Fund to support legal and tax clinics.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller and the Maryland State government
stakeholders: Low-income Maryland residents, including seniors, rural communities, and under-resourced populations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated approach to fund and support mobile and on-demand tax clinics and integrates legal and tax assistance programs with financial education initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by providing tax assistance and financial education to low-income families.

Title: Higher Education - Douglas J. J. Peters Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship - Repeal of Service Terminal Date
Synopsis: Repealing the service terminal date required to be eligible for the Douglas J. J. Peters Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the service terminal date requirement for the Douglas J. J. Peters Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship, making it more accessible to eligible veterans and their families.
responsible_party: Office of Higher Education in Maryland
stakeholders: Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq conflicts, their families, and eligible students in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes eligibility rules for a scholarship program and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly supporting veterans and their families.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - College Athletic Event Venue Concessionaire Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing a Class B-CAEVC (College Athletic Event Venue Concessionaire) beer, wine, and liquor license in Prince George's County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners of Prince George's County to issue the license to a certain concessionaire; authorizing beer, wine, and liquor purchased under the license to be consumed in certain areas; and providing for the hours and days of sale and an annual license fee of $3,500 to be paid to the Board on or before May 1.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class B–CAEVC (College Athletic Event Venue Concessionaire) license in Prince George's County, allowing concessionaires at college athletic venues to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption in designated areas during events.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County
stakeholders: Concessionaires, college athletic venues, attendees of college athletic events in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized license for concessionaires at college athletic venues to sell alcoholic beverages, which is a new approach to alcohol licensing at such venues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns licensing and sales of alcohol at college venues.

Title: Affirming the Federal Equal Rights Amendment
Synopsis: Urging the Administration of President Joseph R. Biden to publish, without delay, the federal Equal Rights Amendment as the 28th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution and for the U.S. Congress to pass a joint resolution affirming the Equal Rights Amendment as the 28th Amendment.
bill_summary: This resolution urges the U.S. government to publish the Equal Rights Amendment as the 28th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, affirms that the amendment meets constitutional requirements, and encourages other states to support this action.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly
stakeholders: All Maryland residents and the broader U.S. population, especially those advocating for gender equality
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legislative resolution to advocate for the federal ratification and publication of the Equal Rights Amendment, which is a traditional legal and political approach rather than a technological or novel method.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on constitutional and legislative advocacy for gender equality.
